text: Stopped in as the baseball game turned away our groupon. Lucky for us we needed a drink and we had already been to the VFW. we sat at the bar and ordered the $3 mixed drink. Bottom line, she poured a nice drink. We played the juke box. We watched the crowd swarm in as it got later. Nice place. Had a great time. Right on the bike trail. Friendly server/bartenders. Dog friendly.

Decided to check this place out for lunch during the week. Noticed a few people upset in the lobby but didn't think much of it. After placing my order I realized everyone in line were waiting almost an hour for their food. I patiently waited for about 45 minutes before speaking with the cashier who told me my order was given to someone else, "it's been happening all day". I told her my order and she went back to make it. After waiting almost an hour, my meal was extremely dry and cold. Don't see myself coming back.

If my family has a regular place, this is it.  We eat here at least twice a month.  It's authentic, and the food is delicious!  I regularly order the black bean nachos, the chili relleno, shrimp fajitas and/or tostada.  My son always get the mac n cheese, which is so creamy!  All the staff are SO nice.  Particularly, and anyone that eats here knows, Jesus the manager is so cordial and personable.  He comes around to each and every person and acts as though he's always known you for years.  It's a nice touch.  
I'm so glad this little Mexican restaurant is tucked away in downtown Franklin off the beaten path for those in-the-know.  Make no mistake, it gets crowded...especially the weekends.  Get in before 6:00 for no wait.

This cafe is one of my favorite cafes to study in. The ambiance of studying with the roasted coffee scents and being surrounded with beautiful art paintings is great for those who need to seclude themselves to do some work. On top of that there are lots of spaces to study in, including a basement floor. The drinks and cookies are refreshing and scrumcious!

This place is sucks, the service is also sucks, very expensive, food do not have taste at all, I ordered Homos and falafel combo, the taste very smellier to anything except Homos and Falafel, and Also I order Tea with ment, it was horrible. Beside all that we order desert called Konafeh, and they bring to us totally different desert and they insist it's what we order.

while we are there, there was a big group of student, they had another bad experience like they missed up with there bills and there order.
we were 4 people, we had bad experience and we do not recommend anyone to go there, I'm not sure how this kind of restaurant can service tell now with this kind of service.

Great place.  From the outside we weren't sure what to expect when we pulled up to grab a bite to eat after a hike through Washington Crossing Park. We were pleasantly surprised.  The food was delicious--especially the salads. 
It was a great find and I look forward to going back when it's warmer for some ice cream.

Our son was admitted to this facility for a relapse of appendicitis  after our initial stay at CHNOLA. Our experience was alot better. The Pediatric Er was fantastic along with the pediatric unit. After having surgery Child life came in four different times in two days trying provide toys or to get our son to come down to the play room which we finally did on the final invite. Compared to Children s where we never saw the Child Life person nor did we ever get advised of there play room. Our surgeon (Dr. Vincent Adolph) was fantastic. He was there multiple times a day to check on our son. He made sure we were totally informed of everything that was going on and never left till all questions were answered or we felt comfortable. His residences were also very good and very knowledgeable. I also want to give a shout out to a Nurse on the peds floor named Paula. Her care and compassion for our son made us feel like our son was her only patient even though he wasn't. Besides her all the nurses were great. If i had one negative thing to say about the place is it is as very big hospital and for families it can hard to navigate.

Formerly Pho 88 and as of today's visit the Pho 88 sign is still outside but business cards and menus inside reflect the name change to Pho Can Tho.  There appears to be some freshening up of the inside with a new checkout counter, new tables, TVs and music.  The menu has been scaled back considerably but fortunately the pho remains good and pretty close to that of Pho 88 which I very much liked.  The egg rolls were a bit different than Pho 88 but equally tasty albeit a little on the small side.  It will be interesting to continue to check in on this place to see how it develops.  It's off to a good start but I already miss the nice old server lady from Pho 88.

We tried to go to this Outback early Sunday evening with 5 adults and 3 young children. The hostess said it would be a 40 minute wait with no one in the waiting room and clearly empty tables in both sides of the dining room.  We were shocked at how long the wait would be and decided to go elsewhere.  As we were leaving the gentleman staffing the door asked us why we were leaving and we explained.  He asked us to wait for a moment.  He came back quickly and asked if we would be willing to sit at the tables on the outdoor patio.  We were thrilled with that option and quickly pulled two tables together.  As we were doing so another woman came out and said- No--we cannot serve you out here, we have no "outdoor" servers available.  Really?  Tired of being jerked around we went to another restaurant and had a lovely dinner.  My advice--go somewhere else to begin with.

Great location on canal. Super fun vibe!  Music and drinks are flowing.  A beehive of activity with dogs, joggers and bikers in the area. I had Cuban sandwich ($13) and it was very good. Loses one star for service. The staff seems like they are not around.  Must be smoking on back. Ha!  Nice staff just not around enough. You have to hunt them down. Saw others do the same.

Traveled to this establishment on Lundi Gras 2013 for brunch. The place was rather packed on the outdoor patio - which looked rather charming - so unfortunately, the server led us to the indoor area (if you could call it that). We were taken down a hallway into a room that appeared to have been designed by a goodwill fanatic/crazy person.

The walls were littered with cheap replicas of over-used classic paintings next to random pictures of pies. Of course, it was also filled to the gills with half-dollar store Mardi Gras decorations. Oh, and who could forget the random boxes that appeared to comprise some dude's storage room in the middle of the inside dining room of the establishment.

After perhaps a 15 minute wait because of slow service, we were finally able to order from our particularly slow and rude server. The menu was very sparse with minimal description for any of the dishes. I made the mistake of ordering the Buffalo Wings and the Muffaletta (yeah, I can be pretty nasty some times when I'm waking up after a night of partying).

We waited at least 30 minutes for our food to arrive, and when it did, my food continued my disappointing experience at this restaurant. The wings were severely over-fried and the Muffaletta was dripping with nastiness juice. In a halfway redeeming sense, though, the portions were fairly large.

The reason why I am not giving this place a one-star review is because the outdoor seating in the front of the restaurant appeared to get a fair bit more server attention and the decor was substantially more attractive.

We tried Sprinkles a few weeks ago when we were in the area and really enjoyed it. Today, we came back and got 2 cupcakes. I have to say on this visit I was not impressed at all. If this was my first experience, I would have to say I probably would not come back. The vanilla buttercream on the vanilla cupcake had a very off taste to it. This is what we got the first time so I was disappointed that it was not as good as the first time. We tried the chocolate banana cupcake for the first time after the employee recommended it and the cake part itself was pretty dry. It has the potential to be a great cupcake too! The chocolate marshmallow cupcake was good. I think today may have been an off day, but for living almost an hour away, it's disappointing that it was not that great today.

This is the place to go in Kennett Square, PA for all car repair related needs, including inspection, service, minor or major.  They are a family run business and treat you fairly.  They will tell you the honest options and what needs to be done/what has to be done.

Blitz's is also a great supporter of the Kennett community.  I say this only as an afterthought, because their service is second to none, but what they do and the energy they have for local causes makes this a repair shop with a heart.  Can't recommend them enough.
As always the best gourmet Italian restaurant in the city. The fillet of Douglas is to die for.

Went to Borst after seeing a Groupon for an oil change and inspection for $19. An awesome deal! After the inspection was completed, I was shown a list of items that needed to be repaired on my vehicle. This would have been great if the prices were reasonable. I was quoted for new rear brakes for $330. I kindly refused the repairs and drove down the road to another business where they were replaced 45 mins later for $180, almost 50% less than Borst. I can understand that small businesses have to make their money somehow, but overcharging for services is not the way to go.
Great neighborhood Chinese.  Been eating for 10 years and consistently good.  Happy family dish great and lo mein is tasty.

Awesome restaurant! It was so refreshing to have such a yummy meal from start to finish. Our server, Jess, was great too! She was so bubbly and helpful with the menu. I ordered the fried chicken and it was seriously the best fried chicken I've ever had. Go here for your next meal out!

Such great service! I was having trouble with my tire light showing I had low tire pressure and I was instantly helped and have not had any trouble with it since! A quick fix and the problem is gone. The gentleman who helped me was very kind and knowledgable.
I like this pub and hit it every time I am in town. The people are friendly and they have a good selection of brew. They have a nice patio you can sit outside and relax.

My mom always told me not to judge a book by its cover. And in the case of Twin Kegs, I'm so, so glad I didn't.

Nestled in between a Shoney's and another large building, it's very easy to blink and miss my beloved dive bar when you're heading east on Thompson and nearing the Nolensville intersection.

PRO: Cheap beer (seriously, $1-2), DELICIOUS hamburgers, grade A people watching, best karaoke in town.

CON: You'll have to do laundry and take a shower when you get home to get the smoke smell out.

RANDOM TIPS: Cover your drink with a coaster; the regulars like to throw pieces of paper.

Also, check their Facebook page. They post daily specials all the time!

A HUGE THANK YOU to the entire staff at Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant in NOLA!!    My company recently held an event for approximately 200 people (bought out the place) and it was a tremendous success!  Not only were they easy to work with (long distance arrangements) in the planning of this party, they were so helpful and accommodating to our every need. The staff was in my opinion the best I've worked with (and I've planned 13 events in the past 6 years)... the food was absolutely delicious, bartenders kept the party running smoothly (with selected wines and specialty beers - of which won 2 awards at the Great American Beer Festival in Denver), and the DJ rocked the place!  A special THANK YOU to the ladies that helped me check in 200 guests... made my life so easy... and to Priscilla - thanks for putting up with me for the past 3 months you're the best.   The party was an overwhelming success and hailed as "one of our best parties" by the guests!  Visit this place if you are ever in NOLA...staff, spirits and food... fabulous...  you will not be sorry!!

This place rocks! The price is unbeatable for a lunch special! Its a little hole in the wall, but the workers are extremely nice and helpful. Highly Recommend! On vacation in Florida for a month and we went ALMOST EVERYDAY after we tried it!

This is our 5th night in New Orleans and this was the best meal we had so far.  We got a bottle of Chateau de Montfort Vouvray, the blackened salmon fried chicken and bread pudding.  It was all wonderful.  Also tried the Gumbo and wasn't super stoked on it but it wasn't bad.

Simply put , I was pleasantly surprised. Grilled chicken gyro was the perfect size. Chicken was moist with nice red tomatoes. I got the side cucumber and tomato salad again fresh ingredients. The price very reasonable. I hope this restaurant sticks around. This area has a way of not allowing good restaurants to stay. Ahem *yard of ale*. I look forward to returning to try the lamb gyro that's not typical gyro...someone can explain inside if you are curious.

This is the second worst restaurant I have been to in Tucson. The minute I walked in the door I could smell a combo of old fish and dirty grease, disgusting. If i would have been on my own I would of walked out but instead I stayed to endure the worst sushi I have ever had in my life. The tempura roll was fried in old grease, that stuff needs to be changed every now and again. Even the edemame was bad, totally over cooked. The sashimi almost made me vomit, it was mushy and not fresh, ewww, I am grossed out just thinking about that place!

As the first and only vegan restaurant in SB, this restaurant has a lot of expectations to fill.. 

My boyfriend and I went there today to eat lunch. We were seated quickly, but the waitress took a long time to come back to our table to take our order. They forgot about us.. and we had to flag down the waitress ourselves.

We ordered two sandwiches, sweet potato fries, lemonade, and juice. The food was ok, but too expensive for what it is. The restaurant charges 2 dollars for filtered water and 2 more dollars to share a plate... simply ridiculous.

we will not be returning.

I live less then a mile from this place, we ordered $30 worth of food. Took over an hour for the delivery & the food was cold & dry when we received it. My husband called the restaurant they said "sorry nothing we can do" & hung up on him. We took the food back to the restaurant & asked for a refund. The staff was beyond rude, but eventually 1 staff member agreed to refund us.

This is the newbie on the street. 

Not bad, and I actually would go back because they have loyalty cards. However, it's just so hard to bring myself there when tea do is right across the street, and I like their milk tea just that slight bit better!

To begin - must get their chips & salsa.  The yellow salsa is the best. I could have 3 of those! If you love spicy - you will love this salsa. The guac is delicious but the serving size is small. Too small. 

For entrees - the chicken enchilada were just ok. I would go with the tacos! Their shrimp tacos were fabulous. And do not turn down the opportunity to get the pot roast tacos. They are sooooo good!!!! I know they sound gross. But really - so good. 

Their house margs are definitely not my favorite. Bakersfield still holds the crown. They do have a great grapefruit marg. Try this. Unless you like sweet margaritas and the traditional may be for you.
Such an awesome place in the heart of Santa Barbara. Friendly staff, awesome drinks, great atmosphere. Would highly recommend to anyone who loves boba :-)

I'm not too experience with Philly's ramen, but this was pretty good. The ambiance was great -- you could actually sit at the "bar" -- and the service was friendly. Most importantly, this is BYOB. They don't serve any diet clear drinks though, so if you plan to mix make sure you bring rum.

I ordered a greek salad, carryout. When I got home, I found dirt on the lettuce in several places. I had to wash my dinner before I ate it. I also asked for dressing on the side. They did not give me any dressing. I will not be back.

Of the four German beer halls in Philly this one is by far my favorite.
Great authemtic German feeling decor and atmosphere.
Food and beer list are outstanding and reasonably priced.
Very good service.
Met a friend there for Lunch today. I can see why it's rated so high! Good Food and Good Service!

I'm with the other reviewer on this one.  I first experienced Wok Box at their Sherwood Park (Baseline) location and absolutely fell in love with their consistently tasty stirfry's as well as their butter chicken... Unfortunately, I found that the consistently tasty meals, were only consistent there.  The Wok Box on 178th Street was a different story entirely.

Sure their furniture is nice and they have friendly service, but that's where the similarities end.  I find that the sauces have a watered down taste and they use completely different vegetable mixes than the Sherwood Park location.  I was also quite disappointed to see a UFC fight on their big TV next to the counter... Not because I don't enjoy watching two guys break each other, but because I don't want my 6yr old son watching it.

All in all, I'll be sticking to the one I like.  It's not to say the whole franchise is doomed, just that they haven't mastered the McDonalds secret... Consistency among all restaurants and not just the one.

I LOVE PWAT! I've been here 6 times and have 6 awesome paintings to show for it. I'm not terribly artistic but they break the paintings down into easy steps and walk you through each one. Apparently they even have a time when you can come in to work on fixing any mistakes you feel that you've made.

They also have a punch card so you can get a free painting class after you fill the card. And if you check-in on Facebook while you're there, they'll give you 2 punches. So that's basically 1 free class after you take 5 classes. AND they gave my friend and I our own aprons when we turned in our punch card for our free class. Did I mention how much I love this place?

I had a hard drive issue with my Dell computer, so I bought a new hardrive and brought it to this place to complete the setup/recovery. The cost was quite reasonable especially since they updated it to windows 10, and included an anti-virus, PLUS they can provide any help if needed via remote access.  Well, more than a month after, my laptop needed Windows activated??? So I called them and without hesitation, Jeff, was able to get it fixed via remote access. So I didn't have to bring it over to them or pay any additional fees.
Highly recommend them!!  Their knowledge and customer service is awesome!!

Any restaurant that uses bagged frozen peas and cubed carrots should be banished from receiving anything remotely resembling decent reviews on Yelp or elsewhere.  The food was otherwise palatable but the decor was a bit tragic and bathroom not clean.  You can do way better for Thai food in South Jersey.

Best meal I've had all year, easily.  Best Caesar salad I've ever had, and the first time I've ever had fresh anchovies.   What a difference!   Steak and dessert literally melted in my mouth.  House wine and the dirty martini were both excellent too.
Sub par service but the food was delicious and not too expensive.

The food and drinks are excellent! 
Service was good as well, they had a large variety of drinks to choose from. We had the fried chicken, fries, and Mac n cheese. We really enjoyed everything.

I literally cried in the chair. I went in for a trim and came out with side bangs to my ear...The girl who cut my hair took a razor to it which is not ok for my type of hair...anyone who actually went to beauty school would have known that. My current hair stylist was beyond shocked. So I'm pretty sure she didn't even graduate. I should have known from the great discount deal and the fact that the place was empty and took me the same day I called to schedule an appointment. It's been a year since I went there and the undesired side bangs have finally grown out. Run away! Things that sound too good to be true generally speaking are. This is not a hidden gem.

The "artisan" doughnut movement might be nearing saturation in Indy, but GADCo is my favorite. The doughnuts are consistently fresh and tasty, and I don't feel like I just swallowed tablespoons of sugar after I eat one. The salted caramel is a must-try. They also serve Stumptown coffee (including bottles of the cold brew). If you're trying to decide among the several specialty doughnut shops around town, try GADCo first.

We went back to Topanaris again based on some of the updated reviews.  Since we'd been last time, they've completely revamped their business model, offering full breakfast service (brunch on Sundays) as well as a weekday lunch buffet.  As iterated in my previous review, the food is excellent with a fair selection of items available.  Our only disappointment was that there was only curry chicken available, with no jerk chicken (we love Jamaicaway's jerk chicken) available.  Since this was our first try at their lunch buffet, I don't know how much the selection changes, but they had a wonderful sampling of veggie dishes with the tofu callaloo, sweet potatoes with pineapple, collard greens, red beans with peas, and green beans.  The buffet is interesting in that it is currently $9.95 for everything you can fit on 1 plate.  Any subsequent plate is $5.  We managed to eat quite our fill on a single plate, so no complaints there.  All in all, we got great food (just like last time) at a much more reasonable price.  Fantastic!

I been in Nashville for a couple of years and I 'think' I had heard of Arnolds, but actually it wasn't until I was reading SCOTT PRATT's "Joe Dillard series of fictional novels.  In his fifth book page 274 , "Conflict of Interest" Scott writes about Arnolds and I quote; " a garish orange, block building, the name "ARNOLDS" was painted on the side of the building.   People were standing in line outside beneath umbrellas.  I don't know what they served there, but I told myself that if people were willing to stand outside in the cold rain, I'd have to make it a point to bring (wife) Caroline to Nashville when this was over"--

I am a SCOTT PRATT fan and Now I too am an Arnolds fan- I was NOT disappointed.  It is Comfort Food-- perfected.

BRUNCH REVIEW: I never saw concert venues with brunch before. Sit on the sidewalk, drink an acceptably great horseradish-heavy bloody mary. They fucked up neither the eggs nor the bacon. One of few outside brunch spots around. I'd come back in a second, esp. if I lived nearby.

Mina's only redeeming quality is that they carry some of the brands that are harder to find in Edmonton like Da Vinci or Impression. There is nothing else positive I can say about them. The place is so badly run it is almost comical.

My experience went like this: My mom, sister and I went to find a bridesmaid dress for my wedding. We walked in on a very slow morning and were ignored. The salespeople saw us come in but didn't say a word to us. My mom and I spent about 20 minutes combing through the extremely disorganized racks and both had an armful of dresses. The salespeople watched but did not offer to start a fitting room nor did they try to help us find a dress. Oh yeah did I mention we were the only customers in the store? We were. For the whole hour we were there. And the staff was standing around chatting with each other (in Cantonese or Mandarin I think) and on the phone with people who were obviously not customers. I don't think any of them cared that we were there.

So we ended up randomly choosing a fitting room and my sister started trying on the dresses. Once she had tried on about half the dresses a salesperson waltzes into her change room without asking and just takes ALL the dresses out. I told her that we weren't done trying dresses on yet and that there were a couple that i might choose for my wedding. At this point she started acting friendly in the most obvious fake way. She brought out swatches and started hovering around us. When we were down to deciding between 3 dresses she did this ridiculous fake giggle thing and says "oh you guys like everything!" Uh no we were deciding between 3 and was that really the most helpful thing she could think of to say? I ended up choosing one of the dresses as my bridesmaid dress but we bought it at another store in Edmonton because of how horrible our experience at Mina's was. 

This store has been in business in WEM for years and I don't get it. They clearly don't care about the customers in their store, they have no desire to help out nor do they have any people skills at all. I have come to expect a certain level of rudeness and snobbiness from bridal stores in Edmonton but Mina's is in a class of its own. AVOID THEM AT ALL COSTS!

Not sure I understand the healthy part.

++ Lots of variety: pastries, danishes, sticky buns.
++ Good place for breakfast.
++ Nice sitting area to enjoy the outdoors (summer months only)

Didn't try any of the non-breakfast baked goods.
The new mall is awesome, plenty of parking and lots of different stores, my only issue is with the food options. The food court has like 4 places to eat and there aren't any other restaurants yet.

Solid burger joint!

A step above Five Guys in a few areas (I still love 5G though!). We came in during a quiet time and food was up quick. I did like the different sauces available, especially for the fries. I got the 2 6oz patties on mine, super juicy and tasty, but a bit over overkill size wise. I'll opt for the single patty and pile on the toppings next time for a more manageable bites.

Staff was friendly and my fiancee enjoyed her burger as well.

The food was 4 stars but the service was 2 stars, so I split the difference for a 3-star rating. I had the Huevos con Chorizo and it was excellent. But i am always frustrated when the order taker is not the order deliverer. The order taker was nice enough, but the guy who delivered my order had to ask if it was the right meal. Never a good sign in my book. And he spoke very quickly using kitchen-ese to refer to my meal (just saying "huevos" is not enough - it means eggs and that's not enough to tell me if you brought the right meal). The order taker stopped back to check but infrequently and when she delivered the check, she did not tell me to pay at the front and asked if I wanted my drink to-go. I sat there with credit card on the table for another 20 min before it occurred to me to bring the check to the front desk to pay.

I'm so happy to have found Peabody Shoe Repair! I love being able to re-sole and re-heel shoes that are otherwise still in good shape. 

I took a pair of Frye boots and a pair of high heels to get new soles/heel tips, respectively. The repairs were done within a week, and done so well! He did a half sole and heel repair on the Fryes, and they look great, with a nice leather sole, charging $50 which is a good deal considering I wear my Fryes all fall and winter, and they are $400 boots anyways. 

The heel tips were only $9, which I feel like is a total steal. 

And, I got a dozen farm-fresh eggs while I was there, to boot! yahoo!

I used to frequent this place back when it was known as Blue Sky Court.  My taste shifted right around the time it became The Rutledge, so I've only been about twice since the change.  The Rutledge is a decent small venue with good lighting and sound, but I just couldn't give them more than three stars for the acts they pull in.

Capacity at The Rutledge is somewhat limited--it probably fits about as many people as The 5 Spot...just a bit more than Springwater.  The bar and performance room are separated, which I typically prefer.  The place is 18 and up probably due to the bands that play The Rutledge regularly, thus it's a non-smoking venue.  They have a nice courtyard out back as well as typical bar food, but I've never had the pleasure of enjoying either.

The Rutledge typically stages shows for acts that play slick radio pop rock, metal core or something equally cheesy.  More often than not the bands are local, and if you want a general idea of the type of music they make you can check the calendar at The Rutledge's website.  Mostly bands who had their promo pictures taken while standing in front of a chain link fence with their hands in their pockets.

I recently checked The Rutledge's site just to get a general idea of upcoming shows.  They're having several industry showcases and a Waylon Jennings tribute in coming weeks.  If that's the sort of thing you're into, this is your place.

I recently found myself in downtown St. Pete with a friend looking for some place to get a drink and food. I pulled up yelp and found this place. The reviews look good so we decided to try it. It was Thursday night around 9:00pm and a slightly chilly night so plenty of empty tables outside so figured we would have no wait. The hostess told us that they had calls out to other customers waiting for those tables and had to give them 15 minutes to show up. The thing is those customers put their names in an hour ago, don't think they are coming. So it was very frustrating we had to stand around waiting for 15 minutes when there were 5+ empty tables. This place would of been 4 stars otherwise. 

Now onto the drinks and food. We were trying to decide between two bottles of wine and the waitress kindly brought us out a taste of both. We went with Domain Gayda- 'Flying Solo' Grenache Blanc-Viognier and it was pretty reasonable in price at $36 for the bottle. 

Then we decided to share a few appetizers. We got the BRIE & CONFIT CROQUETTES, LOCAL SQUASH BRUSCHETTA and CRISPY PUMPKIN GNOCCHI. The LOVED the gnocchi. You could tell it was made fresh and the flavor was delicious. The Leek Hay on the bruschetta was different but tasty. The croquettes were good, though I think if the cheese was on the inside instead of on top it might of been better. 

And dessert was the real star of the night! We shared the chocolate tart. Our slice had to be at least 6 inches tall! And it had house made brittle on top. It was simply amazing!
No doubt, best wings in the area. Garlic parmesan wings and blue cheese is the way to go. Great beer selection too.

I regret not writing a positive review about our previous visits since we did enjoy this restaurant every time we went. The food is great and unique for the desolate culinary wasteland in which we live, and we were happy to find a place featuring fantastic, creative cocktails for me alongside craft beer for my husband. We especially appreciated the variety of local beers on tap. Today I read that Cinder has joined a small boycott of NJ breweries and will no longer serve their beer in protest of a proposed change in the law that would allow local breweries to skip the mandatory tour of the facility and sell packaged snacks like bags of chips. A few bar/restaurant owners are protesting because they feel it will devalue their liquor licenses. How on earth is going to a brewery that only serves one brand of beer and snacking on some Fritos at all comparable to going out to a nice restaurant and enjoying your pick from a variety of alcohol and menu options? When we go to a brewery we are looking for a completely different experience than we do when going to a restaurant or bar. Last week we went to Death of the Fox, which is just a few doors down from Cinder, and we were planning to go to Cinder tomorrow night. Going to the brewery doesn't mean we no longer want to visit Cinder too. Having a local brewery in the same shopping center shouldn't affect Cinder's business in the long term if they continue to focus on serving tasty food and a variety of beverages. I assume this protest is in direct response to a brewery opening up next door. Way to be neighborly and welcoming of a new local business. I was hoping we'd see Death of the Fox beer on tap at Cinder so this is especially disappointing. Obviously we'll find somewhere else to go tomorrow since we too feel we have something to protest, in this case an unwise business decision on the part of the restaurant owner.

Do you want a clean place to eat. The food was cooked perfect. Hot fresh coffee was smooth tasting waiter left a small pot on our table so we had endless coffee. Service was excellent. Very cleans tables and floors too.

I finally tried china wok for lunch!!! I was there for the buffet and it's very reasonably priced for the amount of food and the quality. The only thing is that I wish they had more healthy options. I know it's a Chinese buffet and it's not healthy usually but a salad option or grilled chicken options would have been a plus. Overall I liked the place, very clean and very very friendly service.

While perhaps not as nice as other parks of its size in the rest of the country, FDR is pretty good in attracting people of all types. It has the National Swedish Museum, a really cool boathouse from the early part of the last century and most importantly...plenty of places to play baseball, a skatepark, and of course a gazebo.

I really like FDR if it weren't for where it was located. Pattison Ave is a HIKE from anywhere with people and it is not entirely worth it if you are going by yourself. It's a car park. Therefore you round up the friends, get a picnic or bbq of some variety going, and then it's fun.

I really enjoyed my short time perusing the park and I definitely would like to come back on a warmer day.

I was in Franklin for business and decided last minute that I absolutely needed a haircut. I live in the sfbay area and last minute could only think of ulta for an affordable good salon. Made a same day appointment after my training class and Sherayne did a fantastic job! I am so happy with my hair it's a shame I won't be able to come here all the time! She listened took her time and really made sure I was happy with the result. Thank you Sherayne for providing me with some much needed "me" time!!!

This is one of my favorite nail salons. I have been coming here for years. The place is clean, has great pedi chairs, was just recently updated and the nail techs are friendly. The nail products they carry are very good. The location is easy and has plenty of parking.
Love the Pho! Always leave full. Pho Barclay is  the hubby and I favorite lunch date spot!

Oh Scotty's what happened to you???

You started as a high quality unique offering in Muncie, IN and now have expanded to multiple locations and instead of increasing in quality,  it has diminished with each new location you have opened.  Not only that, but your beer prices seem to increase with each new menu you put out.  No reason a Bell's or Upland should be running $5 a pint.  I guess the term "recession buster" does not apply. 

I normally love giving rave reviews about restaurants but the last few times I have visited your 96th St location and your Downtown location (both in Indianapolis) I have been under-whelmed/dissapointed.  We'll give an overview.

Ambiance - 4 hosts at the host stand greet you, but they don't necessarily seat you.  They just stood there and basically expected you to pick a table.  Blaring music from the late 90s was a plus but made it hard to hear each other at 6pm.  Every TV but one was on the same station.  I love ESPN, but what is the use in having multiple sets if they are all playing ESPN?

Menu - We get it Scotty.  Your menu is 3 lbs.  You have a lot to choose from, but nothing is really above 2/5 stars in taste.  What happened to the 3 pager you had in Muncie where the food was quality and competitively priced?  I think you may be too big for your own good.

Specials - $12 Burger special and $4 beer special.  Not anything special about that.

Sever - This was a complete joke.  The guy didn't know the menu, didn't know the specials, didn't know the difference between a draught beer or a bottled beer, and couldn't tell us which beers were from Indiana (which was the special).  He kept using the excuse "we are getting a new menu so everyone is confused" We were patient with him, as he was foreign, and allowed him to make FIVE separate trips to the bar to verify the above questions.  Piss poor.  Not to mention he phantomed out on the meal after he had his food runners drop it off with no pre bussing and no check.  We actually had to leave our seat to find him to get the check.

Food - Like a said usually a strong suit that could save the experience, but not this time.  We had a handful of differnt items, nothing worth having again.  One lady ordered a cajun tuna sandwich which came out as a well done tuna steak on rice.  I know that its the midwest but tuna is meant to be rare or seared, not light brown on the inside.  The cole slaw was rancid and the chicken in the appetizers and the wraps was dry and tasted a bit old.  Not even the "Mo Fo" sauce could hide how bad it was. Just an overall dissapointment from a brand that used to mean quality.

Scotty if you get the chance to read this, maybe you can make a few changes:
-Stop wasting money on oversized menus
-Stop with the daily email spam on supposed specials and events
-Return to quality in - hiring, food taste, beer specials, and general professionalism as a business
-You had a great brand, stop running it into the ground.
Love this place! From the turkey to the brisket to the devil egg potato salad to the bomb ass voodoo sauce!

Gelato is good. However I have to say the service is horrible!!!!!  There are always a lot of people but the staff would simply tell u "oh there is no line just come on over " . We were there first, but nobody served us until everybody else were served. So we said excuse me can we have a small sweet cone? The Asian girl with short hair just said very impatiently to us " you need to be patient!"  What kind of service is that? The tables are dirty, no body cleans them!

Warm friendly staff. This place so welcoming. A group of friends and myself initially entered to purchase T-Vice tickets for the All White Party that was occuring that night. After a quick smell we decided to have a few quick snacks before we departed. 

They have the greatest stuffed Haitian patties I've ever tasted outside of south Florida. The patties were light, flacky, buttery, and loaded with meat and flavor. They also carried Kremas ( kinda like a pina colada/egg nog - but thicker). You coud purchae it by the cup or bottle. They are not cheap with the serving sizes - huge. But they don't short change you on the flavor. 

Food was so good we actually started dancing in the dining room. We were so ready for the great night we had. 

Later that night they transformed the restaurant to a great dance hall. Band played beautifully, bar was nice, fresh food was available for purchase, and security was even kind enough to walk us across the street (yeah all those lanes) to our car. Can't wait to go back ...mwen beswen pate...

Consider me a regular now.

This place is so good. Great staff and product. The first time I went about 6 months ago I got one of the juices in the cooler to the right of the cash register and it wasn't my favorite drink (I can't remember what it was) but nonetheless I enjoyed it.

My favorite drink so far is a smoothie called The DOC. A little bit expensive ($9.75 for 16oz) but it is so good I just ignore the price. I haven't tried the food yet outside of the Chia Bars, which I am also addicted to now, but I will definitely be trying their food soon and updating this review. 

A+.

I ordered pho and the noddles were a bit more limp than I'm used to. The prices were also more that you would expect to pay for pho. However, the dining environment looks more modern and elegant compared to other Vietnamese restaurants.

I found Pennsylvania 6 on yelp and loved it! Not only do they have great drinks but amazing food. The service was personable and welcoming. If you looking for a great experience while your in Phili swing by this place!
Get your official po-boy here! Had to go deep in the hood to find it but it was worth it! Get the burger po-boy!!

Most definitely my favorite restaurant. Great food, I've never had anything I didn't love!! My whole family is vegan except my dad (he's a pretty big meat eater) so we brought him here. Even he admitted the food was great! 
You won't even miss the meat or dairy. 
Can't wait to go back!

A decent place to get a quick bite to eat. Service was fantastic for a fast food joint, the guy who took my order was incredibly kind and gave me a coupon for next time since it was my first time there.

I ordered the smashburger and sweet potato fries.

SmashBurger: 3 out of 5 stars
Sweet Potato Fries: 4 out of 5 stars

The burger was average at best. I didn't expect greatness and I got exactly what my expectations were banking on. Fries were pretty good, just a tad too greasy.

Overall, it was an average what you would expect burger joint. Nothing special. Would probably not come back here unless I had only fast food options. (Yes this is better than McDonalds and BurgerKing)

I love this place. I've been going here since I was a teen with family and friends. I typically get sweet and sour chicken, pork,or shrimp with rice. The crab Rangoon is awesome. A few times I just went for the Tiki Bowel which is the best drink ever. It tastes sweet and sour with a tropical twist and they have Bacardi 151 in a center spot and light in on fire. The service has always been awesome.... Polite, professional, and delightful staff. The man who has tended bar is a hoot! This time around I ordered off American menu. On a diet that requires proteins and vegetable. I thought I would try the steak. I was curious to see how they would prepare this. It was awesome... Like perfect! This isn't even a steakhouse but one of the most perfect steaks I've ever ate!

Ugh, I was hopeful, Italian owner, makes his own pasta. Lasagna, well, not like the lasagna in Italy, very sharp tomato sauce. The vinaigrette on the salad was made with CANOLA oil, good Lord, no respectable Italian would use that!! Good bones, needs improvement.

Bru burger is probably on the cusp of 4 stars but just not quite there.   It was our third choice for lunch on a warm winter day.  Kudos to them on their winter outdoor seating complete with outside heaters. Another bonus was we could have our two dogs outside with us. The wait staff were not bothered at all by our furry lunch mates. 

We managed to luck into "devour downtown" which was good and bad.  They were out of the pretzel appetizer which may have cost them that missing star.  Pretzels should be a food group unto them self and running out does not bode well. 
 
The burger was cooked properly.  Nice to know some chefs understand what medium rare means and be confident in their meat supply to cook it that way.  The blacked tuna was not nearly blackened enough. 

The fries were fine but nothing special.  The shame is that the homemade catsup was special and deserved a better fry to show it off.  It found a happy home on my burger and the fries were thoroughly enjoyed by the dogs. 
 
The cheesecake didn't taste homemade but was ok.  Milkshake was a far more enjoyable after dinner treat.
Our regular place after kids sports such as swimming and baseball.  Extensive gluten free menu and great beer selection

Awww, where do I start?

Well, we were recommend to try this place if we wanted crawfish.  Well, the crawfish wasn't too spicy and very juicy. U can tell
The crawfish was fresh and not frozen. 

I also had the fried alligator. U really have to try this is ur adventitious. I loved it. 

Service was good even as this place was packed!!!

I'm giving this place 5 stars on a realistic comparison to other buffets in this price range. With a coupon, my lunch was under $6 before the tip (which they actually deserved). I don't write a lot of reviews, but there wasn't a lot of feedback on this place and I figured they deserved a little recognition for their effort.

My favorite part was definitely the Mongolian grill, which the manager gave us thorough instruction on which sauces to use. Whatever I made on that grill was definitely the most savory, spicy, and flavorful dish in the restaurant. The pho station is a similar concept with raw ingredients you choose and they cook for you. I'm not a pho expert, but it tasted great and was a welcomed lighter dish than the rest of the buffet offerings. I was also impressed by their chicken wings. I'm not sure what the sauce was and they were a little small, but the flavor definitely made up for that. Just try them. I was happy to find potstickers on the line, which is not always offered at similar restaurants. I am choosing not to comment on the sushi since we came around 2pm and it wasn't being made fresh at the time.

Every employee I encountered was courteous and helpful. The atmosphere is welcoming and definitely new. They've also got plenty of space with private party rooms. Again, for the price, this place takes the top spot in my mind for atmosphere, value, variety, and taste.

Great little tobacconist.  I've been shopping here for years because they're the only ones I've found that stock good rolling tobacco.  Very attentive staff and owner that listen to what I'm looking for and if they don't have it they will stock it.  It's always a pleasure to go here.

Outstanding! We tried this hidden gem on Brandon Blvd. for the first time and all we can say is we are very happy that we did. This is authentic 100%! The prices are perfect and you really got your money's worth. Please visit here and enjoy! I would give it 6 stars if I could.

I ordered seafood Tom Yum soup, it was full of tomatos and imitation craps but no other seafood. 
I ordered also Salmon with garlic sauce, first of all they delivered Chicken with garlic sauce,charged me the price of salmon, and when I called they didn't even apologize and told me that I said chicken. Then why the hell would you charge me the price for salmon??? Bad service, not great quality..... not worth going there or delivery

Meat forward menu that won't disappoint. Personally, I love ordering a glass of wine and watching the old movies on the screen behind the bar.  It's a great place for a date, and be sure to try the boudin and Foie Gras.
Been here frequently. This is the best. The are other ramen places in Philly which are wonderful, but this is the best pure ramen house. Don't pass this up. Eat here!!!!

He is affordable and does a great job! As far as the negative reviews.. If you can't get in touch pop in, to the person whose dog was poisoned..you should have already called the poison hotline and had the situation assesed. If you want to be treated like a queen and pay top$ I agree go somewhere else. But if you just want a good basic no frills vet at an affordable price he is definitely your guy!!!

Best Halal cart in the city! Since the offer is available, whenever I get lamb, chicken, or combo over rice I allow them to add fried pepper and onion. ALWAYS worth it! Great prices for great meals, not to mention a very friendly fella serving 'em up!

I am a Trinidadian myself who has lived most of my life in Jamaica, Queens, where much of the population is also from the Caribbean. I recently moved to Levittown, Pennsylvania after graduating college and found a great Trini spot in Hamilton, New Jersey about 20 minutes from my house where I can get some great, cheap, authentic Trinidadian eats. Then, I moved to Warrington, Pennsylvania, and began to crave some good Trinidadian food! I did a search on the Internet for places nearby and this came up. Upon entering the place and looking at the menu, I could tell that the food was primarily Jamaican despite the owners being Trinidadian. That was no problem for me because I love Jamaican food as well. The food was very tasty: I got a fish sandwich as well as a curried shrimp platter with rice and beans and cabbage. My total came out to almost $26. The food was pretty decent. However, it was extremely, extremely pricey. The shrimp platter in itself was $15, and most of the other platters on their menu range from $14 to $16. (The fish sandwich was  $7.) Coming from Queens, and also having traveled around Brooklyn as well, I knew that this price was outrageous. I've gotten similar platters for $9, $10 max in NYC. Maybe even $12, but nowhere near $15. The food was very good for what I have eaten around Pennsylvania, but it was also not as good as the platters in NYC in terms of taste. I will definitely return but it won't be a regular thing due to the prices.

All dive bars are great for drinking, but Yo Mama's has the food to go with it. Bring your appetite.

The menu is simple - burgers, and your choice of a baked potato or mac-n-cheese on the side. I've had 3 of their burgers - all delicious, but the Peanut Butter Burger is killer.. a must try! Trust me, I was hesitant at first but it is delicious!

The baked potatoes are my side of choice. The mac-n-cheese (I've had only once) was okay, not great.. and the portion was small. In comparison to the monster baked potato, it's an easy choice (for me, lol.

The place itself is your typical hole-in-the-wall.. friendly, no-BS bartenders.. upstairs has extra setting, all indoor.

No frills. Great authentic food. 

You'll know about the lines before you get there, so once you're prepared for that it's not a problem. The food will not woo fine diners, but it's solid, such good value and it's more about the overall experience. 

The busy kitchen is part of the joy of this place and watching the parts of the puzzle come together in this kitchen based choreography is awesome. An absolute joy.

Had to come here to get dog food because we didn't have time to grab ours due to the fact we had to evacuate our home from the fires. The gentleman working was super friendly and even threw in a free bag of treats after learning we had to evacuate and have had a long day.

I trust Dr. Woody and his staff at Main Street Chiropractic to treat me and my three children. He's helped me recover from several sports-related injuries and has treated my kids their whole lives. He's kept us all relatively happy and healthy. He has several treatments available including chiropractic adjustments, massage therapy, electro stimulus of muscles, icing, heat and ultrasound.

Tens across the board. James greeted me at the door downstairs and led me upstairs to the studio. After a short wait, the 60 minute session began and he paid special attention to my lower back and shoulders. I went to sleep at least five times. If i could pack his things and move him out to San Francisco with me...I WOULD. He has hands of gold! Will request him the next time i am in Philadelphia.
LOVE this place. Staff very friendly and the food is good. Priced right and never too long of a wait.
Good food,  great prices,  friendly staff. Soup, salad,  and lunch entrée,  for under ten bucks.  Great deal!  Clean!

I'm sitting at the bar writing as I eat:  The waffle and coffee were great, however I had to ask for cream for my coffee and syrup for my waffle.  Not happy about that.  I'm adding to this:  I wasn't asked for a refill of my coffee. I'm taking two stars away!

Great bar, great bartenders, great people. Fantastic happy hour.  What more do you need to know?   Tough looking on the outside but you feel like you've been going there for years (and we just stopped in for the first time).

This place is always "understaffed".  There is always drama.  I can here the cooks fighting from the dining area.  The tables are not clean and of course the wait time is long.  My food tastes ok.  But this place needs new staff.

The Hotel Congress is a nice, reasonably priced historic hotel. The property was built in 1919, and retains its historic grace. Rooms are small for modern tastes, as are the beds (doubles are the norm) and bathrooms, and are tastefully decorated in period decor. I asked for a quiet room when I made my reservation, and that's what I got--no issues there. Hotel staff were friendly. Free validated parking across the street was an unexpected bonus. 

Kudos too for the Tap Room, the small bar attached to the hotel. Here you will find a great jukebox and some fine cocktails featuring house made ingredients. I had an interesting take on a Dark and Stormy, featuring house made ginger syrup instead of the standard ginger beer, as well as a fantastic daiquiri, which was not at all swish and weak as might be expected but instead had real depth of flavor and was strong as a bull to boot. 

The price for all of this amazingness was just a shade over $100 per night--well under what the chain places out by the interstate were asking. I heart the Hotel Congress!
Take-out or delivery only. Fast Service. Cheap Prices. Nice little touch with cornmeal on the bottom of the crust.
Food was bad, service was bad. Margherita tasted like a virgin. Don't waste your time and money.
Great brunch spot. Food is excellent, wait staff is very nice, informative and patient. They had great recommendations for both the food and the drinks. Plan to go back again soon.

I was in for a business Lunch, the half sours are great start!  I had a bison burger with sautéed mushrooms onion and topped with fancy cheese that I don't know how to spell but it was awesome. I got the half fries half onion rings as a side which no one does. They have the small crunchy ice for soda which put it over the top for me!  I had passed this place a 100 times and really thought it would be average, it was nearly perfect. I want to go back for dinner and have an entree.

Larder and Cupboard is another great addition to the constantly growing Maplewood community. I knew I was going to shop local this upcoming holiday, but I can now tell you the majority of my gifts will be from Larder and Cupboard. There are so many items that will be perfect for the foodie and boozer on my gift list. 

My family and friends who enjoy the alcohol beverage, may be getting a gift box of bitters or a kit to create a kick ass Bloody Mary. Others may get a gift basket created with the large variety of different honey jars. My personal favorite has to be the Hot Honey, a perfect topping on cornbread or a biscuit. I can even create a condiment basket with gourmet catsup, Soy Sauce, Worcestershire Sauce and variety of mustards. 

The staff is friendly and eager to assist you. As they increase their inventory, I am confident that I'll be filling my own personal kitchen cabinets and creating several gift baskets.

Who doesn't love some good oysters? Came here to taste some for myself. We ordered the fresh raw variety as well as the chargrilled. The raw oysters were incredibly fresh and flavorful. The chargrilled were surprisingly tasty as well and had a nice crunch to them. The sauce they were served in was like icing on the cake. I recommend ordering extra bread to dip in the sauce.

This place is great! if you are looking for a cute and good brunch place this is it. they have $18 bottomless mimosas, margaritas and bloody marys. I ordered the breakfast tostada and it was way better than I expected. The pork was great and plates have a good size!

Why did it take us so long to find Arpeggios?  This is such a nice local restaurant.  We love the fresh hummus and ww pita to start the meal off.  The cajun chicken is my favorite and my husband loves the lobster ravioli.  Their salads are yummy too, especially the warm goat cheese salad.  The staff is always welcoming and good at accommodating your preferences.  Carolyn gave us great service on a recent visit.  Last Fall we had a memorable meal one cool evening with friends.  The patio heaters made it possible to squeeze in one more meal outside.
Awesome!  Had pressure light on way down from Phoenix.  Appoint in 35 min.  They took care of me in less than 5 min and sent me on my way.  Discount Tire is first class everywhere you find them!
Best Cuban foods around. Had Mamas meatloaf and real mashed potatoes. Homemade salad dressing, sangria and bread pudding. To die for!

This place is good for what it is...obviously if you're coming to a pizza buffet that's 2.99 you're not exactly going to get Ruth's Chris-level ambiance. BUT what you do get is above average pizza (try the hot wing pizza...my fav), salad bar, and soft serve ice cream. I've never been here for dinner so I can't say I've had to deal with the rugrats like some of the other reviewers have.  Nice place to kill 45 min - 1 hour on a lunch break though.

NOTE THAT THIS IS FOR THE LOCATION ON THE RIVER WALK, NOT THE ORIGINAL IN THE FRENCH MARKET. Stopped by on our first day in NOLA. Tried Cafe au lait for the first time, and found it a bit more bitter than I hoped. I figured it would be half coffee, half milk/cream. At least it was hot. The beignets were tasty and sweet, a bit heavier than I'd hoped. If I stood in the line at the French Market, I would have been disappointed.
The views here are better than the views in French Market. You can watch the steamboats on the river, and maybe a Carnival cruise will pass by.
First time having hot chicken. Tiny hole in the wall place. We walked in and they were filming an episode for Vice, with Action Bronson. You know it's a good place to eat if he is there eating it!
Traveling with my husband and daughter, and saw this restaurant on Yelp.  It is absolutely FABULOUS!

The dude who rang me up was so accommodating and sweet. My falafel wrap was humongous for only $7. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I found it to be very bland even though it was loaded with vegetables and hot sauce. Definitely going to give them another try. Maybe I just caught them on an off day.

On a recent trip to St. Louis, we decided to only eat in restaurants we hadn't eaten in before.  We were staying in the Overland area, so we were looking for restaurants more centrally located, not downtown.  After reading several reviews, we settled on Pastaria in Clayton.   We arrived there around 6:30 on a Sunday evening and found street parking easily.  When we walked in, we realized that it was packed!  I was still on Tennessee time and so that felt like 7:30 to me and I was starving, so we grabbed the last two seats at the counter.  Kind of awkward and right on the end, but we loved it.  We had a great view of their wood fired oven and the stoves.  Watching the chef's work was fascinating.  I'm so glad that we didn't sit somewhere out in the restaurant!

Our waitress, Tiffany, was excellent.  She answered all of our questions and took our order quickly.  My husband ordered the Wood Oven Roasted Chicken.   I ordered the Italian Ramen.  We split a mixed green salad.  They split the salad for us and it was perfect.  A nice spring greens mix with pears, walnuts and goat cheese.

It did take a while for us to get our food, but we didn't really mind.  We were watching the chef's work, the pizzas being made and of the goings on behind the counter.  We kept trying to guess which chicken in the oven was going to be my husbands.  When the food came, it was more than worth the wait.  My husband's chicken was fantastic.  It was a large chicken breast with part of the wing.  It was smokey with crisp skin, but still moist inside.  It was served with a bread salad of toasted bread, cucumbers, tomatoes and pickled red onions.

My Italian Ramen was incredible.  I could eat this every day for the rest of my life.  The broth was insanely rich and flavorful and almost thick from the grana padano cheese.  The ramen noodles, perfectly chewy and the chicken, smoky and tender.  Topped with a perfectly cooked soft egg and fresh basil.  I was going to try and get the runny egg yolk food porn shot, but I knew that once I put my spoon it it, I was going to be all about the eating, and not about the photos.  I want to try and make this at home.  It was like chicken noodle soup kicked up several hundred notches.

Next time we go to St. Louis, it's going to be hard to stick to our only new restaurant rule, because this ramen is going to be calling to me.

Service superb. Excellent wine list. Hubby had the duck confit. Good not great. His chix and Andouille gumbo was awesome! I had the burato j starter and the spaghetti with the poached fried egg. Super.  Our gueat had lamb neck. Sounds weird but it was delish.

I'd first like to start out by saying that this is THE FIRST bad review that I have ever written. I went to this establishment because I had heard that they had great live jazz music. The cover was $10 a head which was kind of strange for the area but I didn't hesitate paying since I had heard it was a cool spot. I gave the lady at the front door two $5a and a $20 since I was paying for me and my married friends and not only did the lady try and say that I only gave her $10 but she was super stubborn and upright rude about the situation to the point that she threatened to call the police when simply all I wanted was my money back since she said that I had only paid her $10 instead of $30. As a business person this is hands down the lowest of the low slap in the face and I will never return.
I liked this place until today. I came in for a waxing and they said "oh, we are busy, you need to come back later, sorry". Not even a "can you wait?". Lame

Excellent food, cocktails, wine, service, and decor. We were able to transfer our bar tab over to our table easily. The biscuits and honey butter set the stage for the wonderful food. Perfectly cooked filet mignon medium rare, with a unique flavor on the creamed spinach. Dark and posh decor are the perfect backdrop to a fabulous meal. Our waiter was attentive, knowledgeable, and professional. If I'm back in Philly I will definitely return.

I moved to Philadelphia four years ago, and based on reviews I found online, I decided to give American Mortals a shot. When I called to make my first appointment, I was randomly assigned Shari...and I've been going back to her exclusively ever since.

Our relationship could have gotten off to a rocky start, as I had to cancel my first appointment with less than 30 minutes notice because I got pulled into a meeting at the end of the day that I couldn't escape. Shari was great about it though, and squeezed me in the following day and didn't give me a hard time...only a great haircut. The rest, as they say, is history.

The best thing about working with Shari is that she is able to deal with my lack of clear direction. When I sit down and say things like "I want to keep it longish" or "I think, maybe, it might be time to do something sort of short", she just nods and goes to work. The end result is always better than I could have described anyway, and I completely trust her to do what ever she feels like doing...she hasn't led me astray yet!

I just rode my bike to Cold Snap.  The girl working there was awesome - she even grabbed some new mochi from the back.  I wanted one of my friends to try mochi (rice cake that is like a gummi bear).  I like a little topping on my yogurt but not much, and I hate when even sprinkles make a yogurt an extra 6 ounces!  This is not a weigh-by-the-ounce place.  Cold Snap even has shaved ice - their fruit looks extremely fresh, so I would love to try this sometime.  Also, their motif decorations are cool.

Cold Snap's tart flavors seem to be less sour than they were last year but still tart, so that is a huge plus.  Any time there are children that come into Cold Snap, they seem to be extra attentive.  There is also a punchcard ( I bought two yogurts and got two punches, paid $6, and got something far better than a gallon of ice cream - only 100 calories and non-fat too).  You can get a student discount too if that applies to you.  The two restaurants adjacent to Cold Snap have closed; I hope Cold Snap stays open forever!  Look at their facebook page for current flavors.

I came here on a first friday. Food (buffet) was very good. I had a drink that was in a small glass mostly ice and was almost $15 thats just robbery. The cruise itself was three hours long I normally wouldn't complain but the music was too old school/pop for my liking. It was also too cold to enjoy the outside part of the ship. I would return just on a warmer day.

My husband and I were here for lunch on Presidents' Day. 
The good:
A) Homage to Bern's
B) ChocolatePi is right outside the door.

The bad:
The oysters were not fresh. I thought I was going to get sick because the last oyster I had really had a putrid smell to it as it went down my throat. 

The indifference:
A) Service. It could be more attentive. I am not asking for royal treatment, but at least ask me how the food was after each course. Also don't make me repeat my request for water refill. We are in Florida not Paris! Though judging from prior reviews, things must have improved in this area.

B) The duck duck goose burger was nothing to write home about. If you are on the fence, just skip it. 

Elevage is not Bern's , though owned by the same people. Don't come here expecting Bern's. You will be disappointed. 

Overall it's a good restaurant. Will I go again? Yes of course. The next time we have one of those days when work is off but daycare is open, you will find me there at lunch.

I have to be honest...moved in Jan 2011, it was very nice.....  Then my fiancee and I lived here for a little while.  Management could be very accomodating, but they aren't.  Staff could be pleasant, but they aren't.  

If you happen to make a mistake and lock your keys in your apartment, do it during work hours, cause you are going to get charged $50 if it happens on a Sunday, when NO maintenance staff are there...

If you want to workout on an eliptical, good luck.  1 out of there 3 has been down for more than 2 months, and the entire issue is the battery, simple fix.  NO ONE CARES...

One thing I will say is we had no issues with mice, thank god, but everything else, BRUTAL.

Good luck working with their staff, they are 100% hit or miss.

The service was great, this has nothing to do with the service at all. In fact that's the only reason I'm giving them 2 stars. I ordered the Philly cheese steak which is a Weds special. Now normally, I go to an alternate location and they're fine there, amazing even. I order one here & wow....it was terrible. Cheddar cheese? Since when? It's always been a white cheese, like mozarella or something but never cheddar. Found out that they just switched to that...well that was a bad idea. Worse cheese steak I've ever had. Even the peppers were bad. I had some that were hard and I couldn't chew them up so I had to spit them out into a napkin. I had to do this 3 separate times before I decided I can't take this anymore. I politely asked the waitress to take it off my bill because of how bad it was which she did. I don't know about their steaks at this location but if they treat them how they did this cheese steak, I definitely wouldn't expect anything good. I won't return here, I'll go to my normal Tucker's location.
Try the prosciutto and arugula pizza.  Excellent.   We were seated quickly.  Service was attentive.

I couldn't be more happy with the experience I had with Bill.  I have a leased vehicle and had a scratch along the side of the car and two dents.  One dent on the door panel and another that was in a really odd spot.  After reading all the great reviews I decided to give PA Dent Repair a shot even though it would be a 1.5 hour drive.  I submitted a quote request via their website and received a call within a few hours.  Bill was professional, courteous, and was happy to explain what he was doing every step of the way.  I waited at his shop while he worked on the car and got to see the art involved in performing a quality dent repair.  You won't regret going to him for your dent and exterior detailing needs.  Top craftsmanship, the best materials, and an extremely reasonable pricing structure.

Thank you so much for your help and I look forward to bringing my wife's car in as well!

In my quest for a representative example of authentic St. Louis style BBQ, I was directed to Bogart's Smoke house. We ordered the "Old Joe" to split among the four of us. The ribs were delicious, tender, but not mushy! There was a selection of sauces, from which I selected the "Sweet Meagan Ann"... It was delicious and tasted to be molasses-based. With our dinner came pulled pork and beef brisket sandwiches, BBQ beans, coleslaw, "Fire & Ice Pickles" & "Deviled Egg Potato Salad". Everything was delicious!

Do not call in advance if you have to be somewhere on time. 
I called 3 hours in advance to reserve the cab for 3:15. Once they were already late 25 minutes, I called operator and got rude and disrespectful answer: "driver might be there in 5 minutes or in 1 hour, the best I can do". I had to go to the wedding and was extremely late. The cab never showed and I had to drive my own car.  
Bad business.

Overall theme: VALUE DOES NOT MATCH PRICE POINT.

I have been to Flyte on two occasions. On one occasion, it was for a Valentine's day meal. This means a restricted menu. Not a great comparison for the one of a the busiest dining days of the year, so I opted to try Flyte again this past Friday. For ambience, I would give it 3 *** It is a pleasant, romantic environment with lots of urban piping, followed by low level lighting and candle light. 

Highlights: They offer an amazing wine selection, along with my favorite CHEESE by a A La Carte selection with various side items to add to your wine/cheese tasting experience. It is usually served with basic water crackers, which I found odd. For a high end establishment, I would have chosen a homemade artisan cracker, rather than any basic garden variety. 

The food is not terrible, and I would say the scallops were good to average, but overall, I find Flyte to not be terribly innovative for a fine dining experience. Overall, the portions are small, and there is nothing particularly exceptional about this experience. Prices are a bit over inflated and I had a hope that my second experience would offer more. Basically, I think this is a restaurant based on making a profit for offering something slightly urban, in an area already lacking in this type of establishment. This restaurant would never make it in Denver. I am not saying it is terrible. If you want a decent meal, good ambience, with some options for good wine, and to pay an inflated cost, I would say try it out. Honestly, I think they can do better.

Ordered takeout for the first time from them at this location .  It was so good!  Everything was perfect.  We had the chicken and steak & shrimp hibachi.  The salad was more than just bib  lettuce, the steak was cooked perfectly and everything had such good flavor.

yes!
This really has a dive bar feel but good lawd you've got to stop in for some great times and playful characters.  The tout an amazing beer selection and some flavorful pub fare

I talked to several different plumbers before I chose On The Way to re-pipe my home, but I knew in the first few minutes that Sergio was who I wanted to do the job. Not only was he polite and professional, but he was knowledgable & easy to talk to. He did the job they way I actually wanted it done (even though that meant working in a tight crawl space) and he was careful not to damage as much of my of my existing finishes as possible. He alerted us to existing problems other plumbers didn't even ask about. For the quality of his workmanship he provided us a very fair bid, & completed the work on time & on budget. 

I simply won't call anyone else.

Absolutely delicious! Shared the vegetarian philly cheese steak and the crispy tofu-very flavorful and filling! The crispy tofu seems like an interesting combination of flavors, but it is such an amazing balance of sweet salsa and savory tofu with soba noodles. The vegetarian Philly cheese steak was flavorful, but a little dry and spicy towards the end. Overall, the plate presentations were colorful and inviting. I would recommend to anyone who is looking for vegetarian /vegan options or just looking for some good eats! Also, our server, Danny, was very nice and helpful-gave us some pointers to check out throughout the city.
We loved shells! Especially their crab leg options. I was pleased to find Dungeness crab legs, restaurants rarely carry them.

My take away was the chocolate shake, hands down. This place has great reviews as it is overall, but I didn't see anything on the shakes. The chocolate shake was the best decision of my trip to Indianapolis! Just wanted to point that out from the start, lol. 
Being from California, food was tough to find and I'm glad I found this spot. However, it was really "hipster", if you will. If you're looking for a place that feels like home, this isn't the place. However, the lights and decor certainly look great and again, give it a nice "hipster" feel and vibe. That being said, the food was good. The bourbon burger was okay; the fries and the shake really take the credit, (again especially the shake). 
The burger bun was on point; I wish all burgers had that bun. The house ketchup was not all that; preferred the ranch. 
In sum, if you're in town, def stop by, just don't forget your shake!
Poor conditions.  We booked the "suite" which ended up being only a double queen room.  The bed put a crick in my neck that is still there. I would not recommend this.

Great venue for concerts.  Recently attended Zach Brown Band's performance.  Lawn seats were enjoyable, the performance itself was fantastic.  Although you can be a long away from the stage, I prefer the lawn seats with the ability to spread out.  I recommend this venue.

My good friend John "Mr. Pizza" Morris told me that this place is the best in town for pizza and that I had to go there (and invite him) and put it in the mix for the review.

They do pizza by the slice (I love sampling a variety of pies) and thus I got a pepperoni pizza and then three additional slices to try. Well..... I say slices, but that would be understating what I experienced.

I got the special, (same combo as before) which was very good, and against my better judgment the white pizza (I don't like white pizza but thought I would try this one).  Surprise, surprise, I didn't care for it and am officially retiring myself from the white pizza league. It's been real, but I am over it.

Following the white pizza catastrophe, I sought to raise my spirits with the "Stuffed Slice".

Imagine a pie, but it's pizza. Bottom crust (like any pizza) then an inch or two of mozzarella, ricotta and other goodness and a TOP CRUST and that's what you have. You know what? Just check the picture, I can't explain it and do it any sort of justice.

The pizza is very good; it's in the top five on it's own. The "Stuffed Slice"; it's over the top. It's fantastic. I am a convert. I will never go here again without getting it. It is a must. My only criticism, (God, I'm really splitting hairs here) is that they only do one type of "stuffed slice", as best I can tell. I have to defer to my man Fred Zand who said it would be great to have some other types, a cheesesteak or something and some other samplings. This pizza is really something that you have to try. I love it, and you won't convince me that it doesn't have magical properties. If you're on a diet, break it. You have to have this pizza; you too will be a convert.

I read about Pet Vet on the internet and liked their story (they've grown out of two different locations since opening almost 20 years ago)...so I made the drive with two kids in tow for our cat's annual checkup.

The receptionist Nancy was super super friendly!!!  I felt right at home with her:).  She got us right in for our appointment with dr. Alexander who did a great job checking our cat out!  He was quickly given two shots and then we were sent on our way.

The coolest thing was the ID card we were given for our cat.  We can take it anywhere and show it to buy cd cat food (which you have to have a prescription for...the ID card acts as a prescription)...what a great idea!!!

Would select minus 5 stars but will not let me. Making me pick something.  The worst meal ever. Expensive steak was very tough and not cooked properly. Sat us outside with tour buses idling.  Noisy. Poor service.

Food great, however they do NOT accept Yelp reservations. Made the reservation on Yelp and when we walked in they said we advertise with Yelp but do not accept their reservations. Oishi's their sister restaurant has exact same food only cheaper because KO has a liquor license
Would not return

**Do not be turned away by the surrounding plaza!**

It's true - the location has zero appeal on the outside. However, inside is clean and open. 
We went around 4pm for an early dinner.
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!

We ordered 3 rolls (Mexican, volcano, and sweet potato + cream cheese). All were VERY good. The volcano has chopped bits on fish and scollops in the baked topping. Best volcano I've had ever. 

We also ordered the hibachi chicken dinner to share. Big portion of chicken, veggies, rice, and noodles. The best part about it - they served yum yum sauce in a bowl with a spoon (they know what's up! Haha) 

Take my advice - try this place!

Been here several times, always quick service and good food. Calamari is a cut above other restaurants offerings. 

Great wine list and helpful staff, worth checking out!
Great Thai food in St. Pete. You won't be disappointed. Masaman curry was excellent. Very spicy just how I like it. Check it out if looking for good Thai in The Burg.

The thing I love the most about it is the ambiance and service. We ordered taco fish and Tamale as starters and they were excellent. My entree was short ribs (Costillas al Piquin) and it was great. The meat was very tender. I will go back for sure.

Awesome time..Lynn and her staff we great! Great teachers, great stories that relate to the cooking styles. Very informative..wine was great. Our family had a blast. If you like to cook and at least want to learn how they make certain NOLA foods...book it..you will not be disappointed! Enjoy!
A very delectible byob, would go there again but nothing really stood out on the menu.

There's a ton to like about the Hutton Hotel, from the obvious tiny touches and finery to the extra care they build into your experience when you set foot inside. It's an easy place to stay by and large, and though I wasn't here for more than a night this go round, I definitely enjoyed my stay. 

It's worth mentioning that I don't count on sleeping well in hotels - one's experience can vary wildly from one place to the next, and even some of the nicer hotels around can't seem to manage the Pillow Conundrum, wherein they furnish rooms with pillows so puffy your head basically sleeps at a ninety degree angle. I digress, but you see my point: little touches like fluffy pillows that are actually comfortable to sleep on rule the day here, and it seems most everyone I met kind bordering on enthusiastic (with the sole exception being one of the housekeeping staff, and in fairness to her, it was about time for me to check out at that point). Still, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. 

I'm just scratching the surface on Nashville and can't wait for my next trip in. This green hotel is but one of those reasons.

Went to Grannies once and will never return! Friends told us the breakfast was good there but we only managed to get there for lunch. What a mistake. Where to start? The food was less than average.
