The wait staff was just OK, they had more to talk about to each other than making us feel at home. What absolutely turned my stomach was how dirty this place is. The tables were sticky, the windows look like they haven't been cleaned in quite a while and there were an ample supply of flies! In addition, when I asked where the bathroom was, they told me outside in a separate building. I got the key, went outside and was appalled at how filthy the bathroom was. Can't imagine how they can pass any inspection. So, if you're not concerned about cleanliness, and less than average food, this may be the place for you. I've eaten at many Mom and Pop places and found many of them to be extremely good, but this one is really bad.
Car on the rack 5 minutes...two hours to change the battery! UGH Did the mechanics go on a break? Sad to say that I will not return. Pros: front staff wonderful and knowlegeable.

Great collection of Dogfish Head.  My cousin and I went for brunch with my baby girl.  We ordered 2 items off their special menu:  the smoked meats breakfast plate and the seafood ceviche.  I also ordered the Delaware Crab Chowder.  The breakfast plate came with a pint of Dogfish Head Beer For Breakfast (Brewed with pork scrapple!) and it accompanied our food quite well.  It was a nice casual meal and was tasty and well priced.  Will come again when I'm here visiting family.

Reviewing for spa and massage:

My massage therapist was Kristina. She did a fantastic job and make me feel extremely comfortable. I had a 75 minute Swedish massage and instantly felt better as she began to work. She worked out my knots and stress and really put all of her effort into working on me. Having had massages before, being comfortable with the therapist is a must for me. She exceeded all of my expectations. I wish I could see her monthly. I would if I could afford it!

The showers in the spa are amazing. It has a raining head and side faucets. I could have stayed in the shower forever! The robes provided are comfortable and the lounging area after you have spa services is quiet and relaxing with snacks, water, and hot tea.

I look forward to coming back for more spa services and trying out their hair salon as well!

I tend to say "hidden gems" a lot in my reviews and here is another one. The place looks quaint from the outside but inside, it's all business. I came in by myself on a Wednesday afternoon and most tables were filled. That's a very good sign. Then, I ordered the seafood noodle soup. The helpings were large and the food did tasted as authentic as advertised. My only regret is that it took so long for me to find this place, even though it is pretty much in my backyard,
Come early and no wait. Eating at the bar tonight. My favorite is the turkey dip with wedge salad. Huge menu,something for everyone. Good BJ beer. Tried the pumpkin last time. Very tasty.

Had a late lunch here on a Sunday afternoon.  The 5 of us were greeted and seated promptly in a mostly empty restaurant.  The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere/noise level was good for conversing.  The lunch menu had a wide variety of options (including many non-spicy options for the less adventurous eaters in our party).  The food took a little while to prepare but nothing extreme...the pace was a leisurely lunch.  We all had sandwiches.  The food was very good and the fries were delicious.   The server was very friendly and attentive - refilling waters throughout the meal and offering more bread when we ran out.  I will return in the future.

I want to like this place but I think it's still finding it's feet.
One problem I have with healthy restaurants in general is that they are overpriced, which turns off a large part of the market. Quality ingredients aren't cheap, but beans, bread, and rice aren't exactly luxury goods either.
We stopped in for brunch today, and had the choice of breakfast or lunch food. I had the field and dreams salad, which was fresh mixed greens, pickled onions, yams, orange segments, and walnuts. All the ingredients were good and crisp, but the portion was pretty meager for $8.00. My friend had the Rita Pita Pizza, which was basically a pita pizza, for $8.00, which had skimpy toppings and also seemed overpriced. She enjoyed her smoothie (for $6.00!) made with fresh fruit, and I liked my coffee. Mashed avocado toast that we added on because we were still hungry, was absurd. For $4.50, we a piece of diner-sized toast, with some avocado and nutritional yeast on top. At least I didn't have to worry about portion control or getting a to-go box.
I know I'm harping on prices, but I felt like I could get food that tasted much better at other local places: Fork, Juniper, Locavore, etc that is just as healthy and quality. Banking on the health halo to support the restaurant and the prices is irritating.
I love the idea of the Cultivate plate, however, which you can buy and pay extra for to support meals for those who can't afford as much. As a vegan, I also support any restaurant who makes eating cruelty-free a priority. I think it's great they have healthy food and are a much needed third option for veg*ns in Boise. I just think they're relying on being in a small market and not serving the quality they could.
I spent several years in Santa Monica where they had amazing vegan food, and I think Boise could really step up and do better. (California haters, stop. I'm a native. I just took an extended vacation to the beach, so I don't want to hear it.) We'd make better inroads into the meat and potatoes crowd if we presented tastier, more accessable food at prices people could afford.
Stopped here for dinner with my family.  Nice atmosphere great service and the food tonight was excellent. I would recommend coming here for dinner with your family.
Simply poor service, mediocre sushi and a plain disappointment. This was voted best on Boise?  Not best in my world. Never to return...
One of my favorite coffee shops in town. Love this place because the coffee is good and the service is always quick.

Would not stay here again. The rooms and facilities are aging and over the course of a 2 day stay the WiFi was offline. The staff explained that their internet connection is very slow and if too many people try to use it that it's unavailable. I tried connecting at off-peak times without luck, am doubtful that it works at all.

This spot is great. I honestly haven't explored their menu too much, as I'm obsessed with their pea leaves and their eggplant, and order that most of the time. However, the friends that I've visited with have ordered more creatively have also thoroughly enjoyed.

What I like - 
*Food Allergies - They are extremely accommodating of allergies, intolerances, and the like.
*Children - This spot is great for bringing kids to lunch. The food is just so fast.
*The staff - Everyone from the management to the waiters are so welcoming and cool.

I'm surprised by the reviews stating that lunch at this location is great, but not dinner. I've been here at least 3 times for dinner and have had quick and delicious experiences each time.
Stopped in and had some heart surgery on my daughter.  It was pretty good but they only refilled our water glasses once.  I knocked off one star because of that.

Had a wonderful experience at the Parish last week. This was my first time there and I would definitely return. The atmosphere of this restaurant is nothing like anything else I have experienced in Tucson. Perfect for a low-key date night. 

The food was beyond delicious. I ordered the "Dark Angel" and the cornbread to start. Both I would highly recommend. 

They have a large selection of unique hand crafted cocktails. I ordered the "Front Porch", it was light and not too sweet! 

Can't wait to return to the Parish for a second visit!

I stopped into this winery on a Monday afternoon.  I was killing some time before I had to catch the train.  It was such a nice little tasting room.  The staff was very personable and knowledge able.  It was fun talking to the other people in the tasting room as well.  I tried the red wine flight, 5 wines for $10 and thought they all were delicious.  Generous pours, too.

This place is pretty much over-rated. I give it 2.5 stars. I'm a huge fan of pulled pork sandwiches and have tried my fair share but this is not one of the places to get a really good one. Sure they give you a lot of meat but the quality, tastiness, and moistness is just average. I'm pretty sure one of the the reasons why the meat is dry is because they chop up the pork too finely, instead of it being pulled or slightly chopped. And this place is real stingy with their BBQ sauce. You have to ask for it on your sandwich (or meal) and then they pour just a little bit on your sandwich. Then there are no dispensers or bottles to put more BBQ sauce on if you want to. But besides that, the sauce isn't that good at all anyways. The sauce has this sour & odd taste to it that just doesn't taste right...or that good. And the hotter BBQ sauce wasn't hot at all and also lacked taste.

As for the sides, the macaroni salad looked and tasted exactly as if you were to buy the store brand kind at Publix / Sweet Bay / Wal-Mart / etc. Cole slaw was plain & average. Not sweet whatsoever and even salt didn't help kick up the flavor.

Price wasn't cheap either. And there is no lunch specials there at all which is surprising.

The new layout and remodel is nice but doesn't make up for the average food and high prices.
Great food, great prices, hit or miss service. Their moussaka is one of my favorite dishes anywhere!
Loved the chorizo breakfast burrito!! It was so big, I could only finish half of it. Being open 24 hours is a major plus!

This place is great. Good food good prices. The people who work there are helpful. The one thing the desserts are way ro rich. I tell everyone I know to go there it is one of the true hidden gems in nampa.

Oh goodness. As a cinci native and a former (although it brief) employee,  greaters has a very sweet place in my heart. I was thrilled to learn it was coming to Indy...and my waistband was not when I saw it was just a few blocks away  

I will say, greaters is by far my favorite ice cream in the entire universe. I'm still convinced that there is a magic ingredient that makes this so. I have tried every flavor and below are my absolute faves. 

In addition, this location stole my heart when an employee was making my free Sundae (you get one on your birthday if you are part of the rewards club!) and I told him I was a former employee, he proceeded to ask me if I wanted some extra toppings. Ah! As if the ice cream wasn't enough to keep me coming back! 

Faves: Black raspberry chip
           Salted caramel 
           Chocolate chip cookie dough 
            *the dark chocolate gelato is good if you MUST watch your calories 

Tip: scoops are HUGE. Order a "child's scoop" for a more reasonable portion size

Food was ok.  I picked up a roast pork w/spinach and sharp provolone.  A cheesesteak with onions and american cheese and some fries.  Huge quantity of meat, but too much meat perhaps.  Fries were not good.  I just don't like crinkle cut for some reason.  My only surprise was there was no cheese whiz!  Oh well.  Would I go again?  Probably not.  I like Tony Lukes better.  Better bread and better tasting I think.

Great fun drink menu! My cocktails were so delicious with the perfect amount of punch. Service could be a hair friendlier.. waitress seemed grumpy when we didn't immediately order food. I felt the urge to look around for a sign that stated we were obligated to have food in order to stay. Whatevs, we had a good time anyway. The space is efficient and they seated our group of 6 with a reasonable amount of wait time for dropping in on a Friday evening. Definitely a good spot to share a lovely evening with good company.

Really great pizza by the slice, the crust is awesome.  A couple vegetarian options.  Really good beer selection (although small) of draft and bottled beers, mostly domestic west coast breweries.

probably like $8/9 for 2 slices and a beer.  good pizza too.

the only downfall is its Cash Only!

Nice view, good location. The building is older but well maintained. The staff is friendly and attentive. The downsides are that downtown really is not a lively place, no shopping, no convenient walk to shops, restaurants. Some are here but have limited hours. I have lived in many downtown areas and Tucson is an up and coming location but has several years to actually make it to a level where I would recommend living here. As far as places to live downtown Redondo Tower is top on my list.

We had an amazing experience with BC kitchen! Every time we went in everyone that was working was so friendly and helpful.  We went to a local cabinet place, and when we got the design they didn't take in consideration in what we wanted., but BC Kitchen listened and designed exactly what we wanted. Not to mention their prices are awesome and very reasonable! The cabinets are good quality. The installation guys were kind of late to arrive for installation, but they did SUCH A GOOD JOB. I honestly can't say anymore good things about this place. The installers were so nice, and they stayed a long time and made sure we were happy with everything. They triple checked everything to make sure it was all level. And the best part, they left such a clean space! We are so happy with our purchase.

You know what I love? 

Oyster crackers.

You know why I love Route 6?

Because their bread service consists of GIANT oyster crackers that are fat, salty and quintessentially oyster-crackery and don't make your mouth feel like a desert. 

Oh yeah, and they serve horseradish to spread on your oversized oyster crackers.

Very nice owners, and good, solid sushi. Not sure whether the lunch buffet option is good or not. Tends to get very busy, which shows that they are doing something right. Good location especially for people who live Eastside or central.

The best take-and -bake pizza on the planet! Friendly staff every time I've been in. I never would have thought  this type of pizza place would work; that we're basically too lazy to take it home and bake it ourselves. But believe me, it does. And you'll be rewarded with some of the best pizza you've ever had. You gotta check it out if you've never been!

My wife and I have been staying across the bridge form this place for a month now and we finally made it over to try it out.  I am very upset that we waited so long.  The view from the deck is great.  The service could not have been better, everyone we encountered was happy and helpful.  And the food was incredible.  Started with the Conch Chowder and it was the best I have ever had, spicy and flavorful, then we went and had Conch Fritters and Bong Bong Shrimp.  Both were very good and the beer was cold and cheap.  We will definitely be back before we leave town!

The atmosphere of this place is awesome, it's very nice. I ordered some sushi rolls which were good, pleasing. I also order a taro milkshake with boba.... wow I must say it's got to be one of the best boba shakes I've had. To fulfill my sushi and boba craving this place would be it.

WOW! This place is amazing! Went with a couple of friends and we all had different flavors. I loved them all but my favorite was the coconut cream. If you are a fan of coconut then you have to get the coconut cream. You won't be disappointed.
My husband and I went here for lunch and al I have to say is amazing!! The quality of the taste is so so good. I love their lechon meal. It's a lot of food and very filling!

Eric took great care of us in bar. Spinach salad c fried oysters was perfect. The blackened redfish was as good as I remember from K-Paul's 20 yrs ago. Potatoes cold because it was late and chef had gone home. Come earlier than closing.
Great service, management with excellent Seafood and steaks. A great 'go-to' for business lunches.

Went the the orchards on a perfect autumn day.  We went apple picking first.  It was a bit more expensive than what I am used to paying at other orchards in NJ and MA.  We went mid-October so I was a bit disappointed that there were very few apples left.  The apples aren't organic here but nevertheless they were crisp, sweet, and crunchy.  A lot of the apples are starting to rot/have worm holes. The bakery/market was amazing.  We purchased half a dozen apple cider doughnuts and a carrot cake slice.  Doughnuts were fantastic.  I could see why they received the "Best of Philly" award a few years back.

My truck broke down in Nashville, so decided to make the best of it a find some killer ribs. I checked out the reviews on yelp and I stopped by G'z to check it out. The owner and his cousin who worked there were super hospitable and hilarious messing with each other. The ribs were also delicious, falling off the bone, and they had some great sauces. 

G'z gave me the perfect authentic Nashville BBQ experience!

Eat in experience was great although the wait for a table is long and there is nowhere to stand except to just stand next to occupied tables and try not to make eye contact with the other diners.  Food and service were awesome though.
Tried the carryout option on second visit - not as good.  Pizza was undercooked and garlic knots were burnt.  Maybe just inconsistency among the cooks?
Kind of risky but we might dine in again.
Awesome Cuban food. Friendly service!! A little tight inside but, makes it even more exclusive.

Was here last night because my friend and I wanted to find somewhere in Old City for First Friday and I liked the pictures ofmthe tacos here; I ended up not even getting tacos!

The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the red Phillies Phanatic next to the unbrella bucket. After we sat down at the table closet to the door, I noticed the sign that said "you play country, we skip country (rip this sign downproces the oppositeof you being fonzie) =)" what's wrong with country music!? Haha. Above that sign was another one that said, "If you are stupid enough to forget your credit card, you are dumb enough to not get it back" and then you realize, the area on the wall the sign was sitting on was covered in credit cards!

Now to the food!; I don't drink so I can't review the bar or the alcohol selection.

My friend & I ordered: buffalo fries, half order of buffalo wings, 2 taco of the month (BLT tacos) & chips and dips with warm and spicy cheese salsa & spicy ground beef and cheese as the dips.

I didn't try thr wings or tacos but my friend said the tacos were really good. I enoughed the fries but felt like they got cold really quickly. The chips were really good; they weren't really greasy like most chips and the 2 dips were amazing!

This place wasn't overly crowded like I thought a bar in Old City on a Friday would be; maybe it was because of the rain.

Might come back just to get those chips and dips!
Simple, quick process to rent single surrey, $28 for 2 hours. Relaxing ride on paved path along the beach.

My weimaraner has boundless energy and she attends daycare almost everyday while I'm at work. When I pick her up at the end of the day, she is exhausted and falls asleep in the car on the way home. The staff is very friendly and greets her by name. Just wish I could afford it everyday I'm at work.
Why we need a chain like this in a town with great Italian-American restaurants I don't know. The portions are large, but the food is so-so.

We've had continuous problems with our service being very slow or not working at all.  We called and a service person set up a four hour time frame to come.  No one ever showed up.  Service is still constantly not working.  Currently looking for a new provider.

We loved this place. My husband has never had "real" Chinese food and was reluctant to try it. He fell in love with it and keeps asking to go back. The dan dan noodles were fab. The garlic chicken was great as well. I like how it is family style so that you can try different things

Love this place! I love that it's open all the time, even late into the night. I love that the guys that work there clearly know how to drive and are supportive of those who want to learn. They will inform you on the difference between the older and the newer carts, and which they think will work best for you. It's not the cheapest entertainment in town, but for thrills it's pretty darn good. Great date, or a fun thing to do with your family.

Oh, Drago's. How I love thee?  Let me count the ways - your staff, your new dining area, your 4 pound lobster stuffed with creamy angel hair pasta with shrimp and mushrooms and small fillets on the side.  Magnifique!
Service was terrible, all the food was just ok EXCEPT the gnocchi! It was light, fluffy and covered in butter! But I wouldn't go back even for this amazing gnocchi.

one word, and it's not haunted.  the word is bland.  smelled a little of paint and i did see some supplies, so maybe it's under "renovation".  plain walls, not much interaction between groups.empty back room, and boring colors throughout.  there on popular/busy nights, but did leave before 10pm, so maybe it's a late night bar.  enter through the rear door from parking lot and there is large room with a pool table and one very large mirror.  walk east and you'll enter the main bar.  rectangular bar with seating on three sides.  boring bar back with a window frame, TV, & bottles/shelves.  black padded stools with back support.  around 12 or so stools.  kind of empty space in corner opposite the bar on the SW side behind the large brick support.  past the bar is a mix of high & low tables.  also where the musical artist will set up if there is one.  bar itself is wood laminate with no rail.  brass rail foot rest.  hanging lights over the bar & elsewhere make gaslight a well lit bar.  i must be missing something and will try again.
Not a bunch of options for vegetarians. Potato cakes are good. Music is awesome at night.

I am so fortunate to have discovered Nechelle and her amazing salon. Her service is out of this world. Not only are her technical skills on point, but she pays great attention to detail, values communication (it shows!), checks in wit you about your comfort level (too cold? Need a drink or a magazine?), gives you options during your consultation, spends a ton of time giving you her undivided attention, she values connection and makes it her business to go above and beyond for your service. Everything is the salon is very high tech. Her shop is simple, classy, and inviting. Even the music was great. She's also managed to transform my poor hair that was butchered by a razor into a work of art that I can gladly sport. Her education and passion are apparent, as is her kindness, which she shows equally to every guest, making it an inviting space for everyone there. She listens to what you said you wanted, and she always has a smile. Never leaving Nechelle!

The ambience is fun and changes from other restaurants! Drink at the bar and the bar tender (very nice lady) are good! Apps (risotto ball & toasted ravioli) were served in 10 minutes and were good - i prefered the risotto ball! 

I was a bit disappointed by the entrees... Everything was overloaded and fat! Parmigiano was ok... We asked them to substitute the mashed potatos and veggies with pasta but server said he couldt do that and will bring both - as we pay for it! 
The seafood past suzanna were bad - not much of the seafood (2 shrimps and some other clams) and a creamy fatty sauce.. Homemade pasta was good!

I really expected sth else... I felt that they have good products but do not respect them and overload them with sauce...

I went here for the first time recently after it being talked up by friends. I liked the layout of the ordering, it's nice to be able to pick and choose everything you want without having to awkwardly stand in line and point at things.

I ordered the chicken pesto and my husband did the turkey bacon ranch. There were no other customers when we got there and multiple people working and yet it took about ten minutes before both of our sandwiches were ready. Which was a little irritating, but hey at least there's free wifi to help pass the time. I was excited to try my sandwich because I adore pesto, but it left a little to be desired. It barely had any chicken in it and was overfilled with lettuce, I had to take a lot off just to make the sandwich more flavorful. I ended up trying some of my husband's sandwich and wished I got that instead. The sandwiches are good, but not amazing. I'd definitely go here again because they do have a good variety of sandwiches, but next time I'll make sure to leave off the lettuce.
I ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes and an omelette. They were okay. Nothing out of the ordinary. Simply a decent place to grab some breakfast/brunch
ood nodles fo the énd tįmes

(Hastags) best Indian, lamb korma, chicken tikka, paneer whatever!!

Our favorite Indian restaurant in the city by far. We order this food for delivery every couple of months or so.  We haven't found something that we don't like. We do find that some of the appetizers like the tandoori meats are a little small but they still taste great.

Great server, but food was just ok. Took a really long time for the poutine (just French fries!!) The place was very dated and definitely a locals kind of place, but not a fun locals place. Would not rush back...

No, it's not as big or awesome as KoP mall. But then again, you won't spend hours walking from one end to the next just to visit a few stores that happen to be inconveniently placed for your particular shopping visit.  Comparing a local mall to one of the biggest malls in America and saying it falls short is just not very helpful. 

It has a reasonably good selection of stores plus the few big names like Macy's, Boscov's, JC Penney, Sears surrounding. After the big makeover years ago the mall itself definitely looks a lot nicer and cleaner. The food court has expanded. The large windows in the ceiling let natural light in during the day and lend a nice atmosphere.  Yes, there are birds in the food court, but they're cute. If you're freaked out that a few songbirds are around your food, please never go on a picnic.

There are a few things that make me sad about Exton, like the disappearance of the arcade and Allied Hobbies, but overall it's a nice place to go when you need to hit a few clothing stores or the bigger stores all in one place.  Or Gamestop (there is one on each level since EB was bought!).

I've never had any of the staff be rude to me. There might be some stocking issues, but that's because they're small mall stores and not giant outlets that have every size of every item. I also try to go on weeknights when the mall isn't nearly as crowded as the weekends, so I've never had crowding problems either.

Honestly, I don't see how a lot of the criticisms written by my fellow reviewers even apply to Exton Square Mall. Sorry! It's a good local mall, but if you want a larger selection of stores, go to KoP.

Not only is the idea a brilliant one but the wines are fantastic! 
I have been fortunate enough to taste most of the selections. The Riesling and Gewurtztraminer are delightful. The Sauvignon Blanc crisp and delicious. The Chardonnay isn't overly oaky. And the Pinot Grigio far exceeded my expectations. 
As for the Reds: old vine Zinfandel isn't over loaded with green pepper but has a nice spicy finish. The Bordeaux and Rhone blends are both solid wines. And the Merlot is awesome. 
Do yourself a favor and go taste these wines!
Stuffed challah french toast. Decadent. One of the best sweet breakfast items I've ever had. Split it as desert with a few friends. My word.

This place had more character than many of the other restaurants/bars that we stopped in during our trip.  A couple of friends recommended this place because of the amazing po-boys, and it seemed to be a great decision.  Though I didn't get a po-boy, friends got the shrimp po-boy and many got the gumbo- and they raved about it.  I loved that this place seemed a bit off of the beaten track and a bit diver, and all of the people who stopped in seemed to be locals enjoying good food and drinks at the bar.  I think the wait staff was a bit annoyed with our group- we were a group of 6 on NYE who stopped in an hour before closing- and they were a bit standoffish, though I completely understand.  I would definitely recommend this local joint to any out-of-towner (or even any local) to stop in for some good local food and drink.

One of my favorite places to go for gelato in Philly. They have great seasonal rotation of flavors along with the traditional ones. I haven't tried the coffee, but I hear that it is quite delicious as well. I do recommend getting a pot of fresh tea leaves brewed. There is free wifi and a pleasant atmosphere with music.

My recommended flavors of gelato are: dulce de leche, Pistacchio Siciliano, thai coconut milk, and Nocciola Piemontese (hazelnut).

Not quite as good as the gelato stands in Rome. But this will do :)

So here's my issue. Most of the staff here don't know how to or don't spend the time to shape brows. 

I'm sorry, but I'm a busy lady. I barely have time to feed myself, never mind get my brows threaded every one or two weeks. I squeeze in the time to get them done literally by leaving class 10 minutes early so I can stop here on my way to work. So by the time I actually have those10 minutes to get my eyebrows done, I need to get them DONE. Like, SHAPED. And the ladies here don't shape. They spend 30-60 seconds cleaning up stray hairs, leaving me with the bushy, uneven caterpillars.

I'm like 99% sure that in the first psychology class I took, I learned that in some animals, operant conditioning is equally effective, if not augmented, if the reinforcement is offered irregularly. This is why I keep coming back to this place. One or two of the staff can not only thread, but they can also shape. And I keep coming back hoping. 90% of the time I am disappointed.

Why do I keep torturing myself by going here? Seriously, does anyone know a good place in Tucson to get eyebrows threaded?
I retract my previous statement about not getting the peanut butter bacon burger again, it's all I've thought about when planning my trip.  Do it...do it!

Went there for lunch, trying to avoid long lines, maybe this is why there wasn't anyone there... Very disappointing for the price! Stay away from the $13 for 2 mushy crab cakes or $10 bowl of gumbo that was a very small portion and was tasteless!

The service was slow and the food is average. They don't have much of a beer selection so I just had water.   My kids wanted a milk shake but they only had two of the multiple flavors listed on the menu and several sliders we unavailable.  We spent over $60 and didn't get what we were hoping for at this new restaurant.

I love PIG, and anything and everything made from pig, so when I heard about this place (a restaurant named, "pig"), and after reading all these wonderful reviews, I really wanted to LOVE this place.  But, sadly, I didn't.  Maybe I set my expectations too high, but while I liked the food generally, there was nothing remarkable about the food.  I had the gnocchi for the app and suckling pig as the entree, and while they were both good, I felt like they were both super rich and heavy, which made it hard to finish.  

I will admit that my dessert was amazing.  I got the "poor's man" pudding and it was delicious.  Definitely made up for the app and entree, even though it was also rich.  Not complaining there!  :)

Meh. It is what it is. A chain. Service is hit or miss, usually miss. Food is pretty consistent.  There is always a wait even at 930. That being said, don't go anywhere near closing time even if they are jam packed. They will treat you like shit.
Pretty building. Cool little bars. Interesting history. Very loud at night.

Bubbletea and sushi - every Asian's dream.

Lots of Taiwanese flair here.  Very, very clean restaurant, quick and friendly service.  Trendy environment.  I was definitely a fan of the space.  

Smoothies / Tea:

As I have a huge sweet tooth, I like to save my sugar intake for my dessertsssss.  With that said, I really, REALLY appreciate that you can choose just how much sugar you want in each of your drinks here - Less 70%; 50% or even 0... YES!  Most of the smoothies are already so sweet so you can totally cut it down in half and not even miss out on it too much.  I highly recommend the Matcha milkshake.... omg this was amazing.  Perfectly blended; not too sweet AT ALL.  Refreshing and just SO GOOD.  The Very Mango smoothie is super popular here and though it was good, it only comes second to the Matcha milkshake for me.  

FOOD:

Things we have ordered during our dining IN experience and our take out experience:

LOVE:
-Angry Dragon - Loved it so much the first time we visited Bubblefish that we ordered 2 for our takeout the next time 
- Bubblefish Roll; Monster Roll; Shrimp Tempura, Spider
- Spicy Maki Combo is PACKED with good rolls (comes with three different kinds!) 
- TOFU CHEESECAKE - so light and so delicious!!!  Definitely a healthier alternative but you couldn't even taste the difference... really impressed with this

Worth to try:
- Calamari (it's good but super deep fried....  not the kind of batter I typically prefer though... you also only get a few rings of calamari lol)
-  Volcano Chicken - My friends liked this - I could've done without it (pretty Meh to me)

Things to skip:
- Crabmeat Salad Onigiri - just not the best; there are way better choices there than this 

Also - a huge plus - this is not one of those places that jips you out of portion size or quality of the food if you choose to order out - you get everything you ask for (plus tons of sauces!) and they really do such a great job of packing it all up so it's fresh for you to eat once you get home!

Delicious an incredible valuable asset to the community. If you're vegan and or raw or just let the cuisine. The place is a real timesaver .. I especially love the green juices and the wall hummus with the onion chips. You can be a little pricey and sometimes inconsistent but overall I do recommend.

French melt & biscuits & gravy before an early meeting. 4th floor restroom (restaurant is in lobby) was not super convenient and having to get the key from the waiter felt kinda gas station. That said, it's probably an old building. 

I always hesitate to order biscuits & gravy north of the Mason Dixon, but this was fine. The gravy was particularly good and the biscuit was ok. Hard to figure out if the French Melt was a sandwich or French Toast. Regardless, it was good & large. Hash browns were crisp & tasty. Service was attentive and food came out quickly (as breakfast restaurants should). 

Definitely would try this again.

We ordered fried fish sandwiches, loaded baked potatoes, broiled shrimp.  The French bread was fresh.  I would have given this place another star but they ran out of gumbo and the show was sold out.  I would recommend coming earlier to get the gumbo.

These are great people with outstanding food!  4 different people seriously stopped to make sure I enjoyed my meal. Lamont was my server and he was great!  I had the smoked meatloaf with side of green beans and Mac n cheese. I can't say enough. Meatloaf was indeed smoked and dressed with bacon and an awesome sauce...Smokey, sweet, and with a tiny bite of heat. Mac n cheese was just what you would expect. And the green beans?  Oh my!  I wish I could do that!!!  You have to try them to believe them.   5-stars well earned.

We made our reservations in advance and three hours before called to add someone and it was no problem. We had seven for a birthday celebration. Right after we arrived a very large group for a bachelorette party arrived. I thought the food would be slow but is was quick. Everyone ordered drinks which came out cold and quick. My husband ordered a sidecar and the bar got it perfect. We had the BBQ pork nachos, crab dip and fried pickles for appetizers. The nachos are delicious. The pickles were good but I'm not a crab fan so I won't comment on that. We had a 3 1/2 year old and her food came out with the appetizers.  We had a variety of entrees including the melt in your mouth ribs, chicken, brisket and one person had soup. The ONLY complaint was they were stuffed. The entire evening the band played toe tapping, hand clapping sing along favorites. This is a great place for a celebration!

All around nice zoo people and animals are friendly making this a great place for kids.
If your a teen from Philadelphia use the Philly stamp pass to get in for Free

I would pass this place every time I had class at Montco.  This was the place where I grabbed something quick when I forgot to pack my dinner.  I would just love their Italian hoagie because the garnish and meat was great.  I remembered that they toasted their seeded bread which made it even better.  Plus, you can add more hot and sweet peppers at the station next to the drinks.  Service is fast and good with plenty of TVs to watch the news or game.  Great atmosphere if you just want to lounge with friends.  Nice location being in Blue Bell and around the parks and school.
Best chicken tacos! Their seasoning and flavor is unlike other spots in the neighborhood! Try the chicken tacos!!!

I'm surprised by the slightly lower rating. We were seated at a lovely window table with a great view of the park. The service was great and every single dish we tried was delicious. I had the butterfish which was great. However, I was most impressed the unique pretzeled trout.
Epic meal I had some combo with grilled grouper and shrimp and I topped it with crab meat. Amy was our server and she was awesome. First time everyone in our family ate all their food. Go here
Great Latin dance night- mix of reggaeton, salsa, bachata, merengue, & hiphop!

Moved back to New Jersey from San Diego, after 20 years.  I missed cheesesteaks (pizzas)  and hoagies.  (Scrapple and a few other things).  There, you can't swing a cat without hitting a mexican burrito/taco place. Here, it's about the same for cheesesteak,  hoagie and pizza. So I went around and tried a few places around me.  Someone in my family said Vids. I tried it, but chose a meatball sub.  Fresh homemade meatballs.  Delicious, except the sauce is a little heavy with oregano. Ive since then tried Vids cheesesteak with fried onions,  ham and cheese hoagie, scrapple/egg/cheese sandwich,  pork roll sandwich, corned beef special on rye, and cheeseburger. I basically tasted my way 'back home', grabbed some wise potato chips, a birch beer soda, a soft pretzel and a Jewish pickle. (Not all on the same day). Everything was homemade where it could be.  The meat is loaded into their sandwiches and is as awesome looking as it tastes.  This is the only sandwich shop I'm going to go to from here out.  I have paid the same or more elsewhere for similar food and got less meat and less philly flavor.  By far the best deli in Burlington county.  Maybe the workers are old philly residents, they remind me of when I lived in philly.  (And to the person reviewing Vids burgers,  they tell you it takes long to cook because the burger is real thick and needs to cook.  It is really good and it's tender.  Worth the wait. (Not l like an Islands burgers in San Diego, but good nonetheless.) Bon appetite!

Took my wife and two kids. Got the burnt tips sandwich and my wife got the chili. Kids got grilled cheese. The grilled cheese still had the American cheese slices visibly unmelted. My burnt tip sandwich was warm not hot. I guess they are ok with food leaving the kitchen sub par. We live almost across the street and wanted to have a walk to eatery. Too bad. I had high hopes. We'll stick with Bardenay as Mickey Rays is just not good quality food or experience. We tried.
Hoagies and cheesteaks are insanely huge, but the line is equally long. I suggest calling ahead to save time. Overall, one of my favorite hoagie shops.

While visiting Philly, decided to get a cheesesteak. After asking a few locals near our hotel, they recommended Carmen's. It didn't disappoint! Service was fast and friendly. Cheesesteaks were delicious! It is a cash only place, but I was quite pleased with the dining experience.

One bar, small dance floor, loud music, a few seats here and there, and you have yourself Suite 69. I went here for a reception following an event I attended, so I probably did not get a feel for the way the place really gets on a average Saturday night. I did notice it is small, dark, smells of alcohol, and you can end up waiting a while for your drink. I don't go for small, crowded, loud places, so Suite 69 probably isn't for me, but if you are into that sort of thing - here is your place!
I have eaten here numerous times and find the food five star. They serve excellent craft cocktails I gave them a four star only because the service should be friendlier.

Had our anniversary dinner there last Monday night.  Unbelievable!  Great staff and ambience.  Food was prepared to perfection.  My wife is Sicilian and not easily impressed when it comes to Italian joints.  She loved the lasagne. Far exceeded our expectations and lived up to all the positive reviews.   Nice wine list and reasonably priced.  Room is small but that adds to the character.  Definitely will be back.

This place is tasty! We got Ella's favorite chicken tenders and were impressed by how large they were. Mine had a few tough pieces in it. I got fries, which reminded me of the shoestring fries from Steak 'n Shake. The mac and cheese was ok and I definitely have had better. I'm not a huge fan of craft sodas and decided to get a root beer instead. They also have white BBQ sauce which was absolutely amazing and was my favorite part of the meal. The restaurant was busy but it was clean and organized. I'll return again.

I had been wanting to try this place for a while. So glad I did!! small place, but very comfortable.  I went there with my two boys & we all loved it! Seems like a local, family owned place, which I also love & the food was awesome!!! I would definitely recommend!

Beware of Bed Bugs!! Like previous reviews this hotel has a serious bed bug challenge. I also was on the 5th floor and suffered bites all over my body. I woke up at 3:30 am on my first nite covered in bites and took pictures and video of the bed bugs on desk and bed (pillows and sheets). I went to check out at 4:00am and the night clerk stated he was sorry and when they get these type of complaints (meaning I was surely not the first and now reading here) that they offer a free breakfast which I see in reading other reviews here seems to be their lame go to response. Seeing as I was checking out before breakfast he then gave me a business card to contact the GM who might give me some kind of certificate. It is four days later and my body is riddled with bites. I would not want another guest to suffer through this. Stay clear.

My sweet little sister is getting married next April! Yesterday we stopped in last minute to look for her dream dress. Mary Kate worked with us to find the perfect look! She was so patient and helpful and made us feel right at home. My sister found the dress of her dreams and Mae Me's staff made this possible! We were also able to try on countless bridesmaids dresses. We felt welcome from start to finish. We weren't rushed and at no point felt pressured to purchase anything. I'm one of four sisters and I can honestly say that Mae Me will be our first choice for every wedding to come! Thank you so much for all of your help ladies especially Mary Kate! You've made this day so special for my sister and I can't thank you enough!

Fabulous!!!  Great food and friendly staff.  We had the B&G platter and garden benedict.  Both were great with homemade biscuits and muffins.  Not positive about the muffins.  Not A big place and definitely a local hangout. Will be back!!!

Oops...  When we left we discovered the other half of the restaurant.  We used the side door without realizing it.  So,  it is a good sized place

The wings were awesome. My friend got a kid burger and it was the size of a normal burger anywhere else, he said it was also very good. One of the best blood Mary's I've ever had. ( I got the vegetarian.) Our waiter was cool and the food came pretty quick.
had such a blast! typical dive type bar, great drink specials, bar staff was super nice! will def be returning

This place is a gem! We stopped there after looking on yelp. The food was delicious, we had the artichoke appetizer it was really good. The best part was the environment, the live piano was fun and the small dining room created an intimate environment. Overall a great dining experience.

What an amazing experience. The dining portion was great. The duck empanadas are to die for. The food and drinks are on the pricier side, but worth it. I went with three friends and we averaged about 2-3 drinks each and our checks were all around $50. 

Definitely make a late reservation and stay for the burlesque show. Very fun and entertaining, the performers all have such awesome personalities and are so friendly.

We had the best tour guide.  I definitely recommend taking the tour.  We came here after trying the colonial sampler at City Tavern.  So glad we did.  They have very low priced flights of beer so you can decide what you like.  The staff is enthusiastic and knowledgeable.  I am not a big beer drinker but my husband says everything was awesome and the growler was his favorite.  I tried their rootbeer and it was great.

As far as coffee shops go, this one is worth going out of your way for. An absolutely huge interior with lots of natural light and enough to look at for hours. 

You'll want to try a draft latte or a cappuccino! And their food is not to be understated.

Been to this guppys twice. What a great spot. Great mix of very healthy, tasty treats, reasonably priced and proportioned. Friendly owner and staff. A must visit for anyone in the are looking for something new and different.

Nick d.

The cheese-steak sandwich was very ordinary and without the choice of toppings that would be available in a pizzeria or steak shop. I would give it only 3 stars. The meat had a slight burnt taste, and the "Beer Cheese" topping was just some sort of drippy Cheese Whiz. My wife had the pulled pork sandwich, and she said that it was excellent - 5 stars. So averaging the two dinners, the result is 4 stars.

Worst service ever! Party of 10 at 6pm. The waitress let us know at 6:15 that another party was coming at 8. That set the tone as she continually repeated this fact throughout the night. We were rushed from start to finish. 

The food was sub par and the bread was terrible. Or maybe the food was good but the server so rude that no one could focus on the taste. She ruined our meal. Such a disappointment. 

We will never return. Nor will the 8 others at the table. I have never had such terrible service before - ever.  Our waitress was a heavy set, brunette with curly hair wrapped in a bun on top her head with a forced-fake smile.  
Note to the owner: hire waitstaff who make guests feel welcome. 

Too many great restaurants in Lambertville to waste an evening here with worn out employees. Instead go to the Hamilton Grill room, Bryant, or Manon.  In a town with great restaurants and fabulous service - this place is one to skip.

I had a chat with Nick, the owner, today and he is so nice and accomodating!  He asked me about my food preferences, and when I told him I'm an Asian food addict, he let me in on a little secret: they're marinating chicken thighs in Korean BBQ sauce to serve later this week!  Woohoo!  It's good to have the inside scoop.

The chicken caeser salad I ordered to day was as delicious and satisfying as ever.  Thanks for brightening up my day, Linda Jean's!

Waiting time in the lobby is the worst every time I go in.  This is my third visit with heel and foot pain. Seems like they just want to sell me products and give me shots. I'm hoping for some rehab information this next time.

Interesting cocktail menu, but overall not impressive.

Bartenders are unfriendly to the point of making me wonder if they were visually impaired - after walking past us several times without acknowledging our presence. Maybe a handlebar mustache would have gotten me a drink within 10 minutes of being at the bar...

Decor is trying... But not quite there. Do like the group seating arrangement. Only good thing about this place is location.

Katie wasn't lying, this store really is dangerous.

I have been here a few times now and I never made it out the door without having bought at least one thing. I know that this is a chain, and I usually prefer shopping local, but this is a good place to start if you are looking for stylish home decor. You will find it all here: pillows, bedding, candles, kitchen ware and the list goes on.

I stopped in here because I have had my eye on a big pink wool pillow. I need this pillow. It will be mine. While I was pricing it, of course they were having a 20% off sale on other bedroom items so I broke down and got myself a throw. Hey, winter is coming. No matter what your style, you are bound to find something here that will fit your personality and they are always having sales, so keep an eye out.

Amateur hour in Boise! No sound check prior to show. Waited 30 minutes then only swapped out voice mikes for very poor replacements. No miking of piano or guitar. Sound was harsh & distorted. No one at the mixing board? Never go for a concert there. Too amateurish!
Awesome environment! Friendly staff! If you want interactive drinking, this is the place to go ! LOVED IT.

I'm a fan of tapas-style restaurants because I get to try lots of dishes. This place has the classics and they are all pretty good. Server was really friendly- she recommended the right amount of dishes and didn't try to talk us into ordering more than we could eat.

- Green salad- mostly greens, though these were nice and fresh with a good dressing. A few little asparagus. Didn't notice the avocado and favas if they were there.
- Spanish octopus- slices of tentacle were nicely cooked and flavored with paprika- recommend
- Goat cheese with fig and cherry jam- good sized slice of cheese was tasty with the jam and pretty green apple slices. I preferred without the slices of dry bread
- Roasted cauliflower- my fave dish of the evening- there were some sort of pickled and sweet flavors all mixed together. The result was delish!
- Artichokes- was a little disappointed with this, three small slices of artichoke in a creamy Parmesan sauce. Not my fave, esp for $11.

Drinks were meh. I'm not sure my gin and tonic actually had any gin. And my sister's wine was a light pour. Maybe better value if you go with a bottle, or just stick to the food. Good spot for traditional tapas, esp if you can get a seat at the chef's counter and watch the talented crew at work.

Living up to their marketing, the Hampton Inn is very clean.  My room was always spotless and tidy each evening when I returned.  The public areas as well were very well-kept.

The new building is well-maintained in both physical appointments and their friendly staff.  I was especially impressed by the attentive women working the breakfast shift, keeping the good selection well-stocked as well as asking to clear dishes to free up your table top.  

The exercise facilities were more than expected and I'm a little disappointed that I didn't get to try out the heated pool or hot tub (my fault, not their's).  

Restaurants are a short walk away, but don't expect a lot of shopping without a car.

Overall, an extremely pleasant experience all around.

I saw a really cool photo article the other day in the Riverfront Times showing Forest Park 10 years ago and then today.

It is really unbelievable how much of a difference the Forest Park Forever foundation has made.  In looking at the Grand Basin, Boathouse, etc., you really get a great idea on how improved the park is today.

We were in the Park for the Forest Park Forever run on Saturday and looking at the various sites on person you really can appreciate the beauty and history we all get to enjoy.  This is one of the best places to visit in St. Louis and it is getting better every year.

Awesome food and great service! I would recommend this business to anyone. Although the prices are a little more you are buying quality delicious food! I also love their location, we are surrounded by beauty.

The eyebrow threading they do is good. I've been here thrice already.
The wait time is not that bad i feel...
My eyebrows loose shape in less than 2 weeks :-( so i need to go in at least twice a month.

Price has increased from 5$ to 8$ now. I am not a price hike fan....
Great haircut and feel like I've reunited with a long lost friend... thanks Brenda, you rock!

We loved this place and you will too. When we entered the smell of fresh oranges was in the air. They were cutting them up to make a homemade orangechello yum! This is a small space but it's comfy and inviting. You can pull up a seat at the bar and sample any of the many many flavors of vodka that are made in house. We enjoyed candy cane vodka, jalapeno heat (wow that one packs a punch) and so any more. We loved or bartender she was so friendly and very passionate about the products. Of course we purchased a bottle to go. I can't wait to revisit and try some more seasonal vodkas.

I went here with a couple friends and my husband for a recent lunch date and the food was amazing. I would especially recommend the truffle fries, the whole table went crazy over them. I had the Kale salad, which was a nice light lunch and my husband had the fish tacos and loved them. Highly recommend this place!

What a great find! This cozy restaurant has some of the finest food you can find in South Jersey. The perfect place for date night or a gathering of friends. The lamb special and pesto chicken were superb. Do not order rice-- the vegetables are something i only wish I could replicate in my own kitchen.

This is a place I will recommend to friends and family for as long as they will listen!

Another fantastic John Besh restaurant. My girlfriend had been there before and wanted to go back. Great food at reasonable prices. Will definitely go back. I had the chicken sandwich with Serrano slaw on a Hawaiian roll. It was fan-bloody-tastic. Highly suggested.

Amazing quick service! Called at 10am on a Saturday and made an appointment with Kevin for 10:30am that day. The salon is clean, sanitary and cute. Kevin's wife also does eyebrows and she's great! I just moved to the area and have been looking for a nail and eyebrow person and I'm so glad to say that I can now check that off my list!

Totally worth the wait. I got tipped off to the place from a local friend of a friend, and am so glad I did. When I got there I was told that it would be 1 to 1 1/2 hrs before I could get a table, but that I could try to snag a spot at the bar, which I eventually did, with some help from one of the hostesses, after about 45 minutes. But the food -- so worth the wait! 

Definitely get the alligator cheesecake. So savory & delicious. I also had the duck & andouille gumbo, which was excellent, and fried green tomatoes & fried grits, which were pretty good too. A bit on the loud side for me, but great ambiance and friedly service at the bar.

I must be broken because people told me this was a don't-miss, but I'd have to disagree. To be fair, the chargrilled oysters are worth the hype. Have those and a drink and you'll probably be in good shape. I dig the crab dip too, it's a yummy indulgence.

Other than that, it's nothing more than an expensive hotel restaurant. I ate here twice during my stay in the hotel and while I did like the crawfish ravioli, when we had a lunch compromising of the lobster mac and shrimp and grits I wasn't nearly as pleased. Actually, I'd definitely recommend you come at dinner than a late lunch. Service was nice both times, but the food was off at lunch. Stale chips, inedible shrimp and grits (sorry!) and bland mac. I was actually a bit queasy after lunch, and I had hardly eaten. Better to pre-party here with oysters and move on to one of the city's numerous delicious haunts.

I wanted to share the Dragos experience with my Arizona boyfriend, but unfortunately this was not the dragos I remembered. First of all, I couldn't locate the dinner menu online until I employed creative methods. Once we arrived, I noticed the ambiance had changed drastically for the worse. It looked much like an Olive Garden or cafeteria seating than the upscale seafood restaurant I remembered; extremely disappointing. We ordered 3 versions of oysters, one of my favorite. I forgive there being shell in some of our oysters, but the oyster voisin were terribly disappointing..... I wish they would have offered oyster Rockefeller instead. Our waitress and the staff were kind and fairly prompt, but the food and atmosphere were subpar. Next time I hope the raw oysters are colder, but they were pretty good. For the price and the name, I was disappointed and could not recommend above other smaller oyster bars.

I've always heard such great things about this place and always wanted to try it. My husband and I were on our way back home to LA and decided to stop in SB for late lunch. Finding the place was easy and we were lucky enough to find parking easy enough. There was a small line out the door. We were there on Presidents' Day and it wasn't too long of a wait. I've heard that the line could be pretty long. We waited about 10-15 minutes to order. There was a guy in front of us that clearly had been here many times before. He was recommending his favorites to the group in front of him. We decided to try some items he recommended. As a matter of fact, we ordered 6 different items to share. Everything we ordered was amazing. Chicken tacos with cheese, chorizo and cheese tacos, chili rellano, pork and cheese taco, and a couple other amazing items. As we were waiting I was watching the woman hand make the tortillas on the stove. I can't believe all the amazing magic that was going on in that tiny kitchen. So good. I can't wait to go back again. This will definitely be that place we always stop to have lunch when driving north to the central coast.

Finally! Spicy vegan food!

This is a welcome addition to the vegan food scene in Philly, which, by all accounts, is already impressive.

Highlights - 

1) Curry cauliflower - spicy, smoky
2) Dan Dan Noodles - spicy, noodle-y
3) Langos - basically, a savory donut of deliciousness
4) Piri Piri Tofu - Tofu on a skewer

We didn't fall in love with the cocktails - they are creative but didn't blow us away.  We tried the Cruz Control - sweet but somewhat bland. Bolder flavors needed. My wife liked the Hong Kong Karaoke - accurately described as "boozy."

Will revisit V Street soon!

I am obsessed with Eggs Benedict.  If I go to breakfast anywhere, I ALWAYS order it.  Tiger's II has the BEST EGGS BENEDICT.  The best. Perfectly poached egg and a wonderfully buttery hollandaise sauce.  The bacon is really good too - I think it's how they make it.  It looks like picture perfect BACON on your plate - not all weirdly shaped and super greasy like you get at most breakfast joints.  Everything we have ever ordered here has been superb.  This is our favorite neighborhood breakfast place.
Had the turkey chill next day sick as could be. Called the store they told my wife 3 others had called about they same thing. The offerd is a free meal next time we come In. I will pass

Staff is very rude. We planned my birthday party there and were very unhelpful and didn't even want us to have a birthday balloon at the pool "to not interfere with other guests". We went the week before to see it and go to the bar, we waited for over 15 minutes with no service, not even eye contact. When I called to ask questions the front desk said the manager on duty isn't able to answer questions only the primary front desk manager. When I asked what his hours were I was told they aren't posted. We aren't even there and I'm not excited to go.

Great space and location, minimal options for coffee, no sugar except agave or raw sugar, only whole milk or almond milk, 10 minute wait, decent slightly bitter coffee, steep price.   I am confident that they will get a great local following, but if you desire a quick cup with sugar and half and half, this isn't the option. If you are looking to sit down with a cup or tea, excellent space and good location to do it in but if you are on the move and want a large coffee, you probably want to move on.
Took the 8:00 walking ghost tour with DJ on our recent trip. Very entertaining but also informative. And I liked how we stopped for a bar/bathroom break partway through!

My favorite spot in the city. Bring your bread loaf heels to feed the ducks with, or check out the free sculpture garden! There is so much to do and see here you will probably never get to see all of it, it's HUGE! There are tons of little nooks to have a romantic picnic and lots of wide open spaces for recreation. Tennis courts, a museum, botanical gardens, pedal boats, fishing, this park has it ALL!
Food is fine but the wait in the drive thru is so painful.  I believe this may be our last visit.  I think it'd be quicker to drive in to town for food and bring it back.
The view, if you are outside, is wonderful.  The service was above average.  The food was not worthy of mentioning.

So far so good, hey I really like this place having a good time watching the Garcia fight on CBS, round 5 of 12 battery low will finish review later........
Food was great had a bunch of appetizers good service good crowd good people nice atmosphere from the staff was good,  parking lot a little tight but hey you can't win them all I would go back.

Would not recommend to a friend. Food was severely lacking. I had the spaghetti Ragu and my friend had the gnocchi Ragu with meatballs. We asked for more sauce because dishes looked and tasted dry. Both were in need of salt and Pastas were undercooked. Wine was great. We opted out of dessert.
I don't normally do a 5 Star but this place deserves 5 stars! Clean, delicious food, there's free parking lot with plenty of space (despite roxborough)! Price is reasonable!

I sent my husband to get a 60 minute table massage as he has lower back trouble and it was bothering him even more than usual. When he got home, he was ranting about how cordial the staff was, how the massage therapist utilized perfect pressure and really listened to where the pain was. The atmosphere was professional and relaxing, and he loved how they put a warm cloth on his back at the end. I will be trying out this myself soon! It was SO easy to get an appointment too! They take walk-ins but prefer appointments, however, I called 1 1/2 hours before my husband went in and they put him right on the schedule. Definitely recommend Bucca!! Thanks for the great experience!

I can be very judgmental. Slowly but surely I'm maturing and letting go of my quick-draw assumptions. I can tell a few employees at Moriarty's have yet to reach this point or even start the long haul towards adulthood. 

I've been here once before so I'm far from a regular and didn't realize that behind door #1 is a clear walkway and behind door #2 is a huge wooden bench that will stop you dead in your tracks. I was quick enough to catch myself before toppling over it, but the guy who entered a few seconds later was not. Everyone got a real kick out of it and I was the only one, staff included, to help him up. Maybe we can move the bench now? Or lock door #2? Just some thoughts.

My friends, a married couple with a newborn, were home from Hawaii for one week. In that one week they had to squeeze in three sets of families, a wedding and tons of visits from friends. As smart as they are, they plotted to kill a few birds with one stone and have all the college buds meet up at Moriarty's to see them, the babe and savor the wings that even the beautiful Maui sunsets couldn't erase.

The staff was more than annoyed that we rolled so deep without a reservation. They also weren't too keen on the baby. We had to split up between a booth in the back and seats at the bar and our server actually had the nerve to ask us to only order drinks from her. OK. So we'll stand by the table, order drinks, then go drink them by the bar. 20 minutes later they relinquished a large, unoccupied table held for a no-show reservation. Some of us moved to the table, some stayed in the booth that was within arm's reach. They said we had to give up the booth. This still did not solve the problem of the lacking seats. So we left. 

I've never felt so unwanted. If it weren't for the wings  and stellar happy hour deal ($3 drafts from a hefty selection) I'd knock off a star in the ratings.

I was so excited about coming to this restaurant with my family. Live entertainment was nice at the bar while you waited in the seating area. Drink service was prompt while you waited for your table.
Attentive staff.
Between the four of us we ordered everything! We always try numerous dishes the first time we try restaurants so we can get a good idea of the best dishes.
All the seafood dishes were very disappointing. The broth/sauce for the chioppino style dish was minimal and seafood dry, alot of shells not opened in another, another dish was not warm...it was a bad night!! We ended up spending hundreds of dollars and left very disappointed! Its a nice concept but your food has to be consistently spot on.
I would not go back.

I was looking at a jeep renegade, but was open to checking out everything within my budget. The dealer (newer kid) comes over and asks me how I feel about the Patriots and I told him I liked the body style 

Says he has a 2014 jeep patriot with 12k miles, fully loaded for 16,500. As a first time buyer, I think it's an amazing deal. I had my mother with me and she thought the same, and that i should buy it. So we test drive it. In the test drive he said, "my mistake, this one is 16,880. That's fine, since I'd only be financing about 13k after taxes 
So we're talking financing and whatnot then they value my jeep and offer me 3500 which, KBB says is worth at least 4,575. 
He also kept talking to my mother about all the costs until she finally told him, "it's not my money, it's hers. You better start talking and selling to her" so he does. 
He leaves to get the paper for me to sign to run my credit..

Then he comes back, "oh my gosh. I'm soooo sorry, I was thinking of a base model in the same color for that price. 
This one is actually 24k but because I messed up we'll give it to you for 19,880." So I said no, and I understand the mistake because we're all human, but it's too much for me. 
"Well, let me talk to the manager" he comes back and says, I can give you 4000 for your car so I said no, I can't afford it 

So I leave and do more research, the jeep I test drove was already marked normally to 19,880 and they made it sound like he was helping me out for his mistake. 

I don't know if it was really a mistake, or a bait and switch. But as a first time buyer, I'm not thrilled, and will not be returning when I am ready to buy.

Horrible . Got stomach pains before I even left the building, had come after getting a pedicure and while I Was eating with my friend, we agreed the food tasted bland and cold and a little off. We were not pleased. To top it off the staff looked bored out of their minds while making it. Definitely not the chipotle experience I'm used to. Given this place a couple of chances and I'm always left un satisfied. I'll stick to the downtown location, little extra drive is worth it to make up for the mediocre food service/food quality here.

Visited this place for the first time yesterday. Nice airy place, reasonable prices, and reasonably good food. The service was friendly and super fast. Had the chicken gyro, was pretty good. Will be back for more. I have heard that the feta cheese served here is excellent.

I can't believe I've never reviewed Bobbie's Dairy Dip! It reminds me of Zinga's Corn Patch, which none of you know because it's in a tiny town in NJ. BDD gets 5 stars for their black and white malted milkshakes. They make me happy, I bet they would make you happy. Based off of their milkshakes, I'm willing to bet their other ice cream treats and burgers are 5 stars too. I'll let you know next time I swing by!

I will never take this cruise line again!! I purchased a cruise for my husband and I last Christmas to go on our first open water dive. We booked our excursion for a scuba dive without equipment since we had our own.  We left on March 10th for Nassau and Coco Cay, or dive was scheduled  for Sunday March 12th since daylight savings time was taking place that night we decided to get a wake up call at 0630 to make sure we were up. We went to bed early all excited for our first dive and woke up to the phone ringing. After getting ready we lug our scuba gear to the meeting point were there was no one around wondering what is going on my husband leaves to find out what the issue is at the same time a crew member came out saw me and asked if I needed help I explained to him why I was there and the only thing he said was you missed the boat !! Apparently it was 830 not 730 ! The wake up call came at 730 not 630 like I set it!!!! From there out went down hill he was very rude and unwilling to help in the mean time my husband is arguing with customer service to no avail. I finally catch up with him head back to our room to drop off the scuba gear he stays in the room and I go to customer service, explain to them the same thing my husband did and hire I wanted my money back. They were rude the whole time blaming me the whole time and soulful refund my money said I had to choose another excursion instead !! I got upset and insisted I get my money back. Another crew member went to a different computer and came back to the one talking to me he then did something on the computer printed a paper handed out to me and said there was a computer glitch sure to the time change and your money was refunded! That's it no sorry no can I make it better no nothing they only made me feel like a second class citizens!
Our favorite spot in Nashville for live music and drinks. Have never eaten here, but always stop in for a couple hours to listen to music!

The pretzels are always hot and fresh, not bad price and they have lots of dipping options. The store is small but it's never busy when I go so there is never a wait, but who wouldn't mind hanging out and breathing in that smell for a few minutes anyway?

Love the soups and warm sandwiches. Pretty good food for a little airport joint. I travel a lot so I find myself eating here almost every other month. I have never had a bad meal yet. For the little place it is you cant expect to much. So they get 4 stars.

I would rate this about 2.5 stars.  The food was just ok.  My pasta came out cold and the cheese placed on top was ice cold - no chance that it was going to melt into the pasta.  My dessert came out melted.

While this was restaurant week and was cheap-ish, isn't the point to encourage me to come back?  There is no way I am coming back.  I only went because my friends wanted to go.

If you're a beer lover, Tap & Bottle is the place to be. They offer a wide variety of different beers. Although it can be very crowded, the bartenders are quick to serve you regardless of how busy they are.

Danger, Will Robinson!

That's what you'll be saying to yourself sitting down at the bar of this frozen drink drinking establishment. 

Upon entering this bar, one is greeted with dozens of frozen drink mixers behind the "bartender". The drinks vary in title from "jack and 7" to "call-a cab", which we were told is the equivalent of 4 domestic beers.

Whoa.  This place is not for the faint of heart.

The managers were pretty cool, offering taste tests of the various concoctions spinning before us.  They also explained that you could mix different flavors to produce even more unique frozen drink combinations. 

These went down very smoothly - you should pace yourself here because trouble will quickly find you!

Great fun and very cool beverages to cool you down / relax you on a hot Florida summer day!

If you like craft beer and pizza this is the place to go. Although they do have a full bar offering signature cocktails and an food other than pizza. There are TV screens everywhere and today being Saturday seems that every college game was on.  You get a wrist band so that you can pour/taste any of the 30 or 40 craft beers on tap. You pay by the ounce and you can have an ounce or a full glass. Taste about 15 beers/an each and it cost $6.00.  So that's roughly a pint for $6.00. I had the Last Word Cocktail-Hendricks and cucumber. I've had better. We had the pork Crackling and shared a Popeye Pizza. Both were very good.  Sat by an outside window and it was quite warm. We'll definitely return to sample other beers and menu items but ask to be seated away from the window. The service was friendly and efficient.

I love Sycamore Vet! My family has been bringing our pets here for multiple generations! I've since moved from the Newtown area, but I still drive 45 minutes out of my way to bring my little gal pal here for care. We see Dr. Neubauer, and he is phenomenal. Really, I can't say enough good things about him. I'm always so confident in him when I bring my little munchkin in. Whenever my lil fur-baby gets lab work done, he calls me as soon as the results come in- often after hours. The rest of the staff is also great. They're enthusiastic, empathetic, and take a lot of pride in the work they do. Don't be fooled by the office! It's an older building (I think it's been there 30-40 years), but it does the job and they're able to provide all primary veterinary needs.

Great beach bar. We went there based on the yelp reviews. Melissa was a sweetheart. Food was good we had a burger and a Cuban sandwich. The setting was great. We sat on the back deck and the solo guitar player was decent. Beers were cold and the Mojitos were perfect. We will definitely be back!! Glad your using "Delco" rolls. Being from Delco!!!

Had the flafel wrap, the flafel was very dry, and scarce, mostly lettuce and tomato. I will go back and try a different sandwich next time to see if that's any better. If not there is so many places down by the beach to get outstanding sandwiches. They need to step it up some notches.

One of the finest meals I have ever had. The fried oysters and the porterhouse were as good as could be expected but the baked Alaska was the real stand out.

Expensive? Yes.

Worth it? Definitely
This is my favorite place in my neighborhood. I come here all the time. I have tried almost every item in the bakery and on the brunch menu. Everything is delicious. You really can't go wrong.

As a road warrior, I know what to expect at a Residence Inn ... but this property is just plain terrible by any standard. Furniture looks like the dog ate it (truly), filthy couch, dirty bathroom floor, sagging bed ... and the list goes on. Breakfast was OK and the only thing about this property that was marginally acceptable. Plus the price is no bargain at all.

The front desk staff (Manager?) said a renovation is scheduled  ... no time frame given. So strongly suggest staying somewhere else until a major re-do is completed.

Note: This place was home to Mama Velia's Italian Rustico and Doc's Bistro in the last 18 months.  Neither good.  I suspect but don't know if it has the same management/owners.  Similiar downsides.

I went here twice, on take out, once around lunch and once around dinner time.  Both times it was fairly inactive, maybe because it was on off days dining wise (but close to it's Grand Opening).  

They don't seem to know their own specials, having forgotten a salad from my Coney Island Burger Lunch special that I only discovered once home (tip: always check your takeout before leaving any place).   Also tried a rack of ribs at dinner, the two sides were tiny for the price.  Both times the food was decent, nothing to write home about though.

Between my first and second visit, I wanted to call in an order and was told they weren't taking orders due to "propane delivery" not coming.   Both times I went, it was staffed by teens who really seemed over their heads, with long wait times for the small amount of customers already there and general chaos.  It's like I'm intruding on a home ec class playing restaurant.  I can't imagine how it operates during busy times.  Yesterday, Friday, I drove by and the parking lot was fairly full, maybe we'll find out from future reviews.

After my last visit, 20 minutes for the burger, I saw what looked like the manager, an older guy, in front doing nothing of use while people waited, as I drove off, I saw him hanging out in the back with some young guy, idling away as people waited.

Meh.  Bottomline: Neither particularly good, cheap, or fast.  I usually like to have 2 of the 3 merits in a restaurant.  Also not the worst, seemed fairly clean, I'll give it a few months before I go again (unless more bad reviews roll in) and see if it improves in general service and if the kinks get worked out.

I was pleasantly surprised by the size of Saraga. It truly has an incredible selection of ethnic food. If I remember correctly, I encountered Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Indian, Mexican, Southeast Asian, and South American - in addition to some American staples. Ethnic supermarkets are rarely this diverse, let alone all under one roof. I found everything I needed, from fish sauce to carne asada meat. They even have Halal meat for those interested in obtaining the rare goat meat.

Their own drawback is that their grocery department is not as fresh as one would hope. Again, it's diversity that they shoot for as I found pink guava, an assortment of Southeast Asian tropical fruit.

They also have a large amount of available whole fish, including a whole sea bass. That was pretty impressive as sea bass is rarely found as one giant whole fish.

The restaurant atmosphere was very happy and the service was great, but the vegan onyx and coconut ice cream was absolutely disgusting. The onyx was crumbly and ice like and the coconut was already melted. I wouldn't call it ice cream. Hopefully the recipes can be improved in the future.

When I bought tickets to a Music City Burlesque show, I honestly had no idea where this theater was.  Supposedly it was close to me but I had never seen it in my life.  And now I know why.  I thought it was a church (an honest mistake here in the south!) but its a beautiful old brick theater with a very small amount of seating and a time-warp feel to it.  Up front you are practically on stage with the performers.  It reminded me of a small high school's theater, and that's not meant to be insulting.  It redefines intimate.  I really enjoyed the whole setup, from the small setting to the exposed brick to the shabby chic of it all.  I would go here for a show again.  Keep in mind its very small, but a lot of fun with a fun crowd and a little off the beaten path.  I look forward to another experience here.
