Bone Fish Grill's food is really tasteful and service is satisfactory. I love the bread with some sort of oil and herb spread and the bang bang shrimp/chicken  is "bang banging!!" Most dishes I try is pretty good with generous portions and servings. Overall, good experiences!

I work in Clayton, and it was our Intern's last day on the job and we wanted to take her out to lunch.. (We only get one hour for our lunch break). It honestly looked like we were bothering the wait staff to acknowledge us. We were seated nearly immediately during the Clayton lunch rush on a Thursday, but once seated, it was like all of the servers wouldn't even make eye contact. After waiting 15 minutes or more, my coworker flagged down someone who looked like a manager and we were served quickly. The problem seemed to be 3 servers not knowing who is covering our particular table. 

My coworker requires Gluten Free, so this place has limited options for her. 

And the pizza was blah....over hyped and over priced. But you can get away with this in Clayton, right?! 

I will not be returning if I can help it.

This is my standard coffee stop when I'm in South Philly.  There's a charm to this place that beats most Center City coffee houses; hanging around with a beverage, a cookie, or a pastry is mandatory.  Although I usually keep it basic, they've got a nice selection of treats.  Anthony's garners my first fifth star on Yelp for great basics, outstanding South Philly coffee house character, the hang-out factor, and people-watching in the diversifying Italian Market area.

I love this place. It's simple, it's quick and quaint. The owners are an older couple and are the only employees as far as I can tell. Just the sweetest grandparenty people. If you're around Largo or Clearwater (Ulmerton Rd)  and in the mood for some old Chicago style lunch, you have to stop in. Tell them Phil said hi! Bone Appetite
Really nice place. Clean. Service was friendly and fast. For ordering a little,  you sure get a lot.  I'll definitely be back here
Always on my list of places to eat when I work in Tucson.  Great food, great flavor, great drinks, and great prices.  Have never had bad food here.

This place is amazing!!!! I thought I had had good Mexican food before but this place stepped it up a notch. Slightly pricey but WELL worth it. Amazing flavor, incredibly generous portions and a fantastic salsa bar. We don't live in SB but we come here every time we pass through!

Black and Tan latte aka peanut butter with soy milk, espresso and chocolate?! COUNT ME IN. Seriously one of the best drinks I've had. Tastes like a Reese's cup thats melted, which is literally, one of the greatest things ever for peanut butter lovers like me. I've been a customer for over a year now, and since my move to NY, I still pop in occasionally to say hello to the cute dog and get my fix. I've tried a little bit of everything here. From the tea to the sandwiches and I would have to say it is my favorite Cafe in Philly. Wish they would put one in New York *cough cough*

This restaurant was walking distance from the place we were staying and we had a wonderful dinner on the beach while watching the sunset. Beautiful view!! I got crab legs and they were very good and my boyfriend got a burger with provolone and he said it was great as well. The dessert though!! Fantastic chocolate dome dessert-even better if you add ice cream. Great place.

Crisp, non-oily, non-salty, flavorful chips.  Came in differently sized bags; I appreciated the small ziplock for $1.75.  They've won "best of Indy" type awards for these carefully made carbs, apparently. Breakfast!

Got caramel and cheese popcorn, sweet-n-savory.  This local small firm uses real cheese, real ingredients--not "flavored" and shortcutted versions.  Bags at various price levels, from $4ish through $6.50.  Reasonable.

Nice entrepreneurial owner will kindly talk with you, if you're wandering around lost around the market. He knows how to "bark," i.e., get passing customers to come in and examine his products--very old-school sales style, pleasant and folksy and hard-working.  He also can tell you his life story: how the chips idea started.  This business was long time coming, and had been a bit of a vision.  He knows his product well.

Local small business people's wares, when folk behind them are this solid, are simply the BEST, and will beat corporate, mass-produced, generic product all the time.  This qualifies.

Went this past Friday for dinner and the food was great! The flavor of everything was delicious. The cashier gave us recommendations on what local brew to pair with our food which was helpful. I will definitely return in the future and I look forward to trying dessert then. We were so full after dinner lol

One of the best places in Philly.  JB's offers plenty of local and delicious food and beers.  I've had plenty of dinners / snacks here in the past, ranging from seafood dishes to falafel pitas.  Upstairs is home to a venue which has yielded most of my finest concert memories.  The themed brunches are pretty wonderful, offering some solid eggs benedict and bloody marys to start off the day.  Oh and also, not having to deal with convenient ticketmaster convenience charges of $25 being tacked onto your $15 JB's concert ticket fee is a huge plus.

The crepes were amazingly delicious. Split one, they're huge! The staff was very nice and seated my husband and I in the best seats right by the window, without us asking. I believe I had the Mona Lisa crepe, to which they readily added Nutella, vanilla ice cream, chocolate sauce, and strawberries at my request. Being in historic Ybor, the prices were a little higher than I like, but I still have to say it was worth it. I would like to go back.
Believe what everyone says...this place is that good. Excellent Chinese food and superior service. The Friday night dinner buffet is delicious,  has lots of varieties,  and is an excellent value.

Dos Segundos is truly glorious. As a California transplant, I was wondering how I could survive on the East Coast without my beloved Mexican food. Fortunately, Dos Segundos appeared to answer my prayers. I had a fantastic birthday dinner here, which makes a great place for good fun and cheer. I wouldn't recommend the burritos, which fall short for my standards, but the enchiladas and tacos are excellent. Don't miss this amazing find in NorLibs!

lovely dinner.  The spinach manicotti was amazing.  My husband's pasta was pretty salty, but still really good.  The pasta sauces are all made to order, so I'm sure it's not always that salty.  We had a delightful dinner, great, sweet service.  2 entrees, a glass of wine, and a beer was $57 if that gives you an idea of the PPH.  We'll be back.

Customer service here was good. We ordered a gyro on pita bread. There was a lot of gyro meat on the pita. The only thing I didn't like was the tzatziki sauce. It taste like cream cheese instead of yogurt and gives the gyro pita a weird flavor. I would probably come back if the recipe for the sauce changed or I would buy the sauce somewhere else.

I was taking N to Devil's Alley for lunch and I was tired of walking so, I suggested we have some chinese instead. My lomein was average and N hated his lemon chicken. I think it is one of the few lemon-XX that disappointed him so much. he practically didn't eat anything. 

When N saw Devil's alley in the next block, N was def mad at me. He could have had a nice burger instead haha.
Happening place for a Friday night. Very social atmosphere. Great place to bring friends!!

I'm really surprised by all the negative reviews on here!  I love the clothes, the staff is nice, and their shoe selection is awesome.

They also have very reasonably priced designer things that come up for like $25/$30 which is pretty awesome.  I love the variety of clothes and everything is really high quality.

It's a Starbucks in a really neat building! I love how Starbucks has re-claimed this space and made it usable again. The major downsides are that it's very busy and the drive through is incredibly slow. Major upside is that this building is a two-fer and you can get Chipotle next door.

Went here for a weekend dinner. I would say the best Indian restaurant in central indiana. Biriyani was amazing. They were almost equal to hyderabad biriyani taste. They have a lot of biriyani varieties in non veg. 
When you order make sure to specify the spice level. Normally they serve very spicy food.
Rava Dosa was too good with tasty south indian sambar and chutney.
Don't forget to try the hyderabad special double ka mitta. I have not seen that on menu in Indian restaurants in this region.
This is a small place and it gets filled fast. So go early to avoid waiting time

Branched away from our usual Mexican restaurant to try this place.  Drink was good.  Salsa is good as are the chips.  Our poor server was brand new, the manager (I think?), told us this was her third day working.  Why would you throw her to the wolves and have her wait tables (and be given a huge section) on a busy Friday night?!  Not cool.  Of course our order was messed up but they fixed the bill.  Also took three people to correctly explain what the drink special was because the first two did not know.

INCREDIBLE BURGERS. Actually, EVERYTHING is good. Love the Fig Marmalade burger.

Their variety of beers is extensive and always changing with new, great beers. The fries are delicious and the staff are very friendly and attentive.

Last time I ate there, I was in a party of 14. Our waiter was fantastic with great spirit and suggestions. He actually knew the beers and never got overwhelmed by the size of our party.

Our experience was extremely frustrating. We were not waited on for 15 minutes into us being seated. The first thing we ordered when we were seated was for a glass and a half of moscato. Our 3 person party ordered drinks and an appetizer. When the server returned 15 minutes later with our drinks, I was surprised to see that there was not a glass of wine on her tray. I figured she forgot and reminded her. She said would get it and came back with no wine when she brought the breadsticks. I asked yet AGAIN and she asked me what I ordered. Our food then didn't even come out for another hour and it was cold. When we expressed our frustration she responded that if we came on any other night than Sunday it wouldn't have been so bad. I didn't realize there were days customers weren't supposed to come eat. Never going back.

Ordered one corndog for kids first and noticed the price tag stating one for $2, two for $3 when pick up. So wanted to order one more corndog for one dollar extra. but not honored and treated in a awfully rude and  arrogant manner. Will avoid this place.
The menu lacked variety.  Food was ok   Server was awesome   Wasn't crowed on a Monday night at all   The average age of the customers were 70 and that scared me

This review is for service and food at the bar only. 

We had:
Spicy fries - amazing
Soup ( vegan squash) amazing
Tomato and mozzarella - great even for out of season
Jambalaya- solid. Great spice. The fish and shrimp wee cooked well
Mushroom and sausage tortellini -good pasta and great sauce but the sausage could have been sliced into thicker portions ( personal taste only)
Apple cake and homemade ice cream - rock solid

Service: the bartender was great. She balanced a full bar with ease and made us feel at home for new guests. 

Price: We are from the east coast and would have paid 120 dollars there but ended up paying 60 with a drink a piece. AmaZing value.

They have a great happy hour. 

If you are in midtown you should come here.

I can't say anything bad... our plan was to head to our favorite beer and food truck place but our least favorite truck was there so we ordered a ToGo order while we were driving to the Side Car bar. Our plan was to have a cocktail and pizza. The order process was easy and quick while I was driving. 

We got to the bar and ordered my first drink, while it was being made I ran to Falora and picked up the pizza and bread. We got back and our drinks were done and we sat back in the relaxed atmosphere and enjoyed both. I can't tell you how nice the evening was. 

We ordered the Carni pizza. The fresh cheese and sausage is what I like best. The crust was just perfect.
Pizza quite good.  Thin crust, & small enough for one person.  Very fresh.
Simply amazing. Great prices, great food. The Large sandwich can feed two people for just 7$.

Management is nice here 
Room smelt bad but they gave us right away a new room as we told them 
And the rates are affordable 
Kind of shady young kids living here but it seems like they suffer from a hard life 
I wish motels would be in better shape but hey we could not get to burning man due to the rain and they totally helped us out in the last second so thanks guys

For our last day in New Orleans my husband and I decided to check out Frenchman Street. We were told that the music was great and it was a much different and better experience than Bourbon Street. Snug Harbor was recommended as a good restaurant on Frenchman Street so we decided to try it. Unfortunately, we were disappointed in the atmosphere and food. While the music we heard playing upstairs sounded great, we could not get tickets ($15 each) until the next show which was 10:00 p.m. and since it was only 8:00 p.m. we decided to pass. For the initial impression, the restaurant lacked character. It was very plain and cafeteria like. But we were seated right away and looking forward to enjoying a nice meal. Our waitress was friendly and got us our drinks. The drinks were good. I had a Captain Morgan and Coke and my husband had a Tanqueray gin and tonic. I wanted a burger and since we heard Snug Harbor was known for good burgers I ordered the cheddar burger. Since the baked potato it came with seemed too heavy, I ordered a salad instead with blue cheese dressing. About 5 minutes after we ordered, the waitress came by and said they ran out of blue cheese dressing. Well, I was disappointed (and surprised) but since I had watched a couple enjoying the gumbo, I told her I would get that instead. Then she said, "We ran out of gumbo too...I'm sorry." Uh...really? Wow...okay. Anyway, I decided to just get the baked potato and box it up. However, when I got my burger, it was a huge piece of meat but with no flavor to speak of and topped with shredded cheddar cheese. The bun was burned so bad it was black. So I ended up eating the potato instead of the cheeseburger. Unfortunately, that set our evening off to a negative start. We ended up calling it an early night. On the bright side, my husband had the fried chicken sandwich and loved it. We will probably never go back again...

This place is awesome.  The food is great food and  prices are reasonable.  The service for drive-thru and carry-out is also good.  I have not experienced inside dining yet...but plan to soon.  The burritos, quesadillas, and tortas are wonderful.  An order of chips and salsa brings a good amount of chips and very large amount of salsa.  The queso dip is also very good.  I have become a regular.

I went to SugarFire with some coworkers last week for lunch. We were all pretty happy that another BBQ place was occupying the former Dickie's location, since you can never have too much BBQ, so giving this place a shot was a no-brainer.

The Good:
- The BBQ was very good. I had the brisket and tried a coworker's turkey. Both were great.
- My french fries were small and crispy, just like I like 'em. More surface area to get good and fried (compared to say, steak fries).
- Lots of BBQ sauce choices at each table. I'm a fan of the sweet.
- Ski on tap! The soda fountain had ski, along with lots of other relatively obscure (and sugar based) sodas. It's a very nice change from the normal Coke versus Pepsi choices.
- Great customer service. We were greeted quickly by a host, who offered a quick rundown of our options, and every person in the food line served us with a smile.
- It was fast. I'm sure that might be obvious considering the type of restaurant it is, and the fact that they aren't cooking to order, but it's an important point for the work lunch crowd. You can get in and out in good time.

The Bad:
- The soda fountain! Oh god, the soda fountain. As another reviewer also pointed out, the soda fountain layout is TERRIBLE. You walk past it on entering, then get instructed to double-back for your drink before ordering. Want seconds during lunch hour? Fight your way through the line of people waiting to get food and it's all yours. A much better location for this would be over by the exit, in the little area where the trash is today.
- The potato salad. I'll admit, I'm pretty picky about my potato salad. Few stand up to my gold standard (homestyle red potato salad w/ egg from Schnucks. get some.) and this was no exception. It was just bland and boring. Like somebody insisted that they have potato salad, since it was BBQ, but nobody there really knew how to make it.
- The tray. You don't get plates at SugarFire, they give you a metal tray with butcher paper on it that you get your food on. And that would be fine, except that mine wasn't level. It had a big dent in the bottom so I would push down into my food with a fork or knife and the other side of the tray would pop up, constantly, like I was sitting at a table with a short leg.
- The size. I can't say this is a really big negative, but it's important to note that this is not a good place for bigger groups. If you go off peak you can probably pull a few tables together, but during lunch hour I wouldn't really want to try with more than about 4.

I'll be back to SugarFire, for sure. I'll make sure to get a flat tray, and I'll just skip the potato salad; problems solved there. The fountain needs to go, though. They just opened so they get a pass for now, but if that doesn't get moved soon I'll probably drop another star off my review.
Great food and homemade soda's. Tenderloins as big as your head!! Great service with great food so you can't go wrong.

I went to this buffet with my aunt and uncle, after a long day of snowboarding in Lake Tahoe.  It happen to be a seafood theme night, so we got to eat lobster, lobster cakes, crab legs, clams and a whole lot of seafood in general.  I'm really picky when it comes to seafood, and this place did not disappoint.  The desserts are awesome as well.  They look really nice, and I'm not using a buffet standard.  These desserts could easily be sold piece by piece at a high-end bakery.  All in all, the buffet was definitely worth the price we paid to get in.  Highly recommended by me.

Up until yum house moved in there had been no good Chinese restaurant. A lot of Average places. Yum House is excellent/ - pepper dishes are beautifully prepared. 
The variety is incredible.

Great beach for relaxing and especially watching sunsets.  It is not a large beach, but you'll figure that out when you try to park.  If you are lucky enough to find a spot and start cranking money into the meter, then you'll be rewarded with a nice clean family beach.  There is a lot less party atmosphere on this beach so this is the place to go if that's your thing, but you still want to be close enough to amenities like restaurants and hotels/rentals.  If you don't care about that, Ft de Soto is great too.

One tip; don't be tempted to walk across the street and eat at Hurricane restaurant until you read the reviews.

Just order take out from your favorite Chinese restaurant...this place is hit or miss, mostly a miss! My husband likes to go here when he's not sure what he wants to eat...he likes that there is a lot of different choices but the food is terrible! It's either overcooked and dried out or in a goop of brown sauce. The sushi is awful...you can get better Sushi at the Baltimore Pike Giant. Every time we have eaten here, I end up sick...it's cheap eats but you get what you pay for....
Do not come on a week day!!!! No one speaks English, owners suck, and food is subpar!

The food was delicious and service excellent. I was immediately won over by the fresh, hot bread that had just come out of the oven. So yummy. And it came with a nice dipping sauce that I really enjoyed. Definitely a great way to kick off my meal. I ordered the Di Carini chicken platter with penne which was fantastic. The portions are big so I had enough for an entire other meal. Great place!

Coming from out of town, we made sure to make a reservation far in advance. We were seated immediately & our friendly waiter stopped over to share the specials with us.

We started off with a mushroom, grits & quail egg special that was absolutely divine. We scraped the plate clean. Next, we had the foie gras torchon which was very rich. We finished with a cheese plate that had 3 generous portions of pungent cheeses, complimented with fresh jam, strawberries and pecans.

For entrées, we had the Venison and Wagyu beef. The Venison was cooked perfectly and the Wagyu beef was complimented well by corn & potato puree.

The highlight of my dinner, however, was a seasonal watermelon martini that was fresh, light & flavorful.

Coolest place in Nashville!  The decor is unique. The menu board provides a glimpse of the past, as does everything else at Skulls. It feels like going back in time when you walk through the door.  It's worth a visit just for the vibe, not to mention fantastic cocktails and delicious food. 

I started with the tuna tartare.  I was a little surprised and somewhat skeptical when it was served with homemade potato chips. The chips turned out to a nice pairing with the tuna. They were just thick and crispy enough to work. 

The prime rib was the best I have ever had. I asked for it to be prepared "as rare as they will cook it."  It did not disappoint. A great cut, perfectly prepared. On top of all that, the prime rib was HUGE!  The sides of blue cheese mashed potatoes and almond green beans were great, but totally overshadowed by the entree. 

Skulls has a decent wine list and a good selection of local beers.  Our server was well versed in pairing appropriate wines with what we ordered for dinner. She was fun and attentive. The ladies in our party split a desert of chocolate something. They all enjoyed it but I was unable to even think about desert after the huge prime rib. Instead, I ordered a Manhattan on recommendation of the server. It was the best Manhattan I've ever had.  

As for the Burlesque Show, it was described as classy and I would agree.  Still, not kid friendly. There are no 19 year old wonders of plastic surgery here.  No overt nudity.  I thought it was quite entertaining. 

Skulls is a cool place with atmosphere, delicious food and great libations. 
Fun for couples or groups, I highly recommend spending an evening in the Rainbow Room.

Thumbs up to Zen for being that clutch 5th restaurant I go to every week for lunch. 
The lunch specials are all really good and have a great price for the amount of food you get. I always leave with that "damn, I am stuffed" feeling everytime I leave. The owner and staff are super friendly. The atmosphere is very hip and modern. And the lighting is perfect.
I am really not a fan of fast food, but I have to say that the Chicago hot dog awesome. Really good combination of flavors and the poppy seed bun just perfectly topped it off.

Tried out LOS while at the Night Market at the Italian Market.  Since the Night Market is an awesome, gluttonous affair, I only had room in my belly for some french fries with the bacon mayo dipping sauce.  

The portion size was plenty for me and my husband to share- although I can see how someone may think $3 for the portion is a bit expensive- I thought it was fine.  The fries themselves were very brown, crunchy, and piping hot, which I enjoyed.  The dipping sauce was super delicious and tasted 100% homemade.

Next time I see LOS, I would like to get one of their burgers- esp since they use grass fed beef
The salmon fajitas are delicious! My daughter had the veggie burrito, great flavors and huge portion. Love this place; great food, reasonable prices and friendly service.

I "ditto" what everyone says below. Their sushi cuts are extremely thin...and their food was to be 'expected'. Don't go on Sundays...at least not for lunch - like most buffets it is "all day dinner". I don't think it's worth it - however during a regular lunch day you can't beat $5.99.

I still prefer The Journey

I went in with already silver colored hair, but with faded color and that harsh line when the roots have grown out. I asked for an ombré color, to blend the line between black and silver better, and Bailey suggested an awesome steel/slate color that ended up being perfect! She also used a cool silver shampoo she just got in to help with the quality of my existing color, and it really filled in all of the spots like she said! Reasonably priced, super friendly and knowledgable staff, and convenient location. I'll definitely be back if I ever need more color!
Brian did a great job on The Printed Image's window tinting. He was professional and worked fast. I highly recommend using Premier Glass Tinting.
smell stank inside the restaurant.  food was not good.  could not wait to get out the restaurant.

My wife and I were out and about on Memorial Day and needed some sustenance. I remembered Lucky Fins from a Yelp search I'd done before and found we were near it.
We're both glad we were! We arrived just as their Happy Hour started at 3PM and decided to try the Happy Hour menu. We ended up with the Kicker shrimp, Calamari and the soup and salad meal. The Kicker shrimp were sweet, spicy and perfectly cooked. Definitely needed the ranch dip, but it made them fantastic. The Calamari were the most tender we've ever had and also cooked perfectly. The soup and salad we split with my wife having the Miso soup- also great and me having a Caesar salad. The salad was above average in flavor and the dressing coated all the greens. Portions were fine and we were pleasantly full at the end of our meal. Service was also suburb since we were the only ones in the room at the time and the server was tending bar and our table. She was there every time our drinks ran low with refills. 
Prices were good for this level of restaurant, and we'll be back again for more of the appetizers.

One of My favorite places to go when I'm home is the MET so I decided to check out Frist. They are currently showing the 30 American exhibit and it beyond superseded my expectations. The pieces are primarily from African American artist and extremely thought provoking as well as personal.

The museum wasn't too busy and it was quiet...which was a nice break from all the tourist stuff. I was probably there for approx 2 hours,maybe less. For a $10 admission fee, it is well worth checking out

Came here because it was nearby and convenient. The quality of the food is very low. There was something in my water and the hot and sour soup I ordered did not taste right. The place did not feel clean and I will not be coming back.. save your time and money and go somewhere else.

We drove an hour to get here. I would drive two hours or more to go back. By far the best breakfast I have had in years. Our waitress was just the sweetest thing! Sooo cute! 
We had grits, they actually had a taste! What! Best grits around. Bacon is phenominal too. Everything was well above par and truly homemade. These people know food. Go! Now! Enjoy!
Its a smaller place so be ready for a wait. Its soooo worth it!!!

The blend of flavors from any dish is amazing.  I had the lamb kebab with hummus which was a bit over done for my taste however wonderful in taste.  The Moroccan tomato soup was absolutely my favorite.  This place is great for comfort type food.

I simply cannot wait until my insurance renews and I pick a different plan and a different dental office!  Zero communication, below par services - don't waste your time and instead find a professional dental office - there are still a few good ones left.

Last year we switched insurance, went from top notch coverage to a notch down, so I moved to this dental office.  What a huge mistake!  I had my first cleaning, which was so terrible that it was visible how little was done to clean my teeth. I had told the hygenist that, since I have a high risk of periodontitis, I was on an regiment of a deep cleaning, followed by a regular cleaning, four times a year at my previous dentist.  She obviously ignored this information and her version of regular cleaning was beyond terrible.  I then called the office and spoke to the manager about it.  They got me in to see a specialist, who agreed that I should be on the old regiment from now on.  

After my first deep cleaning and then a regular cleaning, I tried to schedule the next deep cleaning appointment.  I was THEN told that my insurance will not cover any kind of cleaning until the end of the year and it will be over $150 out of pocket.  When I said I was told to see the specialist who will approve the regiment (and my insurance company will pay based on this approval) I was now told that the insurance will not approve it, unless after the first cycle of deep cleaning/regular cleaning, the specialist performs some sort of gum surgery.  The initial advice they gave me was wrong, what the specialist told me was wrong and now my only option was to come see the specialist for a new assessment.  His next available appointment was over 3 months later - January 22.  

I arrived 10 minutes early and proceeded to wait another 35 minutes.  When I went to inquire whether it will be much longer, I was told that they do not know exactly how long, but there are two people before me...  I told the receptionist who checked me in that had she mentioned something when I arrived, it would have been better.  She was unapologetic and said that he is running late and that cannot be helped and the other receptionist chimed in advising me to maybe keep this appointment as the specialist's next available appointment is in April.  Needless to say this nonchalant attitude, coupled with the lack of communication since day one, made me walk out and write this review.  I am counting the months until I can purchase the top notch insurance again and move to my old dentist office.

While this is the closest theater to where I live; I normally drive up to the Regal Park 16 for several reasons:

The Bad:
1)  few movie showtimes & the last showings are pretty early in the night
2)  It smells like really bad, old, stinky, atrocious feet when you open the doors to each theater
3) They have Pepsi on fountain and not Coke
4) If there are a lot of people that show up (this rarely happens here), they are not equipped to handle it with the 2-4 employees visible at any given time. 
5) No RPX, crappy 3D and IMAX that doesn't seem to be any better than the regular screens

The Good:
1) You are often in an empty/ almost empty movie theater (hence no cell phones and giggly teens to ruin the movie).
2) It's generally quick to get your movie ticket and get into a seat. 

To Note:
1) No immediate free parking right in front of the theater. You have to deal with a parking garage (last I checked Muvico will validate parking to make it free..but it is still a pain), limited 2 hour parking or parking meters
2) Muvico just started a rewards program (FINALLY), but you have to sign up in theater (note: do it quickly! They donate to charity for everyone that signs up in November 2012)

Standard AYCE sushi.  They have a nice plating technique where they bring sashimi out on ice.  Also, the kitchen menu here is a bit larger in selection options than many other AYCE restaurants I've been to. 

Be ready for a surprise policy- if you have leftover sushi, you will pay a mandatory carry out fee and take the leftover food with you.

I've had lots of great experiences here. Perhaps one or two that were "eh". But now that I have found Buffy, the most amazing masseuse ever, I don't have to worry about "trying others out". It has been incredible every time. Nice ambiance as well.

Miss Vi's Cook-Up was at my job today serving food. Seriously, some of the best Caribbean food! I tried the curry chicken and rice with some of their homemade sauce seasoning. It did not disappoint. I look forward to trying Miss Vi's again!
The brunch buffet was amazing! Lots of great options and kid friendly too! Kristin was an awesome server and very attentive! I look forward to coming back soon!!

Not quite understanding the negative reviews: a Dairy Queen is a Dairy Queen. I don't think you should expect the highest of standards from a fast food joint. I just come here for the occasional Blizzard, which always gets the job done of putting my sweet tooth in its place. The flavor combinations are yummy, and they are good about letting you add extra candy in your ice cream creations. Sometimes the Blizzard is blended great, other times I end up with plain ice cream at the bottom, but you know what? You can hand-mix it with your own spoon and life goes on.

We were headed to a different Taco place nearby, but when my nephew saw that there was no line here, he insisted we go.  Super Rica is super simple, menu on a chalk board, Tacos only, order one or one of each.  The Asada is awesome but the surprise favorite was the bacon queso, picture extra thick, chunky bacon diced in white queso.  a selection of red and green salsas is next to the counter where you pick up your order and grandma is behind the counter hand making some of the best tortillas I've ever had.  ambiance is very simple, picnic tables basically.  Cash only!!
My favorite is Jacob V....very polite very courteous & willing to go the extra mile. As for the food, the best Italian food in town. Made fresh daily!! You got to have the Osso Bucco...the best.

We didn't swim or stay for more than 1 night because we were moving on, but it was a solid 4 from what we experienced.  Not giving it higher do to we didn't see pool or laundry facilities, the pillows were fluffy but would have liked them longer, and the WiFi was slow at times.  Plus, I may be a tough scorer, but I think average hotels even at their best don't get higher than a 4 really.  Decent breakfast, always a plus when there's a meat - there was sliced kielbasa this morning.   No noise from outside. Think it would be a good deal for like $75 - $80.  Bathroom was a decent size and clean.  Breakfast was a little better than regular grab and go. I think the room rugs should be changed every couple years or that floors should be wood, but that's me.  We'd go back.

I was thoroughly impressed with Gringos. My friend and I were working a job nearby, so we decided to try out Gringos. There weren't many people inside the restaurant when we entered. The large amount of decorations inside were a little much. Our server was extremely polite and attentive. 

The chips were good and the salsa had just enough of a kick to it without being too overpowering. 

I ordered the Carne Asada Chimichanga. I could have done with a little less guacamole and sour cream on top of it, but that didn't really bother me. The chimichanga was hot, which was perfect for me. The beans, rice and other ingredients mixed perfectly with the Carne asada.  

If you're ever in the Port Richey area and are in the mood for some very good Mexican food, I highly recommend hitting up Gringos. And ask for Sarah for your server. She was great!

Just had probably the most pleasant vet experience of my life today with Dr. Algero and Carrollton Veterinary Hospital. I'm new to town, and though my sweet older cat had been sneezing for a week or so, I hadn't found a new place for him to go. But this morning he really seemed sick and because I had seen this building in my neighborhood, I decided to call and take him in. It's walk-in, which I prefer since I'm never sure if I'll be able to get my cat in his carrier for an appointment! Usually in walk-in clinics you have to wait a long time, but I was in and out of the office in less than a half hour. The waiting area is clean but not clinical -- the decor feels like a home and everyone is friendly and kind. Dr. Algero is like the kind of vet you always dream of -- warm, kind, like he genuinely cares about your pet and not judge-y at all. He fixed my cat right up with a treatment option that worked for me and the price was extremely reasonable! I hope I don't have to take my sweet guy in anytime soon, but if I do, I'm coming back here!
Great Sashimi! I had the Trio Sashimi dinner which was awesome. It's a hard day (haha) when tuna is matched and outshone by both the salmon and yellowtail. ;-)

Great cozy atmosphere! What's better than beer and coffee!!! The history of the place was really cool too. We actually looked up the historic building and drove by it. Such a cool idea for a brewery!

The stand out beers for me personally were the Black Fox and the amazing Coffee Pale Ale.

Don't expect to get service at either location, they claim they are booked solid and wouldn't take me as a walk in. Both barber chairs were empty. Needed to get a shave for a wedding and they couldn't accommodate me. Waste of time and money in the parking meter

One nice thing about this experience is that the owner emailed me right after my review was posted. I've been playing phone tag with her and the salon manager but I  appreciate their concern and desire to make it up to me and my friend. I'll update once we talk.
Delicious! I tried to order online and it told me my address was out of their delivery range, so I called and placed my order and they gladly delivered! Will def order from here again

This is probably one of my new favorite please is Philadelphia for a casual meal. The only draw back was the service was slow. The whole meal for 5 was almost 3 hours on a Wednesday with drinks, oysters, apps (get the cheese plate,) and main course.

This is a great home depot.  I think they go out of their way to be helpful compared to other stores in the chain, or Lowes for that matter.  We go to this store all the time now.  They fixed how they give the military/veteran discount and I appreciate how it works now.

I tried this place out just once. Least memorable pho place i've ever eaten in. 
The pho was not great and when i tried to ask the waitress about another dish i saw other customers getting i had to use hand signals because she didn't know any english. 
Haven't gone back.
Well-stocked, knowledgeable, friendly, local... everything you could want or need from a bait and tackle shop.

I go to Chipotle a lot and I was wanting something similar and I've heard this restaurant is really good. Without a doubt this place is amazing. I can practically guarantee you that anything you order from this place will be amazing. I've had the nachos and the tacos along with the burrito. I would have to say my only complaint is the burrito fell apart on me but its more so my doing than the actual restaurants fault.

They have a wide variety of drinks and a selection of tequila. One of my favorite things about this place is that everything is made fresh and the atmosphere is nice. I've never been in here on a day where it's really crowded but the service is always 100% and great. 

One weird thing about this place though is that if you don't buy anything they won't let you use the restroom which I understand but it's a bit off-putting when you're entering the restaurant and you head for the bathroom and then someone approaches you asking if you're going to buy something before you handle your business.

Had a business dinner there last night.  We ordered the calamari, ceasar salads, and steaks.  The calamari may have been the best thing on the table, but was over cooked.  The ceasar salads weren't eatable.  The steaks were under seasons but covered in butter.

To finish the night, we watch the National Champion game in the bar, where we watched a cockroach scramble across the bar.

Lastly, there were maybe a total of 5 tables eating at 8 PM on a Monday, with the majority of the restaurant empty.

I wouldn't not recommend eating there.

I have taken my car to Pacifico Ford Service because I purchased the Pacifico for life extended warranty. I have been very pleased with the service I've received since 2008. Even if I don't schedule an appointment and just show up in the morning, my car always gets taken care of without any issues. The work is always done in a timely manner and the staff is very friendly. They give me a ride home and they pick me up when my car is ready so I don't have to sit around and wait all day at the shop. If I decide to wait, they have a large screen TV, complimentary coffee via Keurig machine and Philly pretzels. They provide free wifi Internet access and have computers for customers to use. They also have gaming equipment with some of the latest games so if you have children that have to stay with you they can play electronic games for diversion all activities. There are children's books available to read there is a play center with and carpeted area for children.  Their prices are typical dealer prices but they do run some specials. And  if you check in on yelp you often will get a coupon for $10 or more off some services.
In my honest opinion, one of the best buffets in Reno these days. Their seafood selection on Fridays and Saturdays is great! Compared with GSR and Peppermill, this one is the best these days

-Our server Gail was AWESOME! Ask for her. So attentive.
-Food us extremely rich. Oysters we're good. Tastef a bit like the broiler...
-Our table had the seafood Alfredo, shrimp and dirty rice, and lobster Mac. All pretty good
-parking validated
-Full bar due to integration with hotel bar; no drink menu available. Only wine menu.
My wife and I went to the Peking Palace for their buffet based on Yelp reviews. We both agree that this is one of the best values for both food and service.

For a wanna be chipotle this place servers queso. That's why it gets one star. Other then that the Oliveoil looking. Chick was rude to her employee and made her redo our tacos and burrito yes that was us you mean old women. And I do not recommend flys, unclean cloths stale chips and and having to ask for more cause 4 chips is the apparent serving size. Also thanks for the flys getting on my food I'm full now cause I've lost my appetite. 1 star.

Let me just recommend the roasted pineapple!!!!!
Nothing that I ate here was bad and the service was great. Came for lunch because the price is only $17.00 plus drink. Cheap at twice the price. If you leave here hungry it is your own fault. The salad bar is amazing. I would continue this but I'm still eating and don't want to miss any of the meat selection. I think this would make a good date night place.
The orange chicken is  and the broccoli is nice and crispy! This will definitely be my new go-to Chinese take-out!
Great classic barbershop experience where they offer the best haircuts in town from a flat top ,fade or wild designs all of the 4 barbers are greatly skilled but my go to guy is Danny.
Vibe is kind of lame here but they book good acts and I always have fun, Especially reggae night.

Situated right in Center City and practically on Broad Street, Oscar's is definitely worth a look.  This place is home to an unusually heterogeneous crowd, all seeming to appreciate the various strings of Michael Jackson, Queen, and Police songs.  The Jukebox is essential.  The 22 oz. tall glasses of  Yuengling for $3 is also essential to its success as a venue!  They also have a really nice, cheap dinner and snack menu.  Burgers for $5 or less, $1.75 french fries, etc.  It's nice not having to pay $5 for a few fries.

My only complaints are:  it was a little over crowded...which isn't too terrible until your service slows down considerably.  Our service became slow and non-existent.  There was also smoking inside.

It was a great place to meet up with some friends that I haven't seen in a few years.
the food here is really excellent. well prepared fresh and at a good prices! check it out

My roommates and I are if not weekly, atleast bi-weekly ordering from Munchies always sharing different things. I usually get the Tropicali Burger because I'm totally a sucker for anything with pineapple on it... lets be real. From time to time I find myself craving their fries, the seasoning they put on those puppies is probably the reason I keep going back. I've never had an unpleasant experience ordering both by phone or by walking in.

We didn't stay long here coz hubs was in a hurry. I wasn't able to check out everything but looks like their prices are steep compared to the ones I've been to, maybe because it's downtown? I did buy some. I'll come back when I have more time & maybe update my review.

Just had Hoaglin to go ordered in for our office.  I had the Tuna Salad (in Salad form) and it was really good.  Maybe not the absolute best meal I've had in my life but certainly tasty and certainly a LARGE portion.  I also tasted my co-workers egg salad which was also delicious.  All of the other sandwiches that ordered look quite pleasing!

I'm looking forward to trying the grilled cheese on sourdough or perhaps the filet of beef baguette or some soup?  Who know...I'll be back though!

Hector Ramirez noticed our pre paid box wasn't packed right. He educated us how to pack and have your package arrive safely to its destination.He opened it up said it had too much give in it. He comped us some bubble wrap to make it right. He repacked it with no scolding and said now we know better. Well all I can say is we'll be back.I said this was the best shipping store I have been in and everyone behind me in line agreed.
He was so pleasant that the other customers were not impatient and noticed what a nice guy to take time to help. A+ Kindness is back, no more it's not my job.

We ship often and just fired UPS for a very expensive lost package. Useless piece of shit=UPS trying to track a package is even harder than getting the package to the destination

I have loved this place for years. It is the best place to stop In West Ed, especially for the value of the food! Their green onion cakes are fantastic and their food is always cooked with lots of flavour.

My favourite dish is the Thai coconut curry chicken noodle soup. It is my go to when I am sick and the bowl is MASSIVE for 13$.

I wouldn't expect top service as there are usually not many people working and I rarely get a refill on water because they are busy. 

The menu is large and there is an expansive amount of choices. 

Food has always come quickly and correctly.

Easy to find even during Mardi Gras madness.  Good selection, decently priced older issues.   Very well organized store.  Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  Next time in town I would definitely make another visit

Overrated, over processed, over crowded, and I'm over it.



No more, a HUGE let down.   As my friend put it on twitter, the food was a let down but the company was stella!

I've been twice and enjoyed it both times. Coffee was excellent and the other dishes, which I can't pronounce or spell, were well prepared and flavorful. Authentic all around. I'll be back to explore more.
Good chicken salad sandwich!  Coconut cream pie was just OK and was a very small piece.

I was in Reno for the weekend and was looking for somewhere to have a drink and dinner. Very glad that I stopped by here. Sat up at the bar top and the bartender was very friendly and gave excellent service. Ordered the German Chocolate martini which was awesome. For dinner I has the stuffed chicken sandwich with French fries on the side...my guest had the grilled cheese sandwich with clam chowder and she liked them both as well. I will deffiently go back when im in the area.

I went to here on a Monday afternoon at around 4:00PM. There was one couple dining outside but not one customer inside. Right there I thought a mistake was made. Upon walking into the restaurant it appeared new, clean, and sleek. We were greeted by a pleasant hostess at the front door and immediately helped by our server dressed in all black. She was prompt, kind, and attentive. I ordered the bolognaise while others ordered the gnocchi, mushroom risotto, various pastas dishes, etc. We received our orders in a timely fashion. My dish was a large portion for under $20. It was flavorful and fresh. I also tasted the gnocchi and it was cooked to my liking. We did not order appetizers or desserts but I'll definitely be back to check them out.

     Overall it was a nice dining experience at a reasonable rate. There are options for children on the menu but this place might be out the league for some 5-10 year olds. Under 5 can have simple pasta dishes while those over 10 have plenty of adult options. Depends on the child. Gluten free items are also on the menu. I'm unsure about the clothing attire due to the lack of customers but I would say pants and at least a polo for men if not a button down. No booze is a huge drawback as I was unaware but they apparently have BYOB. I'll make sure I bring a bottle on my next visit! 

FYI: Decent sized parking lot in the rear.

Unusual and elegant accessories that would be a head turner anywhere. Of course the main course here is hats, and this is probably the best place in the world to get them. Yes, the staff is somewhat anal but can you blame them when all they see is tourists on a daily basis who have no desire or intention to buy? If I ever needed a tea hat or period hat for something specific and had the funds I would absolutely buy from here. Hats retail for around $700 on up,  which means only a woman who was extremely wealthy and had a very specific desire for them would buy, which is why you don't see many people here when you come in.
Amazing juice and very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The charcoal shot is a must try for hangovers. And the açaí bowl is amazing!

We had been here once before when we first moved to the neighborhood and remembered liking it but for some reason had not tried it again until we Grubhubbed it tonight.  You know how some Indian places it just seems like the stuff is sitting in giant vats/pots all day long and stewing to the point of it becoming unidentifiable slop?  Not so with IndeBlue.  It's probably the best Indian food around in terms of the freshness of the food.  

Here's the rundown of tonight's order:

Vegetable samosas - overall pretty tasty though they were a bit too dense (too much potato filling maybe?) for me.  The shell had a nice crisp to it and was perfectly fried and not at all greasy or overdone.  Was not a fan of the chunky chickpea chutney as I prefer a simple sweet and tangy chutney sauce.

Chicken tikka masala - probably the best version of this dish I've ever had.  The chicken is all white meat and cooked perfectly and diced to the right size.  The sauce does not overwhelm the dish and you can actually make out what is chopped up in there that gives it all the flavor.

Aloo gobhi mattar - not my favorite (mostly peas and cauliflower) though it had a nice flavor and little bit of a kick.  Gotta love that they have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options.

Side note - the take out containers were good quality and dishes clearly labeled.  Looking forward to the leftovers for lunch tomorrow!

Awesome tour!  Dave was wonderful and provided us with history, knowledge about the wineries, good food and fabulous wines.  I've done a number of wine tours and you cannot go wrong with Backroad and the open air Hummer.  This was the highlight of our trip to Santa Barbara, I'd definitely return and go again! :)

Went there tonight for the first time and it did not disappoint!  Food and service were both phenomenal - can understand how the restaurant is so popular.  We had an early reservation, which I think helped as we didn't have to wait.  Highly recommend for a nice night out and a great meal!

Decent Mexican food.  I wouldn't call it authentic by any means, but it's still tasty.  Places that have better and more authentic food usually don't have any atmosphere, so this place gets props for that.
Effective tomorrow, they are no longer Fresco and will be called the Fig Grill. Went by today and saw the change.
Worst pizza ever....it took over an hour to get here even though it's a block away from me and when it got here it was cold, flat and just horrible. You can do better for your money trust me!

I have been to Z-Grille a few times, and the food has been amazing on every occasion. The Dr. Pepper Fried Ribs are awesome, although it isn't a ton of food and it costs $12. The deviled eggs come in a variety of unique and super tasty flavors, and also look like works of art. On my most recent visit, I ordered the Artisan Grilled Cheese. That was also pretty delicious, and actually pretty filling since it comes with the soup of the day as well.

The interior design is also very modern, which is different and interesting. I enjoyed that aspect as well.

For me, the food is 5 stars-worthy, but I deduct a star for the price relative to the amount of food. The portions don't tend to be huge, and you always drop a chunk of change there. 

In short, I don't make a ton of visits because of the price, but when I do, my taste buds leave happy.

The staff were friendly. The hotel could use some work. There was a weird smell in the hallways. It's not exactly foul or pungent just untidy. The curtains in my room are just the right length to block the vents on my room ac. So I had to tuck the curtains into the wall and cool the room or let it hang and just cool the windows. Someone didn't get the measurements right on that one. My bed felt itchy. I went to the gym (3 old cardio equipment, the treadmill is super loud , and some free weights) and a random bug that looks like a housefly bit me. I'm convinced that I'm never coming back.

Service was really slow. But the gumbo was good! The strawberry daiquiri was horrible. The chicken wings where awesome. 
Overall the environment was great right in the middle on the French area.

The man who owns this place is AMAZING!! So friendly and great customer service. The prices are good - less than $10 for most anything. Food is good and fresh - "build your own" style similar to Chipotle. They give you a punch card where 10th meal is free! They have a TV, plenty of tables and booths, and bomb sweet tea!

Came to Miller's Ale house to wish a friend off to better pastures. We've been here once and had a good time. So I am glad that we got to go here again.  We hung out in the Bar area, sipping on Martini's and passing stories back and forth. 

The service was good, but for some reason my $2.00 vodka martini was actually $5. *shrug* not that it's terrible, but I didn't quite understand the explanation.

If my phone would let me I'd rate this a 4.5
Our server was extremely friendly and knew her craft beer. The tap selection was perfect for the beer enthusiast. The aesthetics of the bar are that of what once was a dive bar, with its old wood design and stickers and posters everywhere. (Check out the rare DUEL movie poster in the restroom!)
Besides having a wide variety of local and national craft beer on tap, the food is outstanding! All of it is made in house and the recipes are unique. I had both the Pablo encrusted fingers and the honey wings. My friends had the alligator po boy. 
All that is missing to make this a perfect 5 is the narrow bar itself. There's barely any room between the bar stools and the tables behind them.
If I can't find it second-hand, I come here. If they don't have it, the staff can probably bring it in. This is a place that makes supporting local business easy because of the service and selection.

The best thing about the Whole Foods store is the free samples!  Yes, I know, it may be trite, but come on who doesn't love free samples?!  I always seem to make the mistake of going grocery shopping when I am hungry, and Whole Foods  always satisfies my need for munching on something.  You can make a round through the produce section and get a sample of every organic and fancy fruit.  I guess it's effective, because I ended up buying tons of things that were not even on my shopping list, but after tasting it, I had to get it. 

The new location at the cute Green Hills shopping center is fun to visit.  They have tables and chairs near the front windows, so you can buy something to eat at the deli and actually sit down and have your meal right there without leaving the store.  This makes Whole Food a pretty popular spot for lunch on the West Side of town.

My husband and I just moved to the area and have been looking for some Italian food. Rossi's did not disappoint!! Joanne was a fantastic server and all her food recommendations were spot on! We had the calamari, penne al a vodka, and lasagna. The portions are large and the food was amazing.  The service was fast and the restaurant was very clean. We will definitely be back!

Amazing dinner! Our waitress Emily was on her game, she was super attentive, knowledgable and gave fantastic recommendations.  I raved about the carrot cake and was excited about the hot Carmel sauce that came with it and how good it would be with ice cream.  Next thing I knew she had gotten me a scoop!  We will definitely be back.  Ps- good wine selection

I genuinely set out to write a great review for this place for our visit today. We always come in on Wednesdays for their wingsday special. We called ahead today so that we had plenty of time to eat on lunch break because sometimes it takes awhile. Now kelly was an awesome bartender/waitress. She was friendly and attentive and went above and beyond. I was good with the whole experience until I watched two employees walk from behind the bar wearing flip flops. One was a trainer.... This is how you're training in a food establishment? Yes they were handling food and beverages. That's so gross, I can't believe this is being allowed to happen. See pic.
Very attractive atmosphere,  I love the feel of this bar. Drinks were very good and reasonably priced.

Bathe me in pastry cream and sprinkle me with macarons. Add a tartine, piece of quiche, small salad, and we have the makings of a legit Saturday lunch. Lucky for me, Like Home offers all of the above, which saves me from pulling my hair out during my macaron-ing adventures. They also have bags of homemade marshmallows, which I make on the regular, but just couldn't help but buy a $7.50 bag.

Additionally, the food was delicious. We enjoyed a salmon tartine and a croquette madame followed by a couple pastries. Each item was served with a small salad and they offer balsamic, ranch and caesar dressings (a bit strange for a cafe, I'd say). I was expecting a few vinaigrettes or other varieties, but I went with caesar. The tartine and croquette were divine. A few problems arose with the pastries.

When we arrived, the area where you order is haphazard. You do not know where the line is or where to stand, and either way you are going to be in someone's way. The girl taking orders was 90% clueless. It took her 5 minutes for each of us to place a one person order. I pointed to ONE remaining rectangular bar, described it, and asked if it was a lemon bar. She said yes. I ordered it. After sitting down, another woman came over to tell me it was passion fruit, which I said I would take. She then told the people that ordered directly after me that the passion fruit bar was already sold out so they had to get something else (the order taker sold ONE remaining bar to two people, back to back?) It gets better-she came back 5 min later to tell me that in fact it was sold (ok, so she sold ONE bar to three people??) I did not see anyone eating it and there was no one in front of me ordering, so I'm clueless where it went. I said I would take the berry tart, which had 3 up there previously. Those were now gone too. I settled for peach.

The flavored iced tea was sitting in a jug by the order taker. "it's peach tea". Strange since there were floating strawberries in it. Turns out, it was strawberry, or so we guessed. Definitely not peach.

We wanted to get macarons to go after eating, but after meandering around the register area as lots of people came in, we couldn't figure out where to stand or how to finagle the line. Further, some of the macarons look like "mini macs" but sign says they are all $2/piece. I'll pay $2 for a regular size (~1.5-2" diameter) but not a 0.5" diameter mac. In the end we left with no little cookies.

I will probably be back, but with different expectations. I live near Patisserie Choquette and it's just a better run pastry shop, at least for now. Hopefully I can update this with some improvements after they get things working better.

So Many Bad Reviews? I personally found that all of the BAD Reviews are mostly Legit!. 

This place should be famous for serving Way-Overpriced Portions of Uninspired Cuisine by a Waitstaff that would rather be somewhere else.  

Add one side-item, a cup of coffee plus tax & tip to your Breakfast Entree and you can expect to pay between $25 & $33 per person... for a half decent, small-portioned Breakfast!   

$18 FOR FRENCH TOAST? ($14 menu price plus 9% tax & a 17% tip: rounds up to around $18 and I just can't see this entire plate costing them more than 85 cents in total food cost, plus or minus 15 cents).  The texture of the french toast was a bit weird with mush bananas and the Rum-flavored syrup had little flavor. I saw $10 sandwiches that came with a side dish that had more sustenance than the $18 French Toast. French Toast is Cheap (bread, milk, egg, butter, banana & syrup), for $20, you can serve French Toast to a lot of people at home. 

The Hamburger was a disaster. The bun was overly crisp & dry to the point that it was difficult to eat. While trying to fit the burger in my mouth, the unseasoned hamburger patty fell apart into about 9 pieces. I had to eat it with a fork... pathetic!  The shoestrings Fries were good!  

My biggest turn-off about the Menu here is the constant repeat of the word "Shane-Made" as a combination spin off of the Chef's first name and the word "homemade" or "housemade". This was more annoying than it was cute. The Chef Owner's EGO seems to be larger than his ability to serve a decent, fair cuisine at a reasonable price. "Shanemade" has become our new word to describe a Restaurant's Cuisine that is Highly Overpriced and Underwhelming. 

Upon reading Chef Shane's Bio on his website, I learned that he had previously worked as a head chef under Emeril, but, on his own, he seems that he lacks the business knowledge and self-discipline to run an effective restaurant. Then I decided to Google 'Shane Pritchett' and learned from a (NOLA dot com) article that he and his wife were running a 'Ponzi Scheme' out of their Magazine Street Interiors Shop. These are NOT Good & Honest People look it up and decide for yourself. AVOID THIS PLACE.
Fabulous brunch, Southern breakfast, catfish and grits, frog legs, bread pudding and spring rolls.  Service was great.  Run, don't walk to brunch. Can't wait to try dinner.

I've been to Charlie Gitto's twice and each time, they make you feel very special and truly serve you some of the best food you've ever had.  The service here is phenomenal, your glasses are always kept full, the staff are kind and knowledgeable, and you feel like you're someone special just for walking in the door.  I also love the atmosphere.  It has the feel that an old Italian restaurant should have, candles on the tables, interesting photos adorning the walls, and beautiful chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.  

Now, I can barely write a review based only on service and atmosphere...and to Charlie Gitto's, it would be a disservice to you to not mention the fantastic food!  As a start, we had their calamari.  It was a fried calamari served with an interesting chipotle sauce which starts sweet and ends spicy on your tongue.  For our main course, my bf had the penne borghese which is a large bowl of penne pasta served in a delicious rosé cream sauce and prosciutto and onion.  This meal is a delicious option and still affordable.  But I think the shining spotlight of the night must go to the chicken nunzio.  This chicken is incredibly tender, served with buttery crab meat, and covered in a fantastic creamy, cheesy, sauce. Every single bite takes you to heaven.  Finally, Charlie Gitto's served us complimentary caked for my birthday.  It was a nice treat. 

And that's that.  Don't pass this place up, whether you're just visiting St. Louis and want a taste of Italian on the famous Hill, or if you are a long time resident wanting to have a celebration...go to Charlie Gitto's, they'll take care of ya!
Excellent pizza, healthy, and simple. Cooked perfectly and delivered very quickly!! Good price, too.
I stayed at the parkside inn for 3 nights last week. I really felt like I was at home. I loved being 2 blocks from the beach. The Hyatt staff was great. I would come back.

Good service, horrible song selection. Take me back to NYC or Cali.  This place did not have any of the classics.  No BBD, no ll cool j, no notorious BIG. My friend was very disappointed.  

Come for a Friday night sausage-fest. There's a surprising number of men out numbering the women at this establishment.

I realize that Hernando Beach isn't the center of the known universe, but have they never heard of "locally sourced" food??!! Staying in town I watched at least 10 shrimp boats and 3 or 4 crab boats head out to the Gulf. So, of course I'm thinking that's what's on the menu, but no.  Every seafood item we had was breaded and deep fried.  It's like they bought the stuff frozen at Costco and threw it in the deep fryer.  The fries and cole slaw were meh... nothing special.  No draft beer.  The atmosphere is very authentic and rustic, in the parking lot of a marina overlooking a canal.  Just be careful about getting your flipflops caught in the legs of the folding lawn chairs they use as dining chairs.  I'd look elsewhere for good food in Hernando Beach.
Another great experience! Food is on point every time! Feels like it gets better and better.... West coast oysters, Kobe beef tartare, steak frites, flatbreads!!!! All are amazing!

Great service but bland, unimaginative pub food alongside a pedestrian beer selection. In reality the food is probably pretty close to authentic as Bangers and Mash isn't really that great of a dish in the first place. The peas tasted like, well, boiled peas and the mashed potatoes seemed devoid of any seasoning. Pork sausages were dry as a bone. Ordered a local "brown ale" on recommendation which turned out to be a cream ale. Not the same thing. Basically if you drink anything but Stella or Murphy's then head to the Craft Beer Market literally across the street.

I like The Greek Lady for the value. They give you a ton of food for a very reasonable price. Salads are HUGE and if you order a gyro platter, you get two sides and a side salad for around $11. Great deal.
I recommend the lamb gyro. The lamb is
flavorful, the pita is nice and soft and the tzatziki is addicting. I usually get a Greek salad, which is of course, topped with fresh feta. Yum! Also, I usually get fries and some sort of vegetable for my two sides. Fries are okay, not very memorable and I will say that one major downfall, for me, is the vegetables that are so bland and tasteless that I can never finish eating them.

I have been to both locations I know of of this restaurant and I must say they are fantastic. The excellence of the food is well supported by a friendly and hard working staff, that not only do their jobs and do them well, they are excellent at customer care when something does go wrong. I have had food come to me that was sub par which was immediately replaced by better food in a kind and prompt manner. I understand sometimes things do go wrong and I have been here many times and only had it happen once. When it did both the waitress and the manager were quick to see the situation was handled and that I was pleased with my meal. I would have to say they are my favorite restaurant in Indy at the moment.

My boyfriend and I visited Brauhaus Schmitz this past Friday. The place looked pack and we were prepared for a long wait. I was not leaving with out spatzel! Surprisingly, we were seated within minutes on the second floor, which is very cozy. For those of you who are tall, if you are seated on the second floor, be prepared for a low ceiling! We laughed at every tall guy as he ascended the stairs to see their reaction!  Its was very loud, between the crowd, the great music and the rowdy table near us. This is not place for a quite meal or if you want to talk to the person across from you. 

Our waitress Molly was very lovely and service was prompt. We knew the plates were going to be large, so we skipped the starters. Both of us went for the schnitzel, deciding on Jägerschnitzel and Zigeunerschnitzel. While the pork cutlet was moist, crispy and flavorful, we were extremely disappointed in the sauces. Both lacked any flavor, no less spice, and salt did not help. Next time, I will stick with the traditional lemon slices. On the bright side, the spatzel and braised cabbage were delicious! I could have eaten both all night. 
For the sides and beer prices alone I gave the fourth star!
This place is usually quiet and the staff is very attentive. Even though the food is a bit more expensive it is good.

What a great store, wish I lived closer.  So much to look out that it could be overwhelming.  They have an excellent selection of health food in addition to standard groceries.   The prices are higher than Winco but similar to Albertsons.  As I was wondering I noticed they had a two day sale on boxed cereals for under $2. 

Excellent customer service, very friendly cashiers.

We are from AZ and are visiting friends in DE and decided to stop by Mazzellas for dinner. It was delicious! The portions are large (enough for two to share) but you can order 1/2 portions. Bread and butter was provided as soon as we sat down. There were 2 different kinds of bread and they were great! We ordered full order of manicotti (3 tubes), 1/2 order of gnocchi sorrento, 2 shells w/4 meatballs, a slice of pizza, kids penne w/butter and we were not disappointed! I would strongly recommend this restaurant to everyone!

Our first visit was this morning.  Everything was great.  Super friendly.  Our kid has a nut allergy and that was accommodated without a problem. Will eat here again. Love finding great little local spots

Lots of land for your pups to play! Leashes aren't required so you don't have to worry about any crazy people yelling at you to leash your dogs. 
I always run into friendly people at this dog park; only place I'll take my dogs!
Fresh ice cream inside outside, the cups and cones over flow with love for customers that come in and out of their doors. Always will be a customer keep up the great work..

Don't let your kids live here!!  I moved my son out for medical reasons.  When I returned his keys, although the manager was on the premises he refused to see me.  A young student helped me and informed me that the apartment would be inspected immediately.  We left the apartment with no damage but they claimed my son had damaged the premises.  The inspection was never done, his door was left open.  Who knows who went into that apartment after we left.  They lied to us and then they demanded we pay for the damages and more!!  Stay away for this poorly managed apartment building.  Look elsewhere if you're considering having your child live in an apartment near the University of Arizona.

I loved the hipster-esque vibe of the cafe--in fact, I loved everything about sitting in that small booth and looking around the cafe, with considerate and funny waitresses chatting besides the cute display of tea bags in mason jars. However, my only complaint is that all the food was much too rich. My friend and I ordered around 4-5 meals between us, and I--a big sweet tooth--was even slightly overwhelmed by the sweetness in my Thai soba noodle dish (HIGHLY recommend though), much less the sweet potato fries and stuffed French toast, both of which I couldn't finish because of the overwhelming richness. But I hope I can stop by this lovely joint at least one more time.

My nails have never looked this good! I've been getting my nails done for 5 years now and let me tell you I've been this pleased with the outcome. I've been to at least 20+ nail salons and nobody has perfected the look I wanted except for this place! She was very nice and worked very hard on my nails. I got a fill and you know those nail places that makes your fake nails look fat at the end? Not this place. All I said is I wanted to them to look natural and she succeeded. Really recommend this place the inside is also very welcoming and cute. You will not be disappointed when you spend money to get your nails done here.

Ambiance - its tight cozy atmosphere. Tables are so close . Adjacent tables guests can hear our conversation . Lot of noise . Lights in the room are nice. 

Food- we ordered appam with goat curry, And parota with egg curry . In Goat curry they are oly two pieces . Taste wise they are not extraordinary. Currys are like  South Indian, homemade style. But presented well. 

Service- fast and good .

Price- reasonable.

Great place to eat and drink in Santa Barbara. Food and service were superb backed by a fun atmosphere. I recommend the lobster bisque to start; a cup is plenty. We've had good experience with the fish entrees, like Dover Sole and Swordfish.  We've heard the shellfish is top-notch too.

Where to start . The food here is ridiculously good , I mean this guy Mr Jordan is the best when it come seasoning food . I got one of the best oxtail I ever tasted. I don't even seafood but my is singing praises of the seafood . If you don't believe me come try it yourself.
Best coffee in town. I always go for the drip, and it is strong and never bitter. I literally crave the taste of this coffee and it is second to none in SB.

I love the decor in here and our service was excellent. The price point was great too! I am not someone who typically likes gluten free bread, but my sandwich was so good that I didn't even realize I was eating gluten free until I finished it! 

I had the veggie sandwich which was delicious, and my husband really enjoyed his eggs Benedict. It was a great spot for lunch and brunch. I will definitely be going back! 

And the shops at fatherland right there are great if you are looking to do some shopping before it after.

Their hoagies are the BEST. THE BEST. It's one of the places where if you don't eat it in a while, you start getting cravings. Horrible midnight cravings. 

I also tried their cheesesteaks. Can't say I'm a fan though. But don't let that affect you.
Pretty sweet! Super close to the beach and great sized rooms right by the pool. Real easy to get to the car from the room and very helpful staff!

Oh, it's a dive. But that's not at all a bad thing. 

It looks like a grimy little hole in the wall, but it feels nothing like it. A lot of truckers stop by late at night, and they're usually too tired to bother anyone or just looking to trade good stories. You can sit with your drinks and whoever you came with and be left alone, or you can chat with all the other smokers outside. That's probably my favourite aspect of Jay's: You can be as isolated or as social as you want, and no one will give you any shit for it. 

And the drinks are pretty clutch, man.

Been here a few times.  The service is always lousy and slow.  Despite having nobody else in the restaurant, they wouldn't allow my party to sit in a particular booth because we weren't big enough.   The last time I went there, I got severe food poisoning.  That was the last straw.  Don't go here!

My SO and I stayed at The Lofts, which is a renovated warehouse next door to the main building.  It's a step above, and it's clearly worth the upgrade!

The rooms are well-done, and retain some of the exposed brick and stonework of the original warehouse.  Beds are comfortable (as would be expected at an Embassy property) and the area was quiet.  The fact that our room (447) was facing a brick wall next door might have contributed to the serenity...  so if you're looking for a view, request a higher floor than 4 or 5.

The shower was one of the strongest I've experienced (in a good way) and the bathroom amenities were very good.  The lighted mirror was particularly useful for getting ready in the mornings.

Brunches were extremely well-done - the made-to-order omelets, the fresh fruit, the genuine bacon perfectly cooked, and the homemade waffles all deserve praise.

The staff was attentive and professional, and the location in the rebuilding Warehouse District gets you close to some up-and-coming new spots in NOLA while keeping you just far enough away from the craziness on Bourbon Street to leave it behind.

I have eaten at saffron about 4 times in the last year.

After spending the last decade living in india it has been difficult for me to find good authentic indian food.  Saffron is just about as close as it gets.  The food is great and the seasoning in perfect.  The service can be a little sluggish but with pleasant company this is not a problem.  Although i typically try to avoid judging a place based on presentation this place has great food presentation.  The tandori chicken came out sizzling.

I look forward to my dinner there.

We finally hit this place. Wanted to give them time to get there system down and they do.
What a great meal. Friendly hostess.. Took us to a great table and was greeted right away by our server .  Julio. Told him it was our first visit. He was very helpful and had great recommendations.
We both started off with a ZEN-Rita. Something we would not normally order. Light and refreshing. A blend of Pear sake and Pinto Gigi with pear and apple garnish.
 Then we started with an order of SouZou Snapper roll -lightly fried and rolled in rice and also an order of Wicked Tuna -outstanding -slightly spicy and fresh tuna and wrapped in rice.
Then we had the pot sticker-Gyoza-we the best we had -homemade and served with a flavorful sauce of soy and citrus soy.
Then we had an order of the pork buns -Pork Bulgogi-the meat was tender and full of flavor--we even used some of the Gyoza sauce with them. They were the best!!
I would highly recommend this place for their food and service. While not on the main drag of downtown St Pete -they have ample parking and a great vibe to them.
Well worth a visit!!

I like this this place. I've been here many times and it doesn't disappoint. This is one of the better ramen restaurants in Philly. Small ramen place in Chinatown. I usually get the pork buns, tacoyaki and terakawa ramen.

I shall remember this day forever. The day I actually found a real life yarn store. Sure, I've heard the lure of yarn stores of yesteryear, and how they all went the way of the buffalo with the dawn of big box craft stores. But at least one survived my friends, and for lovers of crafting like myself, it was a religious experience! 
Crafters are the nicest people, and this certainly held true here. Jenna was just lovely, and helped me find my yarn soul mate.  While the yarn here is expensive, it is speciality yarn and worth the money. I spent $27 on some roving wool yarn and felt that was a fair price.
