Apart from beautiful fibrous findings, the store also sells finished items. They have patterns on hand and hold classes as well. Basically a yarn lover's paradise.  I will be a lifelong customer!

Decided to try this place out due to the reviews and was not disappointed. Everything was delicious and service was exceptional. I love little surprises like this. Unexpected location, had never noticed it before. Also reasonably priced they have lunch and dinner sized options. The wings were a tasty appetizer.

IKEA's products are cute like Target but it costs about as much as WalMart. It makes me happy -- mostly. 

I'd never been to an IKEA until the beginning of October. Now I've been twice. The store is a bit daunting and it's still really crowded on the weekends, but now I know better than to arrive at 1 p.m. on a Saturday as I did on my second visit. I spent about 2 hours there on my first visit, but unless I'm making some big decisions or purchases, I don't think it'll take me longer than an hour on future visits. That's good, because every time I return from IKEA, about 5 hours later I want to go back and get this or that. 

Yes, they have nearly everything at IKEA, but not necessarily the best range in a product or the greatest quality, so you have to be careful. I bought a magnifying makeup mirror for only $20 and was so excited! Well, the light isn't very strong and it only magnifies to 3x, which I hadn't realized isn't very much. I've already ordered and received a 7x mirror with a stronger light from Amazon, and it's also larger than IKEA's, for a few dollars more than IKEA's. I like the bathroom rug and various jars I purchased. They have great details on candles.  

RTA furniture is not my style. I don't buy particleboard. I'm at antiques stores or Carol House because I like nice things. (If you think that's dorky, you should hear me at a Wehrenberg. Wehrenberg.) IKEA's metal shelving, however, is so me. 

They have a final sale section near the cash registers. I'll be checking that out every time. 

IKEA is a welcome addition to my STL shopping experience. If they sold clothes, I would about have it made.

Good for big groups and they have an amazing Happy Hour Menu!  Best Seared Ahi Poke Tuna of my life!!!!

I would definitely go back for Happy Hour!

Sure... they sometimes put other people's mail in our mail box and they're not open on Saturday's. But this PO is super close to our house which makes it convenient and I usually find that the lines move pretty quickly. The customer service here varies for sure but I have seen this place have a line out the door. They could have a dedicated line for small items that are ready to go to expedite things.

So my brother highly recommended this place and my husband and I decided to finally try it this was our 1st time at this location let me say that I am of Puerto Rican descent and have yet to ever encounter a true Puerto Rican restaurant. 

I can happily say this is one of those, it is like eating in any of those restaurants in Old San Juan or even in your mama's kitchen if you are Hispanic. We walked in and the smells grabbed me immediately. Felt like being in my mama's kitchen     

I had the white rice and beans with baked chicken my husband had the beef stew and yellow rice we also ordered tostones  and the potato empanada absolutely delicious everything.   When the owner came out and asked if everything was OK and did we want anything else he mentioned something about hot sauce and of course my husband loves heat. The owner had said he has some homemade hot sauce my husband immediately said "pique" (which any Puerto Rican knows is the homemade version of hot sauce). The Owner gave a big smile because I think it surprised him to hear that from someone like my husband (who is not Hispanic) and he immediately came out with the 2 flavors they had, original and one with mango my husband love the original more than the mango but said they were both good.    

It's a small place hidden away in Spring City but worth every effort to find.   The mom and pop owners are such nice gracious people again feels like you're with family can't say enough great things about this place I  recommend all hispanics especially the Puerto Ricans to check it out.

Way up North off SR 54 is Wesley Chapel District Park. This park houses fields for various sports, including, lacrosse, soccer and softball. There is even a basketball court. My son plays lacrosse here and during practice I can get a good workout in on the 16 mile trail that is there. Although I haven't made it a full 16 miles the running, jogging and walking a few miles is fine for me.
I went to a party with catering from this restaurant and it was wonderful!  Great food and very friendly service

Good Indian food. We got the chicken korma and saag paneer and lamb biryani.  The biryani was dryer than what I'm used to.  They're really stingy with the naan. They charge a lot of money for one piece of small garlic naan! The food was fine.  Nothing I would dream about but I would order from them again.
Been coming since I was a teenager (16 yrs.) still the best Greek! Love the gyro and try the Romano!!! Enough for three. Lemon Greek soup is bar none best in FL.
Very clean, nice design for the atmosphere.  The food is good and variety is decent.  I did not go for the burgers but still enjoyed my meal.
Family had a great experience. Provided helpful service & surprised w/ reclinable chairs! New floor was eye-catching and I will definitely recommend to friends and family.

We are happy we found this salon. It is very clean and we appreciate that they are committed to sterilizing all equipment.

I recommend Anna as she is excellent! She makes great suggestions and remembers what I like, e.g. Very hot water. Wow, today Anna gave me the BEST foot massage ever!! She will never get rid of me. 

My husband has had a few technicians and they have also been good; they do seem to rush through with him. I hope they slow down and then I will change my review to a 5.  Too Anna doesn't have a twin. 

The first time we came we had to wait as they were running behind. Now I call 30 minutes ahead of my appointment to see what time we should come. Today they told me to come 15 minutes later so we did. This worked as when we arrived they were ready for us.  We will continue to come here.

My favorite taco place in the city. I do not generally like fish tacos, and lead the tragic life of being a picky eater...so let me tell you about how these fish tacos changed my life! Haha. My boyfriend and I live close (both originally from Birmingham, Al). We have been going to Taqueria Corona for these fish tacos since 2008. Always friendly staff, always magical fish tacos. We always (just about) order two fish tacos each, with chips/pico/guac, and cokes to drink. We normally don't get sodas, but their coke tastes wonderful for some reason! We consider that a rare treat. The guac is amazing. Pico is amazing. Cheese dip, we prefer elsewhere-we like the white cheese (Americanized I think...). I sometimes get the cheese and chicken quesadilla (which sounds like nothing special, but is really something incredible too) and we split that. Pro tip- if you get an appetizer with chips, tacos, AND a quesadilla for two people, you probably won't be able to finish...I have been getting instead (when I didn't want leftovers or we wanted a little cheaper bill) a chicken and cheese only taco. One of our favorite waiters said this was basically the same as the quesadilla-same quality cheese and chicken, but a smaller portion! I prefer no pico, but you can leave it as it comes if you wish! I get no cabbage on my tacos because I feel it's a little bitter for my taste, but even if I forget on accident to say it-they're still fabulous! We are regulars, and they always laugh and say "see you tomorrow!" As we leave. We will forever love our old waitress Jess who left for Panama recently, but love our other waiters and waitresses too! This place will always be special, because the first time I visited Josh in college from Birmingham, they let me sneak in the back and deliver their drinks-he was so surprised, and it was the best valentines gift ever! :)

I enjoyed the whole experience at Biera. Eating family-style is often a pain because it tends to focuses on meat-based dishes, making it difficult to find vegetarian options. This is not the case with Biera. We were able to find three fantastic dishes that were vegetarian but delicious enough to please anyone. The sourdough is as good as everyone says (the kefir butter is incredible!). By far the best thing we ordered was the Morel mushroom dish. The morels were incredibly rich and balanced beautifully with the acidity of lemon vinegar. I highly recommend it, even for those who aren't particularly fond of mushrooms.  We also tried the smoked potatoes, and the asparagus and hops shoots. 

Our server was very knowledgeable and gave us plenty of space and time to enjoy our food and experience. We were initially told by the hostess our table was reserved so we would have to finish by a certain time. (Even though I'd called ahead and was told there was plenty of room). We rushed to figure out what to order and our server let us know there were plenty of other tables available and it was important we take our time and enjoy. I really appreciated his attitude. 

Overall I would highly recommend checking this place out for a nice dinner!

Sports Clips is great!  I have been going for haircuts for several years, since they opened the first store in the Nashville area.  For a guy, what's not to love?

1. They have several TVs showing only ESPN or some other sports program.
2. They are quick and know how to cut men's hair.
3. They offer the MVP haircut which includes a cut, wash, hot towel for your face and a shoulder massage for only $23.

95% of the time you are going to get a consistent cut from all of the friendly employees who work there.  Every now and then, someone will not cut it to your instructions which is really annoying.  I like my hair cut very short, and you would think that would be easy for most in this business.  However, I have had the most difficult time over the years getting a consistent cut.  I also like the convenience of dropping in at any of their area locations without a reservation and getting a cut within 15 - 30 minutes.  Sports clips is a great concept with great service.  They are almost 5 stars, more like 4.5 in my book!
Great lo mein and sweet potato appetizer! Yum.

This is the only place I take my daughter that I actually wish for a lease. It is soooo easy to lose your little one if you aren't careful- and that's pretty scary when there are sooo many  people everywhere. 

Make sure to make it to the 3rd floor for the electro-thingy that makes your hair stand on end:  it's the best part!

PS Fridays after 5pm are free!

My daughter and I ordered the large Mississippian and got nearly three yummy meals out of it!  The foundation of this pie was a thin crust that was fired to a well done char and paired beautifully with the sweet sticky BBQ sauce.  Somehow the melted mozzarella & pepper jack had the perfect chemistry to pull this pie together with two chicken toppings (pulled & grilled) and tasty gems of smoked bacon.  Leftovers were most welcome and left us longing for even more!

Went here for a midnight snack - VERY impressed with the service!! Delicious food, fresh and made to order. I ordered the peanut butter cup pancakes and there was so difference between the taste at midnight and at 9 in the morning. Waiter was attentive and respectful. Always came over for a refill and checked in on me.. Surprisingly decent experience!

Great Frozen Drinks, convenient location...I am a regular and will keep going back, only downside is crappy lighting and questionable food, but they are doing a great job in their main business which is frozen drinks

This review is specifically for Karen in the hair salon. The day before my color appointment with Karen I went to a very highly rated salon for a bayalage. I left the salon with four inches of near-black dyed roots and the remainder of my hair a light orange. This was a Saturday, late afternoon, and I was leaving on a business trip the following Monday morning. Ulta was the only salon open on Sunday and I got an appointment with Karen (thanks to previous reviewer Nicole for the positive review of Karen's work, I felt hopeful and more confident because of it). When Karen saw my hair she immediately told me not to worry, that she was going to fix everything and it would look a thousand times better. She was wrong - it looks a million times better! She foiled my hair using a technique I've never seen before and then used a different dye on the hair outside the foils. She used two different glazes as well. What I really liked was that she never once made a disparaging remark about the other salon or colorist - very professional. She was super friendly, too. But my hair - it's gorgeous! I've gotten so many compliments on the color. When I tell them it's a correction and show them the "before" pictures they can't believe that A) someone was able to fix it, and B) fix it so incredibly. Karen worked some serious magic on my hair!

Very approachable for the uninitiated Nicaraguan diner (me). Owner(?) was very friendly and helpful with menu orientation.  Sampler platter that I had was perfect to try a variety of things. Plenty of food and reasonable price. Small, casual, and clean - order at the counter.

So, how many servers are serving my table? First time here and most likely last time.  We had to hunt down a few different people to get things straight. 1. They have cookies and ice cream for desserts. I asked if they could put the cookies in the oven for a bit to make it soft to eat with the ice cream. Like a Palooza. That didn't happen. 2. There's 2 adults and one child. But why did I only get one spoon when we specially told them we were gonna share it. 
Someone brought out two spoons and they were filthy. The cookies were still room temperature. Bc it was. Baked in the am. So I polished my utensils. I kindly asked for a cup of hot water so I can polish my own utensils. But he insisted that he did it. But what difference does that make. I'll post a picture of two spoons. And you'll see how unsanitary this place is.

The Eagle is becoming a regular go to for us when we have friends out for lunch. Good solid comfort food served in generous portions by pleasant staff. This is a formula which works and I hope they are here for a good long time. We usually have to walk a short distance but that is a function of most places on Mass. Ave. and you can't fault them on being popular in a popular location. If you have not gone for their chicken or their mac 'n cheese, do yourself a favor and try them.
Turkish coffee waa good but lacking cardamom. The kibbe, and bocha were amazing appetizers full of exotic flavor. The lamb shank for dinner was very tender and cooked perfectly

Hits the spot after drinking all night. The actual place is inside of Erin Rose in the way back. Very tight space. Anyway, ordered the pork belly po boy and it was pretty damn good. It could've used more veggies for my taste but delicious regardless. Add some hot sauce because why not. I'd recommend if you're looking for an alternative to traditional po boys.
Wow is all I can say.  Any burger offered here is top notch quality and flavor.  You can't go wrong with any choice.  Expect to shell out a few bucks for a meal, but it is well worth it.

My husband gave me a gift certificate for Mother's Day this year and I had a brilliant idea to redeem it during our anniversary weekend. I was a bit nervous about going because my husband complained that they were snooty at the desk when he purchased the GC and I braced myself to bear it. 
My first treatment was a Swedish massage and I was introduced to Monika. After a brief exchange about pressure and focus areas, she got right to work and I WAS IN HEAVEN. I am not a massage-receiving novice, and I was amazed. I don't know any other way to describe this experience except, wow! Sadly, the hour passed much sooner than I hoped, and I was excused to dress and go to my next treatment.

I met Brandy, my nail technician, and she led me to the nail spa suite. For the next 2 and a half hours my hands were shellacked and my toes were polished. All while making conversation with the adorable girl that was pampering my hands and feet. I've never felt more comfortable and at home in any other salon. Unfortunately my budget can only regularly afford a more sweat shop style nail experience with technicians that don't speak english. 

Overall, I cannot wait till my husband has another excuse to buy me a GC for here. I'm sad that I can't financially visit this spa more often. I never experienced the snootiness that my husband described, in fact, when I mentioned it to Brandy, she said certain people don't work there anymore! If I could give more than 5 stars, I would!
Fresh made south philly style italian food.  Excellent and friendly service.  A very delicious meal and nice ambience.  In a little old shopping center, but actually worth a bit of travel.

Absolutely loved this place!
My husband and I, as well as our children fell in love with this place. 
Their exhibits were a lot of fun, and they also had a lot of interactive stations, where you could touch fossils, and live creatures. They also had a theater where you sat, and they had special presentations with live animals. There was also an activity area for children as well. 
My kids are begging me for another trip, and soon!

I would like to provide you with some criticism from my experience during lunch recently.

We arrived and were seated quickly since no-one else was there. However, the placements of your tables is weird. The light fixtures are not above the tables, rather they are scattered, or in our case, above one of our guests head. This was not very pleasant. This would have been an easy fix if the restaurant management had put some thought into it.

There were two waiters, one male doing the activities of a bus boy and a female who was taking the orders.  Neither could speak English well. 

The female waitresses grasp of the English language was nonexistant. She was unable any question we had. The menu does not give description of the dishes and that is terrible. When one comes to eat a different cuisine, we want to know what we will get. She was unable to answer any and all of our questions. One of the female managers came to answer questions, but even she did not have any idea. She said she would have to go ask the kitchen. 

When the food came out, it was flavorful, however, there were issues with how close they serve the food. 

We had ordered spring rolls. Literally one minute after that came our soups. And again, literally 2 minutes after that came our entrees. This was terrible. The restaurant was completely empty therefore no rush. By the time we got to eat our entrees, they were all cold. The staff should be watching to see when we were close to finishing our entrees. Your waitress did see that we were not even close to finishing the soup she had delivered a minute before, but stacked up the food in the front of the table.

When we were leaving, there was no one at the front. We had looked to give some criticism, and waited about 2-3 minutes before we left. We just left. Also the service was very slow after we received our meal. 

Their menu emulates that of Hunan Dynasty which is a local chain throughout the Philadelphia Area. I would go there instead, or go to Margret Kuo's in Wayne. The service is much much better at those places.

Beautiful architecture sets this building out from the surrounding ones. It is huge & you can see it from a distance. We didn't have time to go in, but certainly enjoyed the beauty of it. I'm sure the inside is just as gorgeous & wouldn't disappoint.

Killer Po Boys was a nice stop, but I'm not going more than 3 stars. The food was tasty, but not exceptional. The price was expected on Bourbon Street. Erin Rose was tiny and authentic. Overall, i enjoyed my experience in the bar, but didn't walk away feeling like it was something to write home about. 

We got both the Shrimp and Meatloaf po boys. I'd recommend the meatloaf, as it was unique and well flavored. I've had better Shrimp Po Boys in other New Orleans spots.  This place is a great diversion if you're looking for something other than slushies and bad pizza.  It's also a good spot to impress out-of-towners looking for a more unique experience. Other than that, I wouldn't go out of my way to return a second time.

Came here yesterday for dinner for the first time. Went threw the drivethru so it took awhile to get our food. But it was totally worth it. I got the fish and chicken combo and my boyfriend got the rib and chicken combo. Both were delicious. The mac n cheese was creamy and cheesy. Spot on. The potato salad my boyfriend got had sweet relish in it which he normally doesn't like but he ate it anyway. Will definitely be coming back. The portion is perfect. The chicken and fish was battered and fried to perfection.  Will recommend coming here to anyone.

Alright, I have been coming here from the start. I live close by and I was here from the time it opened. In that time, relationships were forged from a customer/provider aspect and I can say I never had a bad experience. Not once. I may be biased, or, I may be more easy going than some of the other folks that posted unfavorable reviews and have a stick up their asses. Some people would give a bad review to Gordon Ramsay just because they are full of piss and vinegar and love to say negative stuff on Yelp.

I expect to wait an hour for a table on a Friday night, I expect to wait longer for a drink on a Saturday when Cinder bar has people in every bar seat and at every table. If YOU don't, you're an idiot. That is the name of the game when the establishment you want to visit is doing things right. This establishment IS doing things right. Kitchen staff, bar staff, wait staff, and management have always been very courteous,  professional,  and friendly to me, my family and my friends. The menu is off beat and enlightening. There isn't one like it in any place I've been locally. 

Negative reviews will come, they aren't always true. Maybe ownership should talk to customers face to face about experiences rather than going off of this site. As we all know, the internet is the place for people that don't have the balls for intelligent, face to face conversations to vent on nothing at all

Don't let poor reviews mislead you. To be fair I found this room online and paid only 74 bucks in February. At that rate it was more than we expected. Room was large and spacious. Oudated TV but plenty of channels. Beds were perfectly fine for a nights stay. I've paid way more for less in SB and would recommend the Parkside Inn. Its still walking distance to beach but not simply across the street. Bistro 1111 is one block which is attached to the Mar Monte. Here's a tip...ask for upstairs room and I wouldnt paying more than 120.00 a night in the prime season. No more than 95.00 a night in the winter months.
Don't bother. Go to Cafe du Monde. You won't regret it.

Oysters were good 
Atmosphere is like.noisy cafeteria 
Service was awful 
I got my sautéed spinach after
I was finished eating. They looked like they had barely hit the pan. 
Never got a cracker to use for my lobster. 
The stuffing for the red fish was
Mostly bread
Good hot food for a good price. Very friendly service. Great lunch specials too. The owners are very nice and helpful. Love the General Tso,s chicken an shrimp egg foo young. Try it it's good.

I hit this store up about once a week for my weekly needs. The people who work here are super friendly and it's always a treat. 

Some of my favorite TJ's items: tea tree body wash (smells so sweet), pine litter (cheaper than any other brand!), gnocchi alla sorrenta (7 minutes to cook a delicious authentic meal) and crab cakes (where else can you find two crab cakes for 3 bucks?) I just wish PA didn't have such stupid liquor laws, because we are missing out on some great wine deals here!

The other hidden gem at TJ's: the flowers. I purchased 10 bouquets to incorporate into my table settings here the day before my wedding. I absolutely love gerber daisies, and this was the spot where I found a ton of them for a very reasonable price.

Its a corporate wing chain so you know what your getting but i love their flavors so wanted to stop in.

This is the largest bdubs ive been to and the bar was open so my gf and I  sat there. The server was friendly and patience. She gets five stars.

My only real complaint is that i wanted something other than wings to share with my girlfriend so we ordered a snack plate called the "garden crasher" and the portions were pathetic. For ten dollars we got robbed. Guess thats what i get for trying to be some what healthy at a wing joint.
The lady that took my order tonight was so polite and sweet. First time going there but will definitely return!

The lost star is for it being incomplete (only goes halfway across the bay as of Jan. 2014) and because the pedestrians and young children are OUT OF CONTROL! 

Always always always verbalize when you're passing or coming up on someone, most likely they haven't seen you because they just aren't paying attention. It could save both of you from serious injury. 

If you're on a bike, park at Cypress Point Park and pick up the trail just outside the road that takes you back to the park entrance (at the entrance to the business park). The park has water, restrooms, showers, changing areas, picnic shelters, and a sandy beach. And it's all FREE! 

The first stretch of paved trail is a little rough, not unsafe just bumpy. This will take you by a couple hotels, Hogan's Beach, and Whiskey Joe's before you arrive at the main part of the trail. You are separate from the cars but do be aware of them turning when you cross the road in those few places! 

The picnic shelters are very popular with large families as is the trail itself, so be on the lookout for 3 year olds pushing doll strollers, 7 year olds on bikes, rogue grandmas veering into the opposite lane to take a photo, teenagers wearing headphones sticking their arm out to take selfies in the middle of the trail...that kind of thing. 

There's a nice HILL towards the end, a sign says it's a pier but it's more like a bridge. It's steep so work your speed up but remember...discourteous pedestrians will be stopping all over the place, taking up BOTH LANES to take photos...so be careful! 

There's wind too, so even though round trip from park to end of trail is only 14 miles, you'll probably get a pretty good workout. Enjoy the scenery because it's really pretty beautiful! Lots of different birds to check out and you might even get sprayed by some saltwater on your way back to Tampa. I'm REALLY glad this trail is here because riding in the bike lane on the road with cars flying by at 60 mph kinda freaks me out...especially with those crosswinds!

Anyone ever notice the martini glass on their sign? I drove by it for months not really looking at it and finally I see the glass. What's that about?!

Anyway....

24 hours
amazing pancakes
cheap

What more could you want?!

I went there for the first time yesterday after the movies. We ordered the "strippers" chicken and a cheese pizza. The waiter was attentive, friendly and quick! The food was really good. I will be back soon!
My family and I loved this PF Chang's! The lemongrass chicken salad was perfect and my husband's sesame chicken was amazing! We thought this location was better than any other we've been to lately.

This was my first time trying Puerto Rican food and I am so happy that I did.  First of all I have to say this place is a little hard to find.  The GPS tells you to turn onto Riverside Dr, but this does not look like a road but rather a driveway so keep your eyes open and turn just before the Burger King drive through exit.

On this visit we tried the mofongo with garlic.  Such a interesting dish with a very delicious taste.  We also tried the Cuban sandwich. This flat bread sandwich was full of flavor!  The last thing we tried was the baked chicken rice and beans.  This too was very good!  

Like everyone has said the owner is so friendly and makes you feel like your in her home having dinner.  It was such a good experience I would recommend everyone try it out!!!

Ate here last night with three friends and the husband and for the most part really enjoyed it. 

Pimento cheese spread with house made pickles and little buttery crackers (also house made) was delicious and served with country ham. Always a plus in my book.

The other appetizers were corn and crab fritters (um....could we have some crab please? The crab was just a whiff) and pigs in a blanket. The problem with those was there was too much blanket (very tasty) and not enough pig. Seems pretty simple.

The main courses we had were pork chop with collards and black eyed peas (which my friend liked), lamb pot pie, which was delicious but could've used a little more seasoning....the crust, however was fantastic. 

Finally the odd man out of the entrees. It was listed as "roast chicken." In my book that usually means a few pieces of chicken roasted with crispy skin on...or some variation on that.  This was listed as "Roast Chicken rice + pan gravy + mushrooms + buttered white bread." It had all of those things, but it was actually shredded chicken in what amounted to a risotto. That's not roast chicken in my book. It was tasty (if again under seasoned) but really not what was advertised.

I'd definitely go back for the baked goods, the sesame crusted bread served with the pot pie was really nice as were the house made crackers.

4-7 pm happy hour prices are great! 4 bucks for the Wallaby Darned drink which is one of the best drinks I've ever had. 
I went here with my husband, sister and sisters boyfriend. We actually got seated right away which rarely happens here but it took almost ten minutes to even get acknowledged! 
All three of them enjoyed the steak and crab legs which they said were amazing. They recommended them and raved about coming back for more. I had the chicken and mashed potatoes which was as good as usual. I like this location because its always got short waits and great customer service. I cant really comment on the prices because its a chain and the same everywhere. I will go back as always!

They had a broad selection. There was a nice touch in the way the napkins were arranged--like  spiral staircase. You can get two flavors in one small, piccolo size--it's kind of expensive, but it's a nice treat. Service was pleasant.

Swung by for breakfast, Robert B is the name on the receipt, young black guy working the register, was a total dick. 

It made total sense to me that the donut shop across the street had a line out the door with people sweating waiting in the heat and this place had no one inside besides my group. 

For 8 people it took over 45 minutes for some of my group to get their food.

The boudin balls were great.

The bagels are certainly some of the best I've had. On the negative side the choices of cream cheese are.....strange? Plain, strawberry, vegetarian, jalapeno onion and scallion I think? 2 standard choices 3 non-standard......where's more standard options like salmon? Curious cream cheese flavor choices. Also please PLEASE do not continue to gouge on the beverage prices - 2.75 for a coffee, 2.25 for a 20 ounce coke, and 5 dollars for your fresh squeezed orange juice? That is outrageous. It only makes me think that the person who raved in these reviews about the orange juice is a "friend of the restaurant" - 5 dollars for a small jar of juice is outrageous. I know that's where restaurants make their biggest margins but come on now.....that said the bagels are delicious and I will definitely be back (sans the coke next time) :)
Delicious gelato! Came here based on all the yelp reccomendations. I had the tiramisu and chocolate cappucino ones. Soooo so good!

We miss Vesuvio! This great location lost its allure when it changed to Little Bar. 

Without notice, the bar become cash only and changed from pub grub to over-priced not really sliders tapas. 

They also no longer have french fries or anything relaxed. It's now flashy and expensive. Not my cup of tea. :(

I've been here several times, and the food has always been great, along with good portions. The prices are decent. You'll read a few bad reviews about their horrible service, and give it a one star, but state that the food is good. I don't get that. I'm there to eat not get in the servers pants, but I will admit the service is a bit shit....ty. If your hungry want some good Greek food and decent portions, come here. Do and what I do. Don't mind the service, just eat. This place would get four stars, but the services pulls it down.

Been here twice now, one time was take out and the other was dine-in.  The tacos are definitely good, but there's nothing too special about them.  I was very unimpressed with the chips and queso.  The chips are baked tortillas that I could easily make at home, very bland.  And the queso was watery and had very little flavor--almost like they took powdered cheese that you get with Easy Mac and mixed it with some water and very little seasoning. 

The waitresses are super friendly and helpful for dine-in!  

They have a $2 taco Tuesday special, but it only applies to a chef's choice taco so you won't know what the $2 taco is until you hear the specials from the waitress. 

If you're looking for a half-decent taco this place is pretty good, but you won't have the best taco of your life here.

One of the least known fun facts about downtown Indy is that you can walk to the top of the Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument.  The monument is located at the heart of Monument Circle and contains a Civil War Museum below it.  Like most people I had no idea that there was an observation deck on the top of the Monument, until one random day my roommates and I decide to go "exploring" Indy.  We were completely sold when we read that we could walk to the top of the Monument- FOR FREE!  After climbing up 330 steps (which I dubbed my workout for the day, or week) we finally stepped onto the observation deck, and man was it worth the climb!  The bird's eye view of the city was breathtaking.

The Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument is truly Indianapolis' own Sears (now called Willis) Tower!

I loved coming here to get my hair cut and colored. Abby does an AH-MAZING job at bayalage and ombré. She really listened to exactly what I wanted and gave me exactly what I was asking for. I'm back in Colorado now and have yet to find someone like Abby!
I went there during the weekday at 6PM, it was pretty crowded, there were no open stools at the bar, so my friend had to stand almost the entire time we were there. Great beer selection.

Philly cream cheese gelato.  That should be all I leave for my review.  Seriously.  So. Good. The decor of the shop is so cool! Cozy and modern. Definitely has a small town feel with all of the little kid  drawings on the wall and donation  jar for the Lansdowne theatre. I can't wait to go again. They have water ice, gelato,  soft serve,  pops, shakes and gelato cakes! I want to try everything! !!

So glad we decided to have dinner here! Starting with the great bread, calamari app, and the main dishes, the food was fresh, hot, and exquisite. We went traditional; I had the shrimp broccoli fettuccine Alfredo and he had the lasagna. Both excellent! Portions were huge (I would have preferred smaller as I could not take it home), but this is generally a plus for most. The price is very reasonable and the atmosphere was romantic and inviting. Next time I am in Tampa I will certainly stop in again!

Delicious food, great service and the ambiance is warm and festive (and it's very clean-YAY).   We've been twice in three days and will go back soon.  Their tortilla soup is yummy, not too thick and not to thin-just right, especially on a cold day.  The carnitas tacos are delicious and they sort of crisp up the outer shell just enough to add texture and flavor-Yum!  The fish tacos are filled with a generous piece of fish coated with a nice crunch and the chili relleno burrito is spicy and flavorful.  Can't wait to try the other items on their menu, though it's going to be hard not to get the soup each and every time!

Pretty good burgers, but one of the best things about this place is the made in house ketchup. They make everything in there which makes it unique. 
Gets crowded so call ahead. 
Bartender we had was terrible, but if you stay away from him you'll enjoy yourself.

We had a good experience.  I was driving  and tired so I pulled in quickly and we got a late night dinner.  My friends husband had the Monte Cristo, which  he really liked,  I had a meatball sub which was good, my husband had a philly cheese steak which he really liked.  I can't remember what my other friend got but she wanted to come  back for breakfast the next morning.  Service was normal.  Had to listen to the waitress chat about  Twighlight, but other than that we liked it.

Just got back from my first trip of the season to Bobbie's Dairy Dip. New owner, but the food and shakes are just as good. They've also added some more outdoor seating which is great.

Is it a little slow? Yeah, there's only one line to take orders. And every time I go there are several people there ahead of me. The burger took about 10 minutes to come out. I know the Scene just did an issue on the best burgers. Bobbie's still has one of the best in my opinion. And they still have those great 'Belgian' fries to go with it -- or, just as good, sweet potato fries!

I was also pleasantly surprised by a walnut milkshake. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was Bobbie's awesome ice cream with real walnuts in it! Great stuff. 

Bobbie's is a wonderful place to have in the neighborhood. Take kids, take your parents, take a date...everybody will love the ice cream.

Was just here for the 1st time. Staff were friendly but my son's order was completely wrong. Since he's a toddler,  I let them know, but let him eat it (didn't want a hungry cranky toddler waiting for another breakfast). They gave us a casual "sorry" but still charged us for the incorrect breakfast. They did apologize & correct this when it was pointed out.

I found the portions small for the price & average food. I was disappointed & was still hungry after I ate all of my breakfast.

By far the best mexican food in Santa Barbara.  My girlfriend and I went there Sept 6 and ordered 7 plates of food for about $30.  They have something for everyone.  I do have to correct some of the other reviewers.  This style of Mexican food comes from the "poorer" side of Mexico.  They tend to use a lot of vegetables and fish because its cheap to grow and harvest.  I recommend this  to restaurant everyone.  This is authentic Mexican Food!!!

Actually, this place is open. At least people were in a physical store buying beads as of June 2018. I did hear one of the employees say the building was being sold, but the store apparently is still operating.

Nice small store with very helpful staff. Muffin tins available to sort out different beads you pick up and as they are priced differently. 

They can assist you with necklaces or inexpensive jewelry that needs to be restrung.

So this is my 2nd visit and really only went here because my friend had a gift card to use. Now, read this with a grain of salt because I went here unsure of what I could have because I cannot have sugar, gluten, or dairy right now. My 1st visit would have been 3 stars because it didn't wow me, but it didn't really make me think I needed to ever go back either. 

So I ordered the steak, it typically comes with mashed potatoes and broccoli with bread crumbs. I asked if I could switch the asparagus with the mashed potatoes and was told it would be a $1.00 upgrade fee...okay...didn't make sense to me since a side of asparagus was the same price as a side of mashed potatoes in the menu. Whatever, decided to not get the asparagus since I ate a ton of veggies at lunch. I ordered my steak medium...was told it had to be medium well or medium rare because there was no medium. Okay, did medium well because in the past when I get medium rare at places it's way too bloody. 

Okay, bread and oil comes. I do not have any. My friend does...and is unimpressed. Says I'm not missing much and she doesn't even really touch the oil after the first taste because it's just not a good grade of dipping oil. I dipped a spoon in and tried a bit and pulled a nasty face at the taste. 

Well, we only have a faint hope for the meal is good at this point. 

My steak comes...burnt around the edges, and a very sad little pile of broccoli next to it. Steak was well done. Okay, I could have sent it back, but I'm not a send back person, sorry, I just don't trust people. You had your chance when you sent me the food. So, steak is...okay, not amazing, just okay, not what I wanted, just okay, I could eat it. Broccoli...just bad, no flavor, did not eat it. I blame veggies cooked like that for people saying they don't like vegetables. 

My friend ordered the chicken marsala. She said chicken was just okay and the mushrooms, but the potatoes and green beans were funky. potatoes...don't know how they were cooked, just tasted wrong. Green beans seemed old and were overcooked, shriveled, and burnt. She did not finish hers. 

Sooo yep, had we not had the gift card, we would have asked for our money back and just left a few bites in.

Maybe their pasta is good. But if you are gonna have just one steak dish that's almost $20, it better be good and it just wasn't. 

Will never visit a bertucci's again. I seriously think olive garden may even be better, yep, I said olive garden. 

Just nothing impressive or unique to this place, lack luster Italian that really isn't good.

Shame on me, I waited 6 months to exchange a belt that was a gift due to the wrong size.  The  sales associates were super accommodating, helping dig thru inventory to find the same belt in a different size.  They didn't even bat an eye at the expired receipt.  Great quality clothing, but an even better team in the store!

WHAT THE HELL?  

They changed their fries!  For the love of Elvis, why why WHY WHY?  They had the best fries in the world-- meaty, hearty steak fries that were absolute golden potatoey perfection, and now they have those lame, gross, farking ubiquitous double-battered fries.  Ninja, PLEASE.  If I wanted your lame-ass TGIFries I'd... well... no I wouldn't because I don't want those damn fries. 

That's it.  

The world is a very different place now.

I am cold, hungry and scared.

(They still get 3 stars because Jamie is the best waitress ever.  Visit her late weekend nights.)
OH TO THE MG!!! absolutely amazing Seafood and Hanna is an incredible server...but... the best was the Chilean Sea Bass ...off the charts! A must visit when in Reno and if you  SEAFOOD

Damn if I could I would give this place 7 stars this place is fantastic. They always remember my name, they are so nice and welcoming. I am so impressed. I had the best massage and facial today. My therapist for my massage was so thorough she found every knot and sore spot. You get to pick any scent of massage oil and it doesn't extra. The beds are extra wide and sooooo warm. All the little touches where fantastic. Hot towels on my feel and back to start out. The scented candles. Wow. I finished off with the facial. My facial massage and extractions were by far the best I had in the city. She got every blemish and it didn't hurt. I was fighting so far not to fall asleep because I wanted to enjoy every minute of it. At the end she offered me a mimosa. Perfect end to a perfect day!

Although I live nearby, I've not dined at Liberty Union before. When they first opened I determined, after an online perusal of the menu, to pass on the opportunity. The prices were simply outrageous. Afterwards, the mixed reviews put me off. But this weekend my long suffering spouse and I happened by at an opportune time and chose to give it a try.

We were seated immediately as there were few other diners at 1:30 or so on Saturday. The seating area was pleasant, and the bar looked quite nice. We found the service cordial and were immediately offered an appetizer of Tater Tots gratis. It arrived quickly and was just fine.

I ordered the Liberty Union burger. My wife had the chicken sandwich. The burger was interesting with a bit of spinach and a fried egg. I found it rather good. My wife's sandwich included portobello mushroom and a hint of jalapeño. It too was good, although it would have benefited from more than a hint of the noble pepper.

We ordered Captain Crunch chicken fingers to go, barely managing not to feel silly while doing so. They were, not surprisingly, a bit sweet and also a trifle overdone.

All considered a tolerable place, although even with the reduced pricing it's not a great value. It has all the atmosphere of a Ruby Tuesday, Chili's or other chain restaurant. A TGIF, perhaps, in search of a franchise.
We had the veggie Reggie with a side salad and pesto vinegarette dressing. Everything was so yummy and fresh. I should have taken a picture of how beautiful the pizza looked.

Frequent this bar enough and you will start to get to know the staff, who rock! I go a couple times a week, and love to go on Sunday's for their Bloody Mary. If you're wondering what a 4th Ave Tucson bar is like.. this is your golden ticket. It's definitely not upscale, but they do have a stage out back where you can catch live music. They also do live music inside in front as well on Saturday's usually. 

One of my favorite things about this bar is the prices. They pour a good drink and do not overcharge you. They place great music at night and the patio is always a fun place to hang out. It's one of my favorite places to hang out just for the casual atmosphere.

Mandarin is on speed-dial in my phone (at least the iPhone equivalent of speed-dial). They are my neighborhood Chinese place. I love their chicken with eggplant, and the lady who works there is so sweet.

They have a bunch of tables, but it seems most people do take-out, so if you decide to eat in, you pretty much have the place to yourself. No waiting!

Decent food, we ordered the white cheese dip and it was amazing. Margaritas were amazing also. For my meal, I had spinach enchiladas. They were just ok, there was too much oil so it ran out of the enchiladas.  The rice and beans were really good. My kids had cheese enchiladas which were ok, not amazing. My husband ordered a burrito which he said was delicious. We will probably go back even though we don't eat out often. I'll order a different main dish. 

The staff was very friendly and they were great with my kids.

Very nice canal side dining venue with great night time views.  many choices for seating inside or out and music to boot.
The menu isn't extensive  but there are good choices for different tastes. A separate  sushi  list as well.
The bottle wine selection  was good and the prices very reasonable.
Good for any dinner including date night.
Will be going again.
P.S. free  two hour parking im the garage  with validation.

We used the banquet room here for an event that they catered. We loved it! the staff was very accommodating, the food was wonderful, and the facility was beautiful. The view overlooking the pool area was very fitting for our event. We couldn't have asked for a better experience! We don't golf so we can't attest to that but everything else about the evening was perfect. We will be back! Thanks for being our host!

Because of the Marathon I knew I couldn't get over to south street for Jim's cheesesteak. So I opted for Carmen's because it was the closest place to my hotel. I had been to reading terminal market the day before & couldn't get over how long the line was so I thought it had to be good! Yeah no. It's more hype than anything else. Honestly the cheesesteak was anemic in flavor. I asked for cheez whiz on it & barely got any. The steak itself was bland even with the addition of mushrooms & peppers which by the way were almost nonexistent. The bread was fresh & warm. Service was quick & friendly. No place to sit. Had to take it to go & sit in back of terminal market.  I ate half, picked at the bread on the other half & called it quits. I should've waited until the roads were open to go to Jim's. Lesson learned.

Our server was great, friendly, happy, and attentive without being overbearing.  The decor is romantic and fresh.  The food was average at best.  We started our dining experience with oil stained menus.  We ordered the calamari as an appetizer.  The sauce tasted homemade, but the calamari didn't.  The flavor was good, but needed something like hot peppers to add a little spice and flavor to mix well with the sauce.  I ordered the shrimp scampi for dinner.  The dish was bland and the shrimp overcooked.  My wife ordered the Penne Amalfi.  It was bland, but OK.  Expected more flavor.  The restaurant was nearly empty on a Saturday night, a sign there's a problem.  It is a BYOB and there is a liquor store right next door if you forget to bring from home.  My wife saw an employee bringing in an Oreo cake in a ShopRite bag.  Oreo cake was on the menu.  There is huge potential with this restaurant.  It has a great staff and a great atmosphere.  It needs a Gordon Ramsey Kitchen Nightmares intervention to improve the quality of food and it could be a real neighborhood hot spot.

My friend had made reservations here because it seemed to be the hot new restaurant in town.  Before going I happened to read some Yelp reviews and boy did it scare me.  Many talked about the slow service and small portions of food and how the food didn't taste great.  However, after going I am writing to report that it seems that the management has taken the comments seriously and has, at least for my dining experience, fixed them.  Our waitress was very attentive and considerate.  Our food arrived quickly without much wait and the food was good and decently sized.  I think people may be expecting huge portions but they clearly told us ahead of time that this was a tapas type place.  I ordered the lentils, a potato dish, a cheese course, and the "Mac and cheese" (okay, so what.  I had a craving!) and a beer (for three bucks!) and I was full.  That came out to be around 26 bucks.  The three course meal my  friends got was 30 bucks and the food was good and they felt full afterwards.  Everyone was satisfied with their meal and the desserts were delicious!  Long story short:  If you know that this place is set up like a tapa restaurant, you will be fine.  Hopefully, they will continue to improve as I think they already have done based on previous yelp reviews.  

What my ratings mean:
1 star: Horrible.  I'm annoyed I wasted my time and/or money here.
2 star: Not bad but nothing special.  A decent place if you can't find something else.  I'd equate this to something like McDonald's.
3 star:  I enjoyed my experience there and would go back to try or do more things there.
4 star:  I loved it and would be excited to go back. I'd also recommend it to a friend.
5 star:  A real gem of a place.  A must on anyone's list.

Rosati's Pizza in Madison, WI is our favorite pizza spot during the summer while we are back there. However, after reading the reviews on the Oro Valley location, I was skeptical. We went in on a Friday night and it was very busy. We went to the bar and were quickly served a drink and then were seated in a booth after 10 to 15 minutes. The waitress was great, our order was taken quickly and the salads and pizza arrived in very short order. And the pizza was fantastic! We had no complaints about our experience and will go back many more times. My guess is they just took a bit of time to get up and running smoothly. Highly recommended!!

If I could I would give this place zero stars.  I was at this place for only 10 Minutes.. 

I was on a road trip cross country. It was getting late and we just needed a cheap place to sleep. We chose this Knights Inn at $50 a night. 

We arrive and pay. Go to the room and felt like something was off about the place. I pulled the sheets back and there were stains on them. 

The metal security latch to protect the door from opening looked like it had been jammed open by excessive force and a tool of some sort. 

There was a women a few doors down who insisted on knowing what room I was in when it was none of her business. 

While down at the car grabbing my stuff I heard a violent domestic dispute going on in the room above while I was simultaneously followed by a suspicious man to my room. When I looked at him he shifted his gaze and tried to act like he was lost. 

All of this these things added up in my head to get the hell out of here if you value your life. I went back to the front and asked for my money back. The woman told me she can't give refunds and to contact her manager, she gave me a business card with his name on it. 

I called early that next morning asked for the manager by name and was told he no longer worked there. When I asked for the person I was speaking withs name he refused it and hung up on me. 

I was there 10 minutes. I didn't use the room and had to buy a second hotel room down the street for more $.  Avoid this place if you value your sanity and your safety.

Not bad for the price.  The tacos were fresh and the gentleman who took my order was very nice.  I was surprised that they were open till midnight.

I just moved the area, and my roommate told me about them.  I had the steak tacos, fully loaded with cilantro, onions, & lime.  He also gave me a side of cilantro.  3 loaded tacos for 6$!  

The area seems a bit sketchy but it cant really be helped.  I would recommend it.

I have been to Parc for lunch and dinner a few times and have always had a great experience. I highly recommend sitting outside if your are in the mood to just relax, gaze into the park, people watch, enjoy excellent food and great service. My most recent visit was on 5-16-15 and I had the recommended lamb shank and it was absolutely wonderful. The goat cheese polenta really takes the dish to the next level. Great service with the right amount of attention while sitting outside and enjoying the beautiful weather!
Great selection! The owner was very helpful and knowledgeable. It is always nice to meet someone passionate about beer!

I love it here. I've never once had something marginal to eat. Not a big drinker but the strawberry mojito is delicious. My husband and friends that enjoy craft beers like the variety they have. I always try to order more and leave with leftovers because the food is fresh and tastes great later too.

Great beer. Great food. The service leaves much to be desired. We've been there a handful of times and each time we notice that a few members of the waitstaff need serious retraining. On more than one occasion, our waitress has walked away from our table when we are mid-sentence. Then we wait a long time for her to return, only to have to repeat ourselves because she has forgotten what we wanted. The wait for food is long and for some reason, so is the wait for beer and other beverages - even if you sit next to the bar. It's a shame because the food and beer is very good, but i dread having to deal with the service.

Excellent Downtown Place For Dinner & Drinks! Very Chill & Relaxing Atmosphere. The Menu is Awesome! The Specials Are Great & Let's not forget Sunday Brunch. The Owners are there daily to make sure the customers are happy & satisfied.

My wife and I decided to stop down here the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend for an early dinner.   From start to finish, I was very happy.

We started out with the Blue Hill Bay Mussels, they were large and delicious with the garlic and butter broth.  

The crab cakes are simply amazing.  I am usually not a fan of mango anything, but the mango tartar sauce was a great compliment.  As other reviews have noted, the Yukon Gold mashed potatoes are unbelievable...some of the best I've had.  And the asparagus was delicious as well (despite the inevitable after effects).  

The price really isn't that unreasonable, compared to other places.  Decor was fabulous, and the location on Rittenhouse Square is a bonus.  Recommend!

As much as I love this restaurant, I had to give them three stars because of the length of service. Servers are very nice and helpful ( usually the same guy), but the food takes forever. The first time I went, I had no problem having a long lunch because I had nowhere to be, but the last time I went, I did, and I kept looking at my clock thinking I was going to be late. Not the place to go if you're in a hurry (they weren't even busy...there were five other people in the restaurant).

Food is great, nothing totally memorable, but I always go with the specials. They always seem to be a step above what's on the menu. 

And of course...go for the ice cream! Best place in town.

Yards Brewings' focus is on giving the customer a complete experience with great views of the brewery and operations and lots of space for gathering, pre/post tour and just anytime. There are activities in the shared space (shuffleboard and pool) and they have added seating space over the years outside of the bar area.

Quality of everything is good, have all beers on draft as well as whatever seasonals are current. Service is good and food is limited, simple but very well done.

Service is limited as it is mostly self serve and self order at the bar, but the bartenders and other staff are very helpful.

Selection of food and beer is good. Obviously all the yards standards plus seasonals. basic food, sandwiches, etc.

Menu for food was small and basic but everything we have had the many times we have been here was very good; nice sandwiches, great bread from spent grains and nice mix of locally based eats.

Value of the beer is very reasonable compared to other breweries and nearby bottle shops;  food prices are reasonable

Went into the restaurant on the recommendation of our Airbnb host for the happy hour specials ( which are in the bar only by the way). Ended up sitting in the restaurant so everything was full price. 

The food was a mixed bag. My husband ordered the New England clam chowder which he enjoyed but the Caesar Salad was just okay. There was not a bite to the Caesar dressing as on would expect.  I ordered off the appetizer menu. The calamari was tasty but a little tough. The salmon cakes were mushy and bland so the waitress replaced them with fish ceviche. The ceviche was perhaps the worst I have ever had. I was really disappointed. The best thing I had were the fried Brussels sprouts. They were perfectly caramelized tossed with a light vinaigrette. The pickled green beans in my Bloody Mary were also really good. 

I wouldn't go back.

Small place but good food. Staff seemed to just be going through the motions, you work for tips, you should at least smile and try to feign customer service. I will say I was a little disappointed in the amount of pork I got on my nachos. I estimate I got enough meat to cover maybe 50% of the chips I got. I didn't come there for chips and cheese.  The bacon bourbon pecan cheesecake was fabulous as was the corn casserole. Their brisket and pork were also very good, I just wish the meals had come with a bit more of it. I came from Memphis where my #1 BBQ place never left you wanting for more meat and still didn't empty your wallet.

BEWARE!!!! Don't go here. If I could I would give this place negative stars. I went in and had my screen replaced by this company 3 different times. Each time I left the screen would work for a few minutes then stop. They told me it was the software on the phone so I reset the entire phone as directed, this didn't work. So I came back and he put on what I was told was a genuine Iphone screen that was taken directly off his Iphone. Same thing happened, I asked for a refund since I had wasted so much time having them replace a screen they clearly could not replace. He refused to give me a refund and told me I would have to just keep coming back to have them replace the screen over and over again until one finally works. I finally took my phone to apple, since it was not an actual Iphone screen the sensors did not properly work, apple put a new apple screen on and it worked perfectly. I would spend the extra $50 and go to apple to have your screen repaired properly, rather than be stuck in my position and end up paying $100 more than needed to get something fixed.

I like Epic all for the wrong reasons but it is just convenient for people with kids and picky eaters that it is located next to some of the most popular spots in town. You can go here and buy a slice for your kids and head over to Bogarts/mission taco.

Whenever my family and I visit this neighborhood, we always eat at Zuzu's! It's a family-run, family-friendly business where literally everything is delicious. The owner, Adel, is kind and is always looking out for his customers' happiness. I'd highly recommend trying out this place when you're around.

I only wax during the summer months and exclusively get Brazilians, I hadn't been in since last October and wanted to get a wax for my wedding. Called to make an appt with my usual waxer and find out she moved and is no longer working there, sad because she was amazing. Anywho, got scheduled with Marcy (Marci?),went in and asked her to be careful of a new scar above my area for a cyst removal surgery I had 4 months ago, she said no problem and proceeded to begin waxing. She spreads wax all over my scar and proceeds to rip it off as usual, taking no extra precautions whatsoever. Worst pain I've ever had. The whole wax was horrible and I know that it was the skill of the waxer. Had me screaming and cursing and crying on the table to the point where I was shaking with exhaustion. I have a pretty good pain tolerance and never had this happen with any of my other waxes. One of the worst experiences of my life, and she reacted as if this was a normal experience for her. 
I used to love EWC, they were always clean and friendly and never had a problem with them until now, I am not sure I will be back, will have to think on it.

Went to this restaurant on recommendation of one of the carriage drivers touted as a true creole, Cajun Louisiana meals ...but I guess I failed to ask her how long it has been since she ate there. This was the worse meal I have had here in New Orleans...the Oyster on Brochette well it was not recognizable as was advertised on menu...the oysters were deep fried in a battar with Barbecue sauce poured over them ...all the bread served with the meal was stale and "overtoasted"...I ordered the Seafood Gumbo and well it was defiantly soupy but had a weird bloaty shrimp that didn't taste like shrimp and two thin slices of sausage as for the  Barbecue shrimp I got the appetizer portion (4 large) but they were over cooked and tasteless despite the sauce it was suppose to be in
Needless to say I would not recommend this Restaurant ....
Good food for a decent price. On 8th st in Dntn Boise where all the locals go.

In Dec 2008, I came to Dunedin for a week on a home search. I stayed at an HI Express and spoke to the night clerk there. Asked him about a bar to watch a game at and he told me Eddie's was the place to go.

Ten months later, I finally hit Eddies to see if they had a Nebraska game that was on a sports ticket. The greeter ( who turned out to be the owner) told me, "If it's on, we'll show it!" Sweet. Since that day, I spent the NFL Sundays there .I've also sampled the Buffalo Boneless Chicken Bites, the burgers, and some of the famed  "sammiches." Everyone is friendly there and service has always been great for me considering the place can get jammed. It's my neighborhood sports bar of choice.

Check out their website link above. This place is sick! And I live 6 minutes away! P

Don't take omnivores here. If you like low oil dryish food you might like it. I ordered the tofu Benedict and it was a sad, dry version of what a vegan Benedict should be. It is as if they have created "healthy" versions of all of your favorites, meaning they are no longer your favorites. I like healthy food done well, but let's not make sad imitations.

The veterinarians and vet techs really care about the animals. Everyone is very easy to work with and I have had no problems refilling prescriptions or scheduling appointments. I feel comfortable bringing and leaving my animals here. My 2 cats have both had surgeries here and we bring in our dog as well. The treatment plans are well-explained and they make sure you agree and understand before anything is done; nothing has ever been sprung on me. I see Dr. Martini and she is great! I have also seen Dr. Rasmusson and she was wonderful as well. I would highly recommend this clinic for all of your pet needs!

The service was fast. (We did not dine during peak hours though) chips (very crispy) and salsa was very yummy and probably the fav part of my whole meal. I ordered chicken flautas. They were just okay-rather dry, and nothing special. The Spanish rice was good.

They don't deserve any stars.  I've wasted countless hours this past month dealing with the lodge and their despicable crooked management.  We were falsely charged $550+ for a round of golf, even though we have never golfed a day in our life.  We have been calling and emailing the staff over and over to explain that the charges are not ours, but our complaints fall on deaf ears.  No one will talk to us or return our messages and they refuse to remove the charge.  So, now i have to waste more time to file a formal complaint with the Better Business Bureau.  Just STAY AWAY.  Customer Service means nothing to them.

I came here to get an "enhanced" smog test for my car, as my car registration address is up in the bay area.  I called this place, and a couple other of the places that offered enhanced smog testing in Santa Barbara, and GM Auto & Smog had the best price. (It was the best by five dollars, but I'll take what I can get.)

I pulled in around 11:20, and I paid the bill by 11:40.  They were friendly and quick - I wouldn't ask for anything more, so they get five stars from me.  Oh, and there's some interesting office decor, if you're the kind of person to take note of that sort of thing... it gave me a lot to look at while I waited.

What happened? My favorite breakfast place has lost it's identity. I loved coming here for the country scramble but the food quality is not what it used to be, the portion size is smaller and not the same presentation; the potatoes Anna have been replaced by an over spiced breakfast potato. Do fix what isn't broken. The only positive think from this experience was I didn't have to wait for a table. coincidence or a sign of the future of what was once a great restaurant?

Mona's is reliable and always can expect a good treat.  I love the chicken shwarma and the tahini, with some baba ganuch in there too.  The food is always fresh, and the staff are friendly.  It's not really much of a restaurant environment. More on the deli side of things.  But I usually pickup Togo anyway.  The little grocery element in the shop is nice too.
This is my favorite new restaurant in IV! I was definitely surprised at how delicious everything was. Dope sauce!

I strongly suggest trying this place out! For the price of the sushi, it's awesome. Very fresh ingredients and a trendy/modern atmosphere. They have all you can eat for $22. I recommend the avocado roll and crab puffs.
Stopped for a drink while shopping at the French Market. My wife doesn't care for horseradish and Kolin made the most awesome custom bloody Mary's for her !!!!
Murphy's was the perfect place for us to stop for lunch! Delicious fish and chips, and the scotch eggs were fantastic - try the English mustard with them if you like spice!
Great margs, friendly service and amazing food! I recommend the mango margarita, pineapple guac, pork tacos or chicken chimichangas!

Some of the best Indian food I've had in my life.  The short rib samosa was a delicious starter, although it's a little more egg roll seaming than samosa.  I had the chicken tikka for my main course and I wolfed down as much as possible.  Usually chicken tikka is a little too sweet for my taste.  However, this chicken tikka was perfectly seasoned with a slight kick and delicious sauce.  I couldn't eat enough of the sauce and soaked up the sauce with my rice.  We also shared a roti stuffed with nuts that was sweet and delicious.  It tasted like the stuffing of bahklava put into a piece of naan.  Delicious!

The ambiance is great for a date with pretty interior decorating, a nice bar at the front and a classy but casual ambiance.  The servers were attentive and friendly.  This restaurant will definitely be added to my list of regulars when I visit Philly.

Top notch guys. I brought my jeep in to get it looked at, and immediately noticed how busy and packed their shop was. This can mean one of two things: slow work OR a brand whose quality speaks for itself. Brought my jeep around 1 and despite it closing at 5 they told me that they would try and look at it. I was skeptical seeing the work load but sure enough, they called that same afternoon. Granted, the news was not the best, but like a skilled Doctor they let me down softly. Chose to forego actually getting it fixed at that time but definitely NOT due to any customer service issues. Can't grade the maintenance but can definitely grade the customer service and "pre game" atmosphere--A+!
Happy hour wings were amazing! Great food and great atmosphere. Will be back in the near future.
We ordered several dishes.  Their calamari was excellent, great clam chowder!!  And the best was the snow crab legs.   It's natural flavors shined!!
Great place for hats! I do love hats. Other cool stuff too. I was just looking for hats so didn't pay a lot of attn to the rest.

Great pizza.... Something about the crust makes it. Or maybe its the favorable cheese-to-sauce ratio. I can't quite figure it out. Also saw they use Grande cheese, which is uber expensive, top shelf cheese - it doesn't get greasy and orange like lesser cheeses get. Can't get a seat in the place at lunch time, but if you do, the cheesesteak pizza and buffalo chicken pizza are must trys. Not to heavy on the toppings so you can still appreciate the pizza. Sausage deserves honorable mention for the unique type they use. Joe's also makes decent steaks and fried items. Even had chicken parm dinners there, and while not as good as Benny's, they're less costly and plenty tasty. For a long time I avoided Joe's because they were cash only, but now they accept plastic payment methods, albeit with a $10 minimum. No delivery (sad face).

Excellent job done for my stepchildrens move! Two men showed up to my house expecting to pick up 17 items, which was WAY less than what I actually had for them to pick up. The move was set up by someone out of state who didn't know how much had to go, so not fault of Delta. I had the majority of their items packed up and was under the impression they were going to finish the rest,  however, that is not how this move was set up. Regardless, these guys helped me pack everything up and took all of the kids belongings without complaint. I was very impressed with their reaction and willingness to help out, especially on a Monday holiday. I cannot remember the names, but want to say that one may have been Will. They did an excellent job explaining all of the charges, current and pending upon delivery. Thumbs up for this portion of the move!!

It wasn't a surprise that I chose IndeBlue for my birthday meal.  This place is consistently outstanding.

I have had some pretty amazing Indian throughout my life; I've worked with an Indian coworker who actually cooked me homemade goodies (which was incredible), eaten Indian in England, Thailand and Singapore, and throughout Central Jersey and Philadelphia.  Well, IndeBlue just stands out - perhaps it's the casual dining atmosphere of Collingswood, or the array of menu items that can all be ordered from mild to spicy.  I also love that you can order the Thali, which gives you the option of a few bites of each menu item, including bread and chutneys.  This is a must if you can't decide what to order.

Well, if you didn't know, they have added an outdoor dining area, a deck right off the front of the building on Collings Ave.  We brought some champagne, and ordered a glass of mango juice to add, and it was incredible.  Don't miss the chance to try the food, even if you're intimidated by trying Indian; I got my mother and aunt to try, and they loved it!

This is one of the main places we gas up the car, mostly due to convenience. But I will say that it's usually a few cents cheaper than other places around town. Also, I've never had any problems here and have never felt unsafe.

Crab cake was good and the creme brulee for dessert was delish.  Just did not like table very small and were up against people next to us.  If they re-design the pub and have all booths instead of those dinky tables would be much nicer. Prices reflect more of an upscale restaurant when technically this is in a grocery store.  Also serve drinks in better glasses than beer mugs! Weird drinking iced tea from a beer mug.

I was blown away by this massive food hall. This place has everything you would want to eat, seriously! 
The atmosphere is kinda trendy, fixtures look sleek and modern, blacks and wood, gold, and semi industrial feel all around. 
There are many food concepts to choose from and all pretty unique! There is even a small home boutique and a flower shop.
They have a few bars with amazing cocktails and craft beer. They have multiple outdoor seating options including a courtyard and a river view section. 
Our group was large, so we sampled a bunch of items... my personal fave was the ramen!... possibly one of the best i've had!
It is definitely a really great option if you are coming with a large crowd since everyone can get what they really want to eat in one spot.

I had the luxury of grabbing brunch here with a g/f of mine over the weekend for the first time in a while, & it was just a enjoyable as I remember it.  We sat outside, people watched & made comments as though we were "Statler & Waldorf" from the Muppets while we shared several plates over the span of 2 hours.  
  I am not typically a bloody marys fan, but they are to die for here.  Perfectly balanced with a beautiful pepper kick to the face!  Some of the plates did seem small for the price point ie the poached eggs & asparagus but still good.  The beet salad was delicious, a healthy serving of beets & mixed greens.  My favorite; though simple was the parfait with mixed fruit.  The yogurt was heavy (a good heavy) with a nice array of recently harvested berries.  
  Although there seemed to be several servers & server assistants over seeing our table they failed to fulfill some simple requests we had throughout our meals; such as refilling our coffees & water, as well as getting us another basket of fresh bread for dipping purposes.

Things that are very excellent here:

1. Crawfish
2. Corn
3. Shrimp
4. Oysters
5. Potatoes
6. Sausage

It's different from crawfish at Acme cuz these are spicy. The prices are extremely reasonable and if you sit at the bar, THEY HOOK YOU UP! 

See you guys next year!

Delicious. Best BBQ I've had since moving to Florida a few years ago, blows all the sit down restaurants out of the water. My wife loved the chicken and the pulled pork was great. Will arrive earlier next time as they were out of ribs and I got the final chicken. 

 Prices were reasonable. Cash only. Arrive early or you'll run out of options.

We just had a light dinner here as it was recommended by a friend. I'm really glad we did. Our whole experience was delightful. This newly designed space is attractive and expansive. One did not feel cramped and the clean austere lines created a fine backdrop. We ordered an eclectic mix of Thai, Malay, Japanese and Chinese dishes all of which were artfully presented and quite tasty. Our waiter Devon was both attentive and efficient. One dishwasher late in arriving for which he apologize candid us the courtesy of taking it off the bill. I'm glad to see this new addition to St Petes expanding food scene.  We will be back soon and I suggest you check it out before it becomes as widely known as it should be.

We love Pei Wei and this trip was no exception. Used to live here in Indy and have frequented this location since it opened. We have since moved away, but flew in this evening. Still on California time, we didn't realize it was 5 minutes to closing, but the staff was more than happy to help us. Thank you again for the wonderful meal!

First, the good: Selection is impressive - pretty close to World of Beer. The beer menu's write-ups are thorough and descriptive, so you can make a confident choice (or try something new with characteristics you know you'll enjoy.) The live music is a blast, and there's plenty of seating (both inside and outside).

The service is pretty dang bad, however. My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday night planning on multiple rounds and a few plates to share - but our waitress made it pretty much impossible to order the first time - much less the second. Both drinks we managed to get were delivered by a server other than ours; the second time we had to point out that it had been sitting out on the bar for a solid 5 minutes. Trying to get food was a joke - we decided to just cut our losses and head elsewhere.

Wouldn't hate giving it a second shot, but with WoB so close, Brass Tap will probably be a 2nd choice considering the service.

cat in a bar how can i complain? the service is OK, food is typical bar food and they have some fun board games. definitely on the more casual side; order your food&drinks at the bar, don't expect a hostess/waiter to welcome you. the upstairs had a nice pool table  and another bar but no one was up there... safely assuming the upstairs is closed
Excellent food and service. I had the huevos rancheros which were really tasty. Bottomless cups of coffee

Very ashamed by this place. I've heard so many of my friends rave to me about the food and the vibe of this place. Love the idea of the place also! Ended up in a disappointment from the service I received....god awful. The waitress did not seem to care for how she treated customers that were "new" or didn't look to fit in with the scene. Seemed super uninterested if you were not a "regular" which I could have been if it wasn't for her. Felt like she brushed you off into the corner and wanted to just get a good tip. Didn't check up on us at all through out my meal but did for specific people she knew. Food was amazing even though the price was a little expensive for each dish but not too bad. Latte and the hibiscus iced tea was refreshing. Great flavours for sure and a great aesthetics to the place especially the front. Just wish I had a better experience from the service:/
