Just ate here with my best friend tonight. The chef's wife was our super welcoming and lovely server. The food was excellent. Highly recommend the calamari, the ribs, and jucuma ice cream. Also there was this blue corn drink that was fantastic. Definitely will go again.

Very painful experience, I went on my birthday with a group of girlfriends and hoped to recreate fun experiences in which I had in years prior but this was an epic fail. The waitress couldn't seem more uninterested in serving us. Service was slow and she was inattentive. I really enjoyed the happy hour rolls and the food in general so that's why I'm giving the two stars and returned to try again. 
I went two more times but the second time was just as bad as the first in terms of service. We waited forty minutes for a sushi as the place was not that busy. I took it a little personal this time so I won't be going back.

I try to avoid West Philly.
Tyson Bee's came to 20th and south outside of an art show my friend was in instead of their usual west philly location.
Score one for me!

I was short on cash but I needed to experience this food truck that I had heard so much about. the painting on the outside of the truck alone is enough to make my heart melt with adorableness. 

One taco is $3, I got the edamame taco. as a lover of all things that involve tacos, THIS TACO DOES NOT DISAPPOINT. I spent a good hour thinking about it after I ate it, and telling all who would listen to me go on about how it was the best taco i may have ever eaten. 

Also, they give you a playing card, I got queen of diamonds, that they shout out when your order is ready. such a cool idea!

Great experience.
I had the lunch special with chopped salad and Cacio e pepe.
My wife had kale salad and pasta bolognese. We started with the risotto balls.
The risotto balls were every bit as good as raved about. Creamy heaven.
I thought my chopped salad was perfect and the pasta al dente had great flavor. Wy wife raved about her food too.
We finished with gelato that had really nice texture and taste.
The service was very friendly and spot on pacing the courses.
I don't know what more you could expect.
This place is the real deal.

If you are seeking authentic Mexican food, this is not the place for you.  This is the best TexMex I have had. Coming from the Dallas area, if feel that I am somewhat of an authority on this genre of food. Have yet to have a bad dish. Highly recommend the fajitas.

The facilities are in disrepair and in need of a make over but this does not effect the food or the service.

Drive through today, specifically because of contributing to Carson Wentz's terrific charity - the AO1 Foundation.

My co-worker and I went - I got my usual "Chick-Fil-A Deluxe" but made it a meal (#1 specifically) so I can donate the $1.  My other co-worker benefitted from the waffle fries and Lemonade that it came with.  

Our drive thru server was very nice and chipper.  We complimented her on her special Eagles-themed tee (it really was super cute - too bad that I didn't get a pix of the back of it).

Solid joint with decent food. It's a pretty cool place that has basic offerings for food like sandwiches, mac bites, sweet potato fries, and other bar food basics.  

The moonshine list is a little disappointing, but I enjoyed the few moonshine cocktails I tried. They have 4-7 moonshines available and a list of standard drinks they can make from them. They have some solid beers on taps, though not too many, and a good amount of various liquors.  

The few times I've visited I've been surprised at how empty the inside is. Maybe it's because it's in an odd spot: it's a little too small to have the chill and eat with friends feel that Gamlins has, and isn't atmospheric enough to have the hang out vibe that Brennans has. 

Regardless, while I enjoy their drinks and their friendly staff, I'm not sure there moonshine selection is enough to make it my go-to spot.

GREAT NEIGHBORHOOD BAR!!!!

Awesome beer selection with knowledgeable and attentive bartenters. 

You gotta try the bacon cheeseburger it was amazing.
Overpriced, hotel restaurant.  Had the lobster and steak. Whole lobster with little meat. Also shocked by $4 glass of ice tea

I think this was my first cheesesteak in Philadelphia. I have tended towards sandwiches almost exclusively, but thought this would be the moment where I went full Phil. 

If you're looking for local, this hits the bulls-eye. The little shop has a couple of guys in the back, taking orders by en masse then cooking them all up at once. A small sandwich is pretty much a perfect amount - which is to say huge. I would even prefer splitting a small, that's how big they are. The hoagies are ridiculous sized; If I were going to a party, it would make perfect sense to bring one of these and ask them to cut it in quarters or eights. 

I would definitely come back for an Italian or a Jewish sandwich. Yep, the sandwich is called Jewish. Never seen that before. But I guess it's just another ethnicity, so why can't a sandwich be a Jew? 

To note: You can get on the highway pretty easily from here, so it's a good souvenir for a car ride back to NYC.  I will do this at least 2 more times before I feel comfortable truly understanding Gooey Louie's.

In a town where the average life expectency of a new restaurant is about 11 months you have to admire the staying power of a place that has been around for more than 30 years!   

When I think about why Enterprise has survived through all the upturns and downturns that have closed so many others I try to figure out why.   Is it the garlic mashed pototoes?   Is it their world famous Happy Hour?  Is it the Lobster Bisque with the puff pastry on top, or maybe that they seem to have AWESOME people working for them.    Maybe, but I don't think so.  I think it is the salt water taffy that you get when you leave.  Or maybe, just maybe it is all of the above!   

Start with a cool building, big open beam, industrial.   Put the cooks in the middle with their fire grilling the fresh fish for all to see... add a very cool bar in the front and an awsome fish tank...    Visually there is a lot going on.   With the happy hour, it is always busy and when you walk into a busy place you immediately feel confident that you picked well.   

I don't think that Enterprise is inexpensive because I usually have a small dent in my wallet when I leave, but you do feel that you are getting a deal.   Whether it is the cheap beers at happy hour or the $29 Lobster during the week (which is often shared between two people)  nobody can really say that this place is overpriced!  

So often Santa Barbara restaurants fall into two categories; tourist or local.   Enterprise bridges the gap and seems to be a favorite for both.    I always see friends in there or am asked to join someone for happy hour.    If you are a local when is the last time one of your friends said "Meet me at Eladio's"?  It just doesn't happen.   But Enterprise, Boathouse, Brophy's Arch Rock and others are solid local favorites and we hope that they all stay with us for a long time to come.
MaryAnn's is always a nice and classy experience. I always enjoy eating here. The waiters are so personable, and fun. The food is sooooo good, I'll be back.

This place is a gem!  It's one of those places the locals know about and hope word doesn't get out.  The mushroom omelet is the top prize!  Portions are large, service is usually pretty good and the prices are even better!  The only downside is that they don't take credit/debit cards, but they do have an ATM.  After your meal I dare you to pass by that ice cream counter without AT LEAST thinking about snagging yourself a cone.

Not to bad. But ibwasnt in here for long

Service: they were very kind and knowledgeable. They smiled a lot and were kind!

Environment: I really like how clean it was. It was a very unique place. It was a simple and nothing fancy. It was a large area with plenty of seating. Older feel to it  

Product: unfortunately didn't tty anything because my friend who is vegan went specifically for the vegan donuts and they were all out  we didn't want to be rude and get any while she watched us eat. 
QThat really stunk.

Went for lunch, ordered a turkey burger with avocado.  It was delicious, but was a bit pricey (just under $14) just for the burger.  Ended up spending over $20 on lunch, but it was delicious.  

This isn't a lunch place for a penny pincher like myself.  The food is great, but is priced a bit high.

Excellent service, delicious food, creative cocktails, and comfortable setting.  Would get the dipping plate and special of the day (catfish) again.  Kept my expectations low and was very pleasantly surprised.  Was there for dinner on a Wednesday night.  Our server was fantastic, I believe his name was David.  Prices are high, but the quality and taste is worth it.   Would certainly dine there again!

Stopped in at 11:30a. Not busy. Quick service by pleasant staff. This is a small store with strictly table & chair seating (no sitting area) serving the reliably consistent high quality Starbucks products. As I'm watching my diet, I had The very good Cold Brew iced coffee and low fat turkey and egg white sandwich.  I was very happy with both.

Great for basketball games unless you're above about row 25. Haven't tried the food before but from what I've seen it's pretty standard arena food and generally pricey. However, it's a great place to watch Nevada basketball!

This place has been catching my eye for the past few weeks and I finally decided to stop by and try it.

I walk in and see the special for the day is Fish tacos. I ask the cashier if she has ever tired it or heard any good reviews regarding it, in which she responds nonchalantly "I like fish. I like tacos ...but I don't know about no fish tacos" then twist her face in a nonpleasant expression. 

um. Okay.

I then ask, "well what would you recommend? This is my first time here"

She then looks at me like has better things to do than take my order. "I don't know. I like the lamb and I like the fish"

um. Okay.  

I'll take the grilled lamb gyro with rice then, please. Not even a smile or attempt to be friendly. Takes my money and hands me my change. I think to myself no wonder their tip jar is more jar than tips.

Anyways after 5 seconds of ordering my food, I hear the cooks who are preparing my food arguing over lamb gyros that need to be prepared. This argument appeared to last for about 4 minutes.

um. Okay.

Finally I receive my food by a super sweet server but unfortunately, my food is brought out dine-in prepared when I told the cashier it was to go.

So obviously their service is 2 stars at best if I want to count the nice waitress who handed me my food. 

The food was a step up from okay. Very, very lemony but I like lemon. The portion leaves much to be desired for the price but all in all the food is definitely a 3.8-4 out 5 stars. 

Will I come back? Probably since its walking distance from my job but that would be the ONLY time I came here. There are better places.

Dr. Bistline and his staff are awesome! Making an appointment is easy and their hours are phenomenal.  For my first appointment I was in and out within 45 minutes.  The wait time is minimal.  When I didn't like the first set of contacts he gave me I called to ask what my other options were and Dr. Bistline answered the phone himself - That NEVER happens! I ended up changing my mind on two different pairs and each interaction I had with the Doctor and the staff was always so pleasant.   My fiancé and I both go there and are extremely happy with the level of service they have provided us.  I have absolutely no hesitation in fully recommending Bistline Vision Care!

Positives: Communicates well, was at airport as scheduled, got us to our destination at agreed upon price.

Negatives: Went around the block several times after pulling over to consult GPS, agreed to a rear seat after some additional booking but third seat is not intended for anyone other than toddlers, vehicle not spotless as I expect private transport to be.

Summary: Honest and making an effort, but do not expect private car service comfort.

South Philly, PA
Pho base soup is bland a tad bit and not much meat like other places, so is 2 star for me. Im picky on soup bases. Service was pretty cool even for take out. 5 star. Young asian professionals type of crowd for service, unlike other pho places where they don't speak much English or tend to be more tradition crowd serving you.  Atmosphere, pretty decent. 4.25 star. Will be back for pop wings (aka Korean bonchon chicken) one day; not bad for $6. Beef cubes with stir  fried onions look interesting for my beef craving days. This might be a nice a chit chat gathering place with the girls on weekdays cus it seems like a peaceful & chic atmosphere when I went. Privacy. LOL ;-) Never drove this way and never knew this spot was even here. Thanks Yelp! However, parking might be an issue. 

 Do they have banh mi and bubble tea or anything fruity drinks here?

I just had my first experience with this company and I must say that it was truly professional! They were on time with a quoted estimated time of arrival they were clean There on time with uploaded estimated time of arrival it was clean courteous and very enjoyable personality they were courteous and very enjoyable personality. I would recommend this company to anybody anytime and I look forward to using them again in the future!

Went for Mother's Day and the service was horrible! After waiting for an hour and a half we asked for our food and it was served to us cold and warm enough that it was microwaved. My sides were just tossed on my plate and forgot one of my dishes. I don't see myself coming here in the near future and I would stay away!

I am always looking for another good spot in Ambler, as any culinary talent which may have resided on Butler Ave has seemed to dial-it-in the last few years (see Trax, Gypsy Blue, Lucky Well, Bridget's, KC's Alley, From the Boot, Etc.).  

This follow-up to the failed Massa, a Mediterranean/Spanish BYOB, did a very good job of renovating.  The entrance is now a vestibule, and not a long bowling alley entry walkway along the dining room.  The dining room is open, with table cloths and table settings welcoming you to a cozy, warm dining atmosphere. And, I enjoyed being captivated by the chandeliers. 

Speaking of captivated, the Corvina is to die for.  The seared tender white fish with roasted corn and crabmeat, a touch of truffle oil was truly a delight.  The halibut, again seared, moist and tender, with a couple tender gnocci, was a very good choice as well.  We had started with the beet salad and seafood bisque, both 3.5 to 4 star dishes.  The fruit tart, I have to remember, was it peach, was very crisp, I liked it.

Overall, I am a big fan, and looking forward to my next visit.
Lovely hotel, top-notch service, and excellent conference facilities. My room was very comfortable, well decorated, and had luxurious amenities.
Our waitress wasn't the greatest waitress I've ever experienced, but they have a pretty decent selection of beers on tap.
Had the Pho beef and boba smoothie, good service, waitress was very sweet. Good 1st time experience

Pho and more is a no-frills spot in a strip mall that doesn't disappoint. They get you in, bring your food out fast, and have some of the best Pho dishes I've ever eaten. If you have only ever had Pho, I recommend venturing towards their Bun dishes (vermicelli noodle dishes). This dish is very refreshing on a hot day when Pho might not fit the bill. 

P.S.- All of their prices are extremely affordable.

My absolute favorite restaurant in the city. I have never had a bad experience (and I've been here about 30 times, give or take). The service is always perfect, accommodating and polite. 

My favorite items on the menu are: steak tar tar, warm shrimp salad, and the baguette provencal. The lamb shank is also to die for. However you really cannot go wrong with anything here. 

On one occasion a group of four of us ordered the petite plateau (a compilation of raw oysters, clams, mussels, jumbo lump crab meat and king crab legs) and it was just absolutely delicious. Amazing. Superb. Order it!

If you're not into the fare (which I'm not quite sure how that's possible) then go just for the ambience and order a drink at the bar. Awesome cocktail menu (though pricey, as expected). Adequate beer list, most of the good stuff is offered in bottles and the more common stuff is on tap.
They deliver pretty far from my place, gulab jamin was perfect, and an usual  selection of Indian sodas, ordered a few things, but really enjoyed the tikka masala. But a little overpriced.

Fantastic and tasty. I work in the area and eat here regularly. I'm addicted to the greek wrap. I'm not a veggie but their veggie options are way too good to pass up. I'd buy their hummus by the quart. Green To Go shows just how delicious healthy can be.

Everything was delicious! The appetizers were sooo  good! We had the brie en croute,  tempura lobster tail and beet poke! I'm having a hard time choosing which one I'd pick as the best. The lobster tail and the beet poke are rivals for my first choice. I'm not usually a fan of beets, but I probably would have been able to eat the whole thing by myself! It was that good! They had me eating beets, AND loving them! Who knew?

I then had the strawberry almond salad, and my son had the chateau spinach salad. They were both delicious! The almonds on mine were bacon almonds, (can't beat bacon toasted almonds!) The spinach salad had pistachios and a dressing that was divine! 

For the main course,  I had the, herb garlic flat iron steak. It was amazing, tender, and delicious! My son had the Parisian gnocchi. It was the best I've tasted in a very long time! (Yes, I got to try everything.)

Even though I probably shouldn't have, I couldn't resist having dessert.Their Creme brulee is a no brainer, and one of my personal favorites. It was heaven! Then we tried their ice creams and sorbets. We had the pineapple-basil, rhubarb-ginger, beet, passion fruit-chili, and a melon-mint. My personal favorites were the pineapple, the rhubarb and the melon. The flavors are seasonal, so go try these while you can!

I had such a lovely evening, and there was nothing that I ate that wasn't delicious and perfectly prepared!
Their venue is gorgeous. If I were planning a wedding, this is where I'd have it!

The gentleman who served us, Gilles, was warm, friendly and very professional. I never felt rushed, and enjoyed every minute. (Not to mention, he has a lovely French accent.)
Le Coq d'Or is a fantastic dining experience that has it all, exquisite food, gorgeous ambiance,  and a wonderful staff. I highly recommend you go and experience it yourself.

The hotel is poorly managed and it's a little shabby. Someone thought it would be a good idea to bring a dog to the hotel. Then they left in in their room while they went out on the town. The dog barked like crazy all night. 
The hotel management totally did not care. I complained enough about the barking dog next door that the night manager went as far as to suggest that I was the problem. 
When I book a Hilton property, I don't expect to keep awake all night by a barking dog. At a Motel 6 maybe....but not here.
The management did nothing and I had to use tissue paper for ear plugs.
Oh...and the best part! Management put up a notice that there is sewage in the tap water and we should not brush our teeth or wash our faces with the hotel water....That's nice
Barking dogs and sewage water! That's what you get at the New Orleans Hilton Garden Inn Convention Center.

Came for brunch......I do appreciate the bottomless mimosas but this place might be understaffed for brunch. We sat at the bar with Justin. The food was WONDERFUL. Had a filet Benedict with shrimp added and cheese grits. My friend had the French toast on ciabatta bread and it was also wonderful. Service from JUSTIN was wonderful. 


Here comes my slight complaints. 

The servers were struggling to keep up the refilling of mimosa to the rest of the small restaurant. And it happened to be 52 degrees today and one of the staff has decided to prop a door open to the patio area. I didn't choose to sit outside I chose to sit INSIDE. The parking situation is good on the weekends with street and lot parking 

I'll probably come back.....not quite sure at the moment.

My family was looking forward to Greek food recently and decided to try Athens on 86. We're adventurous eaters and like to try as many locally owned restaurants as possible. When we arrived on a Saturday evening, the restaurant was not yet busy and we were seated right away.  The hostess and wait staff were friendly and helpful. We ordered the taramasalata, and it arrived with a small portion of hot pita bread.  When our server asked if we would like more, we said yes.  We found out when the check came that this was NOT included, and we were charged extra for a plate of bread.  This was never mentioned. When our dinners came, parts of my husband's sampler platter were cold. My calamari was warm, but not hot. He informed our server, who took the entire platter away from him.  A couple of minutes later, it came back steaming hot (microwave??). All of our dinners were greasy and definitely nothing special. Dinner for two adults and a pre-teen, with sodas, came to more than $75.  For that much money, we expect better. The next time we crave Greek food, we'll head to Santorini or to the Trojan Horse in Bloomington.

I can not say a single bad word about this place!!! Went there for a teenage concert last night , a boy band. Got there early stood in line. The gentleman with the megaphone phone was awesome. Very polite and willing answered all your questions. They let us go back with our daughter for the VIP section which was great!! Inside it is very cool atmosphere, they have three bars which they were blocked from the teenagers. If you had a stamp on you were aloud to go to the bars. Very cool decor going on in there. They also opened the Foundry for us parents who didn't want to hear screaming teenage girls. The setting in there is awesome. Nice lounge areas big screen TVs. Very cool place !!!

Short and simple.
GREAT wings and I am wing snob.

In the land of fast chinese take out and buffet, this was a welcome change with a very warm atmosphere.  The restaurant is pretty small.
Our food was a bit over cooked.  But, other than that, I loved it.  Will try it out again.  The serving size could have been a bit larger as well, for the price.

Great little movie theater. It feels like home, when I was a kid and would play with my friends in our garage.
The image and sound are great, the individual chairs are big and very comfortable... I will be back!

I love this place. We live in NE Philadelphia and we drove down because my sister has been going to this place since she started working in the area. This is probably our favorite Indian restaurant now. The food was so good we have my sister bring home food from there for us on the way back from work. 
I would say it's all pretty authentic. I definitely had no complaints!

Hate to say....but NOT coming back. 
I know my review will be an anomaly....but I've been here twice in two months....not a good experience either time. 
Music awesome....people that work there...not so much.....

Nuff said.

Marinka is absolutely the best realtor our family could have met. She made time for our busy schedules and always answered our phone calls. We never felt pressured or rushed in the process. Thank God she was here for our family. If you want a realtor to not look at you like a number or potential client? Then Marinka should be your realtor. Honest, trustworthy and always has your best interest at heart.

This is the Quiktrip I have most often frequented for various reasons. Those reasons include (in no particular order but numbered to ease in reading):

1. The employees are almost always very nice.
2. The store is very clean.
3. The machines for soda, shakes, and hot beverages are working 99% of the time.
4. The new kitchen-cafe section with hot sandwiches and specialty beverages whips up some good grub.
5.It is on a part of Big Bend I travel often.
6. There is a good selection of snacks
7. The roller-items (tacquitos, etc.) tend to be well-stocked on the grill.
8. It's just a pleasant place!

Those eight varied reasons are why this is arguably my favorite Quiktrip. One complaint about Quiktrip in general (but not this location) would be how the chain now only does cash for lottery. I liked it when I could pay for my fuel and Mega Millions all in one transaction, but what can you do?

Anyways, this is a good Quiktrip, check it out!

Wound up here for Sunday brunch when the wait to sit outside at Race Street Cafe was too long. 

Pros: All drinks happened to be $4 because it was their 4 year anniversary. Lots of pet friendly outdoor seating & great views of Ben. The blood orange tequila drink was strong yet tasty. 

Cons: The beer garden menu is extremely limited for both food and drinks. Ordered the lobster roll and while it wasn't the worst I've ever had, it was far from the best. The side of fries was the most exciting thing on the plate. Sad. There is no server outside. You have to get up and order your food and drinks at the food truck. 

I think the restaurant not serving their full menu outdoors is a missed opportunity. They have the outdoor space and views going for them and the place would probably be packed if you could get a full service & full menu experience out there!

My friends have been to Coquette (I have not) and they raved that the food at Sweet Olive was surprisingly better!  We dined at Sweet Olive on a slow Sunday night last week and were excited to try Michael Stoltzfus's next venture.

The ambiance was very cool.  It was dimly lit with a few different hues that made the environment very soothing.

We started off with a pickle plate, which was amazing.  It's a must order to start the meal!  The way that the chef pickled the items on the dish tasted amazing.  We also ordered the Louisiana Crab meat and Grilled Oysters.  Both were exquisite and a great way to start the meal

For my entree, I ordered the Rabbit.  My dish was amazing!  The pairing of the ham with rabbit played deliciously with the jambalaya, which it accompanied.  From around the table, I also heard that the Ossabaw Pork was amazing as well.

Our only complaint was the service.  I understand that the restaurant just opened, but the wait staff was not knowledgeable about what some of the listed ingredients on the menu and some drinks were made incorrectly.  Our drinks were quickly remade and we did receive answers to our questions after our server checked with the kitchen staff.  The food, however, was out of the world so it easily eclipsed and shortcomings in the service department.
I asked my wife to marry me at the speedway and she said YES!!!! We have been married for 9 years and counting!!!!!

Exactly as i'd expected: solid meal all the way arround and more expensive than I ever prefer.

But alas, NO PHILA RESTAURANTS ARE OPEN ON MONDAY!  What gives?

So, monday is Garces/Starr night...

About the food: very good if not a tad too salty. But that probably has more to do with the particular chef's hand movements that evening than anything else.

About the wine: well, paying $10/glass for a $12 bottle of wine is upsetting, but it was very good wine for the meal and i'd never have found the winery if it wasnt on the menu.

WARNING: the cushin seats sink far; seat yourselves accordingly...


so, i wanted to do 4 stars, but this is more of a 3.49... so with the rounding...
The new location is absolutely gorgeous and serves the same amazing cakes and cookies as the original. Hazelnut cake is still a favorite here. Also try the Rum Cake...very flavorful!

Bobby's Dairy Dip is an iconic Nashville institution known for burgers and ice cream.  The place is full of nostalgia.  As you wait in line, you can just imagine the popularity this placed experienced in the 1950's and 1960's when drive up's were at their peak of popularity.

When we arrived, there were about 50 people in line ahead of us. The line moved quickly, as most people were just ordering ice cream. The service for ice cream is pretty quick.  If you order food when the place is busy, be prepared to wait. 

We had 5 people in our group, all ordering burgers and shakes.  We had to wait about 45 minutes before our meal was ready.  At one point, they closed the window and stopped receiving orders for about 10 minutes to allow the kitchen to catch up. While some seem to be turned off by the service, I think its just a nuance that adds to the character of a place with such history.

All of the ice creams are perfect.  My burger was a little dense, but overall really good. 

This is a place that everyone in Nashville must try at least once.

The studio is convenient location right on capitol and main street.  Ambience is great, definitely lots of fengshui going on.  the staff are experts.  Most painless brazilians especially for the price.  And Lumi is amazing!

The bomb is the bomb. Their prices are somewhat dear (expensive) in my opinion but they are generous with their portions. Normally I'd be mad paying $37 for 2 poboys but they really were absolutely fantastic. All we had were the bomb poboy. I would go back and would pay again but I wouldn't mind a coupon for certain.

Our vehicle was stolen - We stayed at the Hilton Airport Hotel and paid to leave our vehicle in long term parking while we flew to Colorado. This is a service they offer in a gated lot. Upon our return, we found that out vehicle had been stolen. The front desk attendants asked if we were sure that we'd left it at their hotel and said they couldn't see how something like this could have happened. We called the police who spoke to the security guard at the hotel. Apparently this has happened before and there are no security cameras in the area of the lot where our vehicle was parked. We have spoken directly to the employees at the Hilton as well as Hilton corporate relations. The only apology/response we've received is "there is a sign saying park at your own risk". We've not asked them to pay for the vehicle or its contents. However, since we are Hilton honor club members, a sincere apology and maybe even a reimbursement for our 1 night stay would have been a really nice public relations gesture. We will never stay here again and will make sure we spread the word concerning the safety of this hotel.
Again ok food . Very nice waitress . Big restaurant . It's good if you're staying at Hilton, it's late at night and you go down there for a drink instead of going somewhere further away .
Soooo good.   Those that know me know how much I worship the ramen gods.  If I lived here this would become my church!

Meh. This is a little belated, as I went to their soft opening when they first came to Goleta. Poke is a part of Hawaiian cuisine that's slowly swam its way into hip, trendy Southern Californian joints, and people are obsessed. Although not much of a raw fish aficionado, I love anything that's new and gives me a reason to reassure my mom that I've eaten something that wasn't bread or deep-fried in the last week.

For a soft opening, all the elements were there: harried workers, limited menu, line going out the door. Those are all things I don't believe influenced my review, but definitely something to note. They have a cool boba shop called Sno-Crave in there that I wasn't able to try, but I certainly will when I return for the cool glasses they serve them in. As for PokeMee, I'm not sure I can say the same.

The ingredients were all fairly good quality -- the fish didn't smell of anything other than the sauces they were marinated in. I definitely noticed that the crab meat that I paid an extra amount for was imitation crab meat. It just didn't have that same texture or taste that ordinary crab meat does. That's definitely a skip if I choose to return for the poke.

I got a large bowl with salmon, yellowtail, albacore, shrimp and tuna. The shrimp was legitimately difficult to find after mixing my bowl together. I know that out of five proteins, finding one would be difficult, but I genuinely felt like I was chewing and everything was the same fishy texture. The edamame offered as a protein might be an interesting option to shake up the feeling of what I'm chewing if I return.

Aside from that, while it was a functional meal and I didn't get food poisoning, it was one of those cases where I hear someone going, "I eat to live, not live to eat." It's sustenance, but it didn't quite dazzle me the way it did others. For roughly $12 for a full price large bowl, I think I'd rather make my own poke bowls at home.

I've been to Sephora stores all over the globe & I really liked this one. Isles are not as close as people describe. They seem normal to me. The staff was awesome, especially Lia. She walked me over to so many products based on the questions I asked her. She spent a lot of detailed time helping me. Great mall! Loved it.
We love UNO!!! The food is amazing and the service is outstanding. My children have food allergies and UNO offers a gluten free menu. Awesome

fantastic local shop with a line around the corner every weekend.  Don't be fooled, the line moves very quickly.  While waiting, there is a window you can see them form the dough as well as ice the variety they sell.  If they are out of something in the case, just ask, they probably have some ready to go in the kitchen and just haven't had time to get them out there yet.  The butterfly is one of their signature doughnuts.  Think of it as a honey bun/cinnamon roll in one.  The yeast doughnuts melt in your mouth.  My big props on their products are the icing doesn't crack off the whole thing with the first bite (which means you can eat them hot in the car on the ride home!)

We ended up getting a variety to last the weekend and they didn't last the day.  After the butterfly, my next fav was the filled long john.  Great cream flavor and cream was throughout the whole doughnut.  My husband enjoyed the jelly (raspberry) that was iced.

Don't forget to fill all those extra spaces in the box with doughnut holes.  Popable sugar for when you just want "one bite".
It's about time SB got a good poke bowl place closer to IV! Fair prices, good quality fish, friendly staff- what more can you ask for? I'm a raw fish fiend so I'll be coming here a lot.

It was a dark and stormy night.  We were headed to Montana Avenue, but flash floods made getting out east impossible.  Country Club Drive was like a swift-running canal!
Opa? Nothing to write home about, but not bad.  3.5 stars even.  The Mousakka is good, not great.  The same for the Gyros.  We had a very nice bottle of Greek red wine ($26) very quaffable with good ripe cherry flavors and a nice mouth feel.  But the waiter brought the bottle to the table uncorked, so who knows what was in it.  It was good enough that I didn't complain.
They served some flaming foods (I don't like food on fire, or noisy, sizzling platters) to a neighborhing table shouting "Opa!", (cringe) something I never heard in a Greek restaurant here or in Greece untill "My Big Fat..."  What next? Lamb poached in Windex maybe?
Speaking of lamb, a Greek staple, it had a minimal role on the menu. Is lamb just too wierd for suburban Tuscon?  Where was the taramousalata?  Come on, guys, let's get Greek!  At least the tzatiki (?) was rich and delicious, and the odd, spongy pita was fresh and warm.  The ambience?  Strip mall Greek.  Could have been an American or Mexican, or even a Chinese place, save for the obligatory murals of Mykonos-esque landscapes.  The Dali-esque light fixtures resembled glowing dishtowls hung over metal branches.  Bizarre, in a Home Depot sort of way.  
Would I go back?  Sure.  It was pretty good, and the price is right!  Two of us ate well with a bottle of the aforementioned wine for under fifty bucks.

probably my favorite bar to grab a drink and spin some tales not only cause it's cozy, but cause no one seems to know about it. it's definitely not swank (like one reviewer was probably expecting) but romantic in a more bohemian way - the bartender has all his fish named (hence tank) and loves to talk about them, so ask!  i prefer to go there with friends than dates, but maybe i'll find someone worthy... but watch out, it closes at 11 on weeknights.

Holy cow.  This place serves up amazing sandwiches.  Must try The Lolla (Prosciutto & Brie grilled on a Croissant)  YUM.  

Woodstock (Turkey w/ Blueberry Mayo), & Hangout is unreal.  Sirracha Tuna Sammich.

I do miss Ellendales original menu, it was superb. While the food was always changing based in seasonal influences etc, it was always a treat. Imiss the Filet with the Raspberry glaze.  The Wine and Rosemary Rabbit.  Oh the memories. Eating a marvelous meal and some music in background , it was always a perfect experience. Todays Ellendale is good , but it doesnt draw me there for special occasions or nights out. The buffets have never pleased me in whole. Elements are good . Its missing the atmosphere of its days gone by really. I cant put my finger on it. I will say a Valentines meal here years ago was and still is the best meal I had ever had. It was a prefix menu, 5 courses. 
I had a Filet with the biggest most beautiful tempura oyster on top. Omg . And the lobster bisque. Oh how I miss those culinary masterpieces....

I ate dinner here on a cold Saturday night after we were forced to leave Roots cafe due to a carbon monoxide leak (it was the closest restaurant).  We ordered the crab and spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer.   It was horrible....tasted like we were eating straight cream cheese.  The main courses were pretty good and the portion sizes were great, specifically the meatloaf.   The service was good and the prices were reasonable.  The atmosphere was too dark, loud, and obnoxious, like an upscale frat party.

I always come here for shows, never for anything else. The space is pretty open with limited seating but there are more options upstairs. Easy to get to on public transportation,hookahs, and fairly heavy handed on the drinks. Bathrooms desperately need an update.

This is a fun place to go for drinks, food, music, and fun. Love the Irish setting and the staff is friendly. I've been here twice, both times enjoying an ice cold Guiness (thanks to my brother's urge for me to try it and surprise, I loved it!). The live music is fun and makes for a great time. In fact, writing this review has reminded me how much I liked it and would love to go back again soon!

I love this theater! Super comfy reclining seats, love the assigned seating (you don't have to show up early to get good seats), right down the street from my house, they have the new drink machines that give you like 1,000 options for drink flavors. Service at the snack bar seems to be generally slow, but overall, a great place to see a movie!

Love this cozy nail and hair salon.  Trust me, I have been to them all in South Jersey and they get it!  I go to Rebecca (the owner) for my nails and Vanessa for my hair.  They are both great and I would highly recommend each of them.  I was referred by a good friend and now I'm referring my friends.  Not only are they good at what they do but it is not stuffy like many of the extremely high-priced salons in this area!  Prices are reasonable.

Well, after reading the reviews and passing this restaurant (great sign), we went last night. It was just "okay". The newly refurbished front room (where the bar is) looks fabulous. Unfortunately, we were seated in the back room....virtually nothing was done to it, & it seems very disconnected from the front..... literally, it is the same as when it was San Pietro... 
 Although "local" & fresh, the portions are quite small. We started off by sharing the edamame hummus, tuna tartar and the fennel salad. Like I said, small portions. For the entrees, we shared the fluke (very bland) gnocchi with romanesca sauce (very sour & bitter) & the scallops... 2 large scallops, this was the best of the 3. The wine offerings were limited & not the best. The pinot grigio was not smooth, vinho verde okay, the red cab was good. I had very high expectations from this new establishment  so close to home, but, it looks as though I will not be going back for quite some time. If you do go, sit at the bar or ask for a table in the front. Back is too bright, loud & basically where the put the "kiddie" tables.  Service of "off" & awkward. Local Wine & Kitchen needs to step it up several notches if they want to compete out here. I would much rather drive into the city & go to TRIA or one of Jose Garces' restaurants. This missed by a long shot.
Left feeling disappointed & somewhat ripped off.

LOL, what's not to love about Good Time Charlies.  I have been a patron on & off for many years now & always seem to find a reason to return.
The clientele is as unique as the establishment itself. You will find all types of patrons from 3 piece suits to shorts and flip flops. People watching is a personal hobby of mine & this is another great place for me to partake in my hobby.
You can't really call GTC a dive, but it certainally is nothing to write home about, unless to tell your stories of adventures while there. It is like a "B" grade movie or a homemade potato vodka, even though they do have top shelf liquor available.
I can honestly say 90 % of the times I have been there have been really good times, I guess that helps to explain why I keep returning. Usually there is just something in the air that becomes contagious.  A bowling teams victory, a job promotion, a divorce party... or just a good time not to work party.
I love the different games & pool tables,  it adds to the charm of a decor that never seems to change. As usual, I normally end up sitting at the bar & chatting with the folks behind the bar, as well as around me. Both sides of the bar are usually fairly antimated.
I have to admit, I am not a fan of karaoke & now they have it every night.  No.... stop the madness, every night is 6 too many! I quit smoking 3 years ago, so that is no longer a reason I like GTC. I really don't like leaving and smelling like a cigarette,  but all things in moderation.
Overall they take their food pretty seriously. It is not just pub grub, but you can get specials and entire meals. I am sure there is no chef back there, but who ever is cooking, usually does okay.
Yup GTC & I go way back & other than the karaoke,  I see no reason to mess with our relationship.
What's a girl to do?  If it's not broken, don't fix it.

I went there for dinner with some friends. We showed up on 6:15p on a Saturday night and were seated right away.

The service was decent, and the burger was delicious, but a bit pricey. It was reminded me of the Rouge burger, taste and price-wise.  

I am excited to go back and try the ribs with the mac 'n' cheese.

Asked to remove a stripped bolt on an oil pan. Took over 2 hours just for them to take a quick look and say that they can't do so because it may damage the thread so I would need to buy a new oil pan. I politely denied the offer or any service at that. Took another 2 hours for them to take my car off the rack and my ozium car spray is missing. Went to the dealership and let take a look on a busy day took 45mins with included oil change. They are professional scammers they will make you buy things when you don't really need too. My car year is 2013 how can a 1 year and 1/2 old car have problems that can extend that far. As for the staff inside and pepboys speedshop they are respectable locals and deserve at least 3stars as for the mechanics they are lazy and poorly educated.

Totally great experience with Alamo at the Tampa Airport....beautiful clean cute car with low mileage...nice employees! Only thing. ..get some gas before going back to airport....no close by stations.  But that's not Alamos fault!  Great car rental experience

Decided to pop in here to find out about tooth whitening, boy am I so glad that I did.

Went in and saw Kelly the hygienest, who did some xrays and a general clean, she recommended i do a deep scaling as the lazy dentist and hygienest that i saw only 3 months before had done a lousy job.
Waited a couple of minutes before I saw another hygienest that could do the scaling for me (cannot remember the name), but boy did she do a good job, she numbed me up which took a few times but eventually i was good and ready and she made thorough work of my bottom left plane.

After that another couple of minutes wait and got to see Dr Chris,  he gave my mouth a thorough inspection and caught a cavity (Thanks to my previous dentist for not noticing this.) I am now scheduled in for filling and full scaling for end of August but have complete faith as i was put to ease and they all worked in a kind and professional manner.  Sooo glad i found this dentist

It just opened and already this is becoming one of my new favourite places.

I truly enjoyed my first experience with Korean fried chicken.. and my second and third...

I found it hard to find as there's construction in the strip mall that Seoul is in, but if you ever ate at Lee House, you'll now where to find it. And if you didn't, Seoul Fried Chicken is in the strip mall between 80 and 79 Avenue (with no frills in it) and SFC faces 104 Street as it's tucked around the corner.

My first time there was picking up food for a girl's night in with a bestie. We tried 10 of the OG (original gangster - classic) and 10 of the soy sauce flavour. Both were amazing with soy sauce being my favourite and the classic being my friend's favourite. The two sides I grabbed, the pesto mac and cheese and the coleslaw were also fantastic. 

The chicken is also great cold - and makes for a breakfast of champions the following day (just saying!). 

Lunch for $11 is fantastic - five pieces of chicken, fries, salad and drink?! Great value, great food. I've now had the opportunity to also try the BBQ sauce but the soy sauce is still my favourite, while the cilantro one is my co-worker's fav. So many choices to try still though!

I found the place to be clean (albeit small) and the service has always been friendly. Every time they let me know how long it would be and they were right on the money each time.
This restaurant has a very "Bywater" feel. Delicious, interesting food and drinks at moderate prices in a white, hipster neighborhood.

This is not really an IHOP, it's more like a lobotomized IHOP. At least the things that I normally order we not on the menu or available. The lady at the register looked embarrassed at having to tell me a couple times that it was not available. I ended up with something but still not happy. Can't blame the employees just because Corporate can't figure out what customers like. I'm a truck driver and won't be stopping at this location again.

I've been here twice and had pretty decent experiences both of the times. I've tried the ciopinno and the jambalaya both of which tasted good. The ciopinno was tasty and included a wide variety of seafood. The jambalaya was nicely seasoned but could include more seafood especially for the price. The fish in it was little dry. Overall a nice setting. Waitresses could be a little more attentive. Will probably come back.

They got me in and out quickly, which I like.  The girl who gave me my pedicure was a little rough.   Otherwise, it's clean.  People are friendly.  I am new to the neighborhood and I am definitely a return customer

The food is not good. Too bland. The restaurant is nice and the patio is awesome so if you are going there for just drinks you will enjoy it and that is if you get lucky with an efficient server, the lady that we got was very slow and chatty. The valet parking is very convenient because you will not find parking on your own.

Don't even bother coming here. No effort by staff to clean anything or even ice the beer. Been here 40 min and they have not cleaned a single table I and others had to clean their own. An hour before they closed the beer bin had little to no ice and when I asked about it I was told they close soon so no need to ice. They close in over an hour!!! At 8:45 an employee turned the music off (same one who didn't care to ice the beer) and was told by someone I am guessing is in charge to turn it back on. Guessing it was a we are closing in 45 minutes time to wrap up type of thing. Very poorly run and no management at all in the evening.

Brunch here was AMAZING. Came with family on an unseasonably warm New Year's Eve, so we sat outside. Pretty view of the park, fantastic breakfast pastries, delicious tea, and some of the best french toast and potatoes known to man. If I lived in Philly I'd be here every weekend.

Had a great meal her with the boyfriend; we ordered lots of different things to try. I like the variety they offer, but after we sat down I could see parts of the menu that I didn't notice before, and wish I would have ordered. So make sure to look up, and read all the different signs! All the staff were friendly, and we got dessert to go from their pie shop next door. It ended up being super crowded as we left, so you may have to wait in line.

This is a really awesome place that is just off the beaten path in Ybor City. This is a Distillery that serves locally-made vodka.

We came here as part of the Ybor City Aficionado days to check the place out, and we left as fans. We sampled a couple different vodkas, the key lime, the beach berry, and a few others. Everything we tried was smooth and tasty.

The service here was exceptional. The gentleman behind the bar seemed genuinely pleased to help everybody, answered questions, and poured a good drink. I highly recommend this place as somewhere to start ir somewhere to stay or somewhere to finish, or all of the above :-)

I love staying here every year when I come to the Gem Show. Rooms are clean and spacious.  The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Traveling by myself I feel extremely safe. The pool is inviting, ample parking, and beautiful landscaping. I love the fountain in the courtyard. I feel at home when I stay here.

The food is always incredible here.  I highly recommend the sweet potato side dish--a must order!  The steaks are served sizzling in butter, giving the restaurant a simply heavenly aroma.  I just wish it was a little less expensive.  A meal for two including one drink each is easily over $100.
The bad cats of the quarter have a new house.. And Kev already has gotten a nice shout out, that did not take long, I didn't think it would..

This place is really good...

Setting
Food
Music
Price for the money...

All is better than average

Most important,  the food is authentic Mexican food, with no influence of Tex Mex ir excesive condiments.

The food resembles the food from central México states such as Puebla or Mexico city.

You wont regret it.
Pretty good, as far as electric services go!  I like that the bill is consistent monthly, because I've had a company before that wasn't so much that way.
I love the chimichangas here. They are so fillinf. I can never eat the entire thing. The mango margaritas are awesome. This has become one of my favorite Mexican places to visit.

This is the first review i have ever done on yelp.  Typically i have used yelp to find new restaurants.  I was shocked to see some of the reviews for Misso.  If you enjoy Sushi, sit at the bar and simply tell the sushi Chef what you like and wait to be impressed.  I am a true sushi snob, UNI, IKURA, SABA,  FRESH SCALLOP.   All of which are very fresh here. The price is good.  Yes there are better deals other places, but i don't come here for california rolls. The service is great and the bathrooms are clean.  Try it out for yourself before you form an opinion based on a review by someone who doesn't know there fish.

We went here for lunch and ended up leaving before we got out food. Our waitress was rude and dismissive and ended up getting into a screaming match with several other staff members and we decided after waiting an hr for our food (without any indication that there was a problem) and the screaming we left. Save yourself the time and go somewhere else.

Seriously amazing! The garlic knots were to die for! I am already craving more!
I ordered the ziti and Brandon had a meatball sub both were delicious and big enough for left overs for lunch today. The waitress Taylor was really sweet and we had no problems what so ever. Everyone wad very friendly and the service and food were amazing!
We will definitely be going back! The pizza looked really good and I want to try it, everyone else seemed to be eating pizza so I totally need to try it next time.
They also had little questionnaires on the experience  in with the check which is a great idea and of course I filled out out.
Make sure u get the garlic knots tho!  DO IT!

This is the first time my opinion diametrically differs from Yelp majority. We were so excited to try CCC and finally had brunch there today. 3 adults and 3 kids. We ordered several dishes as well as the famed ccc. The place was less than half full yet our wait for food was surprisingly long. After about 20 mins, the server seemed apologetic and offered us an appetizer as we waited, we accepted (stay tuned for more on that later). The app was toasted bread with a refried type black bean paste and cheese melted on top, it was good, not great but the kids liked it. About 5 mins after that came the tamale dish of one adult at the table, no one else's food was in sight. She liked her dish. Next came nachos: as another Yelper stated, it was good but with too many cold components to make it great. It seemed each dish came out within 10 mins of the one before... My husbands migas especial came and he, who has NEVER in all the years I've known him, not eaten what he's ordered, did just that today... He just did not like the soupiness not the flavor of the dish...total surprise to me. So we are 45 minutes into this meal and 3 kids have still not received the 3 chicken tacos they ordered and I did not get my dish. I got up and politely asked the server if we could cancel those orders as the rest of the table was already done. I asked why there had been such a delay (btw, I speak fluent Spanish so there was definitely no issue with understanding one another). The server just apologized and agreed that small kids should usually be the first to get fed (especially really you g ones, since otherwise you'll have a nacho chip throwing mutiny). She gave us the bill and guess what, she charged us $6.50 for the appetizer she offered us what seemed to be a co cession for the delay. Sorry CCC, as newbies to the area and with places like Lift, Sabrina's, Reading Market and a bunch of Mexican places and trucks in Philly that blow you away taste and service I cannot drum up one good reason to ever return to you.

Everyone here is so nice, and I want to love this place!!!  The wine selection is great.  The place is beautiful.  But the food was nothing to write home about.  It was just ok.  It left us wanting more.  Our cheese platter for two was ok, but there wasn't a lot of bread to go with it and to be honest I've had better.  I thought the spicy pickled veggies were good, but a weird combo with the cheese (maybe that's just me tho...Amon wouldn't even try them).  My salmon was average, but the vegetable medley left something to be desired.  The carrots were crisp (I'd like them cooked a little), there were a lot of onions (also crisp).  Amon said his steak was fine, whatever that is in man talk.   We may come back for the wine and maybe try the small plates.  The wine selection was great and we enjoyed the wine!  Again, the service here is awesome.  I should also say we didn't complain about the food to the staff because I've worked in the service industry and its not the servers' fault.

This place is exactly what ALL auto repair shops should be.  I had my sons  89 Jeep Cherokee repaired here, and It was no easy job. I had random vibrations, it had clanging/ banging issues. I had shifting, and idle problems. I was sure this would cost $$$.  Nope, from the first phone conversation I had with Matt, to spending time speaking to Chris about my issues and having Chris take the time to explain every issue, and the corrections he did, was priceless. Lastly, I have a very meaningful conversation with the owner Bob about my Jeep, my family, and about how I appreciate is shop. Thanks to everyone at Clarke's my son has a perfect running Jeep.
Excellent cheesecake and really nice owners!  We came in ten mins before closing but they graciously waited on us.  Try it you'll love it!!

This was our favorite restaurant, even though it's 25 miles away, however, we recently had the worst experience of our dining career.  Although the restaurant was busy, we waited for well over an our for our entree's to be delivered.  Other diners who came in after us were served their meals and were almost finished. After about 75 minutes I sought out the manager to ask him what was the problem.  He apologized but didn't seem to take any immediate action.  After another 15 minutes we left, after first offering to pay for the appetizers (there was no charge).  The atmosphere was excellent and the food has always been above average, but the waiter we had needs to be reassigned, he's costing them business.

this is a simple, neighborhood restuarant with outstanding food.  The chips and dips served complimentary include salsa, hot sauce and a delicious bean dip.  Everything served is prepared quickly and fresh, nothing frozen or canned.  The shrimp cocktail is superb, the best I've  ever eaten anywhere.  Lots o shrimp, chopped cucumber, avocado onions and tomatoes.  we've eaten there several times and everyone has thoroughly enjoyed each dish.

I wanted to check out a Mexican restaurant around my area, and I asked "Siri" about it , so this restaurant came up, i have being to other ones from the same chain and have had ok experiences however i told my self today I oughta check out one of these in the " nice side of town" since they tend to give better service , well......I can see why they have a 2.5 star rating. 
I have worked and managed restaurants for at least 10 years and done management training about customer service skills ,and let me tell ya! This place has a lot of room for
Improvement , starting from the moment you walk in to the restaurant. 
As son as I stepped in thru those door I was not greeted at all by the hostess ,I had to stand there to wait for her to do so , ( I still said hi first )then I promptly asked for the rest room. 
The men's rest room also has a lot of room for improvement ,1.- for instance the odor as soon as you walk in, they had at least 6+ of those deodorants laying around and they all were VISIBLE to guests. As if they were some type of ornamental items.   
2.i asked the hostess what the specials were for the day , first thing she pointed was to the clock before she even said the spatial of the day which she didn't know by heart she had to go grab a menu or pamphlet ( which I understand she might be new or something idk,also the language barrier could be an issue I may add I've being told I can come across as  a little intimidating  to others , not that I mean to but it's just the way I carry myself everywhere )
3. She mentioned the happy hour specials about $1 off and also said something about "mini chimis " and she was hesitant about it , not very convinced about it. Which also doesn't look good , all employees need to be sure about all specials and if not have a daily special menu or " cheat sheet" handy so they don't have to walk away from the guest area and miss another one coming in. 
4.  I walk myself to the bar area and a women dressed with a tuxedo style attire greeted me promptly but in a "dry and cold " manner lacking of hospitality and/or welcomeness , she placed some
Silverware and a menu and asked me if I was ready to order even tho I had just ordered a small pitcher of beer. The right question should have being "
Would you like to order something from our menu..our happy hour starts in about an hour ...etc c etc. 
But none of that was done. 
5.-my salsa and chips were not refilled nor the bartender asked me for anything else until 45 minutes went by ( don't believe me ? Check your cameras ) she instead went and had a "meeting" with other employees , I don't know if it was work related but that's besides the point , she never checked with me for 45 minutes nor sent anyone Else to check on me. Keep in mind The restaurant was very slow from 2 to 3 pm , also saw the store manager I believe  walk around the store several times and not "touch tables" with any of the guest let alone to me. 
6.-a different bar tender girl came along after 3 pm (night shift I suppose ) and she was just as distant as the other tender , after I finished my small pitcher of beer around 3:10pm (hour and 10 minutes later ) I asked about special happy hour again but when I asked she was cleaning the blender and I said " excuse me " to what she answers "yes" ( but didn't Approached me to listen to what I had to say since I was siting at the extreme opposite corner of the bar , I wasn't going to yell across the room and say what I needed. 
Then I said : I have a question but with a certain tone of voice , not disrespectful but yet acknowledging I wanted her to approach me. 

You as an enployeee even as a manager of this restaurant after reading my comments may or could be offended  for absolutely no reason , but if that's the case (I hope not because that's not the purpose of this review )  you should actually feel grateful that someone a customer that is , took the time to write this long review on your staff and premises to pint point something that you probably don't see while your "managing" , feedback from your guests is crucial is what gives you the opportunity to grow as a company and as a business.  Good or bad I necessary for growth. 
Shorty after this I waned to pay my bill and get going , so I looked around and nobody was near by , I strongly dislike when this happens , there's no reason why a bar customer should be unattended let alone for that long period of time. 
So I stood up to draw attention to me but no success i sat back down and stood up again but this time I made noise with the stool/bar chair and no luck again , despite the fact that the manager and bartender were behind me having a "meeting" , so I got up for the 3rd time
And went to the restroom  and as I walked toward the back I notoced there were 4 female employees at the main entrance where register is at just chatting about non work related stuff , I went back to the bar and still no attention until i had to say I needed to cash out and had a really....

I no longer live in St Louis but come back a few times a year to see family, friends, and stuff myself silly with BBQ and frozen custard.  I LIKE Pappy's, I tried (and hated The Shaved Duck), but Bogart's is THE place.  I've never had anything that I wouldn't order again and again and the staff are super nice folks.

OMG. This is kid paradise. I have an almost 2 year old and she was rocking all over this joint. I had a hard time keeping up with her. At $16 a pop, including for the little ones, this can be pricey. But we went on the first Wednesday of the month and got in for $2 a pop, a total steel. They also have good membership deals for those who like to frequent the joint.

But seriously, there is so much ish for the little ones to do. They have kid size markets, Mc Ds, houses, etc... They have a river area with toys to play with in the water. So cool.

The one thing they don't have but desperately need, stroller parking. I mean, if I have to chase my kid around, doing it with a stroller sucks. I just want to park it and go. Come on people, $16 for my kid should get my stroller a parking spot.

This is a cozy bar that seems to be quite popular as it was pretty busy on a Thursday around 8pm. They have small tvs, so don't come to watch the game, but you can watch the game if you can see it. The beer selection is tasty, but they could use more on tap. It was limited. The food was excellent for bar food. I had the lamb belly sandwich. Delic.

The hostess may turn you off from entering the building. She has a hautey attitude, which my friends who had been there before say she always had. Instead of saying "There's no tables available", she says "Yeah, that's not going to happen". Really? How do you speak to your customers like that? I took off a whole star for that. Hopefully the owners realize she's not made for front of house work, but until then, just try to ignore her poor attitude and get in the bar.

My favorite restaurant in Reno.  Don't know what else to say.  Great local feel, with regular following from nearby neighbors.  Wide classy bar, awesome food, high-end wines including broad selection by the glass.  See lots of folks 30's to 50's who tend to bring a touch of style.

My last experience wasn't a good one. I will report the cashier who I will not name to corporate. I wanted a whopper veggie burger. How hard is that. Make the damn burger. Cashier asked me why I wanted a veggie burger. The answer is simple, because I'm payin for it. She said rudely "I didn't asked you that."  I was like whatever. Then she was like you don't eat meat, the burger has bacon on it. I didn't care. That's what I wanted. Black folks dees days hmmmmm....................?

Happy hour only served at a small bar at the front. They definitely don't explain this on their website and happy hour signs.  When we asked the manager about this he told us that they basically didn't need our business because the place will be packed regardless... Not a very professional way of handling your customers if you ask me. They did end up giving us a few apps at happy hour prices and we did ended up staying and paying a lot to eat there. 
The food was over priced and not that great, it was just ok, definitely not worth the money.  I will not be returning.

It was... Ok. I mean, reservations were maddening, we waited an hour to eat, and the food was only ok. To many, it was pretty good, but not life changing the way that yelp reviews suggest. We spent $70 on 3 appetizers and one dish, and although we enjoyed the meal, I wouldn't go out of my way, or crave this food anytime again. We got the alligator and crab cheesecake which wasn't anything special. It's really like a quiche more than a cheesecake and didn't have an incredible flavor. The cornbread is superb, and it's free, so enjoy as much of that as you can. Crab stuffed shrimp? eh. Butter beans? Blah.

This place has a tiny kitchen, but still they manage to fit one person to just make tortillas, one person to just cook meat and roast peppers, one person to just take orders, money and get water / drinks, one person just to assemble the orders and one person to get the various odd order stuff.  We always found a line out the door, but it moved quickly. There tacos are more similar to other taquerias, while there specials are not as recognizable. They are delicious and unusual. For example, the cheese and bacon was a bowl of melted cheese and bacon with tortillas on the side. The chile relleno de queso con crema actually is a normal chile relleno in a warm cream sauce.  

The chiles are mild in the winter (perfect for me).  I don't know hot spicy they get in late summer.

This review is for the donairs only. We have had the shawarma platters and they are not good compared to other spots offering the same thing but if you are looking for a delicious donair this is the place to go 

Both beef donairs and chicken shawarma are delicious. 

Would be 5 star if the prices were a little cheaper.

First time here. It was good, not what we're use to but it was good. 
My husband wanted to order to a steak and the server kinda kept pushing us towards the gator and said u don't want the steak it's not really that good. So wasn't to happy bout that. He wanted a steak and that's what he got. Everything was good, to much seasoning on some things but we will give it another shot

We just visited New Orleans for the first time last month and having never been there, we decided to pick a well known hotel chain.  We were not dissapointed with our choice.  It was within walking distance of everything important in and around the French Quarter, but it was just removed enough to feel like we were getting away from the hustle and bustle at the end of the night (or in the middle of the day if some down time was needed).  The pool area is nice, but it is between two buildings so it's not in the sunshine for the entire day (which some would see as a  pro).

It was clean, cool, and comfortable - which is all I ask for when I'm traveling!

I LOVE this bar! I just moved to St. Louis about 2 months ago and I think I've visited about 6 times. The staff is phenomenal, they are all extremely polite, and very knowledgeable about the menu and the beers on tap. And the food... I've ordered something different nearly every time I've been and I've never had anything I wouldn't love to eat again. They also have "sliders of the day" and "wraps of the day" so they constantly have new menu items. If it's summertime you should definitely check out their alleyway patio, it's nice, quiet, and gives a unique atmosphere for your dining experience. Definitely a must stop if you're visiting The Loop!
They always do a great job, they are friendly, reasonably priced and expedited my drop off when I had a unexpected work trip come up.
Great place. I don't live close enough to go frequently, but the time I went it was fabulous with a nice cozy atmosphere and excellent service !!

We were happy to find this place on our way to the beach. We have our favorite places for pizza back home and were pleasantly surprised by how good the pizza was here. The fries were also very good. I would have given 5 stars but our wings were a little dry. This place is tiny, only 5 booths, 1 table and a small bar but definitely a good place to grab a pizza.

First off, they are supposed to be open from 11 until 8pm and they are very rarely open. A friend and I stopped by and there were two other couples waiting for their food. It was very breezy and chilly so we stepped up to the window to get out of the wind.  The owner then looks us and says you need to move, the food has to come out this window. Keep in mind this is an outside restaurant.  So we waited about 10 minutes to place our order and we asked for two side items, neither of them were available!  So we just ended up getting two overpriced shakes after waiting another 10 minutes.  I left a sad face on four square review and instead of apologizing she was extremely rude.  I'll never go back!  Plus the owner is extremely strange.....

You know the saying third times a charm... for this place it was third times a bust. Our first experience was amazing... couldn't wait to come back. On the second occasion we came on a Wednesday evening (approx 7pm) and was told there would be an hour wait... looking around over half of the tables were empty in the dining room and on the patio. Third time decided to try and give them a chance to redeem themselves and let's just say the joke was on us. My mom was served a salad with half of a cup of salad dressing and when asked for more told her they had ran out and to pick something else. I was served the wrong meal. It took half of the wait staff to get a refill. Ketchup for fries took an act of God. You get where I'm going... This place has such potential but the staff is ruining all hope.
This place is great, I don't know what I would do without it. Anything you need they have, all at great prices. Awesome hoagies too!

I've been going to Taqueria Corona off and on for the last 3 years.  Coming from a part of the country that has exceptional Mexican food - I was not expecting much.  Overall, I've generally liked the tacos here, generally preferring the carne asada, cheese and american tacos.  I also have enjoyed the beef and tongue california burritos.  

While this is certainly not the quality of food you'll receive in Texas, California, or the midwest, its pretty good and relatively cheap.  I've never had anything that just wows me - but its good to grab a quick bite from time to time.

I was so disappointed in the Christkindlmarkt. I was so excited to go, as I love Christmas and German festivals. This fell short. I hope they take the feedback from attendees to improve it for next year. I knew it would be busy, but the ice skating rink took up so much room that there was barely any room to walk through the crowds. We couldn't see anything that the vendors were selling because the crowds were so ridiculous. The lines for food were laughable. It felt unsafe for the market to be so crowded, I feel like it could have been bad if there were an emergency. For some reason the market just didn't have the Christmas spirit. 
The worst part was that we parked in the Veterans way garage (all the signs point you to park in this garage). To get outside, you have to go to the bottom level but there was no way to get from the parking garage to the market. You have to walk through a hilly, muddy construction area to get over there. It was not lit and was not easy to walk across. I saw some older adults and children who had some trouble getting up and down the hills. I felt like this event was put together without fully planning it out.

St. Louis is a big city but it is an Asian culture-deprived land. I was here for a weekend visit and I was truly disappointed at the Asian foods overall. But I'm glad that they were here to serve the locals.

My white friends wanted to try it after hearsay. It was in an interesting neighborhood... a bit run down.

The foods were not too interesting. The Pho was average at best, for the broth. The noodles was a bit soggy on the spot. It was a bit small for its price. My friends were not complaining even though the foods were not how they were visualizing. I sampled a bit... it's more disappointing on the broad egg noodles with brown sauce... it's actually just Hoisen sauce.

So diners, ordinary at best for my taste at the time; boring when typing its review here.

Solid Mexican comfort food, satisfying, affordable muy athentico.  The ambiance speaks of a Mexican border town, with an Our Lady of Guadalupe painted on the wall with other classic images.  This is what I love in food family run independents making great simple food!  I had the carnitas plate done to perfection juicy yet crispy with delicious pastry like tortillas.  Que bueno yo comes bien...

Sept 21 6:30 pm. Service was good. Greeter was not engaged, no smile, no welcome.
Our server was excellent as was his trainee. Both were friendly and attentive.
The food, yuck. Over cooked, dry, unappetizing.

First make sure that you understand  that this place is the definition of a dive, then go on in and have a good time. Make sure you have a drink (or two) and enjoy the doughnuts, I mean croutons, at the salad bar. if your expectations are set right you will enjoy yourself in here.

Love this place... sort of.  I spend too much money there and it's a loooong drive, but we find ourselves there just about every weekend now.  Those are the only cons - and spending too much money only means they have a lot of good flavors - so nothing bad with PV at all.  Lots of flavors, all fresh and ready to be eaten.  Girls have been super friendly and allowed us to taste test what we wanted to try and were helpful with suggestions of pairing and mixing.

So popcorn is great
Service is great

5 stars from me.

Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. Yes, prices are higher than what you could find a other places, but that's the price to pay to live in Santa Barbara. Overall the store is great. Staff are always willing to answer questions and help when needed.

Just finished a 3.5 spa day for my 40th. Staff has been awesome! I had the Slim Is In package plus a 75 min Swedish Massage :) First time here and definitely not my last! Samantha went out of her way to help me with a gift certificate concern...and Hue (Whey) is nothing short of AMAZING!!
Great coffee , and if you go at the right time of day , nice quiet place to read a book or work on a project. A good alternative coffee place to try instead of Starbucks.
Food was cold to luke warm. Also dishes and cups didn't even look like they were washed. Enjoy getting sick. Food was less than mediocre. All the surfaces are sticky. I don't think they care here.

I feel like I need to add another review to Dr. Butler's practice because the other two that are on here do not represent my experience. Dr. Butler is the best doctor I've ever had. The secretaries get the appointments scheduled with no fuss, once I get there I always am seen by the doctor pretty quickly (i.e., I don't have to wait long). I like that Dr. Butler always does a thorough examination--he will talk to you about whatever medical issue you are having and will also check you out for other things (e.g., blood parameters). People have complained about being rushed, but I don't think it's different with any other doctor; I appreciate that the doctor has many patients to see. He also "tells it like it is" and doesn't baby his patients, which I also appreciate. The one time he referred me to a specialist it worked out well, no complaints!

Really cute local Childrens boutique. They most had smaller kids sizes but still had lot of unique toys and trinkets. My kids really enjoyed the photo booth! Defiantly off the beaten path but worth checking out if you want to find something unique!

If Old City is where frat boys and d-bags go to hang out when they are in college, Stratus Lounge is where they go when they get jobs and grow up. 

I do have to commend the venue itself. The bar is chic and trendy. There are couches both inside and out. The outdoor roof area is a nice spot to chill, although there is a wall that prevents Stratus from having any decent view. There are two rooms to either side of the outdoor patio which can also be used for private parties. Stratus seems like a great place put on some nice clothing and sip a cocktail. The decor and location give this place a 3 in my mind.

Its just the clientele that brings down both my experience and my rating. Many of the patrons seem to exhibit an attitude of ultimate exclusivity and arrogance. While the prices at Stratus are higher than the places I typically frequent, I don't think this place warrants such pretentious behavior. If you are wearing the appropriate attire, anyone over 21 can walk in. Speaking of appropriate attire- watch your footwear. A guy in our group was turned away based on his Birkenstocks.

Pretentious patrons aside, there's a cool vibe about the atmosphere that will probably keep me coming back from time to time.

Very good fried chicken and sides.  The service was excellent minus the hostess who didn't seem to have a clue about what she was doing.  The prices are very reasonable for the portions and quality.  I would recommend if you are in the mood for some southern style cooking.

We found this place on our Yelp app.  We were a little confused by the menu since it advertised both BBQ and Vegan...kind of an oxymoronic.  Surprise, it works.
