The food was well prepared.The service was friendly and timely.  Overall, a very positive experience.  We will go back to try out some of the more unique vegan options on the menu.
The best tacos in the St. Louis County area. The carne asada and al pastor tacos are absolutely delicious. If you're in the mood for tacos or Mexican don't go anywhere else.

The food is great, atmosphere cozy and comfortable, service excellent.

My colleague and I had pasta dishes, I don't remember which ones, but we both rated them among the best versions we had ever had.  Which is another way of saying it doesn't matter what you order, it will be awesome.

Don't make the mistake we did and try lots of other more popular or convenient places before coming here.  We didn't go until our last night in Tampa and regretted it!  If only we could have gone back several times.

Overall i think this place is great, however front staff needs some improvement. If it wasn't for the male host, our waitress and the satisfying food portions i would've gave this place 3 stars

We were in SB for 4th of july weekend... i yelped a few places before our stay to make sure we ate and drank the best around town. We ended up at Enterprise because all the wait times of the places i yelped around were about an hour and a half - go figure, holiday weekend. I walked up and said "A table for 6 please..." the hostess' in front looked up at me (while talking away with another co worker) it will be a long wait. i said "how long? " she said "40 minutes, we are very busy." I said that is fine and she said okay - handed me my buzzer i walked away... *rude* 50 minutes later i walked in and asked how much longer, the girl said i am sorry we are very busy and there is still 3 parties ahead of you i said okay that is fine, we will wait at the bar... We left to the bar (great bartender by the way) ordered a few drinks and hung around some more. I saw at least 5 parties get seated after, at this point i was hungry and impatient so i walked up to the gentlemen host in front and asked how much longer because originally i was told 40 minutes and it was more than hour already, he said i am so sorry we are going to clean up your table and seat you shortly. Seems like he actually did move some things around and finally an hour half later, we were seated.. *Thanks to the nice gentlemen who made it happen*

The host that sat us brought us some cold water while we waited, Our waitress was GREAT! I wish i would've remembered her name. I  ordered fish & chips they were AMAZING!! They were sooo HUGE! I have never eaten fish & chips that big in my life!! My sister ordered the same and we both only ate half of the portion that was served, next time we will share. My husband had their sicilian pasta which was al dente and very delicious! Lobster Bisque- WOW!!!!  Our food took a while to come out however we had warm bread, our drinks, starters and the soups/salads which held us down.

Now onto the oysters... one word, AMAZING!!! Hands down they were the BEST oysters i have ever had, i seriously will never see oysters the same after this experience.

I was so thrilled when Canadian Lululemon finally made its arrival on American soil and set up shop in Philadelphia.  Everyone back home (yes, Canada is my native land) who is even remotely active lives and swears by their apparel.

After a couple purchases at this store, I too, am living and swearing by their wares.  True, items are expensive, especially for work-out gear, but for the most part they are of really good quality and stand the test of time and rigorous wear. 

A couple weeks ago, I participated in the 3-day breast cancer 60 mile walk.  It was going to be really cold and wet and I was ill-prepared.  I went to Lulu at the last minute and their staff helped me find a pair of wind and rain resistant pants to wear over my cold weather leggings.  The pants totally delivered. They kept me warm and bone dry and after a few washes, the pants are still as good as new and I can't wait to use them throughout the winter. (oh and they look good too!)

And this brings me to their staff: they are so nice, down-to-earth and friendly - smiles all around.  Every time I go in there, everyone is so genuinely kind, informative and engaging without being pushy. Huge, huge plus!  Maybe if I did yoga as often as they apparently do I'd be as pleasant as they were.

Otherwise, last few tidbits: Keep an eye out for sale items.  Apparel only goes up to size 12 in Womens, great sizeable change rooms, small-ish inventory but it rotates often... and you leave with a cute reuseable bag with your purchases.

The staff is amazing!  They are courteous and knowledgeable.  They are tentative and have a passion for helping people.  The restaurant is clean. Oh & by the way...the food is superb!!!  I have never been to another Mcalisters Deli, not sure if I want to.  This restaurant setts the bar pretty high.

BUY YOUR PIECES ON-LINE. YOU WILL GET BETTER PRICES AND BETTER SERVICE. THIS STORE OWNER IS NOT CUSTOMER FOCUSED.

I worked with Carlos to buy 3 bar stools. One cracked when putting it together. After having only two at the island we decided that was the right number. I took the third broken chair back to Carlos who told me, sorry we don't accept any returns. You can take it back to the warehouse for repair but you can't get your money back.
I give them zero stars for customer service and customer flexibility. I will never go to the store again and none of my friends will either. 
The funny thing is, if I had ordered the stools online, they were cheaper and I could return them no problem, no tax, and no shipping. 
Local stores are independently owned and this one is obviously owned by an idiot.

How the heck have I not reviewed this place yet?? I know everybody raves about the shrimp and alligator cheesecake (which is absolutely fantastic) but my favorite app is the fried grits. The stuffed shrimp, fried green tomatoes, crab cakes and deep fried roast beef poboy are also good. The spinach salad and cornbread is great. The grilled grouper, stuffed catfish, and sesame tuna have all been good choices, but after I got the white meat fried chicken, now that is all I get. The chicken pieces are HUGE and very flavorful. I can't seem to order anything else for my entree since I tried their fried chicken.  I love Jacques-Imos, but can't bring myself to give it 5 stars, b/c in my opinion, the sides are weak. I have tried most of them, but none are knock your socks off good.

Ate here a few months ago for a late brunch. We left astonished. It was hands down the worst food I can remember being served.

I ordered an omelet with onions, mushrooms, tomatoes, peppers and cheese. It seemed like a safe bet, but the mushrooms were slimy and metallic tasting, obviously dumped right out of a can. In fact all of the vegetables seemed like they came right out of cans. The cheese was a slice of Kraft processed swiss melted on top. And the toast wasn't even toasted. It was warmed white bread, still completely white and soft, spread with margarine. 

My boyfriend had a grilled cheese. It was also inedible. The Trolley house idea of a grilled cheese is a half inch thick slab of Velveeta partially melted between some bread. 

The service did not leave as much of an impression as the food, though I seem to remember waiting several minutes for a bottle of ketchup, only to grab one off another table ourselves. 

Avoid at all cost.

Ok couldn't find in Yelp the 1560 West McEwen Dr. Franklin location. 
Excellent reception by Mgr. Upon entree. Traditional Lettuce wrap, Spring and Chocolate Chip was excellent. Jeff the Atlanta  Falcon hat cook (Jeff) was awesome. So my score is 4.5. Great experience all around!

Hello all, I have been having the same issues with george smith towing! Terrible company and ridiculous fees! I am actually working with and attorney and got my money back! Anyone who would like to get their money back give him a call! David McClafferty 215-592-1500. He was very helpful!

BBQ pork nachos were delicious. The kitchen sink pizza was to be expected. Personable servers. 

Parking blows. Beer selection could be better. Bathrooms were dirty and didn't have toilet paper. 

Overall good, but wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Great cheese steak, pretty standard prices. The steak comes with a generous 12 oz of meat which remains moist without making the sandwich soggy. Big props to the chewy sesame roll the sandwich comes on too. 

The namesake roast pork with spinach cheese and onions puts Tommy Dinic's to shame. A pain to get to without a car, but parking is super easy. The free pickles in the condiment bar are pretty awesome as well. No bathroom but there's a target close by with the requisite facilities.

Hello! We came in just a couple minuets ago. We where seated right away and it seemed like we would be served in a good amount of time. 
We where very wrong. It wasn't busy at all yet the waiters and waitresses seemed to think that talking to each other was superior to serving their guest. After 10 minutes our family left. We will not come back. This is the second time this has happened.

Wow and wow! This was the first time to a Boston Market and all I can say the staff was awesome and the food was too. As we walked in Colin welcomed us and walked us through process. He gave us great suggestions and was extremely helpful. I was with my wife and kids so Collin helped us carry our thanksgiving feast to our table. Nothing better than having excellent service at a restaurant especially a fast food place. 

This is a fast food restaurant that has a drive through but the food is home style. Nothing fast food about it! The turkey and chicken was so tender and flavorful. Top it off with mashed potatoes and gravy. It's a pre thanksgiving all year round.

The dinning area is a little run down but the staff and food make it up 100% 

Honestly I was super impressed with the service from Colin and will return. If your feeling some home style cooking head over to Boston Market! You won't be disappointed!

Love this place! Everyone is so nice. Really clean, hygienic and sanitary. Owners and staff make sure your stay is enjoyable and you leave happy and satisfied. Nice to be serviced by genuinely nice people.

Stopped in for a quick lunch while in Indy on business.  Very nice service and about the best egg salad sandwich I have ever had.  Just like momma used to make!  Wish I worked nearby so I could eat here regularly.

So, I've seen this place a bunch of times but had never eaten here as the "curb appeal" is somewhat lacking. But, eventually curiosity took hold and I checked it out on Yelp to see what other people were saying. I'm very glad that I did.

After reading a number of really positive reviews about their pizza, I decided to check it out. We stopped by heading home from work, ordered a large pepperoni pizza, and took advantage of the 15-20 minute wait by going next door to the Dog House Tavern. Here I discovered that not only can you kill the pizza wait there with a beer, but Ponzo's will actually bring your pizza to the bar (a service quite a few people were taking advantage of). This is a major plus, as you probably won't want to eat at Ponzo's - the few tables that exist are pretty small.

Anyway, our pizza was ready on time, we took it home, and it was delicious. A lot of the reviews claim that the pizza was "real New York style" - I think the crust was a little too thick for it to really remind me of New York pizza, but that doesn't change that this is my new favorite pizza place in Houston. 

Overall, if you're unhappy with the state of Pizza in Houston (and really, who isn't...)- I definitely recommend giving Ponzo's a try.

Oh, yum! The fried egg sandwich was PERFECT: fresh brioche bun, egg yolk gently oozing at every bite, bacon cooked to a crisp.

The biscuit? Delish. Raspberry jam: oh yeah!

The coffee was strong (as I like it). Too hot perhaps on a July day.

Can't wait to return!

Now most don't know, but Cincinnati (my former city before moving to Philly) was a hot bed of amazing northern Indian food. I know, it's hard to believe that anything in Ohio is spicy or brag-worthy, but it really was "the shiz". So after searching for something comparable in Philly and coming up empty handed, I had pretty much given up -- that is until I met EKTA. Now the mere fact that they will deliver all the way to my office in Rittenhouse, without charge and in a timely manner is unbelievable! Add that to the free dessert and the delicious food and you've got a winner. We've ordered a few times from there now and done it up family style and I've never been disappointed with anything. I usually stick to the veggie dishes like masaladar chola and saag paneer, but the lamb vindaloo and butter chicken totally knocked my socks off.

After driving through a blizzard to get here, we were ready for a yummy meal and a cozy yet elegant atmosphere. It had been a heck of a week, which included our son getting suspended from school, The dog eating my hair extensions and my sons new skull candy headphones , so my husband and I were ready for a relaxing fun evening, and Sabor delivered.  The atmosphere was cozy, fun, and the live music set the mood.  I had the salt cod which was really delicious and best of all, was served piping hot!  The owner greeted us on the way out and thanked us for coming, a very nice, personal touch.

Food was ok but the service was terrible. Took over an hour to get our food and we weren't even checked up on and took 20 minutes for our check. Spent two hours in here when we could have been doing other things. Probably not always like this but our experience here was bad. Also it was overpriced.
Delicious food and amazing staff!! They are all so wonderful. The dishes come out beautifully prepared. We love this place!! And the pastries are amazing too!!!

I'm so sad to give this place a bad rating because they were really nice and it is so close to my house. However, my partner and I ate dinner here tonight and the food was terrible. I got the curry and the rice tasted old and was hard and crunchy. My partner ordered a burger, medium rare, and it came out almost raw. Both these items seem like standard pub fare, so I'm disappointed they were so bad. If we do go back, it'll be just for drinks.

I had the pepper corn burger.  The lettuce was soggy, the bacon was as thin as paper, the tomato was just as then and discolored and the whole thing when lifted up dripped enough grease to fill my plate.  The bartender was attentive but the food was subpar.

I really wanted to like this place when we first walked in. It was 4 of us. The hostess sat us at a table almost at the door. Kind of frustrating when we saw so many tables further into the restaurant open and it was a cold night (they kept the doors open). I'm not sure exactly what this restaurant is going for. The menu is huge, but all over the place. There's sushi, meatballs, tacos. No set theme I guess. The atmosphere is meant to be casual, as your waiters wear plaid shirts, but prices are a bit high. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. He gave great suggestions on food and drinks. We all placed our orders and the place is tapas style so everything comes out whenever it's ready. First "meal" to come out was the meatballs. Literally, only 3 balls on the plate. Small plate at that. Mind you, a grown man placed this order thinking he'd leave full. Then came the Destin. It was delicious!! But again, small sizes. The other two orders were McHangers. One took forever to come out. By the time I was eating, everyone had finished their meals. The bathroom was clean, but they don't have soap, just hand sanitizer and there was no paper towels. We all left still hungry and regretting our decision a bit. I only give 3 stars because the food was good, but otherwise it would definitely be a 2. Won't be coming back.

This place had the location we were looking for! 

It's right on the water between the bay and the ocean. We ate on the outside patio for dinner and had great views with live music playing. We were in on a Saturday night.

The food was amazing. Grouper fingers are our go to when visiting the beach and this place did not disappoint. The fried shrimp tacos were also great and stuffed with more shrimp than we imagined, but they needed a sauce on them though. Would have been great with a cilantro lime aioli. We added ranch to ours. Mild buffalo shrimp appetizer was a good size and tasted great. 

4 stars because service was a little slow and our waiter seemed to be really busy. Our appetizer also came out after our entrees did. But, couldn't complain too much with great views and great food!

We go early Sunday afternoon and they are out of everything and don't restock.  No mini wheats, no PC coffee pods, no hazelnut creamers, no romaine lettuce ...etc etc.  so frustrating that we spend more time at Walmart.  What is the point of guaranteeing open tills if the shelves are bare? Take some of the till staff and use them to restock!  Saturday and Sunday are peak shopping days and as such management should act accordingly.

was a very very nice upscale restaurant, steak was fabulous , waiters were great but just a little slow but to be expected on a saturday pm, we did have reservations and got seated immediately on time, just the table servers were kinda slow, but all the food was very very piping hot and all entrees we ordered were fabulous !

I won't lie, I was lucky enough to be able to call on an all-star cast of vendors for my Palm Springs wedding, but Joy Marie was, far and away, at the very top of the list.  

Joy is an artist.  Truly.  She has a degree in art.  Her mother is a celebrated artist.  And her pedigree shows in the photography she produces.  She is amazing.

Although you wouldn't exactly know all this when you meet her because she is just so dang down to earth and fun.  You start to goof off around her, all the while not knowing she's capturing you in your best light.  Which is great, because I HATE posing.  

For the sake of brevity, Joy and her talents are beautiful, and she should absolutely be trusted make your most special times eternal.

Great restaurant all around.  Really nice date location.  It's fancy without being overbearing, and the food is wow.  

Our waiter was helpful and pleasant, and was spot on with recommendations.  It's pricey (by our standards anyways), but really delivers for a nice night it location.  My seafood mixed grill was very impressive, with large shrimp and scallops, a crab cake, and a large piece off salmon.  Oh plus two sides.  Definitely left me full.  

No doubt we will be back.

We dropped in for my boyfriend's birthday last night and had a good old time. The music drew us in and the music kept us there until the place shut down. Great band with some serious blues and solid cover choices. It was busy when we walked in but the crowd slowly faded down - it was a Sunday after midnight, after all. The drinks were reasonable and the crowd was mature - this ain't Bourbon Street (thank goodness).

Oh. My. Sweetbabyjesus. Grabbed four cannolis today to go. The flavors were as follows: cookie dough, black cherry, chocolate, and cookies and cream (I think that's what flavor it was..). 

ANYWHO: I might set up a tiny house next to this place because, my gawd. How have I not been to this place before?! SO GOOD. The filling was just light and creamy enough and packed with flavor. The dough was soft and flaky but with just enough snap. 

We happily devoured them whilst raving about the glorious decision we made popping into the shop on our way home. Will definitely be back.

We've used their services twice in the past year.  

Our first experience was with an old laptop that ended up having a bum power jack.  I dropped it off on a Monday afternoon and paid $50 for the diagnostic which I was told would be applied to any work performed beyond the diagnosis.  24 hours later I received a call confirming that all they had to do was replace the jack.  I looked online and figured that I could purchase the parts for $25, but was leery of the amount of time it would take me to complete the fix, and concerned if I could do a quality job.  Long story short, I paid $100 for the fix, but it was worth it because I knew that the work was being done by a professional, and that it would be guaranteed.   

3 months later we dropped off another laptop that was having startup problems.  This time we had a free diagnostic coupon (check out the local coupon circulars you receive in the mail.)  There was also a 25% coupon that they allowed us to use.  Just like the first visit, we received a call within 24 hours with the diagnosis, but this time we received a good/better/best option for the repair.  Their technician explained and helped us weigh the cost/benefit of each.  I'm sure he could have just thrown out the most expensive option, and I would have probably taken his advice because of my perception of him as "an expert" and because I've already had a positive experience with this store.  I really appreciate the fact that he didn't take advantage of me, and as a result, I can say that they've earned a customer for life.

If you're looking for better than decent Italian food but a very nice romantic place Bistro Romano is the clear winner.  I would classify the food as a little better than average but the atmosphere makes up for it.  It's the perfect place for a date.  I have not been there in a few months but I had to write a review because it's always a positive experience every time I go.

One of the best Mexican places I have tried in Philly, up there with Barbacoa and Prima. I had the best hot chocolate ever, very fragrant horchata, and a delicious carnitas torta on really decent bread. The homemade hot sauces were awesome. Bonus - you can play battleship while you wait!

Next time I order fajitas I will bring burn cream.  I know the plates are hot, but hot enough to burn fingers is a bit much.    At least they did taste good.  Waitress was nice, but was covering too many and it took some time to get service and drink

Wow. Completely disappointed in this New Year's Party. We bought tickets for open bar til 2am. They cut people off at 1am. Management is super shady on this. Not only did our tickets we purchase say til 2am they pulled the card that the open bar wasn't listed on the tickets from eventbrite. Management referenced the event on facebook that could have been changed since we bought tickets in November. We purposely bought tickets to this party since it said VIP open bar til 2am. No where did it say on emails or tickets that the bar closed before 2am. We'll never come back here again.
the bartenders there need to go back to school and learn math. sandbar overcharges just like sharkeez!!! beware !!

We tried this place as it was walking distance to our hotel & it looked like a good menu with lots of choices.
We did get to sit outside which was lovely however the food was awful!
We ordered a sushi app which was mediocre at best.
The Filet sandwich was over cooked super well done ( we ordered medium rare) & had zero flavor.
We sent them back & we ordered the grouper sandwich. Again not good at all!! The waitress did not take anything off the bill (not that we asked her to) but she did charge us for the grouper sandwich which was terrible.
Definitely try somewhere else unless you just want to sit by the water & order a glass of wine ( no food).

Can't say enough about this place. The donuts are amazing, from the classic options to the fancier stuff. Very affordable, great location. The venue is off the charts cool, and the folks working there were swell. Highly recommended; easily the best donut shop in the Indy metro.

The best crawfish in New Orleans! And try the decadent Jambalaya fries.. Ta die 4 good! James is fantastic and gave us even more then we could eat! Will always be a place for us to eat during Jazzfest!
Great experience as you can't leave Philly without having a philly steak and cheese hoagie.
We absolutely loved Fork! Great food, atmosphere and our waitress was attentive. Looking forward to spending another date night at Fork!

I was just about to give them 5 stars.. but they just lost one star for the snotty front desk receptionist who answered the phone. I am really happy with the service overall, Bethanne the NP is very upbeat and great at her job and the medical assistant is also very kind and great at her job! The wait is not too bad and they actually answer their phones unlike other places. I recommend this place, once you get past the receptionist the experience with the real professional health care workers are phenomenal!

I only had to-go food but the level of service was just incredible. He noticed from my number that I was from Atlanta, and welcomed me to Nashville. He asked me how far I was so he knew exactly when to put the order in so that the food never got cold. Scoth eggs were delish so were the sheppards pie

This place is absolutely disgusting. I don't know if they treated us so poorly because they knew we were out-of-towners or what, but I was shocked. At one point an owner told the chef--while I was in ear shot--that my sausage "was totally burnt but go ahead and serve it anyways." Unbelievable. If you're just passing through Nashville you may want to consider passing on this place.

AMAZING. 

Their sandwiches are fresh and delicious! You can choose from a variety of meats (lamb, chicken, beef), and to add another kick to your meal, you can pay a little more to make it "lebanese." The flatbread that holds the sandwich is crispy and chewy at the same time.

I tried their lemonade and mint tea. The lemonade tastes very fresh and not too sweet. Their mint tea is just that: mint tea. No frills or covers.

If I lived in Philadelphia, I would probably come here every week...

My husband and I are always a sucker for a place that presents a good cheese plate.  And we were hoping to find it at Amada.  

We went for my birthday and were looking for someplace different.  We had a reservation, which we were on time for, but ended up having to wait at least a half an hour until we were seated.  Now, a busy restaurant is usually a good sign, but I get kind of annoyed when I make a reservation and still end up waiting a while.  To me, that's just kind of rude.  

We waited at the bar and I ordered a drink called "woman on the verge of a nervous breakdown."  As a mother of a fearless toddler, I thought that this was pretty apropos.  

When we were finally seated at our table, I noticed just how "cozy" this place was.  The tables were a little too close for my taste, which made it hard for me to try and hold a conversation.  And I don't really like having to drag my ass across my neighbors table when getting in and out.  

The food was delicious.  I don't think there was a single thing that we ordered that wasn't fantastic.  The server recommended that we each get three things (tapas) and share them,  but two dishes a person is way more than enough.  Especially because you need to save room for dessert.  I ended up getting the manchego mousse, and it was to die for.  

This is a great place to come with a group of people.  I definitely wouldn't go on a first date here.

The staff members on the wine side are always helpful and knowledgeable, and they have a nice selection of chilled beer and wine in the walk-in cooler at the back. The best part about the chilled drinks is that you can purchase them in the wine store, carry them over to the gourmet food/deli side, purchase a cheese platter at the cafe counter, and then sit at a bistro table to nibble cheese and drink your frosty beverage. They have excellent sandwiches at the cafe, also, and a solid stock of local goods in the grocery section (Local Folks Foods and Farm to Kitchen Foods, among others). I've never tried any of the fantastic-looking chocolates behind the candy counter, but they look impressive!

I currently live in the Packard Motor Car building (Reinhold property) and the apartment is great. I can't really complain about much other than the construction that is going on next door, which is obviously out of Reinhold's control. The apartment is gorgeous, the staff is friendly, and the location is ideal. Most importantly, I feel very safe in the building. I wish I could stay longer, but I am a student and need to move a bit closer to school this year.

Food is made fresh. 
Takes a while but is worth it since I don't see or hear any microwaves beeping .
Pour over coffee is delicious. 
Staff is friendly. 

Be patient while they make your order.

Great spot for brunch!

I've been several times and always have a great experience. The servers are pleasant and the food comes out quickly. The latest visit I had lots of special requests due to dietary restrictions. They were happy to accommodate. 

The food is always prepared as asked and more importantly it's delicious! All typical American breakfast items can be ordered and serving sizes are very large. 

The wait times can be long on weekends. So just plan on that if you're having brunch at a peak time. But weekdays you can almost always be seated immediately.  They have wifi as well so it's a great meeting space if you have breakfast meetings planned.

Instrument Music has a knowledgeable staff that takes the time to help customers discover and try the product they are looking for.  No pressure just great accommodation from these guys.  IM is a true gem for musicians! And a shout out to Marvin, a great manager who elevates customer service to new heights!

SOHO - not sure why. This place brims with potential, but it's not so close to living up to it. There are small things that left me ambivalent about SOHO. For one, the pizza options are definitely unique; however, they don't always pan out as excitingly as they do harmlessly waiting behind the converted deli case. The cheesesteak pizza, for example, isn't worth it. The cheese whiz on pizza was not what I anticipated, meaning it was kind of nauseating. My other complaint, just to clear the air, was that my pizza was lukewarm. They throw it in the oven for a few seconds to heat it up, but a solid minute or two was definitely in order for these slices. 

It's a tough racket to open a pizza place. In Philly, there's one on every block. NYPD pizza, Old City Pizza, and every single Italian restaurant in the city come readily to mind. What SOHO has going for it is that it's at least different from the rest of the Market Street fare. What it needs is a staff that's a little better-trained (couldn't recommend the pizzas, just offered a generic 'everything's good') and a process to get the pizza to the right temp before dishing it out to customers. On top of that, they could reconsider the pizzas they sell by the slice. They're creative, I'll give them that, but I'd love to see that creativity go toward something better than their cheesesteak pizza or the mediocre buffalo chicken pizza. I was tempted, based on the sheer potential of the place, to give SOHO a 3-star review. If they really reconsidered how they went about it, spiced up their options and had a few more inviting faces behind the counter, this could even be a 4-star stopover in Old City worth a vist on occasion. Could be a standard if they raised their standards.
Great bbq. Come here to watch the games sometimes. The wings are nice and big and the sides are excellent. The sauce is what makes it too. Tons if beer and the scenery aint bad either

Love this place. 
Two Favorite food items- Beef Sopapilla (try with egg on top) or their twist on tamales. 
Margarita ingredients are fresh and very tasty. 
Atmosphere is what you make it. I've felt comfortable in dressy or casual attire. 
Price point is normal for area, but slightly more than traditional Mexican restaurants.

I came here to watch the Laker's game the other night, my date wanted to show me this little treasure of a spot. Luckily he has fantastic taste, because I loved the food and drinks! The interior is dark and old fashioned, you feel like you're in a speak easy. 

 I had a mojito, which was just right... not too sweet, yet still refreshing and tasty. He had some sort of cocktail that had pasteurized egg white, I forget what it was called, but it was great too. We split the steak salad (steak was cooked rare and PERFECT), and also a bbq chicken wrap with pasta salad. It was just the right amount, their portions are generous. The food was very flavorful. 

I saw on the menu that on weekends, they have brunches with a bloody mary bar. I'll for sure be hitting that up! Also, every night of the week has some sort of special. wednesdays they have $5 spaghetti dinner night, I think it includes salad and roll. Try it!

Overrated and overpriced. The char-grilled oysters were "eh." Much better at Acme's. The Caesar salad was awful. The lettuce just tasted old. I sent it back and asked for a house salad which came drenched with dressing. I had the Mixed grill which really didn't have a lot of flavor and the petite filet was really "petite."
My husband had the Cajun baked fish of the day which he really enjoyed.
Skip the creme brûlée. I can make much better.
The waiter started out good but once we had our entrees (while still on our salads), we were pretty much ignored.  And it was loud!
Get your seafood somewhere else.

This is a great Nature Walk and not much of a hike. Very moderate elevation change and a great place for the family or a walk with the dog. Beautiful views of the valley floor and gods beauty. 15 minute drive up a switchback style road which is paved with ample parking for any size vehicle.

On the Frenchman St. strip of music joints, I think Maison takes the cake.  Plenty of room, a good crowd and no cover.  What more could you ask for?

Maybe a guy cooking steaks on a charcoal grill on the sidewalk right next door... Oh, did I mention? He's there, too.

For a change of pace on set breaks, you can always run across the street to the shoebox Japanese place for a lower-key vibe.

Very cool place. It was raining all day and we needed to find a place we could grab a late lunch with our dog. They let us sit on the patio even though it was still drizzling. Wiped everything down and served great burgers and hot fried chicken sandwich. Onion rings, fries, and homemade ketchup were awesome.
Update: after my review i was told to email them. It's been about two weeks and no one has contacted me . I have been given the run around.  Waste of time even emailing them.
Possibly the worst pizza I ever had.   Terrible.  Burnt, soggy in middle.  No flavor.   Will never return.

Giant mistake to book the company. They were supposed to be here yesterday between 8 - 1. Called the day before and said the truck was broken down and being repaired so my move time was changed to 1 - 4. Didn't happen. I was put off all day but repeatedly guaranteed my move would happen yesterday. At 9:00pm after I've waited all day and based my day full of decisions on movers coming - I'm told it has to be put off to the next day. So. I took a day off for no reason and now the leather couch and dresser I don't have movers for had to sit in a pick up truck over night as it snows. I was told they would call me first thing this morning. Didn't happen. When I finally talked to someone at 10am they said 1 hour. It is now nearly 1:30pm and I was just told 2.5 more hours. Incredibly angry.
5:00 and still no movers and no one is answering my phone calls.

I see your rating has been going down steadily since you opened. I used to be a regular until too many of my trips there were messed up by being under cooked, having missing ingredients or none at all, or being cold. I think it's great that you reply to everyone's reviews but you really should think about changing up the same copy and pasted response you give to each. Does anyone really reply to you? Think about making some real changes to the establishment instead of giving canned responses to people's reviews and maybe you'll gain back some customer base.

secret breakfast place that is not the secret, but adds to the fun of it.  free coffee, pleasant staff, decent prices, good food, lively atmosphere, mainly locals.  everything i want in a local place in new hope :)        decent bagels that are made on prem, good pastries, and all items on the menu are above average, you cannot go wrong with what you order.   expect a wait after 8/9 timeframe, or almost anytime on weekends.  always have parking available nearby.
Great deal on my car and even better w service. I've never owned a Chevrolet before Bryner but I may never own another car brand after owning my Tahoe for the last 12 months. Just awesome

Ok so if you don't get your coffee here, there's something wrong with you.  The baristas are amazing- they make everything catered perfectly to your taste- killinCan't go wrong with a cannoli, cookie, and a fine panini for lunch.  Best weekend spot in Philly.

Good standard Mexican fare. Fast service. I liked the atmosphere, it was like an old school American diner but with Mexican food. 

Prices are a tad high though.

Had a nice lunch here today with my daughter and everything was great.  This location has only been open a few weeks, and the staff is doing a great job so far running the place.  I hadn't been to a Panera in a while, because I had been feeling that they were raising the prices and serving skimpier portions.

Yes, I still think the prices are a bit on the high side ($28 for two you pick two combos and two drinks - almost 15 bucks apiece!?!) because I know of plenty of other places I can get a real nice salad or sandwich and a drink for more like 10 or 12 bucks.  But at least today, I felt like the size and quality of the food was more worth it.

The place was packed with a line the entire time we were there and the staff handled it smoothly and didn't seem stressed at all.  Kudos to them.  Since it is on my route to work, I plan to stop in for breakfast sometime if I have a little extra time.  I think this Panera is a great addition to the area and will do a good business here.

Casual american food with good sized portions and fleetwood mac playing in the background. I stopped by here yesterday for brunch with a few friends. The staff was very attentive and courteous. Our guy was very personable and talkative, but didn't over do it. Drinks were refilled quickly. The atmosphere was a little hipster as it tends to be dtsp. Casual clothing. 

Now the food. We started out with a charcuterie plate after I asked him how you pronounce "charcuterie". Duck bacon, lamb belly, breakfast sausage, smoked salmon, pickled eggs, brie, and bleu cheese. It was all very good but the standout for me was the duck bacon and pickled eggs. 

Main course. I couldn't decide on what to get as there are far too many good looking options on the brunch menu. I ended up getting the lo coso nostro which is a chicken sandwich plated with house potatoes covered with fried shallots, peppers, and pimento cheese. Very good. I stole a few bites from friends plates: a waffle, and not your mommas grilled cheese. 

My favorite part of the meal was the charcuterie plate. They did mix up two of the plates for two of our meals and a friend did say that her grilled cheese was a little over toasted. My food was good. I would like to come back and check out the dinner menu as it looks interesting. Other than that, for me, I would probably come back for a few drinks and the meat plate.

Stopped here for dinner and the food and service was excellent. Locally sourced ingredients fill the menu with dishes that were definitely tasty. Definitely will stop back the next time we're here to visit.

This review is for sushi only. Overall, not a bad sushi spot! Wasn't blown away by anything but the sushi was good and the ambiance/environment is nice. Prices aren't too bad, and you do get a free soup or salad when you order sushi which is a plus. The sushi bar does appear a bit small. I wouldn't come back unless I'd be in the area. I don't know how the hibachi and other offerings are.

I love Companion Pet Hospital. Love love love love love.

This place is amazing. And it's so eco-friendly. My cat seemed to suddenly have a urinary block. I called and Companion said they had no open appointments that day, but to just bring him in because it sounded like an emergency. I brought him in and, despite it being my first time there, was greeted by name by the reception staff when I opened the door. The vet tech, Alicia (who is awesome) came out and also greeted me by name without even checking with the reception staff, aka, she was notified that I was coming in and actually remembered my name and my cat's name. 

My cat was immediately given an exam and rushed into surgery. The pricing was really fair - you can't expect vets to be cheap nowadays, and I believe they were still much cheaper than what some other places (VCA *cough* *Cough*) would charge, and they actually showed real results! My final cost was even $500 lower than my low-end estimate. He was in and out within 48 hours, and he's all better now. The staff was friendly, knowledgable, and even let me visit him. They said to bring him back any time because they totally loved him.

Companion Pet is awesome. They take care of you and are totally helpful and reasonable. As a bonus they're paperless, and they utilize green technology. I can't say enough good things. They're everything I'd want and more from a veterinarian.

The long and short of it... pretty good evening!

We were met at the door by our server. Scotty showed up to the table and went over the specials as one would be accustomed. They had a piano player and singer. Which were good, oldies (70's) so not really my cup of tea, but good enough not to distract. Appetizers were good, salmon and lamb were also. 

What made the night was Scotty, very attentive to the table...

We stopped by the Ardmore Farmers Market after hearing about the launch of the latest DiBruno Bros location there.  Between the Main Line suburbans and the fact that it was a Saturday afternoon, we were a little overwhelmed by the hustle and bustle.

Having said that, the place is airy and clean.  We browsed through the Stoltzfus stalls and peeked at their dizzying range of meats and poultry.  They've also got a Great Harvest Bread stall, a couple of Asian takeout places, a seafood counter, and a florist at the entrance.

A little pricey in parts, but given the area and the proximity to Suburban Square, the price is a given.

Been here for 50 minutes and ordered food 40 minutes ago. Our sever today is horrible, unlike or previous visits. No one checked on us or let us know when or if our food was coming. Food finally came out and it was nothing like we ordered. Go to Ihop if you need a place for late night. At least you'll get the food you ordered.

A little on the expensive side for things like tataki but definitely worth the money as the food is very good here. Expect to send around 20$ to be completely full which is not too bad for good sushi. I had the beef udon which was delicious as well as the California hand roll which was larger than I expected which was a plus, also very delicious. My friend got the rainbow roll which I tried and enjoyed also. I definitely will be returning
Food is great, brunch was good too! Customer service is amazing! Welcome to Brentwood!

Recent service visit was as good as it gets, easy to make the appointment, out quickly, priced right and warranty coverage for one small annoying item.  Service advisor very friendly and personable.  In the process of purchasing another truck from same sales person.

We like to go to Clubhouse as one of our options with a little one ( 2 year old ).  Food is decent and consistent. You know what you are getting. There are always plenty of people with kids at the restaurant which brings me to my sticking point. You have high chairs, you accommodate children, but you do NOT offer any sort of kids menu. 

Tonight we spent $15 for a chicken quesadilla and some fries for a 2 year old. That's kind of ridiculous. If I'm going to be honest, it will be a deterrent from us going to Clubhouse for lunch or dinner if we have our kid with us. 

You already have a full menu, just resize some options and offer as a kids menu. I'm not spending $15 for a chicken quesadilla and some fries for a toddler again.

This place had really good bread sticks and garlic bread with cheese . The pizza was good but not as good as I was expecting .  The service was good . Very clean inside including the bath rooms . I would go if I was a local .But I will not drive from were I live just to get it .

Great quick little tacos - order a few at least for a meal.  The beef burrito was excellent as well.  Well flavored and nice mix of spices/ingredients to create a unique and exciting dish in a simple format.

3/31/15, 8:25 pm: Is there a bread shortage? Is this an early April Fools day joke?  I got a SLIVER, and I do mean sliver, of bread with My cup Of soup tonight.  I posted a picture but Yelp apparently defaults in such a way that you'll have to scroll through the older photos to get to the most recent. I laughed out loud at the pick up counter. Anyone finding this at other stores? 
At least the soup tastes great as usual.

I, for one, had no problems with the seating, paint or carpeting.  All I remember is the show, a live version for the claymation tv x-mas special Rudolph The Red Nose Reindeer. The thespian portraying Yukon Cornelius was especially magnificent.

My husband and l went to Taste last Saturday night, the night before Valentine's Day. When we arrived at Taste the hostess told us there was a private event at the restaurant that night, but we could go to their other restaurant, next door. 

When the hostess led us to the other restaurant, the bartender told her he was too busy to have anymore guests. She suggested we sit in the basement. We did and the bartender came down several minutes later. He told us he'd bring water and menus in a minute. We asked that he also wipe our dirty table.

After waiting 15 minutes for him to return, my husband went upstairs to get menus. The bartender told him he was too busy upstairs to help downstairs. Eventually a server came down. She was very pleasant but inept.

At this point there were 4 other parties in the basement. She took our order first but brought everyone else's food before ours. She didn't bring my entree as she didn't hear me order it. She offered to get it for me but my husband was nearly done eating at this point. She also offered to get us free desserts. What I really wanted was my dinner!

We felt trapped as it was the night before Valentine's Day and all restaurants in the area were full.  What a disaster.
Who doesn't love a good fruit tea? This pace has quickly become our go to on Sunday afternoon. Great service, good food, nice atmosphere and never a long wait. We will surely be back again!!

We had heard good things about this recently opened Mexican restaurant. We stopped in tonight for dinner  and were extremely happy! The food was freshly prepared and very good. The fresh guacamole with crab meat appetizer was delicious. My husband enjoyed his entree- Pollo Mexicano chicken breast covered with poblano peppers & Oaxaca cheese. My tilapia & shrimp entree was nicely seasoned (my request for a scant amount of jalapeño was honored with a smile). We will be back
and probably often!

hooray for this place.  had a small black coffee served by a small blonde woman, left with a large ear to ear grin

the espresso bean candy is a nice touch as the set up is great.  doesnt matter how you get your vehicle or vessel in there as theres no one way or wrong way just keep an eye out is all

great midday pick me up on mccarran
Delicious food and the buffet really hit the spot!  Our Lyft driver recommended this place and he didn't steer us wrong....definitely worth the trip
Ordered shirts from here, sizing was off and we orderd lots of shirts. They didn't help whatsoever with the size discrepancy. They were not very nice either.

I bought a hitch on amazon and had it installed on my wifes Kia Soul at this U-Haul not only where they able to do it with out an appointment the wait was under 40 minutes all at a price that would be hard to beat. If I ever need a hitch installed on any of my future vehicles I will return to U-Haul.

First time there tonite. Decor is nice.  Noisy. Wait staff was ok. Hamburger was good. Fries greasy and Luke warm. Chicken pot pie was tasty. They did offer refills on drinks, unlike comment on other review. Breakfast menu looks interesting.  Everything was over priced. Maybe we'll try them again in a few months after they get some bugs worked out or maybe for breakfast.... If the curse of the location doesn't do them in. We wish them well.

This restaurant recently introduced a new lunch buffet featuring beef in a variety of preparations. You know there's a problem when the best thing on a menu promoting beef is the onion rings.

The onion rings are perfect, just the right thickness with a nicely spiced breading, and not at all greasy. The steak fries were thick wedges done to a golden brown, also not greasy but unfortunately coated with so much salt they were inedible.

Now for the various beef dishes. The cheesesteak sandwich was a combination of the Philly classic and traditional grilled cheese. The meat was paper thin as it should be, but the peppers and onions were a little too thick, which made them too crunchy because they weren't cooked through. They were piled on a slice of white bread, covered with a slice of processed American cheese, topped with another slice of white bread, and then grilled on both sides. Certainly not your typical Philly cheesesteak, but at least it was flavorful.

The chopped sirloin steak was so dry it had the consistency of sawdust. The so-called Swedish meatballs were covered with a sauce containing a mystery ingredient we couldn't identify that gave them a very odd taste. The sliders were as thick as hockey pucks and just as hard. The pot roast was dry and tasteless.

Many of the old choices, like roast chicken and mashed potatoes, are still here and still good. We thought the macaroni and cheese was greatly improved. In the past, it was overcooked and swimming in a sauce that tasted artificial. This time it was al dente, dry (in a good way), and tasted like it was made with real cheese. It actually had a nice crust on it. I don't know if this change was intentional or a fluke, but they should keep making it this way.

The bread pudding is very good. Most of the other desserts are too sweet. The sugar-free chocolate pudding is surprisingly rich and tasty.

I think business here might be down - the place was nearly empty at 1:30pm - and maybe that's what prompted them to try a new menu. Now they might want to consider hiring a few new cooks who know how to prepare beef right.

P.S. They serve a weekend breakfast that's much better than this new lunch and worthy of three stars.

Good but not great. Beautiful room and attentive staff are big credits. And, I really enjoyed the wine that was recommended by the menu and waiter as appropriate to my meal. 

However, the pretentious and expensive menu meets the diner only half-way. Plates are artfully prepared but the flavors underwhelm. My duck dish that was to include fois gras seemed to have only a hint of the fois atop the the duck breasts. The "summer beet" risotto was stunning and really rather good, except that there was no hint of beet other than the purple dye in the rice. 

A nice effort and a lovely venue, which included the music from a guitarist wafting in from the bar next door. But, whether or not I'll return and pay a handsome sum for a blase experience remains to be seen.
We all got together there to have breakfast before we headed back home to Florida. The service was good. The food was very good. The variety allowed each to have their choice of food. See photos.

This little Tokyo used to have hibachi, but it's no longer there. I was very disappointed, but we ate there anyway. Apparently they're doing some refurbishing and replacing the hibachi with something better- 

The pho honestly tasted like heaven. Ever wondered what heaven taste like? Then come to this place. We had a few sushi rolls and some Pho. The pho was the beef and it tasted a little salty. The staff overheard me and gave us complimentary rolls of sushi! Very nice people at this place.

So my pregnant friend wanted to go here because her baby is craving red meat and fried pickles.  I am not a food snob, I knew what to expect.  I know this place is a chain and I'm not bashing it because of that.  

The fried pickles were pretty tasty and the blooming onion or whatever it was called was also as good as a fried onion usually is.  My steak would have been pretty good too if it was actually cooked the way I wanted it -medium rare...it was more like raw/rare.  But I know better than to complain about an undercooked steak...you will get it back and it will be grossly overcooked.  I'd rather just chance it and eat the rare meat and pray I don't get food poisoning and/or crap myself.   I was in luck, I didnt end up crapping myself!

My complaint is on the level of cleanliness.  I know the throw your peanut shells on the floor thing is part of the appeal of this place and part of the fun.  But what it does is it lets the people that work there ignore OTHER trash on the floor.  Accidentally dropped dirty napkins and food products on floor are just left there.  Forever. Because its supposedly part of the fun!  Just throw shit on the floor!  Its fun!   Maybe I'm being a stick in the mud, but I felt like I was eating in a friggin dumpster.  At least the bathrooms were clean.

If you ever wanted to relive the bar cave moment from the first Christopher Nolan Batman movie then this is the place to go. Except it's under a bridge. After scaring away the potential homeless sleeping under the bridge you will arrive upon a plaque with various fun facts describing the massive colony under the bridge. The bat shit crazy part is the fact that you'll definitely either step into bat feces or have them dropped on to you by the flying rodents themselves. 

Best time to go is about an hour before sunset. The bats typically emerge 45 minutes before sunset.

I love the Ritz. They play films that I actually want to see. At this theater they only usually play one or two films, whereas the other locations (close by) play more films. They have vegan cookies for sale at this location, which are fantastic. I also like that the sodas have free refills. The theater is always clean and I like the mix of people who attend this theater. I will keep coming back to the Ritz East theater.

Stopped by to grab a bite to eat before going grocery shopping, because you know, you should never shop hungry.  I was pleasantly surprised !  I had the orange chicken with brown rice.  The flavor was good and light, not too sweet.  There were slices of fresh orange peel in the sauce.  Although there seemed to be a lot of breading on the chicken for my liking, it was tasty!  I had enough food for two meals (no cooking for me tonight), so this was definitely a great value meal!  No five stars because of the dine in area.  It could use a good mopping and overall wipe down.  There are no decorations or welcoming ambience.  I will definitely eat from here again, but most likely, it will be take out.

I fear these types of restaurants.  Hibachi *can* be done well but every one that I've been to (this one included)  muddles it down to "if we set things on fire, perhaps they won't notice that the food is bleh drowning in some form of sauce.".

Well, I noticed.

What an awesome whole foods! Huge store with a. Great selection! Love the local NOLA items! The food is fresh just like every other whole foods I've been to. The cashiers were friendly too! Store is clean.

I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the Megabus.  After a few bad experiences with New Century Travel and a horrible experience with the Bolt Bus, I'd almost given up on bus travel to NYC.  After reading all the awful reviews of Megabus, I was prepared for the worst.  Luckily everything was fine!

We took the 11:30am bus from Philly to NYC on Saturday (note: we didn't take it on the way back so can't comment on the NYC to Philly end of it).  We arrived about 10 minutes early.  It was easy to find and not confusing at all.  The Megabus boards right next to the Bolt Bus, west side of 30th St. Station and New York was the only bus boarding at the time.  Everyone was standing in an orderly line and we had no trouble finding 2 seats together.  And we got to ride on top of the double-decker bus...fun!

We left about 10 minutes after the scheduled departure time.  We got to NYC well past the 2pm (scheduled ETA was 1:30pm) due to traffic, but you can't fault them for that. I did not use the outlets or Wi-Fi, so I have no idea if they actually work.  One complaint is that it was COLD on that upper level.  I was wearing my winter coat, scarf and gloves and still felt the chill. 

Unlike the Bolt Bus, the seats are first come, first serve based on when you arrive to the bus, not how early you book your ticket.  I like that, as most of the time the trip is a last minute decision. I guess Megabus is hit or miss and I happened to have a 'hit' experience.  I'll keep using it until I have a 'miss'.

I received bills over and above what my insurance say I owed. According to Seventh St, the amount my ins pays "is not enough" so they must upgrade me (ie, charge me, the customer, more) to make up the difference. Unfortunately, when a vendor agrees to accept payment from an insurance company they cannot bill the customer more. That's called balance billing and it is illegal in most states, including where I reside.

This is, by far, the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to in all of the U.S.  The food is incredibly fresh and delicious, and their buffet (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday during lunch hours) is out of this world!  The portions are very generous and the owners are delightful to talk to.  I have been going to Saffron since the very first day it opened (I was a fan of the previous Indian restaurant in this location, but Saffron really put them to shame with my first bite), and their food has remained consistently exceptional.  I've brought many people who were unfamiliar with Indian food, or felt they wouldn't like it.  Saffon has made converts out of every single one of them!  I feel blessed to live so close to such a wonderful restaurant.  Keep up the good work, Sunita, Nimesh, and Saffron! I look forward to many more years of your fabulous cuisine.
Food is good but service is very slow.   Their to go phone line doesn't work and the menu online is an old one.

Five stars for food. Excellent idea adding an oyster menu! They were perfect! 
The mussels Red were great and the lobster roll was tasty. Fries on point as usual. 
Not sure if our waitress was new or the kitchen screwed up, there were a few issues with the cold food coming out LAST. they screwed up an order and we were never offered bread for dipping and of course, asked for it. 
Otherwise, this was a nice change as no one had a food complaint!

I have made it here twice, and the food was excellent both times. The kitchen area looks wonderfully aged, so it would seem this place has been around a while. I'm not surprised. The food was terrific, and it would be my first choice the next time I'm back in that part of town.

Disappointed  I'm usually a fan, so much so, I invited two friends, who have never been, to meet me there yesterday for some biz talk. We ordered lattes, a green tea matcha and an almond milk latte. The green tea looked awesome, but MY latte looked green tea-ish as well. I politely let the woman behind the counter, I believe the owner,  know. She looked confused and was either irritated at me or her barista. She wasnt happy about the order mix up and it showed. She was clearly annoyed, but willing to make the drink over. 
Thankfully the barista who actually remade the drink apologized for the mix up and really tried to redeem the poor customer service of the owner.

Wonderful place, and my dog has been very happy there.  My only complaint is that it is so small that frequently they do not have availability in the middle of the week and they do book months in advance but even then it is a little tight.  But I'm always happy to know that when my dog is there when I'm at work and being cared for by such wonderful professionals!

HORRIBLE service!!! So bad!!! Worst I've had in as long as I can remember- slow, unfriendly, inattentive. Biscuits and gravy not great. Gravy did not taste home made or fresh at all. Had a sampler tray for an app and was pretty good but honestly the service was so terrible I couldn't enjoy anything.

Great place to take in live music and enjoyed a very cheap ginger ale. Band was wonderful, really dug their sound. Friendly service and a great decor. Tourist-pleaser for sure but what more could you want. Would love to come back later in evening as was not busy when we were there. Would recommend this place for a fun band and a drink!

These guys are great. Sergio is a hands on owner who is on site almost all the time. He has a great group of stylists, especially Jasmin who has done a great job with my hair. I'm very particular with my hair and she just knock the ball out of the park. I plan to continue to patronize these guys for a long while especially thanks to her.  Oh, the complementary scalp message is great too!
Louie salad with extra crab!! Heavenly. Sashimi sushi tuna expensive and not impressive. Good service overall.

This is one of the best nail salons I have ever been to! Just went and got a full set of acrylic nails last week and I am still in love with the results. The owner Kim Tran and her husband are amazing people, they treat you like a guest in their home. Full sets start at $17 which is extremely cheap for such good quality of work. They also offer you a free beverage of your choice with any service!

First time coming to Marketplace Express! 
My girlfriend and I came for sandwiches after the museum.
We grabbed our drinks and ordered the Italian and the Chicken Thai sandwiches.
My chicken thai was fairly spicy, but the provolone cheese softened the spice. 
My lovely lady had the Italian which she enjoyed, but wasn't a fan of the bread. 
(Try the pumpernickel!)
We do not recommend the cheesecake, for lack of flavor and texture. 
There is a good amount of small tables, and many snacks to choose from. A lot of the tables were dirty and still had crumbs on them. 
The tables are my favorite part, though. The tables have music notes and music symbols on them. Absolutely cool. 
Come here for a rainy day - there's hot tea!

Ordered here again the other night.  Pizza delivery with fries and rings.  Pizza was thick, which is how I like it, rings were good.  I didn't have the fries but didn't hear any complaints from those who did.  Overall, a decent pizza.

Mayte is amazing!  I had a barnstormer of a headache and was extremely tense all over because of exercising hard and not stretching good, combined with sitting at my desk for the past three days working on the computer nonstop for eight hours each day.  She worked out all the kinks. I Carrows the aromatherapy for the first time too, I also think that helped!  I definitely recommend Mayte!!!

Second time here and I still thought the charbroiled oysters were just OK. My husband agrees. He remembers the charbroiled oysters tasting much better on his previous visits.  I had the Grilled Shrimp Pasta w/Creole Sauce. I didn't think it was that special, but I didn't hate it. It just tasted like spaghetti to me (which I love spaghetti so that's why I didn't mind). However, we both really enjoyed the Tuna Aioli and the Chargrilled Lobster. For those, we will still go back whenever we're back in NOLA. YUM!!

Clean.  Adequate menu, but many items are spicy, so if one isn't into spicy, selections are somewhat limited.  The music was too loud -- certainly not relaxing.  Take the advertisement of 15 meals under $10 with a grain of salt -- most of them are $9.99 and with tax come to over $10.  The garden salad bar is a BIG plus.  The pretzel burgers are great if you have them specially made without the spicy stuff.

If you like French cuisine then you have to try the Chateau West. We had the Brie fondue as an appetizer and it was 10/10. I could've made a meal out of that. For my entree I tried the special that Saturday which was flounder with roasted vegetables and brown capers. A solid 9.5 out of 10 there. I really was full but my wife convinced me to split the Paris-Brest dessert with her. It was another 10/10. It was a pastry with hazelnut almond and cream. What put it over-the-top was the caramel. So tasty. Our waiter was attentive without being overbearing. The price was quite reasonable and it was a great dining experience.

I'll state again that being the spouse of a snowball-holic kind of makes me a snowball fan as well.  Therefore, I often find myself making impromptu stops at snowball stands all across the city.  Just this past Sunday, I was prompted to go to Piety Street snowballs to give them a try.

The wifey opted to try a side by side snowball whereby you get two flavors served side by side, as opposed to layered one on top another.  The ice had a failry smooth consistency and was somewhere in the "middle of the road" between coarse like shaved ice and velvety smooth.

The flavors she chose were raspberry rose hips on one side and lime mint on the other.  The raspberry rose hips were too subtle, but would probably be good for someone who is looking for a refreshing dessert that was very unobtrusive and leaves practically no syrup aftertaste.  However, the lime mint was a real treat.  The lime had just enough tartness to make your mouth pucker (my mouth is watering now just thinking about it) but the cool mint aftertaste is very subtle and helps subdue the tartness of the lime.  To me, this is a great spring / summer flavor.

The line on a Sunday afternoon was only 3-4 people deep and we were served in less than 5-6 minutes.

All in all this was a pretty good snowball.  Perhaps we;ll go back and sample a few more offerings.  If so, I'll be sure to update this review.

Last Friday night we stopped in on a whim. Actually the Irish pub across the street was jam packed. But thankfully it was. Bru is a gem in Philly. Fantastically decorated with rock and the backbeat looks like something I wish I had in my wedding photo. Great. The staff was abundantly available and friendly. The manager Maureen or Marilyn was top notch. I apologize if I mess the name up. 

The beer from the many taps were organized on a clean menu describing country of origin and style. So with my background in the bar biz I tend to be a snob about fresh tap beer. You can tell the staff and management care about their customers. The beer was fresh as the day it was brewed and barreled. I was very impressed.  

To you folks hoping to get a little lucky across the street at the Irish pub, stop over at Bru first and Prost! To a great place!

Good food and great dessert but very expensive. I would recommend for people looking for a nice date night but would not go here very often. We told them it was our first time and we were celebrating our anniversary so they gave us a free dessert which was really good. The service was good but since we don't have a bunch of money it felt like we were being pushed to spend more on many things that we didn't want.
Small craft beer oriented place. We didn't try any food, but we enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere for a quick beer break

Menu looked good and high end. Just not what we wanted. Only had a salad and cocktails. Menu is limited but quality. We decided to eat across the street at Blue Ox BBQ which was best bbq I've ever had. Better than anything in Texas.

This is hands down our favorite neighborhood go-to sports bar. Service is always friendly and willing  I accommodate anything we've ever asked to switch on our orders. I've tried several different items on the menu (BBQ chicken salad, the bacon cheeseburger, the Cabo wrap) and all of it was very good. I love their sweet potato fries. We always recommend this place to others.

I saw all the negative reviews and gave it a try anyway because I had an Axxess deal, and was very pleasantly surprised!  My sister and I enjoyed dinner so much we were back for breakfast the next weekend, and will definitely return again!  Service was quick & attentive, and the food was REALLY good.

I used to like this place a lot, great food, service, and decor back then. I went this last week with a party of four and I was very unhappy with my experience. The service was non-existent at the beginning when we asked for our drinks and the hostess kept us waiting for almost 30 minutes before getting our food orders. When we finally got to order food (apps and main entrees) they brought everything out at the same time and we didn't even have enough space on the table. Instead of offering to hold the main food she stood there expecting us to make room out of nowhere on the table. Some of the appetizers were alright, but the main kebabs for my entree were overcooked and charred, I could see the black over my kebobs and vegetables. After they brought the food out, they then came to the table many times asking if they should take things away which was a surprise to me as their service was non-existent at the beginning of our dinner. The decor for this place was a joke. They had two formal chairs setup in the front as if there was a wedding party and had disco lights shining the whole restaurant; my friend from Lebanon who joined me commented that it was what you would see at a ghetto restaurant in the middle east. This is not the sheesh it used to be and I will not be coming back.

Word of advice: Look at the latest reviews, some of them are years old.
Great Cuban food at affordable prices. A real gem in the city and hope they get bigger. Also seating is in back too not just upfront.

I can not express how disappointed I was with both the food and the service last night.  After I have raved about this place to everyone. My two good friends took me their for dinner for my birthday.
Rr Our server might as well ignored us, he barely checked on us at all. We either had to waive him down or ask another server to find him, which I hate doing. My friend had a dirty glass. That was first, ok accidents happen. I asked for extra olive oil butter he bought me out a few bottles of herbs for me to prepare myself..huh? How would I know what or how much to add.  He totally forgot my dinner salad and when3 I reminded him his response was "well do you still want it?"  I normally get the shrimp scampi which is generally =0delicious was dry as a bone. I requested linguini or spaghetti for a thicker pasta than angel hair. It was a disaster. The manager came over and asked had everything been corrected which showed that he cared. He did not offer anything as a sorry for the inconvenience..not a comped drink or appetizer nothing. I usually go during the week . this was a Friday night. Still no excuse it was not packed there were plenty of open tables. So disappointed!!

My family was visiting Santa Barbara for the week and we wanted to try some good restaurants. Barbareño is exactly what Santa Barbara needs! I come here about once or twice a month and I have never had a meal this good. There were 7 if us and we had 5 different appetizers and 7 mains. The service was wonderful and helpful in choosing wines and beers. The chambongs were such a fun start!

A classic Kimpton meets Santa Barbara. Very nice property big rooms classic Kimpton touches like morning coffee and wine hour. They even took care of the boy by making his hot chocolate for him. 

The restaurant is very high quality with a great bar staff. 

Roof top pool was nice but a bit small. Parking is limited but valet staff are solid. 

Location is perfect for city visiting

This is an amazing, relaxing, romantic hotel.  My husband and I enjoyed the beautiful views and attentive service.  Our room was large and small touches were everywhere.  I loved the heated floor in the bathroom, the bath salts and very long and deep tub.  The gardens are carefully kept, and the pool is intimate.  We had dinner two nights and found the food to be carefully prepared and interesting, the wine list excellent, and the service professional and friendly.  The snack menu was also great, we arrived from New York mid-afternoon and had smoked salmon with a glass of wine and a extraordinary coastal view.  The  Huevos Rancheros for breakfast is really excellent - a must try!   Overall a great getaway in a sophisticated and yet friendly environment.

To enjoy shopping here you have to be great at looking through racks and knowing what's going to look good on you, or yes you will be here forever. As a shopper I have found some of my best pieces here. Leather Anne Klien boots with the tags still on $35, Luck brand T-shirt dress $16, Anthropologie skirt  $30. At times it's definitely hit or miss, but I have always found the prices to be fair or better than expected.

When you sell your clothes here you will be offered cash on the spot or a higher percentage back in store credit. Whenever I have sold my clothes here I was surprised at the things that they didn't want, seeing as how my brands were higher end and better quality than 40% of what they sell in the store. The trick seems to be to look nice when you go in, and to offer your better pieces.

It's a yoghurt shop so yes it's good. Nice real cookie dough pieces which is my plus.
Check in on Facebook for free ounce. You may as well.

My family came here last night around 5:00 last night to celebrate my niece's birthday. There were 7 of us. I do not remember what everyone else had to eat but I went for the Grilled Jalapeno-lime Shrimp,it had a black bean,corn salsa,cilantro, grilled zucchini, marinated tomatoes, onions,red peppers and rice.$11.49. I almost did not order it afraid that it might be too spicy, because of the jalapeno. It was spicy but not over powered by the jalapeno. The tomatoes were very tasty, and the other vegetables were cooked just right not cooked to death like zucchini often is. The shrimp were a nice size and there were quite a few . I thought the dish was a good balance of flavors , not over powered by any one item. Everyones food looked good and  all were happy with what they got.   When we were finished with our dinner they brought out the cake that we had brought in that they had kept in their refit  while we were eating. As they came one they sang happy birthday.  The service was excellent, I wish that I remembered the waiters name, because he did a very good job , refilling everyones drinks at just the right time! Thank you for the pleasant mealtime! We will go back.

Why did I wait so long to dine here?

I was thrilled to try this place for my anniversary dinner.  (BYOB & CASH only)

Cutting right to the chase.....

Escargot and Pork Ribs for apps (first plate), Pork Trio and Pork tenderloin for entrees (second plate) and a Creme brulee for dessert.  Every portion was a good size, but a couple could probably do with 1 app and 2 entrees.  Everything was great and I was incredibly full.  The flavors are definitely there.

This is a small place with a romantic feel.  Service was good and intimate.

I want to give 5 stars, but it felt like there's something suspicious with the upkeep.  Meaning it feels a bit "worn down" even with the dim lighting and decor.  Maybe it's a french thing?

Final thoughts:  It was worth the time and money.  GO!

Typically I can find loads of things but the last few months have been really blah. Especially in the children's clothing area. The toy section is super crowded and the boxes toys are in look like they've been around the block a few times. Just meh. Maybe it will get better in the spring.

Ate here the other weekend with a friend on a Friday night. I was going to get a beer but they were advertising a patron margarita for $8 so I thought why not ?!  There was not ANY tequila in the margarita! I told them this and commented on the color. They brought me a new one that further convinced me the first was a virgin margarita. Then we were charged $10.99 for tacos and I had to physically show the person at the register where it said 8.99. This place is a scam that I will probably never go back to. Save yourself a trip (and money!) and go to Rositas.
Went here for lunch and the door was locked! Arrived at 11:15 and we were denied access. Staff was rude and did nothing even though it clearly states they are open 11-10 Mon-Sat

I've never written a Yelp review but feel compelled to write one after repeated bad experiences here. Every time (each time convincing myself to give it another chance), I've encountered incredibly rude employees, mistaken and/or late orders, expensive prices and cold, mushy food. The two women who usually work the register will often ignore customers, instead standing behind the counter, eating their own food and chatting with each other. Each time they've acted curt and unfriendly. And the food...I've had both salads, several signature sandwiches, and all I can say is: just go to WaWa. It'll be cheaper and probably taste better!

Perhaps the best authentic Mexican food in New Orleans. I started my lunch with an awesome ceviche and had chicken enchiladas for an entree. Really fantastic. My wife had tamales with mole and pizole and loved them both. 
The space itself is quaint and bright, would be fun with a group I think. Next time I'll invite friends and go for dinner.

Came here for dinner, was sad to find out they'd sold out of ribs. The line went almost out the door, but luckily the staff kept it moving pretty briskly. 

We tried the brisket with some appetizers. The meat was great, well cooked and we had fun trying all their different sauces. The scalloped potatoes with corned beef was super indulgent, and their fries perfect for dunking in whatever sauce we chose. The pork belly hush puppies were disappointing to me: overdone, pretty flavorless, and the tiny bits of meat tasted more like bacon than pork belly. 

Will definitely come back to try some ribs and their pie shakes

This place was so ridiculously good, we ended up there 2 nights in a row!

Must order:

~ Summer rolls: really fresh julienned veggies and shrimp rolled up in a soft rice roll, dip in peanut sauce and DONE!

~ Grilled pork chop broken rice: Love the marinade they have on the chops!  It's sweet and sour all at the same time.  The broken rice is soo addictive, not as heavy as traditional asian sticky rice or even jasmine rice...the plate looks intimidating because it's a huge amount of rice but it's deceiving, you really do want that much rice on a plate for this one.

~ Grilled beef over vermicelli noodles: I think it's the same marinade as the pork above but this is served over very thin rice noodles.  You add teh fish sauce dressing to the entire thing and toss.  It's heaven in a bowl.  Dish comes lukewarm/room temp because that's how it's supposed to be eaten.

~ Crispy spring rolls: Fried made to order, light and piping hot when it get to your table.  Wrapped in some of the red leaf lettuse that it comes bedded on and it's a real treat.
