And the service was attentive but not obtrusive!

Rich Ambiance, Perfect Light and Good Staff. The food was really good and perfect quantity. We ordered Masala Bloody Mary which was a well made drink. For appetizers we ordered Chilled Dahi Avacado Chaat, Mangalorean Crispy Vegetable and Vegetable Shashlik Skewer - All tasted so good. We were 6 people and Dahi Avacado has just 5 pieces - the staff was flexible to add one more piece to it by charging a little extra. We then shared the Veg Thali between 2 of us and was sufficient considering the appetizers we had. there are 2 veggies, raita, mango chutney, dal makhani, rice and hot eggplant bhajiya. This is served in a Thali and it so much reminded of home. We felt like we are sitting in Mumbai at some high end dhaba enjoying the delicious food. The veggies had paneer makhanwala and spinach chana - mouth watering! We replaced the normal naan with lasooni naan and it was a good decision. To add to the meal we ordered Mango lassi which was again good. We all enjoyed the food and I believe it has a lot of options for Vegetarians.I would definitely recommend this place. Anytime I feel like having Ghar Ka Khana..it is IndeBlue. Also since it was Sunday afternoon they had Sitar and Tabla playing Live on the Background...very soothing to ears. My friends visited Philly for first time and I am glad we picked this place as they all enjoyed it a lot.

Super cute store with very affordable items.  The owners are very friendly, and happy to help you select a gift.  There are a lot of fun kitchen items, jewelry, and some kids stuff.  A must-stop spot if you are looking for a present in Northern Liberties.

From out of town and stumbled Across this place.. Two thumbs up for sure!! It was amazing.. Had an abundance of sauces and would highly recommended the "tater salad" was amazing.. It is a cafeteria style go down a line and they give you a huge tray which is honestly how every BBQ place should take lessons because you need room to try different sauces and just eat in general.. Also Corn Bread is on point.. The soda is brewed at a place about 20 miles away or so so it is local.. I had the root beer which was pretty awesome.. All in all very very impressed with my visit if I am back I will make a stop in again

Ugh.  I don't know what to say that has not been said, so I'll bullet point my distaste for this shithole:

- Overpriced drinks
- Overpriced (though NORMAL) cover charge
- Bad service with attitude
- Nothing special DJ
- Trashy girls and disgusting guys
- Long long long lines to the bathroom and I honestly can say I will never understand the "bathroom people" who sit on a stool expecting a tip for handing me a piece of paper towel.  What I would tip for?  If the floor was not splattered with vomit and piss.  That would be nice.

All in all, I am no longer 21 and I'm glad that I don't find myself venturing in here anymore.  It is one of the worst bars in downtown Indy and I would not recommend this place for any self-respecting human being.
Food and service both are excellent (I'm obsessed with the ZLT)! There is a good selection of vegetarian fare, as well as Pennsylvania beers and ciders. You really can't go wrong.

We went to the lunch buffet. Kind service, delicious food. I love the coconut pudding with the curry chicken and naan!! Had a hard time stopping! Very good and will return. The place smelled weird (like old pee)  but my boyfriend assured me it was the mixture
 of spices in the air.

If you like traditional Italian for steak and pasta, this place is for you.  From the decor to the service, it's all very old-school feeling, which works just fine for me.  This place is crowded on the wkds, so reservations are a must.  As soon as you enter, you are greeted and each time I've gone, I"ve always been asked if we are celebrating anything special.  Not sure if I answer "yes" what will happen, but we have yet to go on an actual special occasion.  Before you are seated, they offer to check your coats as well.

Food:
1) calamari fritti - excellent.  The calamari is lightly breaded and fried, and I'm always a fan when the calamari is good quality and not chewy (eek!).  I personally was not a fan of the accompanying sauce (everyone else was), but the calamari was good enough to eat on its own.

2) chopped salad - it's a good thing we decided to split this.  We mentioned we wanted to share, and they brought the salad out on 2 separate plates (I love when restaurants do that).  Each of our plates had a portion that I would've assumed was the regular size, so I can't imagine having an entire order for myself!  I prob should've picked the salad myself instead of relying on the bf to choose bc there were quite a few things in the salad that I don't like to eat (not the restaurant's fault!).  Despite not being a fan of olives, gorgonzola, peperoncini and beans, I still managed to eat most of the salad bc the dressing and salami were delicious.

3) linguine with clams - delicious if you love garlic, olive oil, and butter (could be my 3 fav things!).  The bf doesn't like seafood and he liked the fact that the pasta did not taste "seafood-y".  The clams were great - good quality and clean (no sand/grit!).

4) NY strip - cooked perfectly.  The bf chose the herb butter sauce which was a tad salty for me, but it was good.  I personally was a fan of the mashed potatoes.

5) chicken spiedini - disappointing.  The chicken was almost crumbly (the bf said that's what happens when you let it marinate too long), and it was kinda dry.  Worst dish at the table.

6) veal milanese - I personally don't eat veal, but everyone else thought it was great.

Should have read the reviews before coming here.

Had the Parmesan chicken dish and the chicken had this gamy taste to it.  (don't take me wrong, i like lamb) But this dish has this werid gamy taste which killed my taste bud for the rest of the day. Luckily i have the best bf in the world and helped me finish half of my plate. 

The Sampler appetizer was filled with nothing but fried onion rings, fried chicken wings, fried egg rolls, fried cheese stick.  Not that i dont like fried food, who doesnt?  But the fact that it looked like a shit load of fried crap threw into a big pile on a plate together was not appetizing, at all.  Not only the presentation was horrible, the fried batter falls apart, in every single item.  

Almost half of the party ordered the infamous Chicken Pot Pie, including the bf, but not even 1 person was able to finished their super salty dish.  One of them even took his leftover to-go but the gf didnt even want to eat it. That's how bad it was.  

Im giving this place a 2 ** only bc this is my first Claim Jumper chain i've been to.  Maybe the one in the bay isnt as bad, but then again, i dont think i'll ever go to any of their chain rest unless someone tie me up and drag me there.
Love Love Love this place! Excellent quality food, fast friendly service. Get the jalapeño ranch with your chips!!

Great place for Breakfast, especially if you are a biker.
Take the River rd up and you'll find this nice mom and pop place in the middle of no where. the outside looks as if you are going into a "gentlemen bar". 

I've sampled a few of their eggs bennies and they are very tasty and unique.
Everything come sour of the oven hot and fresh and at the same time. Very friendly staff. From cornbeef to steak to pastrami, their eggs benedicts are definitely the ones to try when you are here.

Very reasonably priced, I've spent double on Eggs Benedict's at other places with no where as good tasting. You'll leave this place with a happy tummy and wallet (which is definitely rare now a days....).

Awesome !!! A healthy version of five-guys. 

About as healthy as a hamburger can get: Organic meat, great fries fried in olive oil, there's even a vegan option. Great shakes. 

Hamburgers made to order with a nice selection of toppings.
Best hamburger place in the area.

I so badly want to give this location a good review but I have visited too many times and been disappointed-have to say that this Starbucks has such a high turnover and maybe this accounts for their inability to make a consistently good drink, specifically their lattes. I really think it's the lack of training. Almost every other location makes their drinks consistently, but at this one, they either let the espresso shots sit too long ( causing a burnt taste) or fill it overflowing with milk (which dilutes the taste) or serves it lukewarm. They are also 5x slower than any of the other locations in town. Whatever it is they are doing, more times than not, I walk away frustrated and vowing never to go there again.

It's a shame because most of the staff in general at the store have been very helpful, it's the appliance company that handles the service after the sale that is terrible. Pacific Home sales has the worst customer service team i have met in awhile. 
I purchased a lg appliance suite, asked all the appropriate questions, rebate information (which the sales associate explained i would deal with lg rebate center for this), etc. 
Regarding the misleading information i was told to deal with lg for rebates, beat buy does not know manufacturers incentives for that so i would file on my own. Totally fine and did so! Just heard back from lg that Best Buy is not partnered with them, and they should have issues me a gift card in store to equal same amount as rebate offer, or lower the price of the appliance to balance out- which neither was done. 
Second issue is when delivered, i received the wrong color dishwasher. When this was noticed this, I immediately called them and they were great to start the process of exchange for the proper one, and free instillation. The manager was great and My time frame was set for a 12-4 slot. However the drivers were terrible. The day of, by almost 545, I have had no reach out, so I called the store for information. They were unable to get in touch with the drivers, so I was to wait for a reschedule- which already made me upset. Then at 740, the drivers said they were on their way and would be 15 minutes. I explained my displeasure in the service, and that I am not Home but would rush back and might have  to wait 10 minutes. That didn't seem good enough, so they started questioning me why can't i do it another day and started making me feel as if this was my fault, how am i not available at all in the next week, so i really need the exchange if the other one works fine, and that they've had a long day. Super rude, and the carefree attitude from these men did not help. I verified that I was willing to work and rush back to the house to make this happen, and they declined. Now it starts all over again.
It's a shame some select employees they have ruin such a simple experience.

I love this place.  I have eaten here at least once a year for the last 8 years, and I have never been disappointed.  While they have a nice variety of chicken, seafood, and pasta dishes, this place is first and foremost a steakhouse.  

They age their steaks at least 28 days, and you can really taste the difference.  They have excellent prime rib, but the black and bleu ribeye is incredible.  Seared with Cajun spices and smothered with bleu cheese, the ribeye is tender, juicy and big.  This is really a piece of culinary art. 

They have some unique salad options and feature a very nice salad bar. The clam chowder is great too.   LS&B is located downtown, near the State Capitol, within easy walking distance from the major hotels. This is a good thing because you will want to take a good walk after dinner.
Best burger place ever!!! Their fries are delicious!!! Get the regular fries and try out their famous crunchburger!!!

Booked this hotel online, last minute as we forgot about a concert we had tickets for in Philadelphia.  First, the hotel was easy to find.  

We had several minor problems with the place.  First, upon check in, the clerk, who was friendly, seemed preoccupied and took 2 phone calls during the time it took us to check in.  During our time at the desk, another guest complained about the smell in their room, and they were moved.

Once we got to the room, we noticed that there was no remote for the TV.   Strange! Who steals a TV remote?  Anyway, the room was recently refreshed, small, but looked updated.  Bathroom was fine with a new tub surround.  

 I also noted that I forgot the charging cord for my iphone 4.  I went to the desk to ask for a remote and to see if they had a loaner charger (most hotels do, as people like me often forget them).  They were able to bring a remote, but apparently, all the phone cords are in the housekeeping office, and that was locked at 6pm on a Saturday, and not one had a key.  I asked what if we needed housekeeping, and didn't get a response.

We got back to the hotel around midnight, went to our room and got ready for bed.  At about 12:40, a very strange alarm started going off.  It would go off for about 45-60 seconds then stop for a few minutes, then go off again.  At about 1, I went to call the front desk, but the only phone in our room didn't work.

This morning, upon check out we inquired about the noise.  The clerk told us it was some type of fire alarm (kind of a problem that the fire alarm was intermittent, didn't sound like any fire alarm I have ever heard, and that the fire alarm light in our room didn't flash).  We told about the phone and were told they would fix that (we were checking out, so what difference did that make)

I am not one to want free stuff when my stay is less than satisfactory, but this upset me.  No that we didn't get anything from the hotel for our troubles, but we didn't even get an apology for the magical fire alarm going off, having no idea what it was, and no way to contract the desk.  A simple thank you would have gone a long way.

I also consider the $150 I paid for the night reasonable under the circumstances.  This is not the cheap $40 per night motel 6 next door (with all due respect)

I would recommended against staying at this property until the staff learns how to treat the guests, and they do simple things, like keep TV remotes in the rooms, and have a working fire alarm system.

Suck it, McCallisters, they've got you beat. Their atmosphere is better, their food is... more sincere? More honest? Deeper, and more full flavored? I don't know. But McCallisters always leaves me vaguely disappointed, and I did not feel that hear. Excellent corned beef, and cane sugar ginger ale. Yum. 

Also- free ice cream for dessert. Yes.

We took the Lafayette #1 tour with Val and were very satisfied. It was an extremely large group (he said so himself) but he managed to do a fantastic job guiding and teaching us. After a week in New Orleans and several guided tours under our belts, I can honestly say that this SOC tour was top-notch. Val was neither over-rehearsed sounding nor mechanical. He gave the information as if he was telling us for the first time even though we know he must have said the same things hundreds of times. He was also very pleasant - which I've also learned isn't the standard for tour-guides. This was my 4th time visiting NO but my first cemetery tour. Fascinating! 
Thank you Val!

Love that you get a parking pass. Arrived in the garage and check in literally took less than 3 minutes! So cool. Lobby is absolutely stunning! Got to the room and the view was amazing. Saw directly into the predators arena where we were going to later  that day. This place is in the center of everything and everything is in walking distance. Sucked it rained everyday though 

Beautiful day so walked 3 short blocks to my the arena. Came back after the game and relaxed. The bathroom smelled really good btw (sidenote). 

The lounge downstairs had a pool table and a full bar and a full restaurant. Great!!! 

Last but not least I was able to control the tv with my phone!! (Mind blown!! No more losing the remote). Also, I needed to make sure my points were added to my account so they have a phone you can literally text any request!! AMAZING!! So I sent a text super early that morning and I got a response that it was taken care of! Amazing experience.. just wish the shuttle was open longer than 10:30!!

My favorite gem on the west side. Pho, pho, and nothing but pho. That's all I get when I go. It's almost like a treat yo self to me! I've never had a bad experience here. 
I get the tofu pho every time and it's delicious every time. This place is perfect on a cold winter day. If you're feeling a bit adventurous try an avocado shake!

Delicious food. 

Painfully bright lighting. I had a headache before the meal was finished.

If your in the West Philadelphia area,and craving something different,hit up Fu-Wah Mini Market. I didn't expect much when I ordered,but I was definitely blown away when I tasted the Banh Mi we ordered. Succulent Grilled Meat in a fresh roll,with fresh veggies on top! To die for! We now visit once a month as a treat! It's that good! Don't let the name throw you off,these people cook with love!

Believe all the negative reviews. My wife and I went last night for dinner. It was a horrible experience. DO NOT come here for the food. It is tasteless and poorly executed.  The servers are inattentive, disinterested kids. We too waited FOREVER for Turkish Tea. At least twenty minutes. Ordered three appetizers and a Gyro. Appetizers came out one at a time, with apologies each time for the delay.  Unless you are ordering an over priced, gimmicky Hookah, they could care less about you. This place will not be around in six months. New Orleanians demand good food.

WOW!  My new favorite sports bar in Gulfport by far!!!  Where do I start?!  First class remodeling job on a smelly old nasty smoking bar where there's something for everyone:

* Giant TV's
* Outdoor Tiki Bar and a huge patio
* A really cool indoor boat bar (yes, you heard me correctly!)
* Darts, skee ball, corn hole, pool, giant jinga, etc
* Live music regularly, and a great new generation jukebox during the other times
* Wonderful bar staff who remember names (impressive!)
* Hands on passionate owners 

This place is such a fantastic addition to Gulfport!  We can't wait to come back!  When you go, tell them Heidi Ho sent you!!!  CHEERS~

What an amazing experience.  I came in because close to my home.  First of all this place is squeaky clean.   I mean clean!    The older lady - Sally - greeted me.   Very sweet.   I just wanted a pedicure.   Exfoliating glove massage, hot stones.  Lots of massage.  Warm towel behind my back.  While toes were drying she massaged my neck and shoulders.   Then she. Fought a warm towel for under my feet while under dryer.  .  They weren't busy so I am not sure what to expect when they are but I will definitely be back!

My daughters wedding shower was held here yesterday.  Staff was incredible - nothing was too much trouble - they were so amazing.  Food was fantastic!  First time I was ever there - can't wait to go back!!!!

Hours are M-F 830-5p. Great barber shop great haircut. You can ask anything from a new modern undercut to a classic clean cut. You will get a great haircut for a great price. The only reason for a 4 star rating is because the majority of the time you might have to wait an hour or two till you get in the chair. No appoints are taken. Walk in only. This is one of the barber shops I would recommend to anyone in town.

French food may be my favorite cuisine, and Bistrot la Minette did not disappoint. The freshly made baguettes and butter are addicting. My friend and I shared the mushroom puff pastry appetizer, which was rich and earthy. I got the ravioli because the vegetarian options were slim. It was nicely al dente with a carrot puree that was surprisingly amazing (because I'm not a huge fan of carrots). My friend got the duck and said it was good as well. We couldn't pass up dessert after hearing the ice cream flavors: vanilla, caramel, and a toasted flavor - the last being the best.

I can't wait to come back and try other things.

Prices on a pair of mens dress shoes are $60, in-line with most other places. Went to their competitor down the street first; quoted at $65, bust wouldn't be ready for two weeks. Seriously? You have THAT much business that it takes you two weeks to fix a pair of shoes? Busy Bee offered to have them done in 3 days. That's a smokin deal. Great service and reasonable prices. The work is quality as well.

I enjoyed my 5 day stay. I didn't enjoy the $29 + tax parking across the street Premium parking ( ($40 on one day do to the football game ) but it was cheaper and faster than the $40 valet the hotel offers. Had no issues with the self parking. Croissants every morning get boring. They could make a pot of coffee in the lobby at night. Or even just for Christmas! The staff was exceptional. They are redoing all the old buildings across the street so the road is pretty busy in front. Nice hotel. Close walk to the French quarter.

If you really need a good wash inside and out this is definitely the place to go. But if you are in ANY hurry don't bother, these guys will take they're sweet time cleaning everyone's car so you may be here for a while... 
And paying 18 bucks for my full size van to get cleaned is a great deal! 
Come here on a nice sunny day sit on the bench and chat with some nice people who are in no hurry at all :)

So delicious!!! Love the sushi; it's really fresh and a good variety. The staff is also very nice.  Another plus is that they have some Korean food on the menu. It's not a large selection but they have a few soups and excellent kimchi.
Best gelato I've ever had. I tried the blueberries and cream flavor and it melted in my mouth. It was very obvious to the taste that the blueberries were fresh!

Dinner at the bar is great. The bar is defiantly the place to enjoy dinner. The atmosphere is laid back and comfortable and A great place to people watch. The live music makes it a  great night. Recommend the oysters.

Noticed there was a problem with roof. I called and Andres  setup a time for someone to take a look  the problem was fixed with no hassle. I can not say enough good thinks about this company and the way they do business. I would recommend Andres to anyone, anytime 
HAPPY HAPPY

I have been going to Sahara Grill since it was opened back in 1999 (or 2000). It is my go-to place for better flavored middle-eastern food, its not as bland as the other restaurants with the same genre and cuisine. I almost always order the mixed grill platter and I have almost never been disappointed. The service is very polite, very pleasant, the space is in the pure heart of Philadelphia downtown which makes it even more convenient and there's a paid parking right across.
I have to say, that since going to this place for so many years, I've noticed the quantity has decreased with the skewers but the food still tastes great. Their new white sauce is not as impressive, tastes like sour cream (maybe that's exactly what it is) but if you ask for the spicy green sauce, that really adds more flavor if you needed it. 

Overall, my family and I love to dine here at least once in 2 months whenever we are visiting Philadelphia. I highly recommend it.

We recently moved to the area and have gone twice now to this amazing place to eat. The first time we were unaware of making a reservation. The woman owner was beyond welcoming and accommodated us even when it was busy. She and the staff were very nice. Our food was beyond delicious and good Italian is hard to find. Our second time today was nothing less than the first time. Great food and service! We are so happy to find this gem!!
First time doing an escape room. Tons of fun, staff is great! Would definitely go again!!

This is my favorite boutique in New Orleans! I lived in Austin for five years and there were always tons of boutiques that were reasonably priced to choose from..here that is not the case! Armoire has great prices and unique trendy clothes, purses, belts, and jewlery! You don't have to worry about another chick wearing what you have on; because they only buy about 3 of every piece. 



My new fav!

What a gem!  We loved this place.  There were 7 of us, which included 3 children, and they were very accommodating and welcoming towards them.  Everyone loved their entrees, can't think of a single thing that needs improvement.  The tiramisu is incredible, but really everything was.  We will definitely be back.

I've been here a few times and have tried a few items.  I have only ordered off the breakfast menu so far, but would love to come in for lunch.  I highly recommend the loco moco and the chicken and waffles (although I substitute French toast for the waffles)  The chicken is AMAZING!  Service is always with a smile and very prompt.  I like that when you go in you see the same faces working.  That tells you a lot about a place.

As diners go, this hits the mark. This is a real diner, with diner food priced accordingly, not a gourmet restaurant, and they do it well. It is the best diner in the area. They have a good salad bar and an extensive menu. The food is good, the place is clean, and the service is always great. When I want a diner, Lancer's is where I go.
The place is not your typical chain, but the service and friendliest around.  Honest work, with good people.  Highly recommended!

So excited for the gluten free options at this little corner bar. I had the catfish and hush puppies and they we excellent! My husband had the catfish po boy and I have no idea how he finished it, it was gigantic. Prices are good, company is good and service is excellent. Highly recommend for lunch!
Come here if you want to feel hip/pretentious and eat great pizza
Fast service; everything explained in detail. Edward is the best! Don't know if prices are competitive but no surprises. Always clean my car and always have a loaner if I ask in advance!

I am an avid fan of tomato soup and grilled cheese. It is definitely one of my top 3 favorite meals. So when I found out Reading Terminal had a craft-grilled cheese shop, I knew I had to give it a try. They have many options to choose from and combos you can order. I ordered the classic grilled cheese with a side of their tomato-fennel soup. The grilled cheese was soooo cheesy, which I love and the tomato soup was good, but not the best tomato soup I've had. I would come back and try another grilled sandwich and maybe try out the tomato soup again.

My favorite Pho place to go to.  Came here as a recommendation by a friend after trying different Pho and Vietnamese restaurants.  This one is by far the best.  It's hard to decipher which Pho place to go to, but once I walked in here I knew it was a keeper.  Clean, delicious, and fast.  Will be returning

I don't eat Indian food at restaurants because most places serve pathetic Indian food. This place is pretty good though. Their food tastes fresh and flavorful (little spicy for some). I highly recommend this place and look forward to visiting again

Brought friends and family here a few times and it always wins over our guests. The meat board is divine. The apps and entrees are top-notch. The drinks are spot on. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is easy. Worth it!

So I got here late, kitchen closed. Bartender said he'd see what he could do regarding a full meal. Well the kitchen staff took take care of me. Great steak. Great bar. Would not have bothered me if they said they were closed but bartender was on it. Steak. Excellent.

Tough to review because I have no frame of reference. But any festival that benefits charity is good in my eyes. 
The hayride to the orchard was extra cool. For a canned food donation or $1 you can hop on.  The ride was narrated by a UofA professor and was super informative. 
They had tractor pulls, hay rides, live music, several food and drink vendors, along with the pecan store. A plethora of everything pecan! The other really cute thing was the high school dance team busting a move on stage. They were fabulous!! 
I'll definitely do this next year if I'm in town. And next time I'll bring canned goods for donation!

We stopped by here on our way home and it ended up to be a double bonus! A taco truck AND beer! SCOOOOOOORE! Also, the word cup was on and we had our kids with us. My husband and I had an assortment of tacos and we were very happy with our choice. I feel that they could've been a little more authentic. But overall, we had a great experience.

Great chips and salsa and sopapillias come with every meal. I always get the chicken stuffed poblano. It's the most tasty dish with a surprising mixture of foods that tickle your taste buds with a side of grilled squash.

$6 Portion size is excellent! It's literally 2 meals . + for the cucumbers and chickpeas available for the salad. Rice is long grain and the lamb is seasoned well. One star only because the meat was a little too greasy for my taste. Service was good: the owner was friendly.

My sister can't stop talking about this new Iron Chef, so we stopped by for a lunch last time I went to Philly.
Well, I don't think the food is really over the top amazing, but it definitely has it's standard
The service was really top notch though, for some kitchen mixed up, we waited longer for our food, and the waitress was really really sorry even thought we didn't really care since not in a rush, but we end up getting free dish and free drinks on her. Nice :)
A friend from Philly told me this is his "third date" restaurant, and worked every time when he tries to impress a girl!

The Trainwreck saloon is within walking distance of the Sheraton Westport Chalet where we are staying for a conference. This is a bar with bar food and plenty of tables both high and low around said bar. The noise level is slightly higher than your normal restaurant but still reasonable. One can easily find the women's bathroom, but the men's bathroom is a well kept secret. Once you find it you will see that it is a fairly clean bathroom. If you chose to order a burger, you have a choice between beef or bison. Bison costs two dollars more but is healthier. We chose to stay for dessert and discovered that the choice was between brownie and brownie. They did warm the brownie up. As we were leaving, live music began. Try the saloon out if you are looking for a bar with pretty good food and live music.

We have been regulars for a few years and dine here with friends once or twice a week. Everything is great as long as you pay and tip good. But when you have a complaint they don't want to hear it and treat you terribly. We recently found a fly in our pitcher of margaritas and their reply was "all nice restaurants have flies." They first offered us a glass of margaritas then the manager reluctantly agreed to take a pitcher off the bill after we called him to our table. No apologies or thanks for all our business. One of our guests also found a hair in her drink. We have been going there for a long time and do not appreciate being treated this way. We are not going back!
I can't believe I've lived here 35 years and never eaten here. This is my new favorite restaurant.

What a popular spot! Didn't mind the wait, as we drank a beer at Maple Leaf next door. 

2.5 stars

Waitress forgot to give us the free cornbread I was looking forward to. No biggie - the place is a damn zoo and she seemed really busy. It was great! 

1 Sazerac cocktail - yikes, this was a strong one and was very hard to take down. 

Their fried chicken was recommended, but wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped. I've had better fried chicken back at home in NYC and even in San Diego (The Crack Shack). Where's the seasoning, folks? 

The blackened redfish was also recommended by our waitress. Again, where's the seasoning? 

This place is hopping with an awesome, lively atmosphere, but the kitchen must be rushed to push out dish after dish without paying attention to 100% of the details - and it shows.
Wonderful atmosphere with plenty of fresh options. Both my boyfriend and I had the fish of the day, paired with a Spanish wine suggested by our waitress. We will definitely return.

Just awful! Went once to get a sandwich, a buffalo chicken wrap, and it was cold and nothing more than bland chicken with hot sauce and blue cheese dressing. Gave them another shot and they delivered pizza with RANCID cheese. Even worse, were not the least apologetic; refused to refund money. The owner was unkind and unpleasant--almost as nasty as the food.

Although we live in Philadelphia, we take my 1969 Schwinn Breeze bicycle to Cycle Sport because they provide excellent service for a fair price.  Additionally, they treat women customers with respect.

So far, I have had my bicycle in for the following:  adjustment to the rear wheel when the rear mudguard was rubbing against it; new cables; and a new 3-speed shift mechanism.  Each time, the staffers have explained things fully to us.  They are courteous and polite.  The last time, when the staffer replaced my shift mechanism, he came up with a plastic cover as well.

We have been looking for a place like this for more than twenty years.  My Schwinn was built to last and does, with the service we encounter here.  I recommend it fully.
The Onion rings are the best! Always feels like being in a family oriented restaurant with great food and service.

Maven is BY FAR my favorite place to buy gifts in the city. The services is friendly and the products are unique and fun. 

Although there is a multiple array of gifts, I would say this is the place to go for gifts primarily for women. 

I particularly like to go here for baby shower gifts. It's the perfect "get-something-for-the-baby-get-something-for-the-mama" gift. They have these great baby onesies, jewelry, candles. 

The only downside to making this my 1# gift shop is that I ALWAYS and I mean always want to keep the gift. Luckily I can contain myself.

I really don't want to talk about this place ---it's my little secret!  But I want them to do well so that I can have another place to shop!  Is it wrong if I call it my ghetto boutique?  I love it!  Hot fashion (especially club wear) at low prices.  They have a huge selection of shoes/boots/heels.  They also have belly baring shirts, cleavage peeping blouses, ass-hugging pants.... wanna b a hooch for the night - you can do it!  Not everything they carry is scandalous, however.  They also have cute blouses, rompers/jumpers, dresses, etc.  They also have a lot of purses.  The girls that work in the store are really nice, and they like to help you pick out your outfit.  The owner is also usually very nice.  Thank you, MODA - I love your store!

Well, its the first time I've been here. I didn't know the menu so I put a bunch of '1' next to the sushi. The waitress just said "that's a lot of food, are you sure?" So I asked if she could explain but she only briefly did. Thankfully I had 4 other friends who helped eat it all since we all got all you can eat sushi. I loved the display, service was alright, experience was good.

(30 Jul 2016)

Popped by for drinks and quick meal with a few friends. I've never seen so many TV's inside a restaurant before. 

We got amazing fries covered in bacon, cheese and chicken paired with my newly found favourite range dressing. The alcohol was flowing, we got pitchers of margarita and sangria and few shots. 

The waitress was great, attended to us promptly and checked in every now and again to see if we're good. The crowd was casual and having a lot of fun. 

I thoroughly enjoyed myself and would pay this place another visit in the near future.
Pizza was cold chicken nuggets were cold the delivery person left and got here in five minutes and was completely cold. That's sad

I live within half a block of the new Ambrosia, so I was very excited to have another choice besides Binkley's so close to my house.  That excitement was incredibly short-lived.  Last night, I had a 7pm reservation for 3 people.  We were on time.  Right in front of us was a party of 4 that was seated immediately.  There were still three empty tables.  The hostess guided us to a 5-top table, but immediately made us return to the waiting area and told us that they were "running behind" on their reservations and could not seat us.  I asked her to check.  She did check with the owner, Geno, who said no, that we would just have to wait.  I pointed out the three empty tables to the hostess, who said, "we have larger parties coming in, and we have to take care of them".  I told her that we were on time, that there were empty tables and that we should be seated.  Her response was, "if you don't like the way we do things . . ." I told her we certainly did not like the way they did things and would just go across the street.  When Geno's mother was the hostess at Ambrosia, she had a wide spread reputation for being nasty to customers and treating them badly.  Geno seems to have taken it upon himself to continue her unwelcoming tradition.  We will never go there again, and will let other people know about the shabby treatment we received.

Really great food, amazing service, frozen margueritas yummy. Had the shrimp chimichanga, oh God was that good. Place is very clean, used to go to Rosepepper, not anymore. The prices were amazing for a really good dinner with drinks!

A co-worker recommended this place with great reviews however when I went last week to try it out with said co-worker we were seated in what appeared to be the "elderly section" and the space was ridden with a foul stench of urine and feces. The smell was so awful that the people next to us asked the waitress to open the door for more ventilation. The smell ruined the meal and I pretty much lost my appetite. This was my first and last visit to Cafe Marmalade. I'm still grossed out.

I think that State and Lemp is a great, unique addition to the Boise restaurant scene.  They are using local ingredients and the food concepts seem to be a collaborative effort of everyone they have hired.  We went on the opening weekend and I thought the food was good (even very good), with a few dishes that had minor flat spots.  

One thing I think is important for you to know before you go:  

While this is not a communal dining experience, it really is.  Although they set the room as individual tables, there is no more than a few inches between the tables.  You can't quite figure out whether you are supposed to talk to the people next to you (although you can hear every word of their conversation).  As soon as the wine starts flowing, it turns into a community dining experience.  A community dining experience is not for everyone, so keep this in mind before you make your reservation.  

A few things I would suggest they consider doing:

The table next to us requested beer pairings, instead of wine.  The beer choices were lackluster, in my opinion.  They served Miller High Life as the dessert pairing--funny, but not for everyone.  I know beer pairings are becoming a popular alternative and I think they should spend some time thinking this through.

Also, I'd like to see them offer a second tier wine pairing option.  Say maybe $50 pp.  The wines they offer currently at $30 pp are pretty easy to find in town at a reasonable price point.  I think a second option would give people the chance to try wines they wouldn't justify buying otherwise.

This is my second time here! Sabrina's has amazing brunch selections!! It's BYOB and their specials are alway tasty and have interesting names! It's a bit crammed inside and the wait is usually between 45min-1hr but it's definitely worth it!!

Eric is fantastic!!!! I found this nail salon on yelp since I was in town for a baseball tournament, called and made an appointment to just get no chip. I bring my own polish since I travel so much it's hard for me to find the color I like which is pink this summer. If not done right in two coats it looks streaky. He couldn't get it right in two coats so he did three. After leaving it bothered me because it was to thick. I called the next day before leaving town and asked if they could redo it. Eric did an amazing job making them look beautiful. I realized yesterday I left my polish there. I quickly called to see if they had it. Fortunately they did and I was able to have someone pick it up for me. That's amazing service all around. 
As for the salon itself. It's very quiet and clean. Great place to relax.

Geeze...Planet Fitness is what it is, and it gets 5 stars for fulfilling its role.

There's a ton of cardio machines...ellipticals, cross-trainers, tredmills, and those two types of stationary bikes that I don't really care to know much more about.There's half a ton of weight machines and a thirty minute circuit area. 

The showers are clean. The bathrooms are clean. The locker room is clean.

It's big. It's spacious. There are lots of big screen TVs to keep you entertained. Your 3G/4G enabled iDevices will get full coverage inside the gym so you can watch Hell's Kitchen while you complete your cardio jaunt.

We were hungry and didn't want to drive far so we decided on Colonial Diner.  We have eaten here twice before for lunch and it was good. Tonight not so much.  

I opened the napkin around my silver ware and there was some old food on them. We should've left at that point.  While sitting there a male waiter who wasn't our waiter  ran his hand on our table top which I found a bit creepy.  Well we got our food. My chicken pot pie had a pink color on the crust. My wife's dish had dried egg on it. At that point we vowed to never come back.
Clean, comfortable and fairly priced machines. The attendant here is friendly and on top of things.

Best salon in SF!!  Before finding Chandry, I'd jumped around between different salons in the city (all with excellent yelp reviews). I've been seeing Chandry for a few years now, and stayed with her when she recently switched salons. (Btw the eSalon space is cute, clean and the girls there are all really friendly). 

Chandry's taken my hair from dark to bright blond, from super long layers to a stylish "lob" (long bob).  Her vision is always right on trend.  My hair is tricky - course and naturally strawberry blond, so I have to be cautious when looking for stylists, as its easy to put in high and low lights that don't look 100% natural.  Since I've been seeing Chandry I've never had that queasy feeling when you're sitting in the chair, hoping that your cut and color will turn out the way you'd envisioned. I trust her taste and ability 100% and feel sophisticated and effortlessly chic every time I leave an appointment with her.  Can't recommend this salon enough!

Sure enough I returned for lunch, got the five meats for $12.95, they keep coming around an the ribs were the best. Everything at the buffet was great as well, so much food. I recommend trying this place out.

WOMEN BEWARE!! of the Santa Barbara Lexus Service department. These guys lie cheat and steal. They told my wife that she needed front end work on her Lexus. The car only has 41000 miles on it and yet they told her she needed $1000-$1500 front work. Fortunately my wife had me to consult with. I said no way the car needs that work. They are lying! Lets have my friends at the tire store look at your friend end. They had 2 expert professional mechanics look at the front end and I was right. Her front end is fine. WOMEN are known prey for car dealers. Too bad there is one or two dishonest mechanics out there that make the whole dealer look bad. I doubt I will ever return to the Santa Barbara Lexus dealership again.

This is a great sushi place. My personal favorite is the Christmas roll and I love their side salads with the ginger dressing. It's a little expensive depending on what you get, but that that's anywhere you go. You can get a decent portion of side noodles for very cheap. I recommend the side kani salad too.

Eggplant entree = amazing! Salad, Poboys, fried catfish, crawfish queso & alligator bites are great! I appreciate this place! Come in, order you're food, they're quick and easy going. Great first experience.

Have been patronizing Prism since their infancy and am very happy to see their success -while also lamenting the loss of the "hole in the wall" feeling of a private little club (and the tooting of the train horn as the engineer sent greetings to the bar tender). Food is surprisingly good and the attentiveness of the staff can't be beat. I know people are anxious for Prism's beers to return but some things are just out of their control and the temporary solution has been fine. My one and only complaint is the type of lighting on the second floor. I know a previous reviewer mentioned that it was too dark but that is not my issue, Prism may have compensated for the darkness by increasing the wattage or changing to LED but the effect is stark and glaring giving it a warehouse feel which collides with the food experience. Softer, warmer light (given the dark walls )would bring back the hominess of the original location and replicate the downstairs experience. Going for brunch today for the first time and hope there is some natural light on this cold winter day to counteract the artificial lighting.

Just started working in the CBD and was looking for a lunch place. I tried Red Gravy's meatball sandwich and a side harvest salad. Everything was delicious and filling, and when I came in to pick up the food the staff was friendly and welcoming. My only complaint is that the prices were a bit much for a lunch-- $16 in total.
Chef Winner's pies are perfection...my fav is the chocolate!
We love coming here after dinner at Ginza's. My husband always orders the salted caramel and I LOVE the flor di latte.

This is the best froyo shop in town. They have the standard 5-6 flavors that are always available. Everyday they change the other 5-6 flavors. Some of my all time favorites include: brownie batter, caramel pretzel, marshmallow, cake batter, tart apple, raspberry, and strawberry.
Unlike many of the help yourself yogurt places, here they have 5 sizes and they fill them up for you. No skimping here, they are packing the yogurt in there and swirl it over the top.  They have a great selection of toppings that they layer into your yogurt!
This is the best deal in town price wise. My husband and I LOVE yogurt and can spend over $20 at those help yourself shops. Here the prices are more reasonable and we usually only finish half and have the rest the next night. I don't mind paying an extra fee for debit purchases since we are helping out a local business. The owner Liz is always friendly and does a great job. I also love it when Joy is working because we can chat a bit and she also does a great job taking care of us! 
Do yourself a favor and check this place out, you won't be disappointed!
Solid place for breakfast, good atmosphere, sizable portions in general, bread and toast served to start. Overall, we had a great breakfast experience with tasty food.

Worst experience ever!!!!! When reservations are made, they should be honored! We had a reservation made 5 days in advance for a large party of women. They said that it would not be a problem. After waiting 40 minutes after the reservation, I went to the owner to see what was going on. He told me that even though we had been waiting 40 minutes (some in our group had been there over an hour), he was going to take care of the customers coming in before seating us. Another of our group went to talk to him and he YELLED at her in front of everyone. He not only screwed himself out of a LOT of money, but out of potential customers! None of us will ever return! Do not EVER go here if you want to be served well.

Food was good, but took longer than expected for a not so busy Friday night, especially since the appetizers ordered were calamari, a Caesar salad, and wings. Also, our waitress was not super attentive during our visit.

Sugarfire is my go to bbq place in St. Louis. My significant other has said the pulled pork is the best he's ever had, and I normally order their brisket or specialty sandwich. One thing that Sugarfire does right is their special sides. Last time, I tried their brisket chili (4 stars) and rack and cheese (5 stars), and they also had a salmon rangoon which looked tasty but I did not get. Word of advice - always get their mouthwatering delicious special sides! Whether you are a classic bbq fan or more adventurous, this place has something for everyone.

We have been to Phi a few times now. Everything has been amazing. From the traditional spring rolls to the wonderful Bun Bo Hue. Love this place. About time Dtown got a new and excellent restaurant. Decor is great. Colors are relaxing and just make you want to enjoy yourself.Great job.
Service is excellent, wine is better. Both dishes were excellent but too much to finish and the is stunning. Would definitely remake recommend everybody coming out to see Kemoll's. Quite romantic.

We are only visiting Nashville and chose to eat dinner at McNamara's based on the reviews. We were very happy with our coice. The environment was very comfortable and welcoming. The service was friendly and very attentive. The live music was top notch and fun. And the food was just what we wanted. My son had the Irish stew. It had a great taste. I ordered the corned beef bites with side salad instead of steak fries. We were very pleased with our experience.
Just stood at counter for 10 minutes, it's 2:00 pm two tables have customers eating, workers just looking at me, wow, not even a "will be with you" courtesy. I finally walked out. Never going back

Really delicious dinner buffet. Price was good. Selection was good. 

Bads: service seemed a little confused as to what they should do. All of the dishes were a bit spicy (I like spicy, but there was nothing that didn't have some amount of spicyness.)

Goods: the naan was absolutely perfect -- and it kept on coming. I really enjoyed every single dish. I was so full at the end.

An amazing dress shop with dresses of impeccable quality and spectacular service.  Can't believe I found this amazing dress shop through the vendor list at TheKnot.com!

While it's hard as a bride to be cool, calm and collect closer to The Big Day, a little niceness goes a LONG way at the time you're looking for your wedding dress.  While I was on a wedding vendor spree on a visit home, I tried making an appointment here on a free day on Sunday.  While I was initially told the store doesn't open Sundays, the lady was nice enough to sympathize with me and open the store that Sunday just for me.  

A great dress boutique for those who hates aggressive bridal shops like I do.  While the store does carry wedding dresses, it mostly carries colorful bridesmaid and mother of the bride/groom dresses.  No worries though - most of the dresses come in the ivory or white appropriate for any bride.   If you're looking for a simple yet unique and elegant wedding dress, this is a must-go place.  

One of the few (if not the only) dress boutique in Florida to carry Jenny Yoo and Thread, the two designers I was looking into for that perfect dress.  While I fell in love with a Jenny Yoo strapless with convertible obi-like train construction, I chose a beautiful layered chiffon Thread Annabelle dress in Ivory.  For what I paid for, I'd definitely take a unique dress of quality construction over mass-produced David's Bridal monstrosities anyday.  

Besides being nice enough to open the store when it's usually not open, the service Judith (the owner who helped me out) was spectacular.  She was very helpful in ordering my dress and having it delivered to me up in DC, and her attention to detail was IMPECCABLE.  From wrapping my necklace in pink tissue paper when I had to take it off to try dresses to the cute mints she included in the package my dress was delivered in, she is most definitely on top of things.

We tried this as a great option for hibachi taste without paying for the show. Yahtzee! Worth it, I would do the lunch first to try. Dinner is a few $ more, but you get more meat. Same amount of rice. Vegetables are not mostly onion. Haven't tried the sushi yet.

What the shell???? (Lol) My first stop on my island time food tour was shells seafood restaurant, and boy was it a good way to dive in. My table ordered two types of pasta the seafood medley pasta and the baby lobster pasta. I was expecting sea food with Alfredo sauce, and boy was I wrong. The sauces in these dishes had a real depth to them, and surprisingly they actually had their own distinct flavors. The seafood medley sauce had a rich Alfredo flavor, but as you swallowed you were hit with an incredibly deep briney clam flavor. The baby lobster sauce also had Alfredo flavor at the front, but it hits you later with a strong wine flavor that really mixes well with the sauce. These sauces really surprised me, and they were extremely high quality. I thought I was a high class Italian restaurant when I took a bite, but I opened my eyes and saw board shorts and island vibes when I looked around. Shells isn't a hidden gem, since it's so popular, but it is definitely a gem in my opinion. The restaurant really puts out good high quality food with a fun tourist casual vibe for a great price.
Good food, nice, but slow service, good coffee, would come back.  Great eggs Benedict & potatoes! All plates were finished!
Tried to call in an order on a Sunday and the phone rang busy for 15 minutes. Now I remember why we stopped going to this Beef's.

Hot new spot in St. Louis! Fantastic for a date night or for hanging out with your girlfriends! Went there last night to celebrate my birthday and everyone had a blast. Very attentive staff, extensive wine list featuring champagnes and the food was tasty. Favorite dishes were the Chorizo Croquettes and the Lobster Nachos. For dessert we got the Macarons, Truffles and ice cream. The ice cream had balsamic infused grapes on it! At 10:00 an Irish band came on stage and rounded out our fun night. Will definitely be back.
While attending a technical conference, had an opportunity to try this restaurant using Yelp reviews. My guests and I enjoyed the friendly ambiance. Good food and service at a reasonable price.

We went for brunch. We were drawn by the Bloody Mary bar.  There was a 20 minute wait for a table which was reasonable. The waiter came by pretty quickly and we ordered our drinks. It took about 20 minutes for the bar to put a shot of vodka into 2 glasses so we could make our bloody Mary's. We ordered the scramble and the chorizo hash. I ordered a coffee which never came. It took about 30 minutes to get breakfast food.  We are at 70 minutes to get our food which was "just ok".  We ate pretty quickly and we never saw our waiter again. I had to flag down a hostess to get our check. The manager came by unsolicited and asked how things went. We said "ok". We explained the food was ok and it was slow. She apologized and gave us a coupon for free desert. It's been a few years since I have been to fork and have had better food and service in 2012. I haven't had a good experience in a downtown restaurant in a very long time.

Crazy enough, I found out about this place after trying their cheese pizza at a kids birthday party at Gymboree next door.   

I typically do not like plain cheese pizza, but theirs is well seasoned and mighty tasty.  I was very surprised when they told me that 80% of the pizza's they sell were just plain cheese.   They really do have the best NY style pies in the area.

Their menu is quite extensive and I like their Gyros so much that I now order one every time I order pizza.

Prices are super reasonable and they offer a large list of lunch specials.  
The atmosphere is nothing to ride home as most people just get carry out from here.  They do have plenty of seating and even a few table outdoors if you choose to dine in.
They do not have waiters, but the staff is very friendly and accommodating.    You order from the counter, but they do not make you pay until you leave.
That is very uncommon these days but refreshing to go to an "Old Style Italian" type place

Not a good experience.  Waited for someone to seat us and then the table was greasy.   Service by the waiter was so horrible.  Not attentive, she smelled like a stripper with all the heavy cheap spray.  If we need anything we had to track it down such as silverware, napkins and BBQ sauce.  
Ordered a dessert to share and brought one spoon came back later with a huge serving spoon.  Very Sad that management doesn't train the wait staff better or watch how they treat the customers.  Food was ok but ruined by the experience.
** I find after reading the reviews the the Manager Chuck B likes to thank the people giving good reviews.  I find it interesting that he doesn't learn from the "bad" reviews.  You should be reviewing the bad reviews and see your areas of needing help.

Theater is ok, the people are not as friendly and the seats are not as comfy as the galaxy. The one thing i learned being a senior, Tuesday's are five bucks all day,and if you buy the bucket and cup combo for 14 dollars, the refill of popcorn and soda for seniors is 3.50. That is good all year, all u ou have to do is bring the bucket and cup back s nd say you want the senior rate. The century theaters were the only choice in town for awhile, but it is nice to have the galaxy in town

Hands down the best pizza in Nashville!  I just literally got done eating it, the tastes and flavors off both pizzas I got were awesome.  Once you go here you won't ever want to go anywhere else.  Kudos to the guy in the truck, awesome job!

Tried Relais for the first time last night.  Definitely a fan.  The space is not huge, the ambiance is nice (although I would prefer it just a tad bit darker).  Bartender Andy has pujt together a great drink menu; every one we tried was creative and tasty.  There's a limited but very good beer selection (Chimay, Delirium Tremens, Lindemans etc.).  We started with the asparagus which was good, and accompanied by two tasty dipping sauces.  We also tried the mussels which had an excellent garlic flavor; possibly the most flavorful mussels we've ever had (and the broth with bits of garlic was great for bread-dipping).  Next we tried the onion soup.  My wife thought it was a little short on cheese, but we both agreed the flavor was very good.  The dinner salads were good but not great, just a little plain (although the dressing was nice).  My wife tried the steak and fries and thought they were excellent (I tried both and agree).  Yummy fries, tender steak, and a great but not too heavy sauce.  I tried the vegetarian dish and was not quite as impressed by the flavor, although I suppose there are limits to what you can do with baked veggies.  We finished with one of the chocolate deserts.  Can't remember what it was called, but it essentially was a chocolate molten lava cake, very good.  

We ate at the bar, so I can't speak to the service other than to say Andy was great, and took excellent care of us.

In short, this is probably closer to a 4.5 star review than 5, but I'm rounding up as 4 just feels too low.  There's a lot to like about Relais!

I came here for a night out with some friends during a work trip. It was a great time! The staff was very friendly, and we had great conversations all night long. 

We ordered a few house drinks (I got the Angry Sailor and it was amazing!) and then tried some food. The house BBQ wings were delicious, crispy, and tangy. The ranch served with the wings was a thick buttermilk sauce that went perfectly with the wings. 

A friend got the loaded tots and they were incredible. They were served in a small skillet, on top of melted cheese with bacon, jalapeños, and shredded cheese piled on top. It was the perfect bar food. 

The place wasn't too busy and the ambiance was welcoming. I'll be back for sure!

Obviously, the chicken is amazing. My coworker, a poboy aficionado, has called the Shrimp PoBoy the best she's ever had. The mac and cheese is what they serve in Heaven on Mac & Cheese Night, But mix it up every now and then and get the pickled country vegetables as your side -- so good!

Love Smashburger.  Much better quality than 5 Guys. Tonight I thoroughly enjoyed a truffle mushroom swiss burger on a gluten free bun, a side of smash fries and a Stewart's rootbeer.  Deeeeeeeeeeliciousssss! The burger made my belly very happy.  The crispy seasoned shoestring fries .more than satisfy my crispy fry pteference.

I love Tumamoc Hill.   There's a nice incline to get your heart pumping but it's also a quick hike. Perhaps the best part is that it's open in the evening. There aren't many other options in the hot Summer months if you aren't an early riser. The views of the city are fantastic, especially at night! The trail is paved and well populated which makes it feel a little safer after dark. 

If you live in Tucson and haven't visited,  you must!

Very very nice for the price my girlfriend got on Priceline. Nice pool not far from broadway the main strip. The hotel remodeling is finished the parking garage needs a make over.  The wifi price is just toooo too crazy. High Parking price ($38 for self) is expect Since your downtown. But overall very very nice hotel.     I would try to stay there again and not to far from White Castle.

First, the hotel is beautifully remodeled.  Very modern.  Rooms are clean and wonderful.  The restaurant disappointed me.  I was not too hungry, so I ordered the Hummus plate and a garden salad with shrimp.  How difficult could that be?  Hummus was good.  The pita bread was super greasy and appeared dipped in grease.  I Could have ordered friench fries for that much grease.  But, I ate it because it was good.  Filled me up, so I ordered the simple salad.  The salad appeared fine.  But, when I looked closely, a few of the shrimp were greyish, which means not fully cooked.  I DO NOT eat partially cooked shellfish.  Another server came and stated they can throw it back on the grill.  That violates Health laws.  I said, "no thanks," and she brought me back another salad without the shrimp because I said hold the shrimp.  What upset me was, the original server came back and with an attitude.  He stated, "buy the way, we took the shrimp and looked at it under a bright light and it WAS fully cooked."  We discounted the shrimp.  I said, "It was not about $$.  Really?  You are going to argue with the customer?  Tell me I was wrong?  That is customer service 101. Do not argue with a customer.  He did not ask me if I wanted anything else....So, here I am writing this review.  Chef, please keep an eye on your cooks.  Dining room Mgr's, send your server back to customer service school.  Making you look bad.  They failed me today.  I'm on business with an expense account and in the restaurant business.  Shame!!!  By the way, the only Chardonnay by the glass was $18.  Even the Ritz, has a house wine for $10.00  Strike 2.  : (
I was downtown and saw this unique shop selling olive oils . The owner has a lot of samples to try from . I purchased a few bottles and their jalapeño stuffed olives , Amazing !!

A glorious experience was had as we celebrated our 10th anniversary at Joseph Anthony Day Spa & Dry Bar.  We thoroughly enjoyed a couple's stone massage as well as the Turkish steam bath.

The spa was immaculate and the fine folks of JA could not have been more pleasant.  The stress of finding my wife a gift for Christmas or a birthday may also have been solved!

FYI - Yelp presented us with a 20% discount upon check-in.

This is such a great breakfast and I'm surprised some of the reviews weren't that great. I have been here several times and each time the service and food were just as good as the last. The crepes & the benedicts are my favorite items on this amazing menu. The smoked salmon benedict was not fishy which I quite often find in restaurants down here, the breakfast potatoes were well seasoned with a nice crisp on the outside, fresh fruit and our server was pretty funny. Price is also fantastic for the value.
